column13:
Om. nom. noms.

This is the Chipotle I most frequent. Good thing too, 'cause they're speedy, friendly and patient, generous with the fillings, and clean.

I know its a (former McD's) chain, but their tortilla chips are the best: thin, lightly salted, hint of lime. And the guac?! Don't even get me started. Total love. 

I'm a fan!

I've eaten here a few times. Every time I eat here I feel like it doesn't taste like chipotle at all. Ate here yesterday it was awful. I swear if I was blindfolded and you asked me to guess what I was eating in a million years I would have NEVER guessed Chipotle. I'm starting to think Chipotle just fell off. I use to love Chipotle. I could eat for breakfast lunch and dinner all in the same day, but now I barely want to eat at all. It's because I'm comparing it to how chipotle use to taste. Im giving 2 star for chipotle standards. If I had no prior experience with Chipotle no was eating for the first time I would have given a 3. I will say that this particular location has been consistently bad. Even when I was in love with Chipotle. 
What's probably going to end up happening is a month or two will pass, and I will eat chipotle again. I won't give this location another chance though. I've given like 10 already.

It's Chipotle.  I love Chipotle.  It's pretty much the same as any other Chipotle.  However, this particular branch is not the greatest.  I tend to come here often cuz it's close to work for lunch.  However, I noticed that they almost always skimp on the meat.  I order the carnitas burrito bowl.  In this location, they mound on the rice until the bowl is almost full.  They then just sprinkle meat on.  Usually not even a full scoop.  All other locations tend to give me twice the amount of meat than this location.  

This visit, they messed up even farther.  I was the first customer of the morning.  They took the covers off the meats, and they were clearly leftovers from the previous day.  The pork was darkened and dry, obviously she'd like bad leftovers.  And there was only a tiny but left.   Then the server skimped on the cheese to make matters worse.  

I've finally given up on coming to the Addison location. Never again.

I love Chipotle in general, but the employees at this location are rude and stingy with the good stuff. That's right, stingy in a Chipotle! If I'm going to pay $12 for a Burrito Bowl with extra meat it better be packed, and not with beans and rice.... the cheapest ingredients!

Called to complain to manager, and they didn't even care!
Not the best chipotle around, the employees are rude, they act like they are bored, they dont even care about what you are ordering, i wont be going there anymore

Are used to like this location. I didn't love this location but I liked it because it was close to work. However the past two times I have gone literally today and two days ago for lunch there is a Hispanic older lady who seems to not understand the concept of can I have more. I don't know if it was after this new program that chipotle put on that now everyone is getting stingy with the condiments but seriously when I say more I mean I want another spoonful of it. This lady in particular who I had the same service from gave me 1/3 spoonful of tomatoes and I asked for more and she gave another third and I had asked for more to get one whole spoonful which I typically would get on a normal day. It was the same deal with the corn. It is frustrating for the customer who has specific ingredients that they love and want more up to not get that because of an employee who is being very stingy for something that is not even hers.
It's Chipotle.. Everything is fresh and made to order in front of you. . . . . . . . . . . . .      ....

Online ordering!  That is why I ended up at this Chipotle this week. My poor husband has been working seven days a week at up to eighteen hours a day. The man was hungry. I get an hour for lunch and I wanted to eat too. So, I ordered from Chipotle online, scheduled my pickup time and crossed my fingers. 

I arrived at the appointed time and found a parking spot right in front of the door. I ran in and straight to the cashier as directed. I noticed that this location seems to have a but less seating than other locations I've been to, but this won't deter me from visiting again as I have never actually dined inside a Chipotle location. It transports well, so I always eat it somewhere else. Anyhow, I showed the cashier my ID, another gentleman grabbed my bagged order from an under the counter warming area and I was gone. Yep, amazingly fast and easy. The order was paid for online, they offered a receipt at the counter and I could t have been happier. Truth be told, I was happier. Ten minutes later when we opened up our food and it was exactly as ordered!

Plus, I received a phone call that afternoon directly from the store inquiring about my experience. Two thumbs up, Chipotle!  You made my marathon lunch hour quite easy.

This is a super Chipotle.  I base this on a few things.

The employees were all smiling and all friendly and pleasant.  No stress here.

The place was clean.  Really, really clean.  And I was not the first person there by a long shot.

The food was actually at the right temp.  The chicken (had a chicken burrito bowl) was hot, the tomatoes' were room temp (not frozen like they often are at other Chipotles), the green sauce was the perfect heat.

Easy parking.  Next to Walmart and SAMs club.  Difficult to get into the parking lot because of the construction on the roads around here.  

4 stars, would be 5 if it was a mom and pop.

I am a loyal patron of Chipotle and this location is the newest in this area. It's trendy and clean. The staff members are always friendly. 

I typically get either a steak salad or chicken bowl. The salad dressing is amazing.  I know a fellow yelper complained about her steak, but I've enjoyed my steak at this location too. 

Tonight, I ordered a bowl with brown rice. They offered me a free beverage while I waited two minutes for brown rice. They threw out the scoop left. When checking out, the cashier apologized for the wait. My thought was what wait? I fixed my free drink and the rice appeared. Either way, the service rocks.

Absolutely love the cleanliness of this chipotle. I've been to several chipotle restaurants in my life but this by far has had the best experience. The food line was clean the staff was pleasant and my burrito was terrific. Great job !

Not sure if bc I'm a regular here but the attitude from a certain employee is disrespectful towards customers. Oh and super stingy on meat even when ask for double. I'd go to another one but this is the closest. Unfortunately I love chipotle but can't stand some employees here.

Full disclosure: This was only my second time ever going to a Chipotle. That said, this location was extremely efficient. Like, I was in and out with my food in probably less than 90 seconds, no joke. At noon! They were really nice though, even asked if I was having a nice day. And the place was clean. As far as the food? It was good. But I have decided I'm just not that into it. I got the shredded beef rice bowl with toppings, including guac. Again, good. But it seemed bland to me. Like, the guacamole just tasted so bland. And the beef didn't have much flavor besides salt. I guess I just don't "get" Chipotle. But I digress. If you do like Chipotle, this place is a good bet. I probably won't be back.

Why is this Chipotle different than others?  Service!  The menu and food is pretty straightforward.  You know the choices, the portion sizes, and quality.  The difference here is the staff and service.  They are always smiling considering this location is not the most convenient to get in and out of relative to the construction on the roads as well as timing of lights nearby.  

I was recently part of a catering order and they were great!  All of the items came clearly marked, they provided plenty of plates, napkins, utensils, chafing dishes, and the value was phenomenal.  They really want to be part of the local community rather than just being the local branch.  It seems easy to forget about them when you might stop by occasionally for a meal but they do a great job.  Overall, a place I would definitely recommend for a meal for one or for 100.
Undercooked chicken in my burrito bowl.  This is the second time in less than 6 months. The employees are nice but the food isn't safe.

Absolutely horrible. I went and got a burrito bowl and chips with my boyfriend  lastnight. I found two pieces of long black hair in my food, so o stopped eating and About 1 hour after eating my stomach started to really hurt. So I went home. 5 minutes after I got home I stated to throw up. From 11pm-9am this morning I was in the bathroom EVERY HALF HOUR, throwing  up. Once I started to have more time frame in between  throwing  up I was able to get sleep. Now I'm dealing  with it coming out of the other end. And i barely  ate at all. HORRIBLE place to go!

I love chipotle, but this one is terrible. So stingy on the amount they give you and when you ask for more they try to pass it on to the next person so you can't get more. So rude. The staff is very unfriendly. 
The only reason I go to this one is because it is close to my work.
Always great food with great service!!  I usually get a salad with black beans, salsa and guacamole and yum!!  Everything is fresh and delicious!  I work in the area so I stop in a few times a month.

The best service from any Chipotle! The staff are so friendly and always smiling. They give you plenty of everything you ask for, some other locations can be a bit skimpy. This is my son's favorite place to eat and this is the best by far!
The last few times we went it wasn't as good. My chicken was cold and tasted fishy.

I just ordered a salad from this location, brought it back to work and started eating it and found a small dead fly in the lettuce. DISGUSTING! I called and spoke with a manager and instead of offering me my money back, he wanted me to come back and have my meal replaced! NO THANK YOU! I will never be eating at this location or any other again! The health department should be called on them!!

All Chipotle's are NOT the same!

This review is strictly on the food.  The service and restaurant itself is fine but I've spit out more pieces of steak from my burrito bowl than I've chewed and that has never happened at any of my many other Chipotle visits at other locations.  It even tastes different.  The meat that is.... You know when you cook a steak at home and you question if you waited 1 day too long.  It's still safe and edible but the quality has definitely diminished due to it not being as fresh?  That's what I'm tasting right now as I sit here with my very disappointing dinner.  As a pregnant lady... I can say we will eat pretty much anything when hungry but this is not making me or the baby very happy.   I can't imagine they use any other cut of steak that isn't used at the other locations.  Maybe it was the way it was cut?  Although that doesn't make up for it's old, meaty taste.  

I'll give it another go of course at this location.  It's on the newer side and maybe they just don't have the flow down yet.  

Happy to revise my review when they get it right cause it is Chipotle and you have to be up to par if you want to make it as a location.

I go to chipotle often, and I always thought the burritos were a tad small....until I came to this location! Everyone's burrito looks big here.  Are they more generous with toppings compared to other locations?
This is the best chipotle hands down! Best service. The restaurant is clean, friendly, and the food is amazing. The staff is fabulous, fast, and friendly!

I love chipotle and this place has by far been the best location we've visited. We went in on 2/21/14 at about 9 pm. The staff was what really made it a good experience. They were super friendly and easy to talk to (particularly our cashier). We have both worked extensively in customer service and were very impressed with the the staff and their positive impact on our experience! We will definitely be returning to this location and trying out the Patr√≥n margaritas!
Staff is always very friendly, the place is clean and food is good!   See ya in a few days!

This Chipotle has some of the nicest employees I have met ANYWHERE. They are hello, how are you, please, thank you, have a great day / thanks for coming from the minute you get there until you leave. You can't help but be in a good mood while talking with staff because they're all so cheerful. It's so nice to have pleasant interactions with people instead of the usual "what do you want" or silence that you get elsewhere.

This is brand-spanking new so I decided to check it out after work one day. The location itself is pretty spacious and has ample seating. Here is a totally random observation but the doors here stink. They are so heavy and awkward. Even when I was leaving, another customer commented about the doors being too heavy and hard to open. 

Now, I am not sure if something has changed in Chipotles' standards but I ordered a steak fajita burrito and the steak they tried to serve was still bloody. The steak was being cooked fresh and they said they cooked it "medium" and if that was OK with me. I'd rather not eat bloody meat so I said I would just have chicken instead. They offered to cook it a bit longer for me if I didn't mind waiting. I was also offered a free drink since I had to wait. Also, I don't get why they ask what type of beans I want. It is a fajita burrito (where you have the veggies in lieu of beans)...maybe something has changed where they offer beans on this type of burrito now?

The burrito was still tasty and I appreciated the free drink for my wait.

This is the cleanest and most friendly Chipotle I've ever been to. The food is the same as all chipotles, but the staff really makes the experience! Every time I go there the staff greets me with a smile, asks about how I'm doing and everyone is very quick with food preparation.
The people here are always smiling. And of course, the quality of the food is up to normal Chipotle standards.  Great service here.

We love it here!! The food is great they have a good variety!! Anything from pot stickers to corn beef to quesadillas!! It's cozy inside and for the most part everyone is really friendly.  They also have great specials on food and drinks!
Rarely disappoints..... The only thing Im not crazy about here is the Pizza & Vesuvio salad.

Came here on a whim. Dollar slider specials on Sunday. The pork was so so. The burgers were pretty decent. I'd recommend them. I really liked the breading on the fried pickles. Wish the pickles were sliced just a bit thicker. Bar tender was very friendly. I liked the relaxed atmosphere.

I am not really sure what else to give this place.  The truth is that I quite enjoy the food here and would come back on occasion during lunchtime.  However, the service is, to be blunt, terrible.  Usually whoever we get as a waitress is very nice but the amount of time it takes to get food is just unacceptable!  We have 45 lunch breaks and tell the waitress that we need to rush everything and she says no problem.  20-25 mins later, she returns with the food.  I don't get it.  It's never busy during lunch and yet it has been consistently slow as hell.  I'd like to return here because, like I said, the food is pretty good...but I won't because I just can't wait that long for a salad or a burger.

Great atmosphere, layout and staff. Lots of tvs to watch sports and the food is good. Jose's pork sandwich is my number 1 item but many of the wraps are great too.  They have also switched up their menu recently so I'm excited to try some new items.  We go to this place almost every week because the staff is so great and its always a great experience. Our usual waitress even knows our drink orders. We always feel welcome there and their drink specials are reasonable.

I have lived in Addison my whole life. I never went to 601 until my Sister began working there. Now, I'm going totally unbiased with this one. I love the place. It's a local hang out and many people that I see around town go there. I get a special order every day for lunch and it is superb. I've been there throughout different portions of the day, but most of my experience is before 5pm. I think the food is amazing along with the prices. Everyone that works there, including the Manager, Owner, and bartenders work their butts off to make sure the customers get good service. I've seen some rude, very rude, people come in and I'm sure some of them gave the negative comments below. I myself have 10 years in the food industry (Portillo's & Panera) and have seen it all. The food is fresh from where it comes from and is ordered through the same vendors as many restaurants. Trust me, I live right there and see the truck. The cook during lunch has culinary skills that astound me. He loves cooking and it shows. Again, you may think I'm biased because I have a family member that works there, but there are dozens of places to eat and this is where I choose to go. 601 gets two thumbs up in my book.

I hate this place. I know it may seem really strong but it's true. I've given it 3 visits (didn't want to go back after the first time but friends dragged me there) and will never go back to this dump. 

1st visit was bland

2nd visit. I was with a group of friends who knew the bartender that was working. She was very attentive to them and completely ignored me several times. I had to wait a 10 minutes before she took my drink order and another 10 minutes to get it. The place wasn't even packed. At the end of the night she gives all of us our bills and tells the three guys I'm with that she was giving each of them a beer on the house and completely left me hanging even though it was I that got the terrible service.

3rd visit was even worse. I met up a friend for his cousin's birthday party. He was the odd man out so I thought I'd swing by to keep him company. I sat next you the group in an adjacent table and asked the server (who took forever again!) if I personally could have a separate check because I 1. Didn't know any of those people and 2. Didn't have cash to throw in. She preceded to condescendingly tell me that I was with the group and couldn't be separate and I should get cash because they have a atm there. So I obliged, went to the atm, took out $20 only the machine didn't spit out money or a receipt: NOTHING! I checked my bank account with an app on my phone and the charge went through, I walked over to the server and explained the situation. She then said that it wasn't their machine and she couldn't do anything about it. I asked to speak to the manager who eventually ended up giving me $20. They then put an "out of order" sign on then ATM. The whole situation was uncomfortable and the server was super rude the rest of the time I was there. With such a shoddy establishment I was worried she would do something unsanitary to my drink. I don't know why I didn't leave, I'm an idiot for not.

I wouldn't come back here if you paid me.

There used to be a place that made fresh bagels there before this place was ever built. I want that place back! Bring back the bagels!

We just moved to Addison in April and have been here a couple of times.  The bar is a good size and has a large beer garden.  The food here is quite good but they have a very small menu. Will definitely go back!
Excited to head over to 601 on Saturday but guess they close at 11 on weekends. WEAK!!!

I love 601 Bar and Grill. There is nothing like a local bar to get a good burger. But a good burger is not all they have. Even though they changed from Solace 601 to 601 Bar and Grill, they kept some of their favorites. The soups are homemade, and you have to try the tortilla soup and the bisque. They have good wings, and you can't beat Taco Tuesday. They serve tacos for a buck, and they are pretty much the real deal. When you're in Addison, you have to compete with some real taquerias, so you'd better have real tacos. These are good.

For beer, they have been limited to mostly American lager, and some Mexican lagers. They have had Spaten and Guiness on tap since opening, and there is always that bottle of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, my go-to beer at 601, but recently 601 has brought in some beer from Revolution Brewery in Chicago, and a Church Street Brewery in Itasca. It's nice seeing 601 get some variety.

I like to hang out at 601 to watch the Hawks or the Sox, get a burger or wings, and down a couple of beers. The staff is very nice, and the owners are friendly.

Had you asked me what I would rate 601 the first time I came here, it probably would have been 2.5 stars. The food was mediocre, the service wasn't great, and the atmosphere was boring.

However, we ended up coming here really randomly for New Years, and we had a lot of fun. There was live music, a free appetizer bar, and a fun crowd. The average age is probably 35-50. The service was really great, and the drinks were exceptional. I don't know if this would be a "regular" place for me since it's not a younger crowd, but if you are looking for a good local "towny" bar with a chill atmosphere, this would be it.

This place used to be a fine-dining French-Italian restaurant.

Honestly, I don't see it, they must have done a major renovation. The owners decided that blue collar Addison needed more wings and fewer foofy restaurants in strip malls. So now it's got a big bar, lots of tables and high tops, and a dozen or more TVs. 

We were seated promptly next to a picture of the Stanley Cup-winning Blackhawks and the most popular people in the restaurant. Half a dozen or more people squeezed themselves in next to my husband just to say hello to them. And yes, on a Friday evening around 5:30 the bar was crowded with middle-age dudes on their fourth beer with no inside voice.

But 601 saved itself. Because the food was quite good and the service was excellent. The menu is heavy on burgers and wings, but also includes other sandwiches, pizza and a few entrees for giggles.

We started with nachos, which were very good chips, covered in beans and taco meat, slathered in convenience store cheese sauce and dotted with tomatoes, scallions and sour cream. Not bad, but would've been better with real cheese and pico de gallo.

We both ordered burgers: I had the California burger (avocado, green chiles, jack cheese, hold the mayo); the husband had the pizza burger.

Pretzel buns are awesome. The burger patties were juicy and cooked well (but not well-done). And the toppings were mighty tasty. We also both had waffle fries, which were sufficiently good though not seriously outstanding.

Service was very, very good -- seemed like nobody walked by our table without grabbing a used napkin, refilling the water, asking how the food was or *something*. Extremely attentive and friendly.

I just wish for a few more booths (I only spotted one) and a few less loud-mouthed dudes...

If there is a such thing as an Addison 'townie' bar, this is it.  I stopped in with some Addisonians for a burger and to watch the Hawks on a Sunday evening.  About $10 for a pretty good burger and fries.  The burger was a half pound of hand formed meat, no frozen business here.  The fries were of the waffle variety.  YeES.

The tables were pretty full and it had a good sports-bar feel with new furniture.  Lots of TVs including one HD projector on a 6' screen.  The sound was loud, but hey...it's a sports bar.

I was really hoping this would be a "go-to" type place because I've heard the owners are such great and genuine people but....NO. The service is horrible and the food is marginal. I actually saw the bartender argue and lose two different guests in the matter of 20 minutes (while waiting five for my own Guinness refill). The confrontations then became a conversation point amongst her and what seemed the entire bar. I've got my own concerns that don't include her lack of barkeep persona. On top of this, its like every other Addison style bar, if you ain't a gumba, ya don't get much service or attention. I have no desire to be back.

The new 601 fills a gap in the local bar scene.  Friendly atmosphere, good food, and good drink selection.  The waitstaff and bartenders are helpful and seem genuinely happy to be at work!

It is a sports bar with TONS of TVs everywhere and a jukebox.  So if you want a quiet place to relax, this is not it.  But if you want good food and a great price, then I do encourage you to stop by.

A couple of us from work go here for lunch once a week or so. Good food , decent prices , and awesome Tortilla Soup!!! T.V.'s everywhere  ans bility to just talk. Great staff / owners always make us feel welcome. Would highly recomend! 

.

We were there during a Blackhawks game.  We were part of a larger group.  The place was way too loud to even hold a conversation.  Our mistake for going for dinner during a game and it is a bar.  We were there for the fish fry.  It was good but skimpy portions.  We asked to have the grilled fish and vegetables.  One person in our party asked for tartar sauce and by the time he received it, he needed more fish to go with it.  One set of bathrooms are not designated women or men because they are for both, however, they are not marked for either.  Confusing for first timers. The staff was very friendly.  It was okay for a bar, but I prefer a nicer and quieter place for dinner and conversation.

How disappointing!!  We used to go here when it was called Solace 601.  In fact, we loved Solace 601. Great food, great service and close to home. Then they became 601 Bar and Grill.  We decided to stop by one night and give it a try.  No one was there to greet us, so we decided to seat ourselves at a table. After waiting a couple minutes, we grabbed some menus.  The menu looked good, and we both decided what we would order.  The problem was, we never saw a server.  The bar was very crowed and loud and the bartender was doing her best to take care of everyone at the bar.  There was another couple sitting at a table near by and they seemed to be enjoying their food.  We sat and sat and waited and waited and no one ever acknowledged us.  So we left.

I went to this bar/restaurant on the recommendation of friends who had previously eaten there. First off, there was a restaurant full of customers with one server who seemed extremely rushed and overwhelmed and second, our food took FOREVER to come out- both aspects which could be EASILY gotten over when good food is placed in front of you....that unfortunately was not the end of it. My food finally came, I had ordered a veggie burger with cheddar cheese, added avocado, and fries as a side. The avocado was luckily on the side of the burger, so as soon as my plate was put down I spotted the gross, inedible addition to my burger with black streaks throughout it. That avocado shouldn't have still been in their kitchen, let alone placed by the chef on my plate and it astounds me that the server didn't even glance down at my plate as she was carrying it out because if she had, I would hope she'd never serve something that disgusting to a customer. The icing on the cake, I proceeded to take a bite out of my "veggie burger" only to discover I was in fact served a TURKEY burger. And as someone who has strict dietary restrictions that prohibit her from eating meat, one could imagine how upset I was. The server was mildly apologetic. All around horrible experience.
Great place! Food is excellent. Great tortilla soup.......BUT the best is their French Martini!!! Bartender makes them better than any downtown Chicago bar :)

Hey, any of you fellas know a guy by the name of Bill Brasky?

He's a 9-foot-tall beast man with absolutely no indoor voice.  When he told a story the entire Chicago metropolitan area could hear.  Even Milwaukee would complain about the noise.  True story.

Well the newly christened 601 Bar and Grill is loaded with Bill Braskys and the guys who love drunkenly going on and on about Bill Brasky.

But first things first.  The food here is actually really good.  Their big thing is their burgers which are made with beef that's so fresh and juicy because Bill Brasky himself, birthed, raised, slaughtered, butchered, and ground the meat himself all in the course of 30 minutes.  You can pick your bun too, which includes the all-mighty pretzel roll, a roll so divine it instantly makes any burger better.  Why is it so divine?  Because Bill Brasky brought it into existence sole by thinking about it... right after he scissor kicked Angela Lansbury.

The other entrees of note include all sorts of sandwiches, chicken, and pizza.  The menu is fairly small, but it seems like they do what they do really well.  Much in the same way Bill Brasky is the best damn salesman in the office.

For an appetizer we got the nachos, which were all right, certainly not bad by any stretch, but they had a melted cheese sauce which just didn't do the pretty good tasting chips justice.  Much in the same way Bill Brasky didn't feel the Grammy's did the music industry justice so he hosted them himself and gave every award to Corey Hart.

The service was really attentive, nobody would walk by the table without offering to get you something or help clear it away.  It was fast but still friendly.  I'd give it a pretty good review, similar to the good review Brasky's production of the King and I where he chloroformed the rest of the cast and slowly ate them on stage got.

The one problem though is the aforementioned Brasky Buddies.  There are just too many loud, drunken, middle aged guys in there, telling inane, exaggerated anecdotes so loudly I could hear them more clearly than my wife sitting three feet from me.  A little bit better atmosphere in the place and it just might have earned that fifth star.  But to earn that fifth star you've gotta be able to jump off the Empire State Building and only sprain your ankle... like Bill Brasky.

But overall, if you can handle a lot of middle-aged guys yelling at each other from opposite ends of the bar, you're in for a really good, well-priced burger.

Oh and Bill Brasky?  He's a son of a b*tch!

I give them an extra star for trying. Addison is a miserable town with few Chicago style bars. This place tries to be one, but unfortunely the town is filled with these middle aged drunks that ruin it. I tried to watch a football game here recently and was annoyed at how much they over serve the patrons here. The Tv screens with the exception of one are small. Their large screen has hardly any seating areas to be able to view it. The food here was just plain pre-ordered bar food and this place just as a bad suburban strip mall vibe, which is exactly where it is located. I only go hear because at 12.00 Sundays I am still pretty tired to drive far for NFL games. This location probably will go through five different businesses in ten years. Just watch.
The pizza is great, and the establishment has a great vibe. Family-friendly during lunch and dinner hours!

The sushi bar with no name!

No, seriously, the restaurant is Sushi Bar. The sushi is pretty sharp, too :) Service stands out- my tea wasn't even close to empty at any point during my lunch. It was a great experience, I really enjoyed the place.

The name is silly, everything else about this restaurant is spot on!

Today i came in for lunch. There weren't many people just 2 other tables so service was pretty quick. The sushi here is pretty good but nothing to rave about i ordered a shrimp roll, spicy tuna and a dragon roll. 

Nikko sushi in Arlington hts continues to be my go to sushi spot, no one does it like them around here

Here's what I think of Sushi Bar:  Rip off.  Rip off.
Rip off...

I am so sorry I wasted my money here... $47.50 to be exact..!!!

I was craving sushi and happened to be in the area on Sunday while shopping with a friend.
I have been to Sushi Bar twice a few years ago and recall having a good experience...nothing mind blowing, but not bad..
I decided to come here since it was nearby shopping and Abashiri was closed (I've had that on my list to try..not open on Sun.).

We walked into an empty restaurant around 5ish...we were seated by a not-so-enthusiastic server...There was a worker eating at a table....no big deal, I just felt our server was rather abrupt and wasn't sure why?  They definitely weren't slammed with customers...While I perused the sushi options, my friend was looking for anything but seafood..She is not a fan. I asked our waitress about non-sushi offerings and she wasn't really helpful...again, just abrupt and hasty, and it didn't help that we had a hard time understanding her...In the meantime, other patrons started walking in (a good sign)...

Suffice it to say, they do not offer a good selection of non seafood items... a few noodle soups, egg rolls and chicken & beef teriyaki...She wasn't impressed with the selection and I decided it wasn't fair to her to dine here, so I placed my order to go, since we were already seated and had beverages.  I realize this is a sushi place, but its also a Japanese restaurant and I've been to many that do offer a much broader selection of options.. but my experience here is more about the sushi...

I ordered:  Nigiri - Super white tuna & Salmon. Rolls - Volcano, Spicy Tuna, & Shrimp Tempura.  We waited about 25 min. for my order...Later on, upon opening the styrofoam container, I was only given soy sauce.  No ginger.  No wasabi.  Yes, I was bummed.
I also asked for "no sauce" on my rolls and there was sauce...I was so hungry, I didn't care at that point..

What I did care about.... the really small rolls I received.  The only substantial roll was the Volcano...not only were they small in size, but small in flavor.  Bland.  I couldn't really taste the fish, more cucumber if anything...The nigiri was just ok and quality was OK, however, after two pieces, I noticed the rice had a flavor I couldn't pinpoint..something off about it...

I could NOT believe I paid $48 for this.  In fact, I'm still not over it (I loathe being ripped off)..
I absolutely love sushi and have been to many restaurants.  This is completely over priced and so not worth it... How Sushi Bar could receive anything above 3 stars is beyond me.  The sushi and service were mediocre at best. And while I pondered on giving three stars for fresh sushi, I quickly came to my senses. You should ALWAYS be given FRESH fish at a sushi place! That certainly shouldn't warrant a star...

I can guarantee when I am in this area again craving sushi, and this is my only option...
I will keep driving.....

I'm really torn about my review on this place. The sushi was great. Everything tastes fresh and there was a nice portion of fish in each roll. However, the rolls were pricy. We ordered a specialty roll (the tornado) which was an amazing deep fried roll priced at $10 and it only had six pieces. I was also surprised that a can of coke cost $1.75. I would be fine paying a higher price for sushi if the ambience and service were better, but both fell short. Service was inattentive and at times seemed rude. When we walked in they pointed to a table and I took the menus and sat us down. The restaurant itself is small and setup as more of a carry out joint. If we do go back it will be for carry out only.

The shushi here it is so delicious! 
We have order a few times to go. 

The menu is a bit confusing. If there is anything they should do is make the manu more clear and simple. 
Other than that, they are very quick for very good quality sushi. 
I'll definitely come here again and recommend to friends.

Tonkatsu ($9.95 w/soup, salad, and 4pc cali roll) - 2 stars. Small and thin. I've tried a lot of katsus in my lifetime, and this is the worst.

Spring rolls - 3 stars

Service was kinda weird in that when I went to pickup, the employee pointed to the bag of food on the table behind him. I thought he would hand me them since he was closer, but he just pointed again. So I had to walk past and behind him to get my carryout order.

This is by far one of my favorite sushi restaurants .. I've been coming here for over 10 years ... Ken is one of the best servers out there! I wish they would start an all you can eat promotion though

It's called Sushi Bar. Plain but descriptive in a very utilitarian way. We tried so many different rolls (wendy, crunchy lobster, eel, salmon skin, baby octopus). Most of them weren't that notable and were somewhat small. Our favourite was the salmon skin roll. Basic but it was done right. 

The place seems clean. The staff was attentive & kept my water filled but seemed to want to rush us to pay. It was an ok dining experience with decent sushi. But I wouldn't rush back here.

I went here once before ages ago for sushi and it definitely didn't stand out in my mind. 

I just went back this week because my mom had got a groupon or something of the sort, so we figured we'd go check it out since she knows I like sushi. I ordered two plain rolls, salmon avocado and regular tuna - I know, I'm so boring. But I like quality sushi that speaks for itself so it doesn't need all the sauces and tempura and all that jazz. The salmon and avocado was actually good, I wish I had ordered two of those instead of the tuna. I just don't think it was great, wouldn't get it again (and I order tuna sushi all the time). 

I had wanted to order spicy tuna, but I asked if it was the chopped up tuna or the actual pieces and it was the chopped kind. For some reason I never really like those so I didn't try it, it might be good - I guess I won't risk finding out. He probably could have offered to put some spicy mayo on my tuna roll for a bit extra or something but that didn't happen. 

My mom ordered teriyaki chicken, which we both thought was good - it came with zucchini mixed in which works for me. 

The service here....I don't know how to explain it. They aren't very friendly, but they aren't rude. It just feels a bit awkward in a sense. 

Overall, it was beyond worth it with the online deal. If I was dying for sushi I might stop in to grab a salmon avocado roll since it's super closeby for me.

I've been here before for dine in and it was great. Service was good, food came out quick! Really nothing to complain about.... Until you order out. 
I walk in, starving to pick up sushi after a long day. "Oh we don't have summer roll" oh. Thanks lady it's now you decide to tell me? After my pick up time?! Aren't you suppose to call me or something???

The first sign of trouble was the dollar store dishes, the second was that the seafood pieces were some the largest I had seen (and they were not thinly sliced, either)... So, I thought to myself, 'the prices are high, could this large portioned Sushi be worth the price? If so, than great - I'm willing to pay for quality, generously sized, Sushi!'. Regretfully, both my fiend (an experienced Sushi eater) an I found all the Sushi to be room temperature and without taste... and I mean ALL verities were without taste. Thank goodness it wasn't 'fishy' smelling.

I have eaten Sushi for decades and across the nation. Regretfully, I must say that this is the worst Sushi I have ever eaten in a restaurant; but, perhaps they attract people with the large pieces.

A staple when I lived in the area, Sushi Bar is a no-frills sushi bar with great service and fresh sushi.  Loads of interesting fried/playful maki rolls for the sushi neophyte.  A silly side-note: They play a wide range of music...Kenny G Christmas jazz to boy bands of the 90's.  Great place.  Give it a try!

Came with here craving sushi...... left here still craving sushi :-/

What I like about this place was listening to the staff talking Cantonese to each other... it's not often I get to here it anymore. Wait... what? Cantonese?? I thought sushi was Japanese. 

The Dragon Roll had waaaaaaaay too much mayo on it. We had to scrape the tops of it before eating em. The roe was delicious and the service was good.

BATHROOM REVIEW: Located at the end of the restaurant, the bathroom was somewhat clean. It had a working toilet and everything was in place. Sit or squat? Sit!

Good service, friendly staff. You can sit at the bar and watch then make the rolls. Everything is VERY FRESH. Much better quality for almost the same price as the all u can eat. This is a much nicer,  quieter room with great spicy tuna rolls.
Warm sushi got me sick. Messed up the order twice and extremely overpriced. Almost like we were eating downtown Chicago.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Literally just threw out my food bcuz EVERYTHING looked questionable. Tried to eat one piece of sushi and had to spit it out bcuz it was dry and have a funny dirt taste to it. 
Ugh, I'll never order from here again. What a waste of money. Disgusted.

**ALSO called them to confirm that they received my order and the guy kept hanging up on me bcuz he couldn't understand anything I was saying.

This has to be one of my favorite sushi places. The rolls are delicious, prices aren't bad and the servers pay attention. Spicy tuna and Philadelphia roll are my favorite. 
Definitely give this place a try!

This is my absolute favorite place to get sushi. The staff is attentive, the sushi is amazing, AND it's reasonably priced! I get different rolls every time I go and I've never had anything I didn't like.  Well maybe the mackerel... but that's not their fault :) I can't say much about the rest of their menu because I always stick to sushi with crab rangoons for an appetizer! You would never know what a great place it is from the outside, but I promise it's worth checking out.

Very attentive staff, nice place. Delicious food too but I'm not a sushi "expert" so who knows, maybe I'm wrong. But I enjoyed everything we ordered and I'll definitely be back. The Mike's roll was good.

Good quality sushi for a decent price. I order take out at least twice a month, they offer decent pieces of protein in their rolls which helps balance out their pricing. Not to mention the rolls are Super Yummy!

I called to place a pick-up order and the worker did not understand me so he put me on hold and ultimately hung up on me. However, we still decided to order from Sushi Bar. I was unimpressed by the variety of sushi rolls on the  menu and by the quality of the sushi. The fish was not that fresh and there was a lot of sauce in some of the rolls.
Pretty good sushi. Nice little place. Forget the JB rolls. Maybe too much cream cheese.

Pretty good sushi at a decent price. Always high quality, fresh fish.

If your not a big fish fan, I Especially like their chicken tempura rolls. Try em out
Came here for a quick lunch. Didn't really like the rolls I ordered, though. Will be back to try dinner when I have more time.

I don't wanna hurt their business or get the staff into trouble but I just wanna state what happened(not) today.
We were on our way to this place as I was trying to call them to place an order for pick up. First call, just ring ring ring and went to voicemail. I attempted a second call as I thought they are too busy to answer but that second call was to no avail either. Told my driving hubby about it and said let's just go ahead to the sushi bar and place the order there in person. Pulled in the parking lot and the "open" sign was blinking.
My hubby entered the restaurant and came back to the car in 2 minutes. "That was quick?" I told him. He said nobody's around  to help him and he saw feet from the table area. I did not ask him to elaborate.
Apparently the staff were having a siesta that time. At least that's what it seemed to me. So we drove off.
I hope that whoever's feet that was was just napping and did not faint, or something worse. That's all.

I found a coupon a few days ago for this place and my husband and I decided to give it a try. BEST decision ever! The sushi rolls were AMAZING! They tasted so good we ended up buying four extra rolls for home! The restaurant is small but cute and all the employees were nice and attentive. We'll be coming back soon =)

Went to there because Groupon. 
Very friendly service, tasty rolls. Love it. Will go again.

Great rolls. Get their volcano roll, spicy girl roll, and hand grenades! The only thing I found odd about the volcano roll was the mustard! But other than that the roll was tasty. Service could have been better. Also, I didn't receive any complimentary miso soup! I was looking forward to that. 

I mean, this place isn't amazing but it's good for a quick sushi craving since Glendale Heights isn't the best place for sushi. I will definitely try their other rolls.
Very good sushi, you get what you pay for and I absolutely love everyone who works there! The food comes out very fast and isn't too pricy! Definitely the best sushi in Bloomingdale.

Bloomingdale isn't particularly known for their restaurants but one stands out. You know exactly what you're getting with the name, Sushi Bar and Japanese Restaurant. 

At first, I was skeptical by the name and location but after the first meal, I was impressed. The restaurant is small but is often filled with local regulars. There are two unique qualities that make Sushi Bar a local favorite, their creativity and service. They have a wide variety of maki rolls with different sauces from wasabi cream to a sweet and sour orange sauce. Each time we have dined here, we have always received great customer service and the food comes out quickly. Each meal comes with a complimentary miso soup. You can sometimes find coupons for this restaurant as well.

The two maki rolls that I always order are the smoked salmon skin and volcano roll. The smoked salmon skin roll has a strong smoky flavor as if it was just blow torched. Their volcano roll is unique in that it's a deep fried spicy tuna roll and drizzled with honey mustard. 

Although there are a lot of sushi restaurants in the suburbs of Chicago, Sushi Bar is great if you are in the Bloomingdale area and don't want to travel too far.

I found this sushi place to be just OK but very convenient.  For two rolls, I paid about $30.  The rolls were also just OK.  However, the level of customer service was very good, friendly, and kind.  I ordered to go and while waiting, they served me a glass of water.  There are not many places that does this anymore.  I was very impressed by this.  Sushi, I believe, is best when ordering All You Can Eat.  By the time you finish ordering individual rolls, you've spent the amount of all you can eat.   Just my opinion.

I eat here probably almost once a week and always get the vegetarian roll. I also recently tried the seaweed salad which was very good and will probably be ordering it regularly now. I've never had any problems with the food or service. I mean there's nothing mind blowing about it but you wouldn't expect there to be from a strip mall sushi place.They consistently have perfectly decent food that I enjoy and I will continue to come back.

I found this sushi place on Groupon. They had a special going on $11 for $20 worth of food. The service is very pushy, they rushed us into ordering our food. The food was not to shabby but I've had better sushi for cheaper. When we got our check, we reminded him about the Groupon we had. Very rudely he asked for the voucher number and Groupon number, which I gave him. He then leaned over the table and attempted to press the "Redeem" button on my phone. By then I had made up in my mind I was not going to return here. Then when it was time for the two other ladies I was with two give him their Groupon information, he Very nastily said "It's only one per table". Which indeed it was our fault for not reading the small print.

So we then asked to get our checks split and it went downhill from there. He was yelling at us, telling us it's one per table, "I can't split the check, and why can't one person pay and we pay them back etc", and mind you their was other customers in the restaurant looking over. Then a lady comes over and he tells her you handle this because I can't "their complicated". So we calmly explain to her the situation and she says the exact same thing he says. "Why can't one person pay, it's not their problem etc". So we explained it to her AGAIN! She walked off to split the checks and they were  over in the corner, LOUDLY speaking about us. she comes back and gives us our separate checks and has the NERVE to ask for a tip.

I have never received such poor service in my life! I will never return.

Great sushi, very friendly staff and very fast service.  The quality of the sushi is very fresh and consistent.  I go whenever I an find a groupon for them.   Been going for a few years now and they never disappoint.

I have to say the best tempura shrimp and veggies I have ever had.  And the sushi my son had was the best he has had yet.  We go as often as we can and will not try another place for shrimp or sushi!!!  And have to love the free tea!

My brother and I always try to con our dad to take us here after church on Sundays. We've been there so many times now that the owner and servers know us (we're very persuasive people...thanks dad!). Every so often, the chef will send us a roll of his choice. Yep, we have the hook ups here. Ha.. I'm a sashimi, nigiri, chirashi kinda girl, so that's my usual order when I go here ($15 during lunch). I have had the teriyaki lunch boxes a couple times which are really good too. The chicken ($9) can be kinda dry, so go salmon or beef ($10). 

They have a huge selection of rolls to choose from, but aren't always listed in the menu. Grab the carry out menu when you walk in, it has more sushi options than the dine-in one (not sure why) and there are pictures! Who doesn't love pictures. Oh, and dinner prices can run pretty steep - so stop in for lunch specials instead.

See you on Sunday Sushi Bar!

Have eaten here many times. The Sushi is very fresh and clean. Service is great. I read a comment where they person couldn't explain it but thought it was weird or something. Maybe it's because the staff is all Japanese? Not everyone is actually from the US and shares all of our traits. I think the service is great. They actually remember me when I come back and are very welcoming. I'm a Sushi addict and this is one of the better places in the area. Really can't go wrong.

More expensive than necessary but the sushi isn't bad. Usually not packed. I really have nothing extraordinary to say about this place. I've tried a few different rolls but nothing completely wowed me. At the same time, nothing really disappointed me either. I would recommend they do something about the music choice. They seem to use an ipod or something but songs or artists repeat over and over and over again. The last visit they let songs play on repeat back to back two to three times before choosing another song, it wasn't even busy. It was quite annoying so we ate quick to get out of there. Other than that, no complaints. Not as fresh as I'm used to but I have to remind myself I'm not in California anymore.

To say that I am a sushi-lover would be an understatement.  A connoisseur of sushi? Probably not.  But all that being said, I try it in damn near every city that I visit.. and  believe it or not, Sushi Bar in Bloomingdale has taken the cake every single time!

Vegas? You would think, but no.  San Fran? Nah.  Downtown Chicago.. meh.
The list goes on.  

What I love most about Sushi Bar is that their classics are consistent and tasty, while their specialty rolls hit the mark every single time.  I never order with my fingers crossed that "it will be good this time."  Sure, some of the rolls may be drowned in mayo, but who doesn't love devouring a savory, creamy sauce with a delicious cut of fish?  Their Spicy Yellowtail is by far a favorite of mine, as well as the Sakura Roll - yum!

I haven't been disappointed here in the 6 years I have been a patron.  The staff is wonderful, the place is perfectly clean, and the miso soup is never too too hot!

I wouldn't change a thing!

Has there ever been an upgrade from two to four stars?  I feel I should eat crow as my previous review was kind of harsh, and now, after a few more visits, Sushi Bar is a fave. It's a small sushi house but nice.  If you don't want to talk to your dining partners, there are 3 flat screen TV's that are usually on so you can watch whatever sporting event they have on. Service is nice, helpful without hovering. 

As there was a stretch when I couldn't eat sushi, I came back a few times to try their cooked items--sticking with shrimp and veggie tempura. Their shrimp and veggie tempura is very good.  Fresh shrimp and veggies, not overly cooked or overly battered in tempura,  the food arrives piping hot.  Very tasty and well-made. 

Now that I'm able to partake in sushi--I came back to test the fresh sushi waters again.  As mentioned by other reviewers, their maki menu is large and inventive.  I prefer nigiri, so I stuck with that--yellow tail, super white tuna, shrimp, unagi, squid.  All very fresh and good quality. The rice perfectly done. Super White tuna is my favorite and their SW here is delicious--buttery smooth. 

One thing to note--on weekdays they close between their lunch hours and dinner hours so best not to dine in close to the end of lunch hours.  They will not wait for you to finish your lunch and will expect you be gone by the end of their posted lunch hour.  If you don't get the hint, perhaps them shutting off the lights and packing their belongings is more of an indicator.  I get it, I get it.  I won't make that mistake again.

I go here once a month and have for the past 5 years. I'm a regular, and have never had a problem here. The staff is nice, and the manager has given me a free appetizer for being a regular. 

My husband used to think sushi was disgusting until trying this place. Phenomenal! I always get the Mexican volcano roll and the spicy volcano roll, both of which are deep fried. Omg yum, my mouth is watering thinking about it. 

Miso soup is good and always hot when I order it. Service is prompt and I never have to wait long. 

And to the person who gave them 1 star because of their siesta... It states on their door that they are closed from 3-4pm. This is when they nap because they're there all day, yeah they should lock their front door but read the hours before you walk in.

Crab Rangoon is yummy, too!

Oh and I've never had an issue with them splitting checks. Just be courteous and tell them you want separate checks when you order, not that difficult tbh.

I am giving this place a 1 star even though I have not eaten here.  Explanation - I called Groupon today and told them that my voucher expired over the weekend they in turn tell me that the amount I paid never expires.  I called up the restaurant to inform them that I have a Groupon and explained the terms of the voucher the face value of $11 never expires.  They said they don't take expired groupon, very hard to explain something when there is a language barrier. Needless to say I won't give these folks my business.

Chose Sushi Bar because it was close to my hotel, and had good reviews on Yelp. Very pleased. Had a "Penny Roll" and a "Red Dragon Roll". Both excellent. Many other choices; I may be back if I'm nearby at lunch time. Recommended!

I had such high hopes for this place after reading some the reviews here. Sadly, I did not like the sushi here. I ordered carryout; maybe that was a mistake to do. But the food was promptly made and ready for me when I went to pick it up. So this place gets a star for that. 

The sushi I ordered was drowned in mayonnaise; I knew it would be topped with it, but it overwhelmed the rest of the sushi roll. The rice tasted old and it was fairly dry. The Philadelphia rolls were almost a copy of the rolls I have bought at the deli section of Target. 

I wanted to try something different from the place I usually order, but I won't be going back here again.
I feel like they have lowered the prices of their specialty rolls and added new ones.  I must say, they are pretty tasty!  There's one called hand grenade that I want to go back and order again.

I come here every once in a while because it's in close proximity to where I live. Not really too big of a fan of the crazy sushi that some places make but this is pretty legit. I guess I'm kind of biased but get the Tom roll. Pretty delicious.

Usually I just get bento boxes though. Steak and shrimp tempura is where it's at. Tip though, boxes come with vegetable tempura, so unless u really want 3 shrimp tempura, get something else because you'll get more steak or chicken rather than just 3 shrimp.

Mild complaint, it's 2011 already so they should get a contract with like coke or pepsi so I can get some free refills man. 1.50 for a can of coke? bah

Place is great! Service was great!  Its nice to find a good joint in Bloomingdale.  Hanks special is my fav sushi platter.  I will definitely come back.  Pay attention to the neighborhood savings clipper coupons.  Save yourself some cash

I have been a patron since the actual day sushi bar opened years ago. The sushi was comparable to china town in San Francisco back in the day and the owners were nice. The spider roll was a naughty fried fav with the crab legs sticking out of the roll. The California roll and tekka maki were perfect! We even had a large family party here in 2001. Now, the staff is not welcoming and act as if they are doing us a favor serving us. Be ready for disgust if you dare to ask for more wasabi or ginger than the small amount they have calculate into their overhead...they obviously have a set ration and any requests for extra is outwardly disapproved of. They also refill tea at a snails pace...all part of the overhead. They smile and talk to one another engagingly/respectfully but literally frown as they approach diners. The spider roll is half the size now and no where near as tasty. The quality has definitely diminished substantially yet the prices are quite high. I know quality sushi is expensive and have no problem paying for quality sushi but this is no longer quality and the staff is just rude. The customers next to us used a GROUPON...what a mistake that was. It was like the soup nazi experience. They were treated horrifically. They shouldn't participate with groupon if they don't "welcome" groupon pleasantly. We felt relieved we didn't have a groupon and shamefully relieved the animosity was then shifted from the other diners onto this poor unsuspecting couple. Now reading here on yelp about employees having sex under a table leaving the door open makes me wonder if our dining there is truly a bother to them for reasons other than I originally thought or is the risk of getting caught a thrill for them? Too bizarre! New roll will be "afternoon delight" roll? Also, how sanitary is this place? Gross! Sadly looking into new places with less intense/irritable staff and fresh ingredients. Never going back there again! PS the owners I knew were the owners were not there. Maybe if they are still the owners and read this and clean house.

This place hit the spot! Our server was the best. We haven't gone here in about 3 or 4 years and they remembered us! Lol the spicy tuna is our favorite. They even have a great Chicago roll. Very filling for two people, and love the miso soup. Will definitely be coming back since we live down the street now

The food they serve is not a revelation but with great service and reasonable prices, it's a great place to call home and become a regular.

I have been here many times and they have stayed consistent. Keep in mind I have only sat at the bar, so service may be different if you sit at the tables.

-Food-
Katsu: They serve chicken or pork katsu. It is enough for two people. You can't really screw up katsu and hoisin sauce. Very crispy and very tender.

Hand Grenade: It is a pringle and on top if it a mix of tuna, Sriracha, mayo, and crispy bits of tempura and panko with an additional sliver of tuna on top. It's a nice tasty snack or appetizer. I believe they serve these in twos or threes.

Chirashi: I have often been disappointed in many Chirashis from other restaurants. Many places do not put roe into the Chirashi, but this place does and it's delicious!

Seaweed salad: Wasn't memorable. Wasn't bad, wasn't exceedingly good. It was just okay.

A la Carte Sushi/Sashimi and rolls: The sushi and sashimi is prepared well. As for rolls I recommend the Dragon Roll, for you non-adventurous types the Police Roll. They have a very nice selection of rolls. The only disappointment is they stopped carrying Otoro.

-Service-
Sitting at the bar the service from the short haired Itamae was excellent. He will remember your favorites/orders from previous visits... even if its only your 3rd. He will also occasionally prepare seaweed salads and hand grenades for you free of charge. What service! I have yet to let the Itamae choose my selections for me (Omakase). But I probably will next visit!

The wait staff around the bar is very attentive and almost never lets your teacup go empty! The older of the bunch is very friendly and will also remember you easily which makes to provide a much more personal and pleasurable experience.

Overall consistency and service is the star at this sushi restaurant and has elevated it from just a 3 (A-OK) star to a 4 (Fan) star.

So sad to see bad reviews! Yes the sakura roll is swimming in warm mayo (a guilty treat) the Philly roll here is the same as a philly roll anywhere else (that's why it is a Philly roll ...lol) and no ...this is not a "contemporary" sushi spot.

I have been coming here on and off for eight years. Of the dozens of sushi spots I've been to across the country ..Sushi Bar is at the top of the list!  The owners and staff are great, and most have been around all of that time.  It is always great to see the same smiling faces every time I go ...

Old school must-gets are the hand grenades, volcano roll and Hanks special! 

If you are looking for bells and whistles, go to Sushi Samba Rio, Swordfish or Starfish. If you are looking for great sushi, at a great price...come here!

If you are using a Groupon, please be aware that you must pay cash.  There is nothing on their website, or in the "rules" on the Groupon. 
But, get there, and see the sign on the door.

We were not prepared for that, and when we asked about paying with a credit card, were turned away, and not very politely.

We got a refund from Groupon, and will not go back.

This place is a bit of a mixed bag. 

The first red flag that went up was the menu. Wow, it's epic. Like Cheesecake Factory epic. It's a little overwhelming at first and you can tell immediately that it's trying a bit too hard. If they could shorten their menu version of War and Peace down to a two pager, they'd easily have better control over what they're trying to do.

Sushi itself had a lot of fun flavors going on. We did try a few different things and I was happy to find out that it was more hits than misses. 

Pet peeve though, the sushi rice. I come from a family where my grandmother measures down to the half teaspoon of water needed to get her rice JUST so. This place, not so much. I'm not sure they're rinsing the starches off or soaking it long enough, but it's coming out way too tough. Still, if you're able to work through that, there's a lot interesting things going on otherwise. 

Service is great, the ambiance is great. Only nit-pick there is the music. Or should I say, musak. I think we spent just as much time trying to figure out what bad 80's song was going to come up next.

Worth a couple visits but that's about it.

Great food, especially the chicken fried rice. It's $10 but you get a ton. Two rolls and fried rice comes out to about $30. You'll get miso with that. Service is a bit pushy, but we take out so doesn't really matter to us.

Great sushi is hard to come by in Chicago, let alone the suburbs, so when I try a new sushi place, I look for 2 things: clean-tasting fish and well-made sushi rice (you'd think these are a given, but not so, especially in the Midwest). I'm not a big of trendy and "out-of-the-box" maki rolls, but I do enjoy a fun creation once in a while. What I appreciate about Sushi Bar is that they have a large selection of tasty rolls to choose from but they also execute the classics well. Whether it's the amazingly delicious and unique Volcano Roll (deep fried with cream cheese and spicy mustard sauce) or a quintessential Rainbow Roll, you're sure to satisfy your craving for a one-of-a-kind experience and for good sushi. 

What makes this restaurant great rather than just good is their attention to detail. The restaurant is clean, the service is always friendly, we never wait long for the food to arrive, and even the hot tea isn't so hot you can't pick up the cup or drink it for 15 minutes. They add to their menu frequently and their hot kitchen menu is always a hit with the non-sushi-lovers as well.

If you're like me and you're more of a suburban roamer and can't stand having to go the city for good sushi, I strongly recommend Sushi Bar. You won't be let down.

This place is great in many ways: RIDICULOUSLY nice and attentive staff, cheap prices, fast service dine in or take out, good location, and excellent miso soup.  The sushi is just okay though.  The rolls aren't super flavorful and the contents are mashed up into a salad-like consistency.  You also have to use a ton of wasabi to make the spicy rolls spicy.  Overall, decent on the run, but not my favorite.

I really enjoy this restaurant and have been coming here for years.  Eva is awesome when she is working and the personality of everyone there is very welcoming.  The comments on the Sakura roll from previous posters.. umm  thats what it is, don't like mayo?  Don't order it.  I get one once in a while when I have saved up enough calories to indulge.  I am fond of a lot of the special things they do there, but lately the fish does not seem quite as fresh and the cuts are a little small.  Hopefully this will turn around.

The sushi is pretty good. Had a lunch special that included six pieces of sushi and a California roll for a pretty good price. 

The experience was strange, though. We were being hurried because for some reason they were closing at 3:00 PM. No explanation. They just warned us right as we were putting in our order.  We were given the impression that we couldn't stick around a few minutes after close. They started turning the lights off and packing up their things right at 3:00 PM. I felt like I was in a competitive sushi eating event because I was eating so quickly. 

I really hope this isn't a common thing. I really like these guys. I've been here twice before and the service is usually great.

Great food, good service. Drinks are a little pricey though...1.50 for a can of soda? hmm...
But yeah, most of the bad reviews had to do with their sushi being 'fishy'..? Guys...you DO know that sushi usually is made with fish right?........ ADERP
Great food. The owner is a nice man. I use to work right next to his store and if I was short on cash he had no problem helping me out.    The hand grenades are the besttt ( please try them)

Unagi? Yes, please!

Spicy Tuna? Oh yeah!

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE me some sushi!

I've been here several times and each time I'll try something new, but I'll always start off with Unagi & Spicy Tuna. The Unagi is perfect for easing somebody into sushi. I always tell my friends that it's like eating BBQ chicken on rice. The Spicy Tuna is pretty good too, just enough kick to it, but not too much to the point that it'll destroy your mouth.

I recommend the Salmon Skin Roll and highly recommend the Philadelphia Roll. I LOVE the Philadelphia Roll! I know it's just salmon, avocado, & Philadelphia cream cheese, but for some reason I keep thinking smoked ham whenever I eat it and I can't get enough of it!

This place is nothing fancy, but the sushi, in my experience so far, has been pretty darn good, the service is fast and friendly, and the prices aren't outrageous. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the area and need to get my sushi fix.


Holla!!!‚Ñ¢

I love this place. The service is great with an extremely friendly staff, it is clean, and they have some very creative rolls. Try the Mark's Roll (our favorite and they remember everytime I go) and the Holiday Roll. I also enjoy the Spicy Tuna Roll. The sushi is good and very reasonable priced.
My go to place for fun sushi.

The restaurant is clean with plain/typical d√©cor (nothing special about the d√©cor, but it wasn't terrible either).  
It's just like any other small sushi restaurants in any suburban strip malls.  

Interesting to note that they have quite a number of "House Special" sushi named for people who I assume are their frequent and/or regular customers.  

Meal came with Miso soup and green tea.   Waiter was friendly, and attentive.

If you are looking for authentic Japanese/sushi restaurant, this is not the place.  
Most of the sushi seem to be catered more for western taste (heavy with mayo).  Maybe next time, I'll try asking to ease up on the mayo or any other heavy sauce (ie. Honey Mustard). 

But, the food/sushi are decent.  It was close by.  Prices are reasonable. It was not super crowded (for Friday night).  We will go back and, maybe, try the non-sushi items (with winter is coming, Udon sounds good) from the menu.

If you want a spicy roll, don't order the special they have right now, the Mexican Jalapeno roll. It was not spicy at all and it was not well put together. The other people I cam with looked like they were enjoying their rolls and boxes, so I think I just ordered the worst roll.

I used to come here all the time. I received a $40 gift certificate as a birthday gift and they REFUSED to take it. I had called ahead as I now live in the city and wanted to confirm that they would take it before I made the drive. I was told they would, of course, take the gift certificate. They basically stole money from my friend who bought it. I will never eat there again. I felt sorry for the waitress that had to deliver the bad news. The least the cowardly manager or owner could have done is come out and do his own dirty work. Bad customer service. They do not care about their customers. If they don't care about their customers I doubt they care about their food any longer.
Was just here for lunch had the Spicy Tuna Rainbow $11.95 Roll was small and lacked flavor.  The fish on top were shavings.  The entire experience stunk.
I have been to a lot of different sushi places and one thing about this quiet little place is that it is ALWAYS delicious, fresh and consistent every time.

Gosh, Ive been going to this place for years now.  The staff is friendly and remembers their regulars.  A little high on their special rolls, but its worth going back for the quality and atmosphere.

Aside from their sushi, their soups and sides are just as delicious.  make a trip and try this restaurant, im confident you will find something to please you.

2.5 stars.

Sashimi was terrible. I mean baddd. The salmon one was fine, the rest were awful. The udon was pretty bad as well, amongst the least good ones I have ever had (the tempura it came was was solid). We got a special roll that had spicy tuna and unagi and that was fantastic. Really well done. Service was OK but nothing special. Speed of bringing out our order was quite impressive as well.

So my summary: stick to the rolls that have flavor added (eg spicy ones, ones with avacado, ones with sauces).
The food is ok/good and prices are reasonable.  The restaurant itself needs some serious updating though.

Kinda come here wayyyyy to often that it practically drains my bank account.  lol.  I am not a big roll person so I usually stick to sushi or sashimi.  Typically order the 10 piece Salmon special or the Sake Don.  Both very delicious.  I dont eat in there often but when I do its nice and quiet.  I usually do take out and take it to work.  Very good food.  Good wait-staff.

The visit here was average. My husband & I ordered the following:
2 spicy Scallop hand rolls - Delicious 
1 dragon roll - a little heavy on the cream cheese
Salmon teriyaki box - salmon was on the thin & dry size, 
but the plus to the thin side...no bones!
Sashimi Deluxe - husband enjoyed it, although for the price,
 a couple of more pieces wouldn't hurt.
The miso soup & the salad, that came with the meal were fine.
The soup wasn't salty & the salad wasn't watery, which is my most found flaw with such restaurants that are not too authentic.
The service, for a Friday night, was attentive. 
It wasn't very busy, a lot of people picking up take out, and they seem to really know their 'regulars'. With all of the orders being picked up, we had at least 3 people waiting on us.
So with our meals, & 1 coke can, close to a hundred bucks with tip.
Not quite a fan, but my visit was A-ok!

Not the first time I have eaten here but it will be my last. Had the 3 maki lunch special yesterday all I can say is ewwww. The fish tasted and smelt fishy. My girlfriend had eaten here last week and said the same. Personally I think this place is a step above store bought sushi.

My point system: 50 points available for food, 25 available for service 25 and 25 available for atmosphere = 100 Total possible points. 1-30 = 1 star, 31-60 = 2 stars, 61-80 = 3 stars, 81-95 = 4 stars & 96-100 = 5 stars.

I love sushi & this place was a decent little restaurant in the burbs of Chicago.

Food = 30 out of 50
Before I selected my main I was given a complimentary bowl miso soup. It was delightfully seasoned and a good light start to the meal. For my meal I wanted to have several different rolls and they allowed me to order half sized rolls (Extra points for you). I ordered "tasting" portions of the tuna & avocado roll, caterpillar roll, spider roll (no spiders actually in the roll :)) & the tuna & pepper roll. The presentation was nice. They placed two of the  1/2 size rolls on a wooden plank with the wasabi & pickled ginger. The planks were wet which caused my wasabi to become runny and leak all over the plank and that is really my only big complaint about the presentation/food. The fish was decent (It is the Midwest) but it was not anywhere close to what I can get at the nicer sushi bars here in St. Louis. The rolls were not over complicated and they were not drenched in some unnecessary sauce (extra points for you). When I eat sushi I like to have the pure flavors of the fish, rice & vegetables. Simple is almost always better & they did that here. Over all I would say it was good but not crazy good. 

Service = 20 out of 25
The service was very quick. My drink never ran empty and I was given a complimentary bowl of miso soup. The sushi was handed to me over the sushi bar counter as soon as it was complete. Overall the best part of the meal was the attention given to me by the service staff.
 
Atmosphere = 20 out of 25 
The atmosphere was that of a small neighborhood sushi restaurant. Standard Japanese decorations hung on the walls and everyone was very friendly. Most of the customers who came in while I was eating seemed to be regulars - The wait staff new most of them on a first name basis. I got to sit at the sushi bar itself and chat with the 3 sushi chefs working that day. That is always a plus in my mind. 

Total Points = 70
Total Stars = 3
Refused to accept our groupon even though it does not expire for 5 months.  I Used come here alot but wont be back again.

I come here for lunch at least once a week with my coworkers. This is a great place when you want great service, simple selection and a good time. Kenny is a great guy and always treats us like family. People may say this is a no thrill place but it is just nice to sit down order what you want and enjoy the food without all the extra stuff but take in the simplicity of it all. 

I personally recommend the Kamikaze! It is simply fantastic. You will never look at pringle chips the same! Also try the Super White Tuna! 

For a nice casual night out this place is perfect or even lunch. The lunch specials can be really good!

I LOVE this place!  The super white tuna is phenomenal!!!!!  It absolutely just melts in your mouth.  Ive tried a good variety of their specialty rolls and havent been disappointed.  I'm ordering again tonight and will be getting the spring rolls, volcano roll and a TC roll.  Super super fresh sushi!!  Yum!

I am a huge sucker for spicy salmon/tuna rolls. Every time I try a new place, I have to try their spicy rolls to see if their up to par.

I was surprised to find that they probably have the best spicy salmon rolls in the Chicagoland area. The flavor is sensational (oh yeah, I did throw that term in there, thanks to all that Food Network watching haha) And the salmon is moist. They don't cheap out on the filling either. Each roll has a good amount of salmon in there too. 

I'm just surprised there's a pretty good sushi joint nearby my place :)

As I write this review i'm watching a straight to video Van Damme movie on cable.

That has nothing to do with this review but that will be the only mildly humorous addition to this review.
Staff is attentive and borderline annoying. sushi is mediocre and the spicy tuna and spicy salmon rolls are awful minced mush.

I visit friends in the burbs often, we won't be going back here.
Good place for quiet Sushi night.  Close, reasonable prices and fresh.....they have a huge selection of rolls and very good Miso Soup.  Carryout is also a breeze.

Sushi Bar, the cleverly named spot lost in a strip mall off Army Trail road in Bloomingdale is surprisingly good. 

The salmon, suzuki, super white & hamachi were translucent and melted in your mouth.

They had a super white salad in a slightly sweetend chili oil dressing with julienne vegtable so fine they were like silk thread. 

You could smell the ocean in the often-scary Uni which was excellent and the miso soup came with the sushi and was what you expect.

Sitting at the sushi bar with its granite counter top of crystals so huge they looked like trilobites I could have been in downtown Chicago, NYC or Tokyo but it was just Bloomingdale.

This place is just okay.  There was nothing about the service or food that made me say "Wow" or even "maybe I'll try it again."  Service was slow and two of the items were ordered were forgotten (salmon sushi and seaweed salad) but otherwise polite.  They were very polite about getting us the items once we said something, but still. We didn't order that much and there wasn't that much to miss.

I just wasn't that impressed with the presentation and quality of the food.  The spicy tuna roll and another roll (a special, $13.95 roll made with lobster and cream cheese but I can't remember the name) were basically just mush.  Sam's roll was okay and since it is pretty hard to screw up a California roll, those were also okay (but nothing to write home about).

Overall, I probably won't return.  I find my money and time are much better spent just a few miles away at Kinta in Carol Stream.

It was alright basically 2.5 stars.   Was looking for a quick dinner and decided to order in this place.   Loved the online order feature on their website and extensive menu.   Fish was fine.   Maybe not super fresh but definitely not bad - tuna was good and salmon was fine.   Ordered a few rolls and the rainbow roll waas disappointing - fell apart as I grabbed pieces of the roll.   Tuna roll was standard and was full of tuna for the price.  Prices seem a little high but that's what you get for sushi.
