I'll order again when I need a quick sushi fix, but will likely do my splurging downtown.

Not the first time eating here but will be my last. Had the 3 Maki lunch special yesterday and all I can say is that is ewww. The fish had a fishy smell and taste to it and just tasted blah. My girlfriend was in a few days before and had said the same thing. I  pretty much think this place is a step above store bought sushi. Dont waste your money.
Been coming here for many, many years.  Always sit in the same spot.  Always order the same (-ish) things.  Fantastic, fresh and great atmosphere.  Worth the money and time.

Service: 

Prompt and the wait staff does their best to be as personable as possible.  I like how they always remember what I want.  I've been going to them for years now and my order rarely varies.  They're all friendly and very much accommodating.  

Sushi:

Fresh, always consistent and I don't think they've ever messed up my order.  That is a big plus for me.  

Ambiance: 

This is a neighborhood spot that gets a lot of attention...on weekends they're always packed.  Its excellent for a casual date night.  

Value:

Reasonably priced and that's why I go about twice a month.

This is my go-to place for Japanese take-out.  It's your pretty standard no-frills Japanese restaurant and food, but they do have a lot of variety on the menu so you certainly can explore some new things here that you won't find at other's.  But, they do the standard no-frills stuff very well-- tempura, terriaki, maki rolls, miso soup and rice.  Prices are reasonable and service is fast.

I gave this place a few chances and I just can't do it anymore.  The food doesn't taste fresh, they put so much mayo which makes me believe now that they are hiding that the fish isn't fresh.  

The place appears to be nice, nice looking bar, nice dining area but it just doesn't deliver.  I tried taking a non sushi eater here to convert them and couldn't.  I took them to a place like Sushi House in LaGrange and they were converted quickly.  You can notice a huge difference in freshness.  I also brought family with me when they were in town visiting and they weren't happy.  They are sushi eaters as well and they didn't care for anything but one item and we ordered simple stuff.  So I don't think its just me.    

I have found another place nearby and won't be going back.

I don't know if they were having an off night or what but I ordered takeout and it was awful! Got the Mr. Right Roll and Philly. Both were warm when I got home ( I live less than 10 min away) the rice was dry and the fish looked off. I couldn't finish the Mr. Right roll, too crumbly and I found pieces of bone in my fish. Not going to go there again. Very disappointed

We did takeout here not too long ago. I know that sushi is better when you are eating it right from the chef but sometimes I just want to relax with a movie and get my sushi fix. The sushi was fresh but some of the rolls we picked weren't exactly my favorite. In particular there was one that was topped with so much mayo sauce that it was definitely gross. Unfortunately it only takes one bad roll for me to go from great to so-so. The normal rolls that I get were great though - crunchy roll, spicy tuna, spicy salmon.

On another note the miso soup was very good and for the price it was a good value.  I will try this place again and steer clear from the rolls with mayo sauce on top.

This place has been around for 10 years now according to the menu, and the last time I'd been here was a friendship, a girlfriend, and a marriage ago.

At least something in life stays refreshingly consistent.

Good food. The menu has expanded dramatically from what I remember. Sushi was fresh and tasty, and while I typically don't order wacky stuff where I can admire the artistry I can appreciate a well executed spread.

There was a goof where my tuna and yellowtail order quantity were reversed, but it was quickly resolved. I'd have appreciated if the rest of my food were left with me at the table while this was fixed instead of having it whisked away, but to their credit it was returned quickly.

Wow.  I was shocked.  The name and its location (strip mall) made me hesitate a long time.  I walk in, and I see mostly non-Asian customers, and I hesitate again.  I order and eat, and I am in heaven with a huge sigh of relief escaping from my lips.  A decent sushi place...in the far west suburbs!  Yahoo!  

I thought the specialty rolls were inventive and tasty -- they had quite a variety.  Crab rangoon was tasty.  They have a lot of other items on the menu, too, like bento boxes, etc.  I enjoyed my super white tuna roll, spicy salmon roll and magura sashimi.  My fiance enjoyed the Philadephia roll (I never partake with him because I think it is sacrilege to have cheese adjacent to raw fish), dragon roll, and eel specialty roll.  

We were stunned.  I truly expected mediocre tasting sushi, but instead we ate a pretty darn good sushi meal.   My only criticism is that there is way, way, way too much mayo in the spicy rolls -- I don't mind the spicy stuff but the mayo needs to be cut back.  Service was terrific, too.  And it was good to see Asian sushi chefs --- though not a guarantee of good sushi, it is always kind of a mark of credibility!

Prices were reasonable, too.   If it were closer to my home, I think I might be eating at this place every day!  LOL...

I thought it was just.. ok. They were very attentive, but it was not very fresh. The salmon in particular tasted slightly less than fresh. This may have something to do with it not being very crowded when we were there. 

Also? It always makes me slightly suspicious when everyone in the restaurant speaks Mandarin, not Japanese.

Service here isn't the best, the waitresses and waiters don't speak English too well and aren't very friendly.  However, the sushi is very good as are the dinners  The teriyaki beef and chicken is really good, the teriyaki sauce is homemade and not from a jar.  I enjoy the spicy tuna rolls (the spicy sauce is mixed in with the tuna instead of plopped on top of the roll which I prefer) and the tuna avocado roll is really tasty.  Not too pricey either and very casual.

We order here about 3-4 times a year, however the last 2 times we were really underwhelmed. We order the dragon roll and it seems to get smaller and smaller every time we order it. We hope things will change, but if the rolls keep shrinking the way they do, we could make do somewhere else for the same price and end up with something a bit better/bigger for the price.

So far this would be my new favorite spot when Thai food cravings arises. I made an impromptu stop on a Thursday around 1:30pm and the small restaurant had a few longer guests. 

I ordered the pad Thai and my lunch date had the pad se ew. The lunch special was very nice portion and priced at $8. The spring roll was crunchy and had good flavor and the Tom yum chicken soup was spiced just perfectly. The overall portions of both appetizers were perfect. The service was friendly and fast. 

Ignore the simple decor and this place is a hidden gem with reasonably priced food.

Wish I went elsewhere...................

Ordered Thai Basil Beef and pretty disappointed to see very tiny portion of meat "chopped up". Most was fat trimmings. The main spotlight the dish seemed to take was all vegetables and sauce..
too sweet, no spice at all. tasted like sugar water.

Curry chicken filled a container halfway, little to no meat again and all sauce.

Quality: below average

Pretty much had sauce and rice for dinner, not something I want to start the week off with..
Maybe I went on a bad day, considering reviews were above and beyond- who knows.

Rather not order from here again.
worth a try since it is on my way home from work.

I don't mean to rip this place up, but the reviews were very misleading on Yelp.

We have been trying out Thai restaurants in the NW suburbs and keep coming back to Yupin as our go-to. The service is fast, restaurant is clean, and it hasn't ever been crowded when we've gone. 

The food is the real reason we go back though. The Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Green Curry here are all delicious and we favor them over the same dish at other Thai restaurants in the area. Each dish is very flavorful and the portion sizes are good.

Travelling for work, wanted to get something nearby my hotel that would be relatively quick so I ordered takeout from Yupin. I ordered the shrimp Pad Thai for my meal. You know, i have to say it tasted a bit sweeter(?) than other Pad Thai I have had in the past, but that was by no means a bad thing. In fact, I loved it!! The shrimp were very tasty too.. and the noodles were delicious. Also got a side order of crab Rangoons which were also delicious! Next time I'm here for work I will definitely return!!

Unfortunately, though I love Thai food, this place does not deliver. 

I ordered the pad thai and was shocked to see very thin noodles and the flavor which did not resemble it at all. Not to mention that I came for rice noodles because I am gluten free, generally speaking, and I was very nervous not knowing what type of noodles where on my plate.

We also ordered a sweet and sour dish and there was hardly any chicken on the plate. While the warm cucumbers were amazing, we cannot justify paying for chicken when there was hardly any.

I was really looking forward to this and left sadly disappointed. 

Note to all, I am sorry to say, I would find another spot.

Amazing Thai food!  Some of the best I have ever had. 

I was looking for a restaurant near O'Hare because I was picking someone up and they had a evening flight and wanted to eat beforehand and be nearby.

I am SO glad I did, but I only wish that this restaurant was closer to my house - it is nearly an hour one way...

The service was good, not great, but the food more than made up for it.  The fresh spring rolls were very flavorful and the dipping sauce had a nice kick to it.  My Panang Curry (tofu) had a good flavor, but the spicy level was determined by the staff, thinking that I might not want it too spicy (they tend to be on the spicy side, they said).  It had some heat, but I wanted more, they brought me a spice tray, but it is not the same as having the spice bloom in the cooking process.

My daughter had Pad See Ewe and the flavor was nice and didn't have the 'standard' dark brown gravy, the sauce was tan in color, but much more flavorful with notes of black pepper.

Excellent place, was passing through Chicago en route back to Michigan and decided to stop to fuel ourselves for the road. Yelp actually took us to the wrong side of the intersection at first but easy enough to find. 

I was really impressed, greeted and seated  upon arrival and attentive service. Food was superb and I wish that I could get these to deliver to Grand Rapids, MI.
I usually order curry friend rice with tofu and sometime curry Fried rice with chicken with extra eggs and i always love it .

I recently moved to the area and am very pleased with this Thai restaurant. I will be back to try the pad Thai. The pad see ewe (sp?) was amazing as was the crab Rangoon. -1 star for serving size of crab rangoons vs cost.

Thank you for a delicious meal and pleasant service on a cold evening. 
The highlight of the night was the Tom Kha Soup. I had to wrestle the bowl away from my wife before she sucked it all down. The Chicken Pad Thai was also tasty delicious. The papaya salad had a nice spicy zing to it. We also ordered the Lard Nar which was also a winner with my daughter. 
Bottom line we will definitely return to sample more items off the menu. I think my wife may secretly come back just for the Tom Kha soup without telling me. 
Keep up the good work.

Stop in for a quick lunch...

Had a Singha to start which always is nice...

Spring Rolls were so-so. Good wrapper but the 33% cucumber log was out of balance. I'd skip it.

Pad Thai was pretty good. Medium spicy is on par with real Thai as it's hot for the white folk...

The lunch special soup is like a bouillon cube broth with a bit of tofu and a couple shredded veggies...

The Crab Rangoon (I think that's what it was) had all cream cheese and maybe some crab flavor. The shell was nice and crispy.

Overall I might go back but for all the hype 5 stars I was expecting much more... I need to not order the lunch special and get a couple real dishes...

Great food, outstanding service. We will be back.

We both enjoyed Thai Basil. Great spice, flavor was outstanding.

They have a lunch special for 8.00, but we got full meals which included chicken tum yum and a fired dumpling. Everything exceeded our expectations.
Had egg rolls and yellow curry... they customise ur order according to your taste! Loved the place... staff is also very cordial

Only 3 stars for today's lunch experience. Pad Kee Mao w/chicken was A+. Love the touch of smoke flavor & they asked if I wanted spicy. YES. They turned up the heat. PERFECT
The egg roll was useless carbs/and was frozen in the center. The soup had a nice flavor, but again-another anemic gesture. Would it really put you "out of business" to put out a real home-made veggie spring-roll (or two even) and a larger "cup" of broth with some actual vegetables in it? I'm all for cost cutting, but this goes too far. I almost laughed out loud. Thai little Home pulls the same crap with their Lunch menu.  ***SIGH*** I'll check back again for dinner : )
Good and convenient.  We placed a pick up order.  It was packed nicely and tasted good  but we expected more for our money.

I took my parents here because they are Thai and they want some Thai food. The food is very delicious, very authentic (can be very spicy) (yes, I'm Thai so I know what's the authentic Thai food), some of the dish are even better than my favorite place in Chicago, and definitely more than what I would expect from a place in the suburb.

Before we left, the owners came to greet us in Thai and they are super nice and friendly.

I don't go to Thai restaurant usually my business partner ask me to go with him
I was very impressed very  good and very fresh I will definitely go again

Pretty decent Thai place and it's close to home!  The owners are very nice and attentive and the place is decorated nicely.  We were here with a big party so we got to order a bunch of dishes.  The standouts were the Green Curry, Pad Se-ew and the Basil Fried Rice.  We also ordered the Tom Yum Shrimp and it was good, but it didn't quite have the acidity that I was expecting, maybe needed a little more lime juice.

But overall, we enjoyed our dinner and it was decently cheap for the 7 of us.  Would definitely recommend at least trying this place out again.

I really love this place. People talk about what tire restaurant is always better than the rest and the truth is there all American Thai and therefore pretty much all the same. Just like Italian, Greek, or Chinese.

What separates Yupin from every othe Thai restaurant  is the owner is Thai themselves  and the food is as authentic as they come. Someone else on the previous review said that the food was like street vendor  food that you get in Thailand. I've never been to Thailand so I don't know. My mom though is from Thailand and the food that she makes enough at home is the same food that you get at this restaurant. At your own discretion as for Thai hot, you'll see the difference tween nothing at restaurant and a regular Thai  restaurant. My favorite meal here is the catfish and basil friend rice!!!

Love a locally owned company where the owners are there for you to talk. Highly recommend.

Delish.... While on business on the outskirts of OHare airport I discovered this tiny little Thai restaurant   Yelp gave it a good review so I was game. They offered a half dozen luncheons at $7.95 that included soup and an appetizer. Wow a bargain and flavorful. The regular menu had a variety of ethnic options. All looking amazing.  
Don't be fooled by the strip mall. It's worth walking in!!!

I ordered the Pad Thai lunch special, which comes with soup and an egg roll ($7.95). The lunch special was meh for two reasons:

1. The soup was basically chicken broth in a bowl with some veggies/ tofu thrown in. Pretty average.

2. The egg roll was good, but so tiny! 

On top of the lunch special, I ordered Crab Rangoon because I've heard great things (which are true!) My fresh out of the deep-fryer steaming bundles of cream cheese and crab were soooo good! Crispy breading with significant filling. 

The Pad Thai was on par as well. The right amount of sauce to noodle ratio with peanuts on the side so you could add as many as you wanted. I wish there were more green things i.e. cilantro, lime, bean sprouts (is that Americanized Thai?) Bonus: I ordered a medium level of spice which helped clear up my stuffy nose. 

I would suggest just ordering the main dish instead of the lunch special because they do their main dishes really well. The waitresses were attentive but very busy. Lunch took me about an hour.
Whenever it comes to Thai food I can't resist. Really good curries at reasonable price. Love the red curry over here it's awesome.
Best thai food Ive ever had by a lot. Incredible. Typical casual Thai restaurant run by a friendly family. The food is absolutely incredible.

Excellent food, service and ambience. We tried the green curry, pad se woo, and the taro custard, fresh spring roll and siew mai- all were delicious!!!!! Will be back for more!! Friendly owners!!! Must visit!!!

I am a big fan of Thai food. I have to say this was the best Thai food I have had in my life. They understand the authenticity of flavors. I will be coming here often. The service was also good. The lady who served is explained us about hot sauces and condiments. Offered us vegetarian options. My God I am glad to see why others have also rated this small family Restaurent very high. Great Thai family owned Restaurent. Thank you for the great Food. Keep up the good flavors. :)

Food was amazing!! I would recommend trying out this place! It's a hole in the wall, but well worth it. I've been looking for a good Thai place, and this is if! Pad Thai is fabulous!! 5 stars! Go eat here!

Good, basic Thai food. They do the basics well - food is flavorful, service is good, portions are decent and prices are reasonable. If you are looking for a casual Thai take out or sit down meal, then I'd recommend this meal.

Affordable and delicious! Came to lunch here after reading other yelp reviews and Yupin Thai did not disappoint. My sister and I ordered the Thai staples pad see ewe and pad Thai. It came with a cup of tofu soup that was super yummy and I don't really care that much for soup! The egg roll was crispy and flavorful. We also ordered the shrimp in a blanket (also fresh and tasty). The meals were great the pad Thai was the best my sister has ever had and I'm going to say the same about the pad see ewe. Server was very nice and I will be returning
What a a diamond  in the rough! !this place was great. The cucumber salad  was tasteful!  The Chicken satays  perfectly  seasoned. I had the red panang  curry. Berry flavorful.   Highly recommended.
An unbelievable $25 lunchtime special for a 3 course meal. Great food and service
Very goof thai place. Had the coconut chicken soup it was excellent. And the lard nar not disappointed at all. Definitely a must stop in the Chicago area.

Looks like a small hole in the wall place. I got the crab Rangoon, Hawaiian fried rice with tofu, and ginger entree with tofu. It was all phenomenal! I would definitely get the ginger entree with tofu again. The ginger wasn't overpowering, it was a good balance of flavors. The crab rangoons and fried rice were also delicious.
Love the delicious food, friendly service, quiet atmosphere, and good prices. Favorite Thai restaurant.

If you like tasty Thai food then this is the place to go. I tried the Tom Kha and it was a nice portion with plenty of chicken and vegetables. It was piping hot and flavorful. I also order the Pad Kee Mao. I recommend that you get the medium or mild and add the pepper oil sauce to taste. It was made just right - street comfort food at its best.  Enjoy!

First time trying Thai food and it was delicious. The older gentleman gave my wife and I wise advice to go with medium spicy instead of hot. We got the Thai fried rice with chicken and Thai Pad with chicken. Great food and nice people that give you a great friendly vibe.

Two mediocre Thai experiences in two weeks had me searching for a good spot to rekindle my love of Thai food. All the great reviews motivated my friend and I to check this place out and it did not disappoint! Here's another 5 stars review!
The place was quiet when we arrived so we chose where to sit, and the waitress quickly brought out waters and menus (which had pictures next to each item--bonus). 
We split the Crab Rangoon and, no lie, it really is the best I've had. Perfect combination of crispy and soft. My friend ordered the Pad Thai and I ordered the Pad See Ewe. Both were phenomenal. Both kinds of noodles were cooked to perfection. Our helpful, friendly waitress showed us how to customize the amount of spice we wanted in our food. 
I think I found my go-to Thai place. Can't wait to bring more friends to try this place out!

This place was absolutely amazing!! Best crab rangoon I've ever had and the pad thai was DELICIOUS!! Service was just as amazing. Definitely going to be making a return trip next time I'm in Chicago!!

Wow. I don't know where to start. This was hands down the best Thai I've ever had!

My friend had the chicken pad Thai and crab Rangoon.... AMAZING! Best Rangoon I've ever tasted.

I tried something new with the panang curry. Out of this world. Perfect combination of sweet and spicy. So rich and delicious. The crispy egg rolls were the perfect addition.

I will definitely be adding this place to my list of go to restaurants! And the customer device was fantastic. The man who took our order talked us through the spicyness so that everything was perfect!

Best Thai food in the suburbs! Love that when you ask for spicy/extra spicy they actually prepare your food that way.  Their food rivals what you would find in the city.  So happy I've found this place!!!
Still love this place. My husband, who never cared for Thai food, is now asking to eat here on Friday nights. I always order the curries, but he loves the garlic chicken and egg rolls.

Been in the area for 3 years and about to leave in may and just barely tried their curry its amazing its dancing in my mouth still spring rolls are delicious too try them out some time cozy lil place too

Ordered the lunch pad Thai with chicken, chicken potstickers, and enjoyed the egg roll and soup that came with the special. Medium spicy was perfect, and matched the medium Thai spice spectrum... Meaning medium is pretty spicy. $7.95 for the special. The potstickers came out fried, which I was confused at, we wanted the chicken wonton soft ones, but maybe I ordered wrong. :). Definitely recommend!
Food here is great, I've never had anything I didn't like, my go to is the Pad Khee Mao, one suggestion is to ask for not spicy or mild because the spicy is inferno.  Love this place, go try it!
Spicy Thai Basil Beef . Hands down for this delicious dish. The service is quick with friendly smile. Thank you for the dinner and I'll definately come back.
I have only tried the Thai Basil Chicken. I LOVE IT! I have even done back to back lunch visits. The best Basil Chicken I have had thus far...and I have had my fair share. Love love love! :-)

Update:  Yupin Thai Kitchen continues to be an excellent restaurant.  The food is fantastic, always served perfectly, and the service is great.  

For those who don't know, Yupin is the lady/owner/chef making her amazing magic with the best Thai food I have ever tasted.  I was thrilled to meet her today!  I love her soups, and every one of the many entrees I have tried.  Pod Kee Mao is one of my new favorite Yupin dishes.

When I bring my friends in to eat, they are always pleased and become repeat customers, like me.  Lunches and dinners have always been delicious, spicy experiences.  Love it.

My friend took me here. And oh my....how grateful I am! If you're looking for authentic Thai cuisine then this is it. The chef/owner; Yupin is such a wonderful lady. Just tell her how you want your food to be cooked and she will try her best to comply. I'm an extremely spicy food kindda person, and she can satisfy my palate just right 
Everything from salads, noodles, tom yum, etc tasted right, you should come and prove it yourself.
It's a pretty small family owned establishment which I support all the wayyy...

+  Really nice service
+  The freshest and largest cucumber salad in Cook County
+  Tasty pad thai, generous with the sprouts and peanuts
+  Lunch for two, plus leftovers, for $25
Me and my family usually visit Yupin Thai . I like the taste and quality of food . Staff is really good . My fav is basil fried rice and green curry . Good food at reasonable price .
Best Crab Rangoon I ever had. Chicken Pad Thai was really good too. Happy I came to this place. I will definitely be coming back again
Tasty lunch - great lunch special includes mini spring roll and soup. Excellent! My husband had the basil fried rice, and I had the pad kee-mao. Good sized portions and very tasty.

One of the best Thai places I've ever eaten at. Basil fried rice, the curries, and pad see ew I've had are amazing. Flavorful and just the right amount of spice. I'd recommend this place to anybody interested in Thai food. 

Place is not anything fancy but will do the job and the portions served are right. But the food is great!!
Ordered this for the first time tonight. I didn't get what I ordered but it was still really good what they did give me! Haha will be back

Went here for early dinner. My husband and I were the only ones dining in. Many people came in for carry out though. The service was ok, not great but the food makes up for it. Dipping sauce with spring rolls was just yummy!!! I had Thai fried rice and hubby had duck.. Both of the dishes were great and flavorful. Very delicious Thai food... A must try place!

Great food! Great taste! Their seafood is very fresh and of high quality. I ordered Pad Thai Shrimp, Basil Fried Rice with Shrimp, and Mixed Seafood Tom Yum. They were all fantastic! Probably the best Thai food I ever had and I am from Los Angeles!

One word - Excellent. Mongolian beef is awesome. The kids devoured the pot stickers. Small restaurant with good service and attentive staff. Food portions are good and the food is superb. It is a small restaurant in a strip mall but the food is unbelievable. Small businesses like this need your support! I highly recommend!
Had Tom yum soup, pad Thai, salad curry friend rice.      They were all delicious. Especially Tom yum was the best I had in Illinois.  Make sure to get shrimp tom yum :)
Still love this place...best Thai in 10 miles radius.

Great food and fantastic customer service.  I recommend to try the curry, the flavors are explosive!  I would suggest to order medium spicy as that seems to have the perfect combination of heat and flavor!  This is an authentic Thai restaurant and the food is not over sweetened or salted. Just go here and find out for yourself!

5 of us and everyone thought the food was excellent.  I ordered the catfish which was fantastic and at medium heat was plenty hot.
Decor is far from fancy and there were some pesky flies so this place is all about the food.

I have to be honest and say that we were reluctant to try Yupin Thai as it inhabits the same storefront that was previously occupied by two different Thai restaurants that were not very good (Saded Thai, Little Bangkok). But we decided to give it a try this weekend and I am glad we did. We order two orders of pad kee Mao, pad Thai, and yellow curry all at varying spices levels. Everything was fabulous. The yellow curry was a bit heavy on the oil. The pad Thai was easily the best among the Thai restaurants in the area. 

We ordered our food carry out so I can't speak to the service in the restaurant, but the gentleman who took the order on the phone was efficient and did not mess up our order at all.
It was a simple little place with big flavors!  I enjoyed it and it was solid quality

Family owned and on premises with you in the restaurant, mom dad kids grandma.  That's ok I guess.  Well behaved.  I was hoping to wowed with some really great Thai but alas only average.  Clean and average.  Nice family friendly service.
Great food with a mom and pop atmosphere.  Prices are fair.  Great place for a casual date!

I like to sample the pad thai at various places.  This is my New favorite!   Right about of sauce and just the right amount of kick! (they actually ask you how spicy you want it instead of just burning you to pieces.. I got mild)  Delicious!!  I'll be coming back to this place for sure... Aside from the food the pricing is reasonable, good portions, and very friendly and fu staff!  :) All around great place

First time here and the food was excellent! We moved to the neighborhood from San Diego and were having a hard time finding a new favorite Thai restaurant. I think we found it! Can't wait to come back.

This is the best Thai restaurant I've been to anywhere!

I can't say everything I've tried here is good, but the ones that I enjoy are just the best. Their food is not greasy like most Thai restaurants, and I really like that. Their beef pad see-ew is really good as well we their tofu pad thai and tom yum soup (no MSG taste, it must be from scratch). Fried springroll and crab rangoon were also good. I didn't care much for their fried rice or chicken satay.

The strip mall this restaurant is in is pretty run down but the owners keep it very clean, no dust anywhere. Their price is not higher, but their portions are smaller than an average Thai restaurant, which I don't mind at all.

My boyfriend was in Thailand years ago and, for the past several years, we've been searching for a Thai restaurant that reminds him of the food he had in Thailand. After eating at Yupin Thai, the search is over.

The little jars of spices they bring to the table is a perfect representation of the restaurant. The sauce they said was similar to Sriracha sauce was the mild sauce. The sauce that they consider hot is made there with chiles that they grow themselves! They also bring a sugar bowl because, they said, most Thai restaurants here offer sweeter dishes to suit the American tastes, but they make the dishes more traditionally so some people like to add sugar.

I added nothing, and it was perfect.

Before ordering, we asked the waitress what spice level was equal to a buffalo wing. She said she didn't know that buffalo wings were supposed to be spicy, so I decided I should go for the mild, which had a nice, subtle burn. My boyfriend opted for hot, and it was exactly what he wanted -- hot but with a lot of great flavor throughout the dish. We also got egg rolls, which seemed very fresh.

Before we even got to my car, my boyfriend was talking about which dish he wanted to try next time. We will be back. Highly recommended.

Great little place in this un-assuming strip mall. 

The lady that runs Yupin is Thai (!), she cooks while her 3 daughters take care of the service. 
They explained to me that their cuisine is authentic, and therefore they do not add sugar to appeal to the American palate. Rather, you can add sugar yourself if you feel like. 
Also a word about the spice level (rewording what others have written). I ignored the 'very spicy' warning and regretted it a bit (it was delicious though!). So on my second visit I ordered the spicy stuff on the side, it's a cool portable tray with 4 dishes: 
one contains sugar, then there is dry spicy chili and seeds, then what looks like sambal oelek (not too spicy), and finally a darker chili and seeds mix that swims in a sauce and it tastes smoky, and is very spicy. When they say spicy they mean it so beware, whitey. 

After 2 visits I can say I will become a regular. They're close to where I work and at these prices why not indulge?! 
I found the service to be excellent and very attentive. 
It's awesome little places like these that I would rather eat at :) 

Show them, Yupin!
A group of us came here for dinner during a work trip to Chicago.  Everything we ordered was delicious!
Best Thai food ever!!! I used to go to Siam noodle in the city but not anymore!!! Really good basil shrimp fried rice, beef pad Thai etc etc medium spicy is the key
Great atmosphere and amazing food! All the food is really fresh and delicious. Vegetables in the dishes are even still crisp and refreshing. Not too greasy. Will definitely be returning.

Delicious food!! My family and I are in town for the weekend and were looking for a place to eat thai food. Found this place on yelp and we were not disappointed. I had the thai fried rice with chicken and chicken dumplings as appetizers. The food was great, service was good and the prices were reasonable. Maybe we'll stop by again before we leave.

Best pad thai I've ever eaten. Service is great. Highly recommend. They have some homemade spices that are brought to the table if you want to make it hot. Be very careful with it.
I will definitely be coming back.

Since I relied on other reviews for my visit I want to pay it forward.

Very un-assuming location. Very fresh ingredients. Tom yum soup was excellent as was my duck basil. 

Everybody enjoyed there dinner.

After 3 years of looking I have finally found an excellent Thai restaurant. Everything we have had here has been excellent but the panang curry and pad lee-mao are my favorites. I order my spice level medium, which is the perfect amount of spice, not too much. Everyone that works here is very friendly. I will be back...often.

Best Thai Food I ever had! I've been there for 3 times. I love their Crab Rangoon, Veg. Spring Rolls, Tom Yum Soup, Curry fried rice,Basil fried rice, Pad Ped Catfish and Yellow curry Tilapia. They are amazing. It's a family owned restaurant so home-made food is guaranteed. (Once, I actually meet with the owner and his wife. It is exciting to have a home-cooked thai food. Tests way better than regular thai). Worth going :)

Got a few dishes there. Some were great (cashew chicken and tom ka soup) others were so-so (Mongolian beef and fresh spring rolls). The portions are pretty small, but affordable, however the spring rolls were not good value at all. Good Thai food.

They have earned all five stars. I order takeout at least once a week, and the food is some of the best...ever. I/we are a Thai food junkie/s and they have just outstanding food. The fresh Spring rolls are nothing short of amazing, along with the sauce. The Pad See Ew, Spicy Basil, Curry rice are all exceptional. The Chicken Satay is always perfect, along with the peanut sauce.

I used to order from here all the time. Its kind of overpriced,  but the food was good and it was close to my house. Then one night I called and it was about half an hour before their supposed closing time and they wouldn't take my order because it wasn't big enough. If they had just said that they didn't want to take any orders because it was late and they wanted to close, I wouldn't have cared at all. But the fact that they thought my order was too small to bother with really rubbed me the wrong way. I have worked in restaurants and I never would have said that to a customer. This is why they lost my business.

By far the best yellow curry I've ever had.  Great service, prices, menu and flavor profile.

Who can really speak to "authentic"?  Even in our own circle we can have discussions about how food "should" be.  People having the same Mom having disagreement about the same dish gives perspective on the "authentic" issue.

It's all about what you like and there's lots to like here.

Definitely a surprise, but very well worth it. The Crab Rangoon was delicious, the Spring Rolls delicious. Presentation and taste were delightful. For the entree, I had Ginger Chicken and my date had Garlic Chicken. Honestly, they were both very good, but the Garlic Chicken was better only due to the lack of enough Ginger in the dish, at least for me, to be able to taste it mixed with all the vegetables and seasoning. I did request extra Ginger and that I would pay for it if necessary, however, the owner's husband  said they don't do that, since it overpowers the delicate balance of flavors in the dish. OK, so now I taste everything but the Ginger. Still delicious, but, next time I will request and if necessary demand it, or just order a different dish. Great food, decent service, definitely  worth a try.
Had the lunch special Pad Kee Mao tofu and it was great. Excellent lunch for 10 bucks including the tip.
Cute and cozy restaurant right. The food was great, I loved their Crazy noodles.

Great crab ragoon; delicious basil chicken (spicy); tasty pad thai chicken. Overall, great price and quick.

Great place for some dinner and then lunch leftovers. The portion are not huge but good sized.
The staff is extremely friendly and the food is simply amazing! They really know how to make your food spicy when you ask for it!

Simply amazing! Don't think just go! I love spicy food and this place totally hits the spot. Don't be fooled by its casual non-descript location. The food is top quality. I had the Penang curry with brown rice.

The food really yummy. The price really cheap. They come with soup and appetizers with all entr√©e. The lunch special? ?? Cheap. Went there with my girl friends and they coming back with they family. ... order they special thai basil fried rice..... yummy.

I went to this restaurant last week, and was very very happy with what I got. I lived in Thailand for almost 4 years and this is the most authentic Thai food I've had in Illinois since being back. The service was great, the food was fresh & the atmosphere very pleasant. I would definitely go again.
In my opinion, Yupin has the best Pad Thai in town. The Thai coffee is a wonder pick me up treat as well.

Authentic Thai restaurant in the suburb. 
I feel like my mom is the one cooking, that is how home made it is. 
Ordered basil ground beef, crab fried rice, papaya salad, beef noodle soup and fried chicken. All were delicious and tasty. 
Clean place, nice people and reasonable price. Definitely we will be back.

Was staying over by O'Hare and needed some good Thai soup.  Found Yupin on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  Was pleasantly surprised.  The Tom Yum soup was just fine.  Lots of good mushrooms and the broth was tasty.  Probably could have used just a touch more spice.  The Pad Khee Mau (poor spelling) was delicious.  I had it with shrimp and they cooked it very well.  The noodles had great texture and the overall flavor of the dish was super.  I'd recommend the place and will be back when I stay here next time...
Yum!!! Mango and sweet coconut rice! Make room for dessert :) best part is the people who greet, cook and serve - what a great find!!!!

Nice location. .A bit small.  Appetizer were okay. I have eaten Thai food for over 30yrs and this was not as good as I thought. I was there with my boyfriend and we noticed a group of people complaining also about their food. .The staff did nothing and they were rude to the customers.  The food was okay but I would not go back due to poor customer service and wait staff is not any better.

Yummy! My coworkers and I had lunch here last week, and the food was great. Nice and spicy, the way my tummy likes it. Service was good too! The prices are great, and the lunch specials are awesome because you get soup and an app. Definitely will be back soon!
Bold statement yet true. Best salsa I've tasted in all of of Chicago. Breakfast burrito is perfect.

No joke, I saw a sign for elote for $2 while driving on Lake St. and pulled over. I didn't care that it was a whole in the wall attached to a gas station. 

I wish I could tell you that I found a hidden gem but this place was just okay. I ordered elote and an al pastor taco. The elote didn't have any chile powder so it was basically canned corn with mayo and cheese. The al pastor was okay but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Afterwards, I was fine and didn't get sick or anything - just disappointed.
This place is a hole in the wall but has good tacos.  I also like the hot dog and fries here.  It's about average price.

The best tacos in town small loaded with meat, and flavor for a small price.

The burrito w/potatoes and soda under 7 bucks.

I always come and pick up my lunch from here and the biggest plus for this joint, they are opened at 7am with everything on the menu available.

Can't beat this if you ask me.

In my opinion, the best tacos and burritos in the burbs, but my order is often wrong. If it's a to go order, it's consistently incorrect. I've ordered in English. I've ordered in Spanish. I've repeated my order multiple times and they've repeated the order back to me. Still, it somehow is always screwed up. I think it's a lost cause.

2 Tacos (1 Lengua, 1 Al Carbon) with onions and cilantro. I ask them to add cheese, sour cream and avocado. A side of beans. This is my order every time, but it's rarely what I receive.

When I've checked my order before leaving seems to be the only times they've gotten it right. And they look at me like I'm crazy for it.

Tonight's surprise was 2 Tacos (1 Lengua, 1 Al Carbon) with onions and cilantro. They gave me a side of beans, what seems to be a whole side of cheese, and half an avocado in their own containers. No sour cream present.

I've had La Placita on my radar for a while, and finally grabbed some grub. I ordered the following tacos (Mexican style, of course!):


Chile Relleno: 4/5
This was a first for me and I'm glad I tried it!

Verdict: Very good: soft, melty, slightly cheesy, and slightly sweet. I'm a fan!


Lengua: 5/5
Another first! Both a student and instructional aide swear by tongue/lengua, so I HAD to try. 
(Sorry-not-sorry, Mom!)

Verdict: AMAZING! So tender and delicious! I think I just found my new favorite taco! (And by "favorite," I mean that I'm seriously contemplating a return visit tomorrow!)


Al Carbon: 5/5
I've had many-a steak taco, but not al carbon before! 

Verdict: Great flavor and texture without being chewy. I'm not convinced I can go back to regular steak tacos after this! The only downsides were the saltiness and skimpy meat quantity as compared to my other tacos. 


Pollo: 4/5
Ahh, an oldie but goodie.

Verdict: Pretty good, but on the dry side. It seems to be made with just white meat, so maybe that's why? It was also pretty salty. The portion was generous.


Al Pastor: 3/5
I'm not a big pork eater (minus the occasional bacon and ham), but I'm not against it. I figured, why not?

Verdict: Just "okay": it was dry and I didn't taste any pork; just spices. It required lots of salsa to make it more palatable. Meh.


SPEAKING of salsas...
The verde was my favorite. The "medium-heat" red was also good: it had great texture! Know it has the "delayed" heat that kicks in after a good few seconds.

I'm disappointed it took me so long to get to La Placita, but I'm certain that I'll soon be a regular!

If you're the type of person who gets hungry at all hours of the day then La Placita is your type of restaurant!  They're open until 11pm everyday and open 24 hours Friday and Saturday.  Pretty awesome in my opinion!  I stopped in for   a burrito on a Saturday night and service was very quick and friendly.  I had the burrito al carbon which came with fries and a drink.  The portions were generous and I was only able to eat half of my burrito.  For the size and price, the food was pretty good and they were generous with the steak.  Don't expect anything fancy but it'll do the job when you're looking for late night food.
It was freezing no heat but food was ok not the best pastor was good my girlfriend liked it alot.

Great solid mexican restaurant. As you might have gathered from reviews other than mine, Addison is quite the place to get authentic mexican cuisine. This place is among the top of the pack. The food they serve is fresh, flavorful, and affordable. The venue is kept clean, with wonderful decor. Add to that the loud blasting TV (volume could be lowered a bit!) with soap operas in Spanish that only adds to the ambiance.

I didn't get a chance to try the chile relleno, but I had the "carbon" meat, which is essentially beef stake slices. It's different than carne asada. It's softer on the chew, and more flavorful, with noticeable peppery taste and other spices I can't identify. The plate sizes are always generous with rice, beans, veggies, and tortilla, and I would say worth the money. 9/10 I had a taco with al pastor pork, and it's quite good, but I still their carbon beef. 7/10. I also got a chicken plate because I saw that they branded their own chicken with its own logo and all! It's grilled with skin-on, and it tastes great. Savory, mouthwatering taste. Oh, and the plate is only $7. We had leftovers and were happy to take it home! 8/10

I must be the ONLY person living in this area that has NOT made a visit to La Placita!!

Shame on me!  Hey, better late than never.  So, after hearing some 'buzz' about how great this place is I decided I needed to check it out.  Its located in a small outdoor mall on Lake, just past Mill Road, down the street from New China.  Walking in, there's a good number of tables to dine in and the menu selection is extensive...place looked clean and girls were really nice...they were busy, busy, busy...

They had all the fillings for tacos & burritos I enjoy - Barbacoa, Cecina, Carnita, Chile Relleno, Al Pastor, Pollo, Camaron, Carne Asada and a few I have not seen - Carne al Carbon & El Pollo Real (they're branded grilled chicken - this looked delicious)...they have tongue as well (for you Lengua lovers).

Going against my usual 'go to' tacos, I went with the Carne al Carbon & half grilled chicken plate (comes with beans & rice) $5.99.  I had a HUGE taste for a Chile Relleno, but sadly, they were all out (yes, I was super bummed & a little cranky, cause I'm guessin, these must be really good..).  What can I say, my tastebuds are used to having their way....  

The 'Al Carbon' is a steak taco but resembles more of a sliced steak fajita (only thinner strips). I ordered mine with only lettuce, cheese, avocado and crema on a corn tortilla (comes w/fresh cut lime).  KNOW that this is NOT the same flavor as fajita meat, just the resemblance (to give you an idea).  

After first bite, you wanna know the first thing that struck me?  How much I LOVED THIS CORN TORTILLA!  I don't know if they are homemade, or where they get them, but this tortilla made my taco!  Mild corn flavor, heated through and just merged perfectly with the tender, lightly seasoned steak...not 'juicy',  but tender (non gristly), good quality meat...
A few squirts of fresh lime juice and this TOTALLY hit the spot.

The El Pollo plate was very SAVORY, tender  (skin-on, 1/2 portion).  Refried beans were light (not heavy or salty) and rice was ok.  I really enjoyed this too...(if your a regular here, and haven't tried it yet, I say go for it..).

Prices are very LOW!  I love that you can choose corn or flour tortilla's and toppings such as avocado, fresh lime (comes w/tacos), etc. Good selection of hot (green/red) sauces...I gotta tell ya, the soups looked fantastic too..Caldode Res & Menudo is a must try the next time I visit (along w/a sampling of more taco's).

This is no doubt, a solid, authentic Mexican joint and out of all the others' nearby, I'd say GO TO LA PLACITA FIRST (the reviews here are pretty spot on).  Open late too...

Adios amigos!

I haven't tried much at La Placita, but I've had enough to know I like what they got and I'll be going back to partake in some more.

Tacos! Tacos! Tacos! I met up with some Yelpy friends and I was near death status in the hunger department so boy, did I revel in the basking light the tacos radiated out when placed in front of me. I scarfed them down in probably 90 seconds flat. During my scarf-fest, I did taste some flavors I liked though. I had the carne asada & pollo - my usual go-tos for meat in a tortilla. They are competitively priced with my usual taco joint and I liked them - but I think my usual spot edges them out ever so slightly.

La Placita is a sit down spot with a very nice lady serving you. You order with the server, eat your grub, then pay up at the register when you're done. Wham, bam, gracias ma'am.

There is no shortage of Mexican restaurants in or around Lake Street in Addison. I mean they are literally on every corner. But, La Placita is in a class all by itself. It is some seriously good stuff. And it is cheap! Less than Burger King cheap. An order of three tacos, rice, beans and a can soda for $5.99. I'll take that. AND they are open 24 hours on weekends! Great, I will be sure to put you in full rotation. 

Thank goodness for Yelp and fellow Yelpers. Without it, I would have been forced to try all 60 "authentic" spots before tasting the goodness of LP. I heard of this place from Erika and she referred to it as an area favorite and place the group visited for an UYE. If it was good enough for the gang, I figured it was worth a try. .....Needless to say it has become a favorite of mine. I really love the food here. I have now been a few times and agree they occasionally get the order wrong and the prices seems to fluctuate and largely depends on who is at the register. But even when certain toppers are missed, it still reigns as the taco of all tacos. 

I have tried a few different meats and prefer cecina. I also spend an extra buck for a Jarrito or Guava drink as opposed to the regular can soda that is offered with the combo.

 Call in, dine in or walk in. Just get here and enjoy the best that Addison/Glendale Heights/Schaumburg/Bloomingdale has to offer. We all need a little cilantro and lime in our lives.

I went here looking for some casual food on a Sunday night.  The place was very busy but I was still able to find an open table.  There was one girl working the floor and she was swamped, but still my wait time was not bad, she was hustling.  I had chicken enchiladas that came with beans and rice, plus they gave me chips and salsa.  Salsa was really good, and the chicken ended up being done perfectly.  I would definitely go back, its a perfect spot for caf√©-style Mexican dining.

Aye, me encantan los tacos. From a taco connoisseur, this place is pretty good. 

Based on all of the positive reviews from fellow elites, La Placita is legit. I would definitely order the al pastor and the alambres taco again since they were both delicious. The carne from the chilaquiles and the al carbon were a bit dry and overlooked but otherwise our table enjoyed the salsas and the horchata. Normally, mild salsa doesn't do anything for me but La Placita's has avocado blended into it giving it a creamy finish - make sure to get some on the side. There is also a hot habanero salsa if you want more heat.

Tacos, burritos, and all things Mexican.  I love them.  

There are a whole lot of Mexican food places in this immediate area.  You would go through quite a few miles of burritos to try them all.  I've found some pretty good places, but none really hit the sweet spot that I know is there.

I have been to the mountain-top, but not in a while.....

Enter Yelp.

I came across reviews for this place in the 'talk' section and immediately high-tailed it on over.

The decor is not much to speak of.  Some tables, seating for maybe 30 people.  I rolled in at about 11:30, stopped to get the door for someone and that turned out to be my only mistake in coming here.

The door holdee ordered ahead of me.  Couple of tacos.  So far, so good.  I stepped and popped in for a few more.  We both grabbed some chair to wait for the goodies.

About 2 minutes into this the door opened and 10 people walked in and arranged themselves at a table they made by pushing a few 4 tops together.  Partay in progress.

Door holdee got her food.  The girl behind the counter took her money, handed over her tacos and then came out to wait on the 10 top.  I could see my stuff sitting there, but there was nothing I could do but wait, so I did so- somewhat impatiently, and on my ever shortening lunch break, but about 12 hours or so later I got my stuff and headed back to the office.

And, yeah, the tacos (Al Carbon this time) are verrry good.  I don't know what some places do to just serve up a palate party while it seems others stick a pile of crud on your tortilla, but these were utterly delicious.  Great meat filling, tender, not all fatty/gristly/gross.

No question I've found my new spot in this area for lunch time fun-time....

Although this says it closes at 11pm , got there at 9 and they were only accepting take out orders! They lost my business  as well as 9 other people that walked in and out behind me! Rude person at the counter, turning people away!

La Placita is the home of my favorite taco - the chile relleno!  I've noticed that a lot of Mexican restaurants don't have these, so I was happy to see this on La Placita's menu, and head over heels when I took my first bite.

The Horchata here is also very good.  There's also a cooler stocked with Mexican Coke, Jarritos, and other Mexican favoritos de bebida.

The free chips and salsa were tasty, but some of that salsa was too hot for my liking.

The restaurant is clean, and there is plenty of seating.  The waitress will take your order at your table, and you pay at the register when you are ready to leave.

I may just make the 40 minute drive to La Placita for a chile relleno taco instead of heading to a taco place closer to home and *hoping* that they have them too, and make them just as good.

Best Mexican restaurant in the burbs. The al carbon tacos and burritos the best .. Also the shrimp cocktail is great also 
Must check them out !!:)

I missed the UYE here and since I was in the neighborhood I thought why not some tacos for dinner!

It's a comfortable little place tucked away in a small, not so populated strip mall, I actually almost passed it. We thought we had to order at the cash register, but after the cashier assisted customers in front of us she said we can pick a table and she'll be out to take our order.  She then greeted us with complimentary chips and salsa (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-placita-addison?select=ZJAH6A1GkCxdpoS3DuxDAQ#SeL8bIVIFF1YW_qXnXy7Jw) that we devoured! The salsa is deliciously spicy! We asked for seconds and water *whew*.

We ordered:
5 Taco Special: steak, onions, cilantro, and lime (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-placita-addison?select=ZJAH6A1GkCxdpoS3DuxDAQ#c-ejkPrD6pKEj-8I0exytA), which was meh. Definitely average not much to rave about here.

Roast Pork Torta Special: (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-placita-addison?select=ZJAH6A1GkCxdpoS3DuxDAQ#hBN70igCkWnbLOGculqLMA), I would of loved rice and beans with this, not the fries, but the roast pork was packed with flavor and holy this thing was huge. I'm glad we split it.

Chicken Tostada (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-placita-addison?select=ZJAH6A1GkCxdpoS3DuxDAQ#zKZNELTf9pMhdRCROlGwww): I LOVE toastadas and this thing was huge for a single order! Packed with shredded chicken which was extremely flavorful, tender, and just down right delicious! I mean look at the size of the avocado they give you, yum yum. I love that they aren't skimpy on the meat and toppings esp. for one order.

The tacos might have been the rave on Yelp, but honestly their salsa and shredded chicken are the hidden gem, which I'll gladly come back for!

Great food, good prices, friendly service.  We found this place by accident a few months back driving down Lake street.  It's back from the road next to a grocery store.  By the time you see the sign, you have passed.  Turn around as it is well worth it.  I have only had tacos, but they are excellent.  You can't go wrong with the $6.99 dinner.  3 tacos, rice, beans, and a can of soda.  Just wish it was a little closer as I work in Itasca and love this place I could eat there daily if it was closer.

I always seem to go to Panera when I visit Addison but decided to finally try something different. 

Decided to go simple and got a carne asada burrito. What's inside? Some avocado, sour cream, lettuce, meat, and refried beans. Not a California burrito but it was still very good! I didn't get the side of fries or a drink. They offer the burrito al carbon which means they use better cuts of meat (is what she explained to me, hah). It was very good! I also was given chips and salsa which were very delicious. Overall, it cost $4.49 plus tax. Super cheap lunch! Go here if you're ever in this city.

I don't know what everyone on here is talking about with all the great reviews.  I'm guessing you all live together.

This place is total weak sauce bro.  Burrito's are smalllllllllll.  Whoever on here said they have Giant burritos pffffft  quit yankin me asshole.  This place sucks.  They cost me extra money due to the fact I have to go to a real mexican place and get another burrito.

While my tacos may not have best the greatest I've ever had, they were served to me by a goddess straight outta Telemundo. 

Seriously, where did this siren of a senorita come from, and why is she working in a Taqueria off Lake Street in Addison, Il? 

Well, God works in mysterious ways and I don't know that I'll ever know the answer to that, but Jesus Christo! ... I'll be damned if it isn't worth the trip alone, just to see her. 

And while my tacos weren't blowing my mind, they were still damn good and had more avocado on them than any other tacos I've ever had, including tacos I've made myself- and that's saying something because I load that sh*t on. I will give a little criticism of their house-made hot sauces, both of which were pretty runny and not hot at all. 

The horchata on the other hand, is the stuff dreams are made of, and the size of a large cat. Muy bien, Muchachos.

One last talking point- the prices. For dinner on very little dinero, this is your place. I got 3 tacos, a quesadilla and one hell of an horchata for $10 and change. 

Should you check out La Placita? Well, that's a very certain and unwavering vote in favor of 'Si' from me.

I love this place for their Al Carbon Tacos. If you get taco's, do not do regular steak, do al carbon! So tasty! The enchiladas are good too. (Whatever you do, do not order them shrimp cocktail. Not good) The service here could be better. They get the job done, but can improve tremendously! The tacos keep me coming back consistently though! They are that good!

My co-workers and I came here for lunch at around 12:30 PM..the place was empty and we were just standing there..I initially thought it was a meat shop due to the decor and feel...and we weren't seated until like 5 minutes later... interesting place..upon getting seated, we were not provided with menus and were just waiting and waiting so I decided to go grab menus for the group (bad customer service I would say)..

Burrito, soda and fries ($4.99): great price, portions are huge and fries were perfectly warm (love when I get fries that were just made)..

Free: chips & salsa upon arrival..warm just made chips! :)

Customer service ..bad..as mentioned, I ended up getting the menu myself..weren't greeted when we got in...we were confused....the lady that worked there wasn't too friendly...and I don't know why the wait was soo long when the place was soo empty!!

Buritto was huge and tasted good, but I still think Buenos Dias Burritos have the best burritos.. :)

Parking: it may be limited if you come during busy hours because it's located in a small strip mall..

I would come here again to eat for lunch although the customer service is bad.... great deals for big portions of food and I love the just cooked warm fries!
Great Tacos el Carbon. Reminded me of when I lived in California. Super friendly employees. And very cheap.

Stop #4 on UYE: Lake Street Taco Tour and technically the last taco tasting spot. 

Service was spectacular! The waitress came out with 6 plates on her arm which made me believe she's been doing this since she was 2, OK!?. I mean, lets face it, if I tried a stunt like that, I wouldn't be able to keep ONE on my arm.

Like Candice G. said, the tacos didn't necessarily blow my mind but they were pretty tasty. I got a carne asada and a cecina "taco". It's in parentheses because again, I was on my no carb kick. Honestly though, I didn't miss the tortilla. The meat was seasoned well enough to be good by itself. 

I asked Bob Barker and he agreed, the price is definitely right for the quantity and quality you receive. So if you're on a budget and crave Mexican food, hit La Placita up.

Awesome place for some authentic mexican food. Definitely spring for their carbon anything. Tacos, chimichangas, anything. Its so delicious. Its also cheap and made to order! They've also got bottles of whatever mexican soda you'd like. Sangria soda? Check? Several flavors of Jarritos? Got it. Stop in for a quick, filling and delicious meal for the right price.

#1 Mexican restaurant in Addison
Everyone I know loves this place too. They're open late and are quick! Their prices aren't bad and they have a lot of seating.  I always get steak tacos, they're mouth watering and even better with my jarrito!

I pledge my allegiance to La Placita, forgoing other Mexican joints in favor of this awesome joint.  My husband and I wanted to try a new place and came on in. We actually drove past it and had to double back. Worth it.

This place is cleaner than most establishments, but it doesn't have much in the way of ambiance.  The chips and salsa were delicious and set the tone for an awesome meal. The salsa was amazing.

My husband and I opted to share two entrees - he got the chicken enchiladas in suiza sauce and I got the La Placita Especial, which was described as steak fajitas. It turned out to be a thin, deliciously seasoned and tender steak topped with two fried eggs, served along side rice, beans and corn tortillas. Everything was delicious, well-seasoned and filling.

I'll definitely be back!

I love this restaurant, been coming for about 5 years. I also get takeout. Food is consistently delicious. I love their tacos (al carbon, especially), tortas, and burritos. I enjoy the jamaica and the horchata. Service is pretty good. I avoid coming weekend nights just because it gets pretty packed. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because...*drumroll* The cooks don't wear hair nets! I've never had any issues thus far, but prevention is always key. Either way, I will keep enjoying this delicious food.

Great food at an awesome price! I've been coming here for about 4 years now. It's hard to find a good Mexican restaurant with authentic flavors but La Placita never disappoints. Definitely a place I'll be coming for another 4+ years

First time trying this place and I will definitely be returning. My Pollo al Carbon dinner was great and I love the added grilled jalapenos and small onions to the plate. Complimentary chips and salsa, and their other salsas were tasty. Good tacos!!

BUZZ
- Al Pastor Taco (5/10)

I ALSO TRIED
- Carne Asada Taco (5/10)
- Lengua (Tongue) Taco (4/10)
- Beans & Rice (4/10)
- Horchata (6/10)

After visiting a friend and celebrating his new house with a nice cigar and 20 year old Port (on an empty stomach) we really needed to eat! Only problem was, it was late (~9:00p) and not a lot of things were open. All I could see were a couple Mexican joints, and I LOVE taquerias and hole in the wall Mexican places, so I thought this was gonna be great! Well..

AL PASTOR TACO
As always, I get all my tacos with onion and cilantro. The al pastor didn't really have a lot of flavor - nothing really punched out but seasoning was acceptable. Ok, it had just enough flavor to make you realize it's not asada, but that's about it. I had a to use a lot of the salsa to pick it up. That taco was a pretty normal size too, like the size of a CD or a little bit bigger.

CARNE ASADA TACO
I'd say it was a little better than the al pastor in terms of flavor (a nice smoky grilled taste), but the seasoning was absent. Again, more salsa! Texture was right on for asada. Not terrible, but not great either.

LENGUA TACO
A tongue taco! I've had a lengua taco once before, and honestly, it wasn't all that great either. Lengua (tongue) almost has a light tripe-y flavor, but almost...buttery. It's really not bad. The flavors were subtle but definitely there, but again, the seasoning was nowhere to be found. Thank you salsa! Really, adding the salsa made all the tacos jump about a full 1 point out of 10. But a taco really shouldn't need that help! 

BEANS & RICE
The beans were too salty. It wasn't quite burn-your-lip salty, but close enough. It wasn't a pleasant experience. The rice was pretty standard, nothing special.

HORCHATA
I'd say, this was the highlight of the experience. Honestly, only because it was cool and refreshing. It was kinda devoid of any cinnamon flavor, though, so it just tasted like rice sugar water. I don't like a lot of cinnamon, but I like SOME!

LA PLACEBO
There is no substance here! Everything here successfully fills you up and quells hunger, but that's all it does. (I get it...first world problems). The tacos are really uninspiring and unless you're just hungry outta your mind and have nowhere else to go, there is really no point in stopping here. Nothing tasted bad, but nothing tasted good! There's nothing to write home about here. Hell, there' pretty much nothing to Yelp about either! BOoooooooooooooooring!

I promise that I will never, ever go to El Burrito Tapatio again after trying La Placita Taqueria.

The food is the best Mexican I've had, and it's an expansive menu with everything from your giant burritos, tortas, breakfast, seafood, it goes on-and-on.  I will upload pictures of the menu so you can see the descriptions and jaw-dropping value for the prices.

I always gauge a taqueria on its chips and salsa, La Placita is excellent.  Horchata?  Perfect.  A quick wink and nod to the $1.50 take out chips and a 20oz styrofoam cup of salsa that needs repeating from others' reviews.

So far I've had a beef stew in red sauce and a chicken chimichanga.  The quality of the chicken is paramount since I've finally found a place that uses pulled/ shredded chicken!  No cubes of white chicken parts!!

Buenos dias, amigos!

Tacos.Tacos.Tacos. That's the 3 taco special with bean and rice and a soda for $4.99! Cheap, filling and really really good!

Of course besides tacos, they have tortas, burritos, roasted chicken, enchiladas and nacho platters.  I've only done take-out (twice in a week! whoa!) but they are really friendly and on my last visit, told me to get an extra soda if I wanted one.  Niiiiiice.

Chicken taco/nacho platter--it's shredded chicken, but still has a nice flavor and was really moist.  The nacho platter is full of nice crispy tortilla chips, topped with mounds of the chicken and bits of white cheese. Very good.
Carnitas taco--great bit of charring from the cooking process, nice flavor, a bit dry. 
Al Pastor taco--nice flavor, but also a bit dry.  My fave is still at the carniceria down the road.
Steak taco--This was my favorite and the one I will most likely order each time I visit. Really flavorful, tender meat. 

The rice and beans are OK.  It was more like a filler, but adding some of their salsas upped the flavor.  And the salsas?  There is a nice selection you could choose from--Pico   de Gallo, Salsa Verde (my fave! so flavorful), a Habanero salsa (super hot for me), an avocado salsa, and their house red salsa.  There is also a milder red salsa that the woman behind the counter told me that I probably would not like as she said it's pretty mild--my guess that it's there for the folks that don't like the hot stuff.  

Their Horchata is pretty tasty too. Icy cold and perfect when your mouth is on fire from the Habanero sauce. 

Friendly service.  Clean space. Great stop in A-town.

I really can't say enough good things about La Placita! 

It's always super affordable and ALWAYS delicious. I have yet to find tacos al pastor as good as these in the state of Illinois. I've never come in to a dirty restaurant and never had a bad server experience. I really can't justify going anywhere else for tacos because there is NO other place as cheap and as good as La Placita.

Best Mexican Restaurant In Addison !!!! Seriously Great Tacos, & Other Tasteful Mexican Dishes, And Great Prices Also! The  Best Part Is That They Are Open 24 Hours On Weekends! After A Fun Night, You Can Stop By For Some Delicious Food...Amazing!! The Restaurant Is Spacious, And Very Clean. The Waitresses Are Friendly And Fast. I Seriously Love This Place, Everyone Must Try!!

At 4 in the morning almost any restaurant will taste good.  This however tasted extra good & I was surprised that I didn't wake up with my stomach sounding like RoboCop.  I ordered a steak burrito & it was phenomenal.  I usually go to another buritto place on Lake Street but this one was a block closer so me & my friend stopped in.  


The tv's were all tuned in to Spanish channels & Spanish music was playing.  Good signs that the food will eb extra authentic.  If you walk into a Mexican restaurant & Gossip Girl is playing on the TV chances are that the food won't be that authentic.  


The chips were a little bit harder than I liked but the salsa was amazing & it was really spicy.  It is really hard for me to call something spicy because I eat a lot of spicy foods but this salsa was excellent.  

I did liek that they gave you fries with your meal even though they were nothing special.  The beef in the steak buritto was delicious & tasted very fresh.  I don't really like guacamole but I could tell that it was really fresh & tasty.  


Overall this is not just a good restaurant at 4 am, it is a good restaurant for someone who likes good authentic Mexican food.

If you are looking for some authentic Mexican take-out, this is a good place to go! You get a lot for your money, and some good food. We got take out, and for about $10 I got guac with a ton of chips, 3 tacos, and a small horchata. They packaged it nicely and sent us on our way. It's not incredibly fast, but they do make it fresh! I wasn't sure what was taking so long, and by the time we got home the food was a little colder than what I would like. You can eat at the restaurant as well, but it's not the best atmosphere. It's really best for take out in my opinion.

The food there is really good and cheap. I especially enjoy the steak torta they have. It's a very big portion which comes with fries and a coke. I always just finish half of it!
 Way better than any other Mexican place i went to around this area. Waitresses kinda weird. But they just get you your food and they disappear. 
I would recommend this place! Also, they are open late.

This place gets 5* mainly for the prices. The quality is great for the area, but not as gud as a few (although pricier) city spots. I totally recommend it for locals! Overrall, good bang for ur buck!!
Yum! Can't go wrong with their steak tacos.  Can't wait to go back to try their infamous horchata.

Went for a quick cheap dinner to La Placita.   Was an interesting dynamic.  First off, it was a Sunday and they were busy - probably 8-9 tables full in the place.   There was one waitress who took our order and took a while to come back with drinks/chips/salsa.   We were watching some telemundo programming and waited...and waited....and waited.   Finally after about 30 minutes, the food came out.  The food itself was standard taqueria fare, nothing special, nothing bad.   The price was cheap but if I knew I was going to wait 30 mnutes for tacos, I would have went somewhere else.

We finally stopped in here after a long while of thinking about going.  We went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and it was pretty dead.  It is your typical small Mexican taqueria by looks and the menu.  The waitress brought us a basket of chips and some salsa that was really spicy and tasted just okay.  

I ended up ordering 4 different tacos (barbacoa, carne asada, al pastor and chile relleno) and Fred got the taco dinner with tacos alambre, which the lady said was bacon and chorizo but ended up just being bacon, undercooked bacon, that is.  The food took a while to come out which is not typical of little Mexican places which was downer number one.  Downer number two was that undercooked bacon, and let me remind you, no chorizo.  Boo.  And finally, downer number three was the dryness of the meats on my tacos and the undercooked poblano on my chile relleno taco. =[  The only meat worth mentioning was the barbacoa, not too fatty and super tender and flavorful, but the downfalls of everything else will make this the last time I come here.  

Moral of the story...there are SOOO many good Mexican places within 5 miles of here, there is really no point in wasting your time.

PS...what was with all the $70,000+ cars in the parking lot?!?!  Maybe Mexicans with money forget what good Mexican food tastes like...not sure.  Sorry Placita...just not impressed.

I've eaten at every little Mexican joint along this stretch of Lake Street in Addison (and there are a lot of them). You would think with there being a large Mexican population in the area that they would all be phenomenal, but that's not the case. Most of these places are just ok and many are downright awful. The place in the strip mall across the street from La Placita is horrible. Some of the worst Mexican food I've ever consumed.

So, I wandered into La Placita with low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. This is somewhere above a real "sit down" Mexican restaurant and Taco Bell. And for that category it's the best in the area. From 355 to York Rd. this is the best Mexican food you can get. Carry out or sit and eat. Awesome portions, great entrees (love the Enchiladas), and their rice and beans aren't just phoned in either.

Really love this place.
Don't hesitate. Come here!

wow...just...wow...I have had my good share of tacos. I mean what else do you eat after making love to whiskey shots all night???? 

But seriously I love steak tacos, but sometimes you get those steak tacos that are plain and the other time you get the ones that are bomb biggity but have random pieces of fat on them that you have to adorably spit back out.

NOT PLACITA, the have the steak "Al Carbon" damn, just damn, and I never really liked red sauce but I love their red sauce.No dont get it twisted I have seen better hot sauce game in plenty other spots, but it does the job and the red sauce is unique. 

What could make it even better you might wonder?? Well try 3 tacos rice beans for 5 dollars!!! yeah thats the lunch special, easily my new favorite taco joint in Illinois, yeah I just said it...


Oh yeah, the waitress is amazing, she had plates all over the place and handed them out like she could do it with her eyes closed.

Outstanding Mexican taqueria!  I've been to 7 Mexican restaurants/ taquerias within a 10 minute drive from the house and La Placita is by far, the best.
I had the steak burrito with fries.  Their steak burrito is a "dry" burrito but please don't mistake that as dried out.  The steak has great flavor - it almost tastes as if they apply a type of rub before chopping the meat.  Fried beans, guacomole and sour cream are applied lightly as a condiment and don't overpower the meat.  It's a neat burrito in the hand without being dry.
I also had an al pastor taco that was very good.  It came with cilantro and diced onions.  I added a quick squeeze of lime and it was delicious.
My wife ordered the chicken burrito.  As has been mentioned in other reviews, they prepare their chicken shredded in a marinade.  It was very moist and tender.  My wife really enjoyed it. 
The food is excellent at La Placita and the prices are are really low.  This is definitely THE spot for Mexican food on Lake Street!

I have lost count of how many times my wife and i have been to this place.  we frequently hit up the low end mexican restaurants for an affordable dinner ans after our first time at La Placita we haven't bothered with any of the other ones.  The food is seriously good and the price just makes it better.  I do suggest splurging a bit and getting some guacamole its the chips and salsa, I think its the best guac i've ever had.

If you want Mexican food La Placita is The Place to go.

I love love love the taco dinner here! They are amazing and well priced. Where can you get 3 tacos with rice and beans and a can of soda for like $5.50? I usually get steak, chicken and barbacoa in my taco dinner. And their salsas are really good. I recommend the green one!!

I've tried the chicken platter which was ok. It wasnt as fresh but I def recommend their taco dinner. This place is my TO-Go for tacos.

This is my new taco place!  Nothing will replace my favorite, but a 30+ minute round trip commute made me need to find a taco joint closer to home, and La Placita is that place.  After working a long Sunday evening at my second job, tacos were on my mind.  I didn't see any places on my ride home so I decided to check out a new place.  After glancing through reviews La Placita looked like the place to go.  When I walked in, I could see this was the local place to be.  It's always a good sign for a taco place when english is the second language written on the menu/spoken.   I ordered my traditional steak tacos and fries (to go) and waited for them to be cooked up fresh.  They have a whole salsa bar to choose from.  When I got home I was pleasantly surprised to see they include limes with your tacos.  You don't realize what you're missing until you've had tacos with fresh lime juice on top.  I can only speak to the steak tacos (both mexican and american style) and fries, but I will (and have!) definitely been back for these.

I had been trying out other places as I checked out places down on Lake Street but regret that it took me this long to come here!  The grill area in the back is open so you can see them prepare everything so you know exactly how your food is cooked.  The staff is welcoming and the food is stellar at a great value.  I had the torta and it was very filling.  The bread wasn't dry and my milanesa was well-breaded with a nice crunch yet meaty.  The toppings were fresh while the fries were adequate.  My tacos al pastor were nicely grilled and the onion and cilantro didn't overpower the meat.  I'll definitely be back to try out more of the menu and specials!

We were in the area and it was time for lunch . I would say that it was a good timing . Pleasant dining room , very attentive waitress who doted on us even though it was busy . Food was very authentic and the quantity's were large . It was not at all expensive . I would return as it was a nice find .

This is probably the cheapest place where you can get a filling non-fast food meal for 2 under $10.

Wanting to try someplace new, we stopped in here for dinner during the week. When we first entered it wasn't clear if you were to order at the counter, then sit down or just sit down and be waited on. If you want to dine in, you just grab a table and someone will be by to take your order.
