We ordered the burrito dinner (steak) and the taco dinner (chicken). Both dinners came with a can of pop. Odd that they had diet Coke, but not regular Coke rather Pepsi. 

Anyways, I really enjoyed my tacos. The chicken was so juicy and flavorful and had a consistency of being pulled (not strips of chicken). And there was an abundant amount, they definitely did not skimp! The burrito was really good too but a tad greasy. I found the rice to be a bit dry, still edible though. I like my rice to be a bit sticky and fresh tasting. Seems like this rice was cooked maybe earlier in the day? 

Also, paying took forever. There was only one girl behind the counter and she seemed to be a bit overwhelmed.

I would definitely be back. The food was great and the price was even better.

If you're in the area or you live in the area and you haven't tried La Placita... YOU ARE MISSING OUT! La Placita is a fantastic Mexican restaurant. Their burritos are about half the price and twice the size of chipotle's and they taste a heck of a lot better. The steak tacos are juicy and tender and the chicken tacos are also great. The real gem at La Placita is the chips and salsa. The salsa is absolutely amazing and the chips are home made and still warm. Out of the large variety of salsas, the red sauce and green sauce are the best and they really make the tacos better. The service is always great and fast.

The main good thing about this place is price, as far as the food goes it is hit or miss. First time going there food was good, not the best but good. Next time i went the meat in the steak tacos tasted like ground beef, the next time was ok then the time after the same ground beef taste. Who knows.

i cant say anything bad about this place. the nachos with meat offer HUGE bang for the buck.  the Lunch 3 taco special is only about 6$ and can easily be your only meal of the day it is that filling. they have TONS of mean selections for the carnivores. the ceviche Tostada is only $1.99 but probably worth $5 (shhh don't tell them that)
solid traditional tacos every time. and at a good price.

Im always down for trying new places and we were on a search for a new mexican place for some burritos and tacos. To start off the prices are amazing. Burrito for $4 and chips with salsa for a meager $1.50. The salsa came in a 20oz cup for gods sake. The burrito was big but not huge and had all the staples minus the rice but had avocado which was a nice touch. The taco was a little small but had great flavor and came with a lime wedge also a nice touch. The guacamole was ok but nothing to write home about.

Great cheap place to get some solid mexican food. Now its time to explore the rest of the menu!

This is the best Authentic mexican food money can buy. I have yet to find a place that has better Northern Mexican Tortas. 

The portions are generous and the prices are unbelievable. I spend more money driving to this restaurant than I spend on the food. I've taken numerous friends here and they always come back for more.

Damn- now I wished I lived closer because I have a craving for mexican food!!!! 

On fridays/saturdays they are open 24/hours.

My family and I had the opportunity to enjoy a meal from the Best Truckin' BBQ while in Arlington Heights!  The one word that comes to mind is "ONO-licious!"  I had the "Road Rage" burger with pulled pork and cole slaw on a pretzel bun, and the "Full Throttle" fries.  My wife had the "Spare Tires", while my kids had the "Lead Foot Nachos".  Everything was beyond what we anticipated and every bite was savored.  I was hoping to try other dishes, but by the time I was able to get back, they had closed up shop.  Basically, it was THAT GOOD!!!

On a slightly serious note, with the rise of so many excellent food trucks in the food industry comes the unique and expressive creativity of the chef/entrepreneur of the mobile operation.  It seems as though it's becoming a rarer occurrence to encounter a food truck that serves sub-par offerings (with the exception of personal palate preferences and/or the staff having a rough day).  In my experience, food trucks present their customers with a distinctive interpretation of classic dishes, and it's typically worth your while to try a number of menu items to determine your preference.

In my humblest opinion, Best Truckin' BBQ lands among the BEST of them!

Mahalo (Thank you), guys, for the awesome food!!!

We are there last night at Festival in Rolling Meadows.  The service was fast and super friendly! The food was delicious! We had the pulled pork sandwich and pulled pork nachos! The food was fresh and so tasty. We will definitely eat here again. It was a lot of food! I highly recommend checking them out!!

Best Truckin' BBQ is pretty darn good! And imagine my surprise when I found out they were owned by Deli Time! Deli Time is the great cafe inside my office building (and inside many buildings in the 'burbs).

A friend had told me about them and when I saw the truck recently at a food truck meetup, I was determined to try them right away. I was their first customer of the day (lucky me!) and the staff seemed really energetic and enthusiastic about their items.

I love pulled pork morning, noon and night (minus the morning) so I had to get the Interstate BBQ sandwich. The Interstate is $7 and is a BBQ Pork Sandwich-hand seasoned pork shoulder, smoked for twelve hours, chopped, sauced, & served on your choice of bun (according to their menu). You can pick from a brioche roll or pretzel bread. You can also get the sandwich in slider form for just $3.50. I liked the sandwich an awful lot, ever so slightly dry but great flavor. It's left me wanting more!

They have a Bacon chocolate brownie....Yea I'm going to need to get that the next time I get Best Truckin' BBQ. And oh yes, there will be a next time. The truck is stationed in Schaumburg and makes a lot of stops in the area - perfect for a weekday lunch for me!

Tried their jackknife Mac and cheese side. It's a small cup it was ok I had more cheesier and flavorful Mac in other places. You can taste the red bell peppers and a little spice to it. I ordered the traffic jam two bbq chicken sliders yum with pretzel buns. They now give lays classic bag if chips which I liked better than their homemade chips from last time. They tasted stale and hard. Staff was friendly and quick with my order. I wished they taped my wrapped sandwiches in place because it fell apart in my bag when I was taking them out. I should have asked for more BBQ sauce on the side maybe next time. Overall cost $9 plus $1 tip total $10 bucks.
Their office is located 1501 e WOODFIELD rd suite 103e Schaumburg, il.

Best Truckin' BBQ came to my work for the first time today, and even though I don't really care for BBQ food, I thought I'd give it a shot. After browsing their menu items, (all cleverly named) I decided to try the Expressway mini pretzel slider (BBQ pulled chicken sandwich with their special BBQ sauce.  It's also topped with cilantro lime slaw) and two sides; Jackknife (pepper jack mac and cheese with roasted red peppers,  green chiles and crunchy baked top) and Over The Road (spicy orzo and black beans served with fresh veggies and feta cheese).

The sandwich was pretty dang good, for a mini slider. The chicken had good flavor and I enjoyed the slaw even though I didn't detect any cilantro or lime notes in it. I think the bbq sauce may have overpowered it.

The jackknife? Nothing short of amazing. I could eat this stuff all day long! The pepper jack cheese was creamy and I loved the incorporation of the red peppers and green chiles. 

Finally the Over The Road was really good as well, though there was a bit more feta cheese on it than I would have liked. 

I'm looking forward to trying the "Speeding Tickets" next time they come around.

Ok so here's the deal - I think I ordered the wrong things. Too many yelpers I adore have rated this place 4+ stars, so I must have done something wrong, cuz I was just a-ok with this truck o' BBQ.

I was beyond elated to learn that Best Truckin' BBQ was going to be AT my office last week. Not a good walk away, but liiiiiiterally right downstairs. Perfect for the lazy glutton with discerning tastes! When I walked up to the truck, I had no idea what I wanted and there was kind of a line, so I ordered in a rush. I got the cheese fries, an order of hush puppies, and an Expressway mini pretzel slider. The menu is cute with themed transport names running throughout.

The food is ready FAST - I meandered away to smoke (yeah yeah I know I'm trying to quit), and before I could even finish, my food was ready. I eagerly grabbed the bag and went back upstairs to eat at my cubicle. 

I set the bag down and went to grab a glass of water, and when I returned, pools of oil were spotting my desk. Gross. I looked to see a corner of the bag leaking oil. I cleaned it up and set the food out, and learned the hush puppies were the culprit. SO FREAKIN GREASY. Like I seriously feel like I coulda squeezed some grease out of them if I had tried. EW. I love my fried food good and fried, and this was too much. I tried two and couldn't deal with the feeling it left on my mouth. Shame, too, because the sauce they come with is AHHHHHmazing and I totally used it to snarf my fries.

The slider was decent - I would probably order something different next time. A little bit dry, but pulled chicken is hard to do. I think I wanted it saucier or something. But the pretzel roll was delicious.  And the cheese fries were INCREDIBLE - they have the shape/size/texture of portillos fries, cooked perfectly, and drowned in a delightfully sinful cheesy sauce that has a hint of spice to it. I love, love, loved the fries and would totally order them again.

So one hit, one miss, and one meh leaves me feeling just all right about BTB. However, I'm not giving up. Food trucks are novel and fun and their menu is expansive enough for me to give it another go - they've got a bacon brownie on the menu and i can't let that go unreviewed!

I've tried Best Truckin' BBQ three times now. I can't complain...mainly because I've liked everything ice tried. 

So what have I tried?  Both the pulled chicken and the pulled pork sliders...both were tasty on a nice bun. The chicken was a little drier, but it wasn't bad at all. And my favorite bite would be the hush puppies. I've tried them a couple times now and they are a definite winner!  The batter is tasty. I enjoy the bits of onion. And the dipping sauce has a nice little bite. 

Their staff at the windows have been quite polite. Overall, I'm a fan of this yummy food served up quick on a local food truck.

Quick, friendly service with delicious food!  The truck stopped by our apartment complex so I gave them a try.

I had the pulled pork sandwich and a bag of Lays chips that came with it.

The pork sandwich was very juicy with a very good barbeque sauce.  I was impressed with this coming from a food truck.  I would definitely eat here again if they were in my neighborhood.  It would have been nice to have something other than Lays chips like fries or homemade chips but that is a minor detail as their specialty is obviously the BBQ.  Keep on truckin!

This is an extremely difficult review to write.  I gave it 4 stars for the food and for the workers on the truck.  My journey to finally try this truck is epic.

Initially, there was no website listed for this truck, so I googled it and I called the number listed.  The person at that number, very graciously, referred me to another number where I had to leave a voice message to get a return call. I went to the facebook page and posted a question about how to know where the truck might be BEFORE it actually left that sight.  Now they post the morning of, where they will be.  Sometimes I need more than 2 hours to figure out if the location will work for my schedule.  The person who called me back explained that she sometimes just puts the name of the building if she thinks that is better known than the actual address of the location.  I lived in Lisle for 20 years and NEVER heard of the building.

So, might I suggest, that you improve your website to make it legible, addresses help, and the correct times are a benefit.  The worker on the truck checked his personal calendar for July and told me they would not be in the area, most unfortunate.  The parking at this particular location in Lisle was akin to downtown Naperville.  Since everything is placed in a small bag, no larger bags are available ~ you might want to get some of those suckers~ I finally just went back to my car and drove over to the truck because there is no way I could have carried all those small bags in one trip AND unlocked my car.

My reward ~ the Interstate, Spare Tire, Jackknife, Speeding Ticket, and Traffic Jam were ALL faaaaaaaaaaaaabulously delicious.  That was lunch for 7 people, next time I know to order more of the Traffic Jam.

I will keep searching for this truck to be some place nearby because I WANT MORE.

I got to try Best Truckin BBQ at the Schaumburg Food Truck Extravaganza.  I wanted to try only one thing here:  The Jackknife.  It's a $2 portion of macaroni & cheese with pepperjack, red peppers and garnished with a crunchy topping.  

When I received my order, it was hot and tasted delicious.  It's one of the best macaroni & cheese dishes I've had at any BBQ place.

This was a great truck to have at the event, because none seemed to have small portions of anything.  But a side of their mac was the perfect portion.

I would definitely try more of their food sometime!

First time reviewing a food truck! I had the good fortune of seeing that these guys were going to be at a new craft brewery in Algonquin that just opened recently. So, I got to experience good beer and good BBQ at the same time! 

We tried two different sandwiches, and agreed that both (Interstate and Expressway) were really good. A side of hush puppies made the meal, and their sauces are unique and memorable as well. The highlight of the meal though was the roasted red pepper aioli that came with the hush puppies. I'd gladly take a vat of that stuff. 

If Best Truckin' finds its way anywhere near your house, be sure to give them a try!

Was able to try this place out at the Food Truck Extravaganza event. The line was quite long, my group waited a hour or so however it was worth the wait.  Ordered the Speeding Ticket and the Spare Tires.  Both sliders were very good however I would have to say that the Spare Tire came out on top for me. 

The Pork in the Spare Tire with the Spiced Pomegranate sauce was very good! The tang from the sauce worked well with the sweetness of the BBQ pork.  The only thing I wish was that the Pork and Chicken were hot when they were given to us.  I would come back to try some of their other items on the menu.

This is supposedly a BBQ truck.  But if you're going to call yourself that, you damn well better have a good sauce.  

The chicken sandwich I had instead was mostly slathered in grease. If there was sauce on there, it'd be news to me. And on top of that, the chicken was tasteless.

If you see these guys, my advice is to keep on truckin'.

This a food truck!! Not a location. Tried calling, got directed to the owner of the truck who (very rudely) informed me that he won't even be in Schaumburg area until 5/16. #majorfail

If you're looking for something quick and delicious to eat on your lunch break, I suggest somewhere else. 

Customer service is everything and this place leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

I got the pork nachos, and I was not impressed. The cheese sauce was grainy, and tasteless. Did it come from a packet? The pork and jalape√±os were tasty, but they didn't make up for the cheese sauce. My friend got the Road Rage and didn't like it either. She did say that the pork was good though. The prices were kind of high for the quality. The staff was friendly, and quick, that's always a plus. I won't be back, but I encourage people to try them and make their own decision.

Some of the best BBQ we have ever had and they are welcome at our buildings anytime.  They arrived at the time they say they will and left without a trace.  Their food is great and very reasonable pricing.  Our tenants enjoyed their visit!!

It was my first time trying this food truck today! 
My boyfriend and I got the expressway, hushpuppies, and the mac and cheese!
To start off, the expressway sandwich is a pulled chicken with their slaw, and choice of bun! The chicken was delicious!!! Very soft and moist. The slaw was a unique touch to the sandwich. I could taste the cilantro and lime in it! The hushpuppies were super yummy! I actually enjoyed the sauce that came with them. It added more flavor and made them less dry! The mac and cheese was also very tasty! It seemed to me that the topping for it was cheeze its crumbled!! Very unique and actually yummy! All in all I would definitely get this place again!

We came to Arlington Park for the races and food truck festival that was taking place on July 12th. Best Truckin' BBQ was on our list of must tries. My husband and I were all about sharing so that we could try as much food as we could from all the food trucks. We ordered one pulled pork bbq sandwich on a pretzel bun. We would have gotten the sliders, which were made using a pomegranate BBQ sauce, but they were all out of the slider buns (bummer!!!) I am confidant that the guy working the truck was NOT down with people sharing sandwiches! He was only offering one plastic fork, and no knives. He looked at me with sharing disgust. What was it to him if I was going to share?!?!

Anyways - the sandwich was awesome. It was the perfect amount of balance between sweet and savory. Would love to try again. Yum!

Follow this truck!!  If you like BBQ, there are no bad choices on their menu and the sauces to top them off are all fantastic. Drop in a tip and ask for a bit more sauce on the side and drown your french fries in it. I wish this truck was around more often, because it is my best lunch of the month when it is. Jim is great, friendly and the food is ready fast. And if BBQ wasn't enough for you, wash it down with a bacon chocolate brownie. Yeah bacon. Oink.

I give them a 4 because they are a food truck.  If they were a restaurant then they would get 3 stars.  The pretzel buns were the best part.  They asked if you wanted a pomegranate bbq sauce or another kind. I had the pomegranate.  The sauce was good and the pulled pork was not dry. I like a more spicier sauce,  it would be nice to have that option.  The sandwich came with chips. . They didn't have salt or flavor.  Overall I would go again.  I feel it deserves 3.5 stars but there is not a half star option.

Great place.  I originally visited this place when it first opened, did not like it at all.  Went back last month and the food is amazing.  The waiter Kumar was great.  If you are going, ask for him.  He makes the experience great.  Great conversation, recommendations etc.  We went back few weeks ago, had a different waiter and she was horrible.  Took forever to get appetizers (we only got them because I went to Kumar and asked him why we haven't received them and we got them a few minutes later). I asked to have Kumar be our server, but it was too late.  The lady we had was disinterested, slow, and really felt like she didn't want to be there.

Tips: Ask for Kumar, he works daily except Tuesdays.  He will make your experience great.  Call ahead and make sure he is your server.
I would have given 5 stars, but the other server was bad.

Food isn't that great I ordered veg hot and sour soup; and there were about 4 pieces of bean sprouts and the rest was just thick corn starch broth.  

I also ordered fish which seemed like it was fried first and than stir fried in that red sauce which they typically have on table for extra spicy taste.  I didn't enjoy my meal at all; hindsight - wine was excellent.  I guess that't the one thing on our table chef didn't make.

WORST experience ever; save your money!

Rating Angle : Vegetarian Food
A very frequently visited joint for us, Bombay Chopsticks caters to the taste of all those who crave for Indo-Chinese cusine, as it is popularly termed in India. Their best to order starters are their Sesame toasts which do soak a bit more oil than usual but are worth the try. Their crispy corn also have been wonderful but we havent seen this on their recently upgraded menus. On their main course comes our favorite Schezwan fried rice that we customize to extra spicy owing to the craving spice levels we consume. An accompaniment to the fried rice is the veg balls in manchurian sauce which goes well with our second dish that we order i.e. Veg Chowmein. 
For all pregnant women who visit this place, be sure to ask them for a non-MSG food which they easily accommodate. 

Overall : A good value for money in an excellent ambient setting and good customer service minus the waiting time. Be sure to book ahead of time  if you are planning to visit this place in a group.

This place is simply amazing. I wish they could open one is Milwaukee so I could go there more often. This is a Chinese/Asian fusion restaurant but all the food is cooked Indian style, so basically Indian Chinese. I went on a Saturday and it was very busy even at 10 in the night; the ambiance is beautiful, the servers are quick to attend, food could cost you $20 to $30 per head without the drinks. Most of the alcohol drinks are $12. They have a good variety of food items on the menu including Vegetarian, seafood and chicken and lamb; no beef items as it is an Indian restaurant. Some of them could be really hot and spicy(although they are marked on the menu). My advise, this is a must go place for everyone who loves Indian/Chinese food as the food tastes exactly or at least very close to the Chinese food we have in India.

This was highly recommended by my Indian coworker, their food seems really interesting for me: Chinese+Indian? Must be good combination!!

Not knowing what to order, we had some chicken with spicy garlic sauce and lamb with sichuan sauce, i am a real chinese so the sichuan sauce wasn't as expected but good. I enjoyed the food while we were there( maybe i was really hungry?) but didn't feel well( not sick but didn't like the food'd flavor anymore) for rest of the day, i didn't even tough any of the leftover. 
It was ok for me, i prefer real indian or chinese food than this kind of combination:)

I am here right now, and they refuse to make Singapore with Paneer instead of Chicken since I'm a vegetarian. They made something else like an appetizer and tried to pass it off as Singapore dish. I am 8.5 months pregnant and I had a craving. I am going home hungry. What a disappointment. I come here a few times a month and they never refused me before.

What a cute place! I really like the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant. It wasn't busy for a Tuesday evening so we were seated right away while we waited for our party. I ordered their lychee sangria and it was delicious! I let the rest of the girls try and it just about everyone ordered it!

The food was just A-OK. The green curry lacked a lot of flavor as well as some of the lamb dishes, however, the Chung King Lamb was fantastic, great with white rice. The lettuce wraps and crab had a flavorful taste, but nothing else really satisfied our taste buds.

Our service was A-OK as well. One of the servers had a bit of an attitude. The meal ended up being quite pricey which wasn't worth it.

I tried Bombay Chopsticks for the comparison to other Indo-Chinese restaurants and learned that the differences are indeed noticeable. Take note, don't come here expecting Chinese or Thai food though. 

With no surprise, Bombay Chopsticks puts the spices at the forefront of their cuisine due to the stronger Indian influence. Dishes here are much more vibrant and aromatic as with Indian cuisine but while still using Chinese cooking techniques. We ordered cumin lamb and dry chili chicken and both were excellent. Each dish was well prepared showing their skill and expertise in the cuisine. 

The food portions may be smaller than what I would have liked but we cleaned our plates. Just from trying two dishes, I want to go back and try more items off their menu.
All of the food options were labeled spicy and while they were willing to make it mild, the taste was very bland. It is quite expensive and not so tasty. The ambiance is cosy though

This place gets a five-star review, only because no other restaurant does indo-chinese as well as they do. 
I've eaten this cuisine all around the country, but this is the closest you can get to the roadside-chinese food in India. Do not expect traditional thai or chinese food here, and don't even bother ordering those, but stick to what they do best.

Ambiance & Service:
The place is decorated in a swanky fashion, with upholstered seating and chandeliers, which I thought was unnecessary and over the top. However, it does give a feel of a clean and well-kept place. The service was reasonably good, but a bit slow even for just a half-filled restaurant .

Food:
Excellent food, as I've stated before. The spices they use are very aromatic, and much better than what I've had at other similar restaurants.
We started off with soup, which we rarely get at restaurants. The sweet corn soup was very close to the indian version, but the manchow soup was clear, which was surprising, and also served without fried noodles. My friends got the chili chicken appetizer, which they said was really good.
For the entrees, we got gobi manchurian, hakka noodles, and shezwan fried rice. All of those were superb, and commendable. The noodles were the best among these. 
The quantity was really huge. Among the three of us, we could only eat 30% of what we got, and everything else was packed away to-go. 
They serve the food family style, so keep the large portion size in mind while ordering.

Value:
Even though the food was really good, it was pretty pricey relative to other comparable restaurant. For one appetizer, two soups, and three entrees, it cost us almost $110. 
However, this is a one of a kind place, so I won't mind splurging occasionally.

Saying this again, this is one of the best indo-chinese food I've had in the US, and will definitely go back here.
If you go here, don't order the authentic chinese or thai dishes, but stick to the indo-chinese specialties.

Need to say more.. This place is bad ass. I love it. Other then the ridiculous long wait, just sit yourself at the bar and enjoy a meal. You are in for a flavor... Try the sauces, it's delicious... Lol, unfortunately for me, I have to drive 40 minutes to eat here...

This is probably one of the most overrated restaurants in general, mostly because of absence of competition.

A- mushroom and cottage cheese appetizers are better than all of the others veggie options.

B- I never had to wait for more than 15 minutes to get a table for 2.

C- Going by their menu, they use a lot of corn starch in almost every dish.
Once we ordered the veg manchow soup which was only starch with no soupy base. I had to convince them that it was no good.
Good thing that they offered us a fresh one which did taste like a real soup.

D- On another occasion, we ordered cauliflower manchurian with gravy which was so awful, no spice and flavor, just lot of starch again.

E- all in all, their food lacks consistency and flavor. And yes, it is a crowded fine dine place.

Hakka wok which is not so far from Bombay chopsticks is a better option when it comes to indo Chinese food.

One of the best place to have Indian style Chinese food with perfect spice level.
I did small catering with them for 25 people in downtown. Food delivery was on time, food was presented well and they gave nice instruction to how to heat up food so we do not burn it specially chicken lollipop.

They have nice seating good place for families.

We are regulars here. Its one of the only places in America where I have had indo Chinese food just like we get in India. 
Most of the time we order the fish finger, chicken lollipop, veg manchurian dry and the chili garlic noodles. All of these have been good. The other noodles like the Hakka and pad Thai are good too but we prefer the thin noodles.
I do not personally like the food with gravy so I always order the dry options.
The portions are good enough for the money you pay.

Good was good. Portions are generous.
Service was good too. Friendly staff.
Ambience was great. Family restaurant, lots of seating, clean, and pretty.

We ordered the tom yum soup, shredded lamb, and chow mein. The soup was very flavorful. The lamb was soft and pretty tasty. The noodles were spicy and hit the spot. The menu is pretty big and I feel like you can't go wrong. We've tried a few other entrees in the past and loved everything. The atmosphere is nice and the waiters are helpful as well. It gets pretty busy on the weekends, so make a reservation in advance to save time :)

I've been a few times now so just want to share.. Service at this place is great. I loved the chilli garlic hakka noodles, so fresh, tasty and light! The food is on the saltier side but guess that's normal for roadside/street style Indo-chinese ..would go back to try other dishes

Was there last night with family. Excellent service, fast, great food, large servings! Couldn't ask for a better experience. Our Moldovian server was very friendly, prompt, and efficient.

We ordered 6 dishes for our group of 7 hungry folks which could have easily fed more than twice as many. The food was slightly Indo-Chinese fusion variety, different from standard Schezwan offerings yet well prepared.

We ordered chicken, lamb, and vegetarian dishes all were well received by the kids and adults. The calamari appetizer was good, but could have been great if it was slightly crispier.

I would definitely suggest this place to folks to at least give it a try. Who knows you might be pleasantly surprised. I know I was very pleasantly surprised, having gone there after a while.

Want to say thamk you to BC team for a great experience and service! And of course delicious food and huge portions. Manager of the place is very professional and with help and understanding treated out party.  We had a bday celebration and all our requests were dpne ahead of time. When we just entered we felt very welcomed. Ladies on front was very nice, we got nice, comfortable table even though place was full of waitings. 
Surely recommend to try their drinks! Those are delicious! Drinks list is very unique and unusual.  I would say irs a bit expensive but 100% worst it! If you a have a big group of people and special event upcoming these place is what you looking for! Definitely will visit again.

overall 3.5 stars

This place provides a rather swanky ambiance for an Indo-Chinese place. Business must be great as it's next to the parent restaurant that owns it too in the plaza that's called India House plaza. 

The restaurant menu is very much set up as family style. Portions are made to be shared and priced as such. Food was okay. We liked the chicken Manchurian the most, and then the Chunking lamb and then the lobster crab dish. Everything we ordered came out record fast. If one takes a step back to see what was ordered, most of the protein dishes follow the same prep: batter it, color it, fry it, sauce it. 

There aren't other options for decent Indo-Chinese and esp. given the nice interior with a view of the cooks, I'm sure this place has returning customers. I'll come back to try the Hakka noodles.  
 
Service: 4
food: 3
D√©cor: 5

Not a fan of food at all here. Bombay chopstick special chicken dish was hopeless with no salt and big chunks of chicken. The dish itself was not appealing or appetizing. Along with that, ordered  haka noodles and they weren't great either. I have definitely experienced better food. Though the portion size is huge here but for me quality always takes the edge than quantity. 
I am still giving this place 3 stars only because of the service provided at the bar before we moved to the table.
We were super hungry when we reached this restaurant and requested the bar tender to get us one of the appetizers which can come soon. She not only gave her suggestions of what will take time (dimsum) which we wanted to order but didnt as per her suggestion and went with another one. It came at a lightning speed and all kudos to her. Really appreciate that effort.
Great Indo Chinese food. Not as good as India but good enough for the Midwest. Will come back again if I am in the area.

I haven't been at this restaurant in a few years but decided to try it out again on the recommendation of a friend.  Food quality seems to have improved drastically although I wasn't too impressed with the Mongolian Lamb. All other dishes were good. 

As for the service, Kumar was great. He was very accommodating and friendly. He took the time to talk to us and made us feel welcomed.

Elegant ambiance! I felt like I was in a banquet hall. Besides the awkward tables at the entrance, everything else was pretty cool. 

The food was good but expensive. We ordered egg rolls, fried rice, orange chicken and all of it was good. Usmania Chinese is definitely better food wise, but this place definitely has better decor. Only issue is, we asked for everything to be spicy and it wasn't spicy at all! Even the spicy sauce wasn't spicy. I didn't even need to drink water. 

They had many many waiters! Maybe too many, which is good because you know the owner isn't cheap. I didn't have to ask for water once because they were so quick to fill it up. Very good service! They also have a window through which you can see how the chef cooks. In case you are worried and want to see if he picks his boogers while he cooks.

If the food was cheaper, I'd give them 4 stars.

I have been here many times and there have been times when the food was good and others where everything tasted like I ordered the same thing with different names. The service is good and the food in general is always decent. I give this place a 4 star overall but the food is a 3 star.

Good Food, But you must make sure TO ARRIVE BEFORE 9PM (in short as soon possible) if you really want to enjoy your food.. We arrived around 9:30 PM and were treated like not welcomed.. Our server keep coming to our table asking whether we are done eating or not right after receiving our main course.. I like to take my time when eating and enjoy it little by little.. Some items are overpriced especially for vegetarians.. I hope my comment helps you guys.. Enjoy the taste of Indo Chinese.. Hakka noodles was cooked with perfection also munchurian so it made my night
Food is really good over here with overwhelming quantity. If you are looking for good Indian hakka Chinese then your wait is over.

The food was good but the ambience is horrible. Its really really difficult to even talk to another person. In addition to this we had to wait for half an hour even after making a reservation. Plus they clearly looked understaffed. The lady at the door and the one taking down names for reservation were really rude. The only glimpse of light was the waiter, she was really polite and tried her best to provide a good service. But surely not visiting again

DO NOT GO HERE. They're loud obnoxious people and the lack of management. Had to ask if we can move tables twice because a family with their 4 kids running around the dining area like they were in a park. I asked one of the server to speak to a manager. "There she us in a red shirt" OK so I wait and she is no where to be found, the same server points at another girl and said there she is, WAIT, the one in red or the gray I ask, the one in gray. So as I head towards her, I see my server so I explain the situation to him and the manager in gray shirt, but she clearly ignores me and walks away, but the server shook his head in a typical Indian style and "it's OK sir I will give you a discount." If I wanted discounted food I would have went to Devon. My Eid is Fucked!

this is my goto place for Indian Chinese fusion in the Chicago area. the restaurant is a very bustling place during weekends and has very nice "Chinese red" theme. this time I went there i ordered my all time fusion favorites. I ordered vegrtable spring rolls and American chopsuey both were really good.  very recommended. 

very bustling and lively place

When I was in Nova Scotia, I went to a place called "Alfredo, Weinstein, and Ho" which was Italian, Jewish, and Chinese.  Well... here we have Indian, Chinese, and Thai.  Quite an interesting experience.

High points
- Varied menu - can easily try fare from all 3 places - or a dish with overtones of all 3
- Quick and friendly servers
- Accommodating to special requests
- Decor that makes one feel "outside of the U.S." 
- Good appetizers to share amongst a small group (we were 5 people; worked well)
- Large portions for the main course (virtually no one finished their meal)
- Markings on the menu indicating level of spiciness - which matched people's expectations (meaning we all tried different levels - mild, medium, or hot - and got what we thought we would)

Novel concept - well worth a stop in.  Reasonably priced.

We are always looking for a place which serves good Indo Chinese fusion food. Heard about this place but to say we were dis-appointed will be putting it very mildly. Would never want to go back again. Horrible and arrogant staff. Bunch of dumb blondes. Looks like the place gets a regular inflow of customers as there is no other option available in the neighborhood. Bunch of complacent idiots. I so wish a new Indo Chinese place opens up and shuts this place down.

My recommendation- Please Please Please Avoid. It's so not worth it. You'll repent. I wish there was an option to give negative stars.

Went to this restaurant on the recommendation of a work colleague when visiting Chicago on business.   The service was excellent and the portions huge.   I got the Garlic Chili noodles and found the flavor to be somewhat lacking - a lot of red pepper flakes combined with a lot of angel hair pasta, with a little chicken and shrimp.    Same with the Tom Yum soup - salty and uninspired.   I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but wouldn't rebel if a group voted to have dinner here again.
Had the mouth watering chicken   Not as good as expected. The spice level was average.  Will try other restaurants next time

Nice and chic ambience compared to your usual chinese or indian restaurant.  This results in a bit more overpriced food than usual. Gort their chicken fried rice and Hakka noodles.  Both were great.  The portions were generous too.

My big brother (best friend who's Muslim) and I always wanted to go to this place. The reviews are good, it's zabiha halal, and it looked like a nice restaurant from the outside. We joked about coming here for months because we always thought it was so expensive. In addition to that, I always thought "it's just Chinese food (I'm half Chinese btw)." However, on this 21st day of November, we decided it was going to be the day. 

It takes about 45-50 mins from Gurnee, but that was studying time we were willing to forego. As soon as I entered I said "wow! This place is beautiful!" The architecture, design, lighting, and entirety of its ambiance makes you feel at ease and delighted. 

We were seated immediately even though it was quite busy. We ordered the dragon roll appetizer within five minutes after being seated. It came out in minutes. Then for entrees we got the Chung king Lamb and the Mandarin Honey chili chicken which were both phenomenal. The food was sooooo sooooo soooo good. I liked the lamb better - they do a good job with the spices and breading. The serving sizes are humongous! You get your money's worth for sure. 

In addition to the food and ambiance, the service was superb too. Salu was our server and he was very kind to us. Very prompt and made it a great experience. Excellent service!

Bombay Chopsticks is bomb! Awesome and delicious food with a fun twist on Chinese cuisine! I recommend this for people because it's not your average Chinese restaurant!

Excellent food and service !! Orderd chicken lollipop and garlic chilli shrimp  fir appetizer .. 
  Service was great and ao do atmospher ..
   Great authentic chinese in chicago .. 
Our server Kumar was really friendly and helpful
   Highly recommended

This place serves good indo-chinese food, but only if you go in their slow days/time. If you go during weekends, you will definitely be disappointed with food & service as well!! Worst part is that some Server actually take your plates without asking if we are done or not..

The food is amazing. It's a Indo-Chinese place so basically they have Thai and Chinese food to the average American.  The food is reasonably priced. I'd say $10-15 a plate but what they don't really tell you if that it is family style. My wife and I ordered the Lettuce wrap w/ chicken as an appetizer and then Pad Thai and Chung King Lamb and we left with 4 boxes of takeout :) 

This place is worth every penny. The atmosphere is really different and not what I expected. The main room is darker with some nice lighting and we sat in a room that had a wall of windows so it was bright but still nice.

But the kicker to our visit was the waiter. The lady hostess was nice but I don't think she completely understood us when trying to get a table/booth that our son (6-months) could fit at with his carseat. But it worked out for the best. Our waiter was Sukumar. He was soo nice and courteous. He was hard to understand some times but I wouldn't have had any other waiter. Every time he refilled my water he would ask if the food was to spicy for me in a joking way. He was super sweet to our son without going overboard. He was cracking jokes with us. When he was boxing up our food I started to wipe the table of the water condensation from my glass and he stopped me stating that if I clean the table then he will be out of a job and he will clean it. He was a gentle nice guy and I wouldn't have traded him for anyone else.

And free rice refills, can't beat that!

My experience might not be the same for everyone but if you do go ask for Sukumar and you will not regret it!!

Bombay Chopsticks has gained a loyal customer with me for sure!
Previously it was one of my favorite places for noodles and chicken lollipops. But, the quality has been dropped drastically since last 2/3 times take always!!

--Plagiarizing most of @Kishen's review cause thats exactly what I wish to say!

We are always looking for a place that serves good Indo- Chinese fusion food. Heard a lot about this restaurant but to say we were underwhelmed is putting it mildly. Have been here few times courtesy friends..But now never again..
The only dish worth getting here is Golden Baby Corn

The cauliflower manchurian , fried rice , noodles were nothing like Indo Chinese ! Flavorless 

Looks like this place manages to get a regular flow of customers because there are no other options in this neighborhood and they seem to be complacent since they don't have to compete.

Wish a new Indo Chinese restaurant opens up in the area and shuts this place down

My recommendation  - avoid this place.

This place is good for starters. Ordered chili baby corn, chicken lollipops, chicken Manchuria and all were tasty. Soups are good as well. Ordered coconut and masala soda. Coconut was fresh and nice however masala soda was just hajmola mixed in water. No fizzz whatsoever!! Ordered noodles and fried rice which were okay!!! Ambience was good or I can say, better than other Indian restaurants.
Awesome food but HUGE portions! Would definitely recommend going in a large group. Very vegetarian friendly & the waiters are all very competent and nice.

Went in for the "Indo Chinese" experience and was not disappointed. Generous quantity and neat ambience.

Chicken Mancho soup - Flavourful. With the addition of the spicy dips, this soup was an ideal starter.
Lamb Patties in sweet sauce - Delicious Patty, cooked well. The party was juicy.
Dragon Chicken - This was a disappointment. Though the stuffing was light , the outer fried batter was way too oily. 
Egg Schezwan Fried Rice - Felt good about this dish. Good spicy rice and quantity was very generous.
Tiramasu-  Excellent rich tiramasu cake served with Vanilla and Mango icecreams.

Took my Dad here for Father's Day to try something new.  It is owned by the same people that own the nondescript India House next door.

The interior is well thought out and tastefully decorated with popular haute Asian themes.  The menus were plastic laminated traditional menus for an Asian restaurant but were held within custom fabric menu holders that added a nice touch in addition to the table cloth and napkins.

We were brought water promptly and we ordered soon after.  I ordered the Kung Pao Eggplant (Diced eggplant cooked with chopped Garlic, Chili, Green Onions,
and Peanuts) for $13.95.

My dish was incredibly delicious and the eggplant was prepared to the perfect texture and flavoring.  Eggplant is tough to cook with because it gets soft quickly with baking or saut√©ing but this was some of the best I've had.  In addition this was fried so I was impressed.  The seasoning and spice was just right and the rice added a good balance.

One thing that drew me to this restaurant was the solid vegetarian menu.  Of course I would expect to find this at an Indian fusion restaurant, but they did a great job of combining the vegetarian staples of both cultures even within this menu as well.

I am disappointed that they serve Halal food at this restaurant.  I respect the Hindu practice of ahimsa or non-violence and for a restaurant with such an attractive vegetarian menu, I would prefer to support an establishment that didn't buy from Halal slaughter houses.

All in all, it is a great restaurant that you should check out!

Good food. Prices are high but portions are large. One entree feeds 2-3 ppl. Chicken lollipops are good, but overpriced for an appetizer. For the dessert stay away from the toffee lychee. Even the vanilla ice cream it came with was bad. 

The chicken Singapore was okay. Orange chicken was really good.

Bombay Chopsticks is a fusion Indian-Asian restaurant owned by the same people that run the India House restaurant next door. The felling is very chic - dark lighting, dark woods, large murals of Buddha and the like.

Service was outstanding. The servers know the menus and are very helpful. There were three of us dining. We skipped the appetizers and ordered entrees only. Mandarin Honey Chili Chicken, Chili Chicken and Pan Fried Orange Tilapia with Ginger, Garlic and Green Onions. All of this was served with a generous portion of steamed white rice and a variety of sauces.

I thought everything was good. In particular the Chili Chicken, although each dish had its own distinct flavor. Great food, a little pricier than other Asian restaurants in the area, but good ambiance for a special occasion.

This review is based on a recent take-out. I hesitated a bit writing a review based on take-out only especially this seems like a nice sit down restaurant but the food really did not live up to par for me to go back and try out the "entire package". The food really was mediocre at best. 
We wanted to have Indian Chinese and decided to order the quintessential Indian Chinese preparations. 
We ordered manchow soup and ended up getting the egg flower soup in our take-out. The egg flower soup was watery and tasteless.
American Chopsuey - i personally dont like this preparation in general, i dont understand why any one would  like noodles drenched in ketchup. Anyway, my husband likes this dish, and he said Bamboo Chopstick's version was good.
Chili Chicken dry - this, I'm sorry but is Not how chili chicken tastes. The chicken wasn't juicy, it was very very dry. It tasted a little bit like kung pao chicken without the peanuts. 
Schezwan chicken fried rice - this was a disaster! It literally tasted like frozen fried rice. The portion was huge!! But i couldn't keep the leftovers since it was tasteless and tasted like something that came out of a super market freezer section.
I hate to give two stars but i don't think the food at Bamboo Chopsticks qualifies to get more :(

Came to this place because India House was packed. 

Ambiance is cool, modern and elegant. Servers are excellent. 

Hot and sour soup had a surprising hint of curry which was in the background but not characterizing. Authentic ingredients but chicken was dry and inconsistent in sizes. Flavor was very good!!!

Garlic chicken noodles was excellent. It had excellent texture, crunchy with cabbage, hints of curry and had good spiciness. These are dry egg chow mien noodles that were gently stir fried and tossed in a garlic chili sauce. 

Kung Pao Chicken had a lot of chicken pieces diced in the correct dice size. The sauce was a little soupy and very salty. The flavor was good but needed more identity. 

The white rice was a premium long grain rice that was aromatic but slightly overcooked. 

I loved this place and was glad that India House was busy.

My family and I always used to come here as this served really good indo Chinese food. It's a disappointment now. We ordered 3 appetizers, 2 entree, 1 noodles and 1 fried rice. Everything was a disappoint as it was cold when it got to the table. The food lost its flavor and the staff got worse. Fried rice and noodles were extremely oily. We actually had them take it back so they can re-heat it. I believe Chinese food is meant to be made instant, made to order. But the food that was brought to us came within 5-7 minutes, it did not taste fresh. Don't come here unless you are trying to eat flavorless, cold or overpriced indo chinese food. I will not be returning, even with the 15% off coupon they offered on next visit.

This is an average restaurant poses itself as a fine dining ...for a few things. We were really craving some good Zabiha Chinese. The fried rice is average but the chicken lolipops were oily but ok. Spring rolls weren't really tasty but they were crunchy. The pad Thai was not good ...actually tasted nothing like a pad Thai; also the noodles were very dry so we actually ended up returning the pad Thai. The waitress didn't really speak English and she hesitated at first (I guess she didn't know what to do) then she started insisting for us to get something else or for them to fix the pad Thai. We didn't want neither. Anyways, the drinks were ok I had ginger limeade and my friend had masala soda. This restaurant is ridiculously high priced I mean my ginger limeade non alcoholic was $10 wow! I mean it was just ginger and lemonade And the masala soda was $6 also, the spring rolls (3 rolls cut in half ) filled with cabbage and carrots was $10! A bowl of fried rice was $17 bucks ....it wasn't even that tasty. Overall, very expensive....the restaurant is very fancy looking and had nice decor but that's about it. The food actually sucks! Don't go here until you wanna spend all your money and get below average food and pay an arm and a leg for it.

For the Indian who wants to relive the taste of classic Indian Chinese ( from memories of those street side Chinese carts), this is the BEST you can get in the Midwest. I have had times when I and my friends have ordered carry out to be picked up by one friend who is in the area. 
Recommendations: chicken lollipops, Bombay chopsticks special hakka noodles and the awesome masala sweet like soda/ tasted like jaljeera

Over-rated, over-popularized!! 
Nothing close to even the desi style Chinese..
Wee disappointed and wouldn't recommend them for sure! 
Only plus point - quantity!!
And good staff.

I love the decor, this place is gorgeous! The food is delicious, i usually take 2/3 of it home with me. The service is always good. Its a little pricy for me, but a nice place to go for a special occasion.
Good only for appetizers. The taste is going down of late. I went for lunch and the food was very mediocre. They reused oil and it was old.

The decor is pretty glam. The waitresses are always smiling, orders come relatively fast. Everything is good except the food. The only exception is CHICKEN LOLLIPOP. Man, thats one food from heaven. Rest are all hellish. Try lollipop.
Love love love this place! Indo-chinese at its best! Chilli baby corn and chicken lollipops are simply perfect as apps. Both me and my husband are a huge fan!

The vegetarian dishes that we ate were good, but not stellar. Though we were very disappointing that this establishment only serves halal meats. It would be fine if they also catered to the rest of the community. There are many communities and faiths that do not eat halal prepared foods, not having options for them is beyond my comprehension. 

The spices were pretty hot in the dishes so it may not be great for kids.

Awesome food! Completely love the non veg appetisers. Vegetarian appetisers are good too! 
For drinks I would suggest the pi√±a colada or the minty lemonade. Main course: Bombay hop sticks special friend rice but tell the server to add a little extra spice if you like it spicy. 
The only reason why I would not give this restaurant 4 stars is cause of the online reservation system. They are never able to deliver. I've been to this restaurant 5 times and every single time I have reached 5 mins before my reservation time and have never got the table on time. It's always about 30-45 mins after the reservation time has passed that we get seated at a table. The only drawback I see in this restaurant. Rest it's a very good place to go and have Indian style Chinese food! Cheers!

Don't come here expecting standard Chinese fare. Prepare to have your taste buds teased with a robust combination of indo-Chinese spices which leave you satiated. Portions are to be shared. Our personal favorites are golden fried baby corn, chilly paneer, egg rolls. Their noodles and cilantro rice are out of this world. The ambience is extremely soothing. 
We are always satisfied with the meal during every visit. Overall gives you a feeling of satisfaction.

Comments about the appetizers here - Golden fried baby corn was absolutely spot on and delicious. The hot n sour soup was pretty good more on the sour side but not bad .. Had the hakka noodles and schzewan fried rice and both were good. 2 entrees and 2 appetizers was perfect for four of us to share :)

Cuzzo and I stopped in for an impromptu dinner on a Monday night to find the place relatively quiet around 530pm.  I'm usually not a fan of the "indo-chinese" concept, but I gave in.  We ordered Chili Chicken and Lollypop Chicken as appetizers, which were a perfect way to start off the experience.  Next came the Eggplant Singapore Style and Chili Garlic Chicken Hakka Noodles as the main course, and both were flawless.  Prices are on par with the quality, portions, and friendly and attentive service.  Although I'm not huge on the fusion theme, I would definitely find my way back here!

Love love love this place! Got the Chung King  Lamb  and it was to die for. I'm Indian by heritage and my favorite food in India is Chino-Indian fusion. They capture it like a dream. I've never eaten it in America where it tastes so authentic! Crispy tener lamb cooked to perfection like Dry Gobi Manchurian. I highly recommend. Also got a drink that was spicy, forgot the name, but spiced with chili pepper and was fabulous! Definitely worth going, portions are huge so plan to split, kinda pricy so another reason to split, but still worth it in every way.

I grew up in India and by god I have missed this kind of food in Chicago. Back in India a Chinese restaurant usually serves chicken lollypops, veg manchurian, dry paneer chilli. These guys make it as good as it is back home. Also, make sure you order an 'old monk with coke'. Its a dark rum/ coke combo we drink religiously back in India

If I get my favorite server over here. I have got nothing to complain about. I don't know what is his name but he is absolutely amazing at what he does. Every dish comes out down right perfect and as requested. Best place in Illinois for Indian inspired Chinese food overall. 
And the mean manager is also gone i think. She wasn't there last time. That woman did not know how to smile. So good to not to have to see her.

It's a good place to go for Indo-Chinese. The restaurant itself is nice from the inside. They have a separate room for larger parties - that way you'll be seated away from the bar too. The food is tasty. They claim that the meat is Zabihah-Halal so that's a plus too. It's just a bit expensive.

Poor food, ticky tacky atmosphere, Undisciplined staff, uninspired safe fusion menu. A gaudy display of Americanized eastern cuisine. If you want authentic food look elsewhere. If you want something good it was too deep in the extensive menu for my party to find it. Everything seemed frozen at some point. Low quality ingredients. Definitely not a value. Would not recommend to anybody. Maybe if you like reality tv.

My girlfriends brought me here for my birthday and I was kind of hesitant at first. The place looks really nice from the outside but even nicer in the inside!
Their bar is beautiful and I love that you also glance into the cooking area. Their table setting and lighting was perfect, very comfortable.

Our waiter came and brought us water immediately after sitting and handed us the menu. We ordered drinks and mine was pretty good, I ordered the Raspberry Mojito and mine was a tad bit loaded with mint but not a big deal. My girlfriends were also pretty pleased with their drinks.

We placed ordered our food soon after and before we did our waiter told us that their portions were pretty big so we decided to do a family style so we can try different things. We ended up getting the Curry Chicken, Mango Chicken, and Teriyaki Chicken. We were pretty surprised and how HUGE their portions were and on top of that we got complimentary Orange Chicken. I have not been a huge fan of Orange Chicken but I tried it and I must say that this is the only place that I will ever it at. The food was hot and tasted very fresh.

This was a really nice place to come to for dinner and I plan to come again and try different things!

Paid a visit to Bombay Chopsticks last night. The food was hit or miss. 

For appetizers, we had chilli paneer and veg manchurian. They were good.

Then we had this eggplant entree prepared Singapore style which was great. The Paneer with Schzewan sauce was not very good. I thought the fried rice were pretty meh... I don't eat pasta, so I couldn't really eat the hakka noodles, but I did taste them and they seemed kind of bland.

The service was OK. There were six of us and we initially got seated in to strange atrium type room, which was kind of the border between this and India House. Did like it, and they accommodated us at another table which ended up being right next to the kitchen window. It was interesting, although you do constantly feel the heat of the theatrics... One of the cooks from in there interacted and even came out to talk to us; nice guy. At the end of dinner, he sent us out some tiramisu. Personally, I hate tiramisu, but it was a great gesture on his part.

Last time I went the experience was horrible. The entire family left hungry as the food was not well cooked or not at all Indo Chinese... No actions were taken by the supervisor upon our complaint about the food. Would not ever go back.

As a place of Indo-Chinese, there is nothing really unique that separates itself from others. There are better options out there. But the were some great goodies such as the lamb meatballs, super meaty with an excellent sauce. The fish appetizer was equally great, which pulled apart nice and smooth.

Gone are the days where Bombay chopsticks was ruling the indo Chinese game. The last 3-4 times I've been here, it has been a huge disappointment, and sadly the food had been on the decline. The past few visits, the quality and taste of food has been largely compromised. For ex, today, the appetizers came literally within 3 minutes of ordering, which shows that obviously the appetizers were just reheated. We also ordered vegetable balls in schezuan sauce, which tasted like watered down soya sauce.  The main course which was chilli chicken, is the reason I am giving this place 2 stars. The fried rice arrived cold and oily to the table, which killed my mood as well my urge to eat. There are many other spots such as Inchin bamboo, which also happens to be in the same neighborhood. It has a lot more flavor, freshness and value for food and money. With much regret, I hate to inform I would not be coming back again even with the 15% off coupon I was given upon my next visit.

Our service was absolutely 5 stars! I believe our server's name was Kumar and he was fantastic! He was funny with a great balance of attentiveness. The food however was, well....meh. And it was really pricey! I mean, if you're going to command those kinds of prices, the food needs to be out of this world...after all, it's in Hoffman Estates, NOT Chicago.

We are always looking for a place that serves good Indo- Chinese fusion food. Heard a lot about this restaurant but to say we were underwhelmed is putting it mildly. The sweet corn soup and schezwan fried rice were semi decent. The chilli chicken was not bad but on the saltier side. The cauliflower manchurian was flavorless. Looks like this place manages to get a regular flow of customers because there are no other options in this neighborhood and they seem to be complacent since they don't have to compete.
I get that it is a business but cuisine should be more than just that - if you don't have a passion for serving food with finesse , why bother.
My recommendation , avoid this place.

4 stars for the ambience 
0 for their food

Their food is extremely  over priced for what they serve.  I have been there several times and the last time was the worst.  I ordered manchow soup and what I got was corn soup with the red sauce mixed it.  I spoke to the server and she was so sure that this was manchow soup and said "this is what the chef made." Long story short the chef comes out looks at the soup and asks the server what soup that was.  And finally admits "oh yea this is corn soup."  

He said he would make me fresh soup but that was definately a lie  The new soup I got again was corn soup but now he just added tones of green onion.  

You can't keep a restaurant going with thinking your customers are fools.  And you can't keep an indo-chinese estaurant  going if you don't know the difference between manchow and corn soup.   

Improve your food.  Don't serve food that has the same base sauce or taste!

Hmmmm... Indian style Chinese.  Meaning more of masala+Chinese. Certainly much expensive Chinese. The menu could use more variety and I can't tell the difference from one curry to another. The portions have shrinked over a year and the delicacies needs a revival. Fish appetizers however always gets it right! Service is fine but there's always a waiting list at the entrance and it takes half an hour usually to get to the table.

Great tasting food and beautiful ambiance made our pre-Thanksgiving dinner a wonderful experience during our visit to Chicago. Chef was very kind to visit us at the table and ask about our meals. Definately, one of the top India restaurants in US.

I heard really good things about this place but was so disappointed.

I came here with a couple coworkers for lunch. It's a super cutely decorated restaurant. They have a pretty good selection on their lunch menu. All orders come with appetizers, soup and either steamed rice or vegetable fried rice. The waiter was nice and checked on us just enough. 

I wasn't exactly sure what the appetizers were or what the soup was. There was some sort of toast-type thing covered in maybe potatoes and sesame seeds, fried chow mein noodles (the type that sometimes gets added to salads) covered in some sauce and a vegetarian eggroll. The soup was good...it seemed like some twist on an egg drop soup.

I ordered the chicken thai curry, one guy got the double fried lamb and the last guy got a vegetarian meatball looking dish. The curry lacked flavor and had an odd consistency. I could smell the coconut and taste a little coconut but that was about all I really tasted. The lamb was really good though. A bit too spicy for my liking (sriracha is spicy for me if that's any reference). I didn't want to try the vegetarian meatballs but my coworker hated it. 

Next time, I'd rather go to their sister restaurant next door (India House) for way better food!

Zabihah Halal

Obviously there is controversy as to wether Bombay chopstick serves Zabihah or not. I spoke to the Manager myself and they confirmed it, plus it's written all over the menus. Now I understand we all believe in different school of thoughts so it's okay to play it safe. If not for the meat go to Bombay Chopsticks for seafood, it's great! 

Seafood: 
For Starters

Changs King Shrimp (highly recommend)

Main course:

Chilli Fry Fish (It will melt in your mouth)
Spicy Szechuan Hakka Noodles with 
Shrimp (try it with mix of the Green chutney & hint of vinegar)

Meat Lovers:
For Starters

Chicken Meatballs

Main course:

Changs King Chicken (ask for extra veggies)
Spicy Szechuan Hakka Noodles with Chicken 
Chilli Fry fish (Bare in mind I am not a huge seafood fan but this stuff is full of delicious Masalas, so give it a try)

Tip: Refrain from curries. I have tried just about all & they were disappointing. 1/2 star off for this. The dry items here are so much better. 

The place loses another 1/2 star  due to the lack of attention from our server during my last visit. We were a big group but a restaurant running at this scale should be able to accommodate all their guest. 

May seem pricey at first but the portions make up for it. Love the ambience. Bombay Chopsticks has become our go to place for special family occasions. It also has great options for the more strict Zabihah eaters in our family.

Skip the dining room and order take out.

4 stars for the food. It's excellent, but it's overpriced. So it loses a star.

0 stars for the service. It's miles away from what I expect from a restaurant charging $15-20 for an entree. Beware of the 18% gratuity added to bills of 5 or more guests. You'll wish you could tip much less!

2 stars for ambience. It's so cramped that you lose appreciation for the otherwise nice decor. There's a good chance that your chair will be backed right up against another patron...literally! It's ridiculous and awkward. I've never seen anything like it. Again, not what I'd expect at this price range.

I'll NEVER go back. I left annoyed and wished I went somewhere else.

I love ur food and I have ordered multiple times from you guys and I gave you guys a 5 star rating last time but this time was so so horrible !! I ordered food at 8:45 pm and its 10:45 we still haven't got the food ! The last did call but it's just so so horrible to wait 2 hours for ur food ! What's the point of eating at 11 pm ? I'm so so disappointed it would have been better you would have cancelled our order rather than make us wait so long ! I'm not coming over again I'm so sad about this ! It's not worth the wait ! Not coming back Bombay chopsticks I'm so disappointed :(

the best indo chinese food in the chicago-land we went there at lunch time we wanted to order for lunch special but manager told us as we are big group better order from menu so we can share but it took them long  to serve even drinks we ordered took long for lunch they are not ready for big group they dont have enough cooks or chefs any way i was very disappointed once before i went there for lunch i ordered lunch special very good never go for lunch to order from menu.

We came for lunch. Ordered for Peking Chicken, Mixed Veggies in Hot Garlic and Vegetable Fried Rice.
Food was good. Tastefully prepared. Gives you the Indo-Chinese feel you want.
The server was very polite and friendly. Service was excellent.
Ambience is really nice. Perfect for the image they're trying to sell. The music is also good.
Price is very reasonable. Bill was just 25 bucks for the two of us.
Overall good. Definitely worth visiting.

I have been here many times. This place never disappoints me. It is a bit crowded most of the times but food comes fast. My favorite is chicken garlic noodles with Singapore chicken. Really good. I would recommend this to everyone.

Beautiful ambiance, but one of the worst Thai food I've tasted. I don't know if I just ordered wrong, but their green curry is tasteless (and neon green), and the pad Thai tasted nothing like pad Thai. Only upside is that the serving is big.

I came to this restaurant on a busy Saturday evening with friends. The restaurant itself is dimly lit and quite beautiful. It's nicely decorated and has an area where you can look into the kitchen and watch the food being prepared.
The food was very good. We got the chicken satay, assorted soups, I got the lemon coriander with chicken- it's tangy and spicy with a clear broth it pretty good my friends got the sweet corn and I tried some it was too sweet for my tastes.  We got for the main course: jumbo kung poa shrimp- spicy and good served with a thick gravy orange chicken- not sweet and if you get a pepper watch out! very spicy it. We felt the chicken was coated with too much breading and that there wasn't enough chicken to being with. The flavor was still good though. and finally a mixed noodle dish that was just so -so nothing to write home about.
The service was very nice but they were very busy so it just took a bit longer to get things going. 
The seating was a little uncomfortable, it's very close quarters at least where we were seated and you could hear other people it was pretty unpleasant. Also in silverwear they only give you a spoon, fork, and chop sticks. There were a lot of items that needed to be cut but you don't get a butter knife so I found this annoying.  Also the water is served room temp. We had to constantly ask our waiter for ice, it would be nice if they would ask you if you wanted ice or not instead of assuming that you did not.
Finally, on a price point it's not cheap, ~$16 per dish. All in all I think it's a neat idea, especially if you have someone who is only interested in indian food but you want them to try something different.

Elegant ambiance! I absolutely dislike coming to this place except for the fact that they have a nice ambience. Their food is pricey which I do not care if the quality of the food was good. The portion size it good because 1 entree can feed 2-3 people BUT quality is terrible. I have been here twice. Got disappointed the first time so I decided to try it again, but it is still terrible so I am not going back. 
Service is bad when it gets busy. Fancy ambiance if you want to walk in, see the place and walk out... which I highly recommend doing unless you want a bad dining experience. The booth is so tiny and the tables are so little that you should be ready to juggle your plates and practice on efficient use of space during your dinner. They have a nice looking bar but I have not tried any of the drinks to give feedback on. Overall recommendation... not recommending this place.

The only thing consistent about this place is the bad service!

I've been here plenty of times over the years in the hopes that it would be as good as the ONE time it actually was. 

I've gone from hopeful to disappointed to actually enraged. My two biggest problems is that everything is overpriced and that they don't know how to season chicken. 

My last time there, they had a shortened menu with about 1/4 of what they typically offer and the food was still horrible. 

Save yourself the misery and go to Hakka Wok or Chef Ping instead.

First off...it's halal. The interior was lovely and tasteful...i wasn't expecting this from a restaurant in a strip mall...that too an Indian one (Devon isn't know for it's decor ideas =P) 

The food was good...we ordered the hot and sour soup, spring rolls, Kung Pao chicken, and i think also the chilli chicken. Everything was good...the Kung Pao chicken was exceptionally good...loved it. But the noddles were too thin and a little too oily. The soup was good...overall a good experience. It's too far out from where i live...we just like to try halal places, so i won't be making that long of a trip again. If ur in the area...def try it out.

We go to Bombay Chopsticks whenever my extended family is together. The staff are all friendly and for the most part, they know the menu really well. They are able to handle large groups pretty well it seems   

Their executive chef is from India, where indo Chinese originated. The taste of their food is how indian Chinese is done in Mumbai and delhi.  

My parents are huge fans of their golden fried baby corn. They have a lot of vegetarian options but also do non veg well. We always get chicken lollypops!

Something to try if you think Chinese food is a bit bland. The ambiance is also beautiful.

One of my most recent discoveries.  I ate here for the first time this week.  Then I also ate here for the second time this week.  I have passed by this place for a few years when I would visit Tiger Direct across the street.  The place always looked to have a good size crowd.  I wasn't sure if this was Indian food or Chinese food.  I have never ate Indian food so I always decided against eating here.  

Finally one day I saw their billboard on I-90 & decided I should give it a try.  My friend & I came here during lunch hour on one of the coldest days of the year.  I soon found out that it was mainly Chinese food with an Indian twist.  I was not disappointed.  

The lunch specials come with appetizers & entrees for around $9.50 - $10.50.  I ordered the chicken in szechuan sauce & requested it extra spicy.  My friend ordered a vegetarian dish.  He also asked if their noodles in that vegetarian dish were made from egg because he was fasting from dairy & they told him that they weren't so it worked out for him.  

For appetizers they told us we had a choice of soup either chicken or vegetable.  We ordered the vegetable soup.  It came out with an egg roll another side which I wasn't sure what it was because it was small & a side of what looked like cabbage in sweet & Sour sauce.  The soup was awesome, I really liked it.  The cabbage in sweet & Sour sauce along with the other side that I wasn't sure what is was tasted phenomenal.  

I was very impressed with the appetizers.  Next the entrees came out.  At first I though the portion looked small but I soon found out it wasn't.  It probably just looked like that because of the bowl it was in.  I could only eat half of the entree because I was so full.  The chicken in szechuan sauce & white rice was also excellent.  

My experience here was very good & it was refreshing to find a new restaurant that I really enjoyed.  I enjoyed this place so much that I came back the next day again for lunch.  I will definitely be eating here again.

The reviews do this place justice. It was the definition of okay. Expensive for what they serve, considering I don't think anything was that special. Better way to put it is I know my mom could make anything that was there very easily. I think that matters. 

The chili chicken was okay, almost too much sauce IMO. The chicken was pretty flavorless without the sauce and vegetables. Same with the paneer, was expecting that to be better. The best dish we had was the crispy shredded beef. That portion was hugeeee. I really like the texture and it had the most unique flavor. We also had the noodles, which were nothing special. I liked the sweet and sour soup with chicken. Egg rolls were okay. 

My mom and sister loveeee this place. And it was very busy. But I wouldn't go back on my own. I prefer just good old Indian food.

5 stars for the decor and appetizers. The chicken drumsticks and schezwan chicken were delicious. I also had the tipsy mango lassi which was perfect. However none of our entrees were that good. Kungpao chicken was especially bad. Chilli garlic noodles were good. Fried rice not so much. Will go back on one of those days when all u want is a cocktail or two and and an appetizer.

Overrated and over priced. Long waits. Most of their dishes are just cornstarch and nothing else, especially the soups taste like water added to cornstarch. I used to like their louts roots but they took that off the menu anyway.

What an overpriced, over hyped restaurant! We went there expecting GOOD Hakka food and it turned out to be such a let down. The place is really nice and decorated well with dim lighting. We were instantly excited but it was short lived upon seeing the menu prices! Extremely over priced dishes, like for 1 sea food dish you'll be paying 20 bucks!!! Ridiculous! Anyhow, we ordered chicken manchurian, chicken fried noodles, chicken drumsticks (only decent thing but was mostly bones, no meat!), and hot and sour soup. Chicken manchurian looked like soup with floating chicken pieces, the sauce itself was tasteless. Noodles weren't anything special, I found myself adding the side sauces to every dish for flavor. Soup was nothing noteworthy. We barely ate much and left the place with empty stomachs and aching wallets. The service was really good and our server actually gave two my friends free soup when I only ordered it for myself. But based on their prices and food quality I will never go there again.

Love this place. In fact I'm here while writing this because I keep forgetting to write them a review! 

I drive from Melrose Park to eat here and if you know anything about that area I have MANY choices for Mexican food but I still choose this place!

Only a short 3 minute drive from my work, this is my go to place when I want tacos for lunch. 
I've ordered ahead which is always a good idea because they can get pretty crazy during lunch hour. 
The lady at the counter always has a smile on her face and the restaurant is very clean. Not many tables but you can take it to go. 
I've only had the tacos and they were very good. Not the best but very good and for a decent price. 
One day I will try one of their dinners, I've seen what others were eating while I waited and everything looked delicious.

The shredded chicken tacos and guac are always fresh and delicious. Just say yes to everything when you visit. And, grab a side of salsa and chips to go. 

I was introduced this place by my former preceptor 4 years ago. I had withdrawals after my rotation was complete. As fate would have it, I started a job 10 minutes away and I eat here, at minimum, once weekly.

They make their own sauces and the salsa and green avocado sauce are both surprisingly good. The salsa is sneaky with the heat. What a find, did not know this was here, will definitely be back to explore more of the menu. Just stopped in for some quick nachos and a magarita. The nachos were OK, but add the green avocado sauce and it takes them to the next level. The margarita was good and hit the spot.

It seemed like there weren't many people inside waiting, but we waited almost 20 minutes for our order to be taken and then another 30 for food. There were a lot of take outs, but we waited so long inside! The food was okay, no complaints. Please take into account your customers in the restaurant. We thought it was going to be a quick sit down meal, but we were there for almost over an hour. Maybe will try again.
