Best salsa I've had in a while. Prices are good and so were my tacos - barbacoa and chile relleno.

Would recommend and would come back again. Is a longer drive than more expensive places closer to my house, but its worth it.

Miguel and his friendly staff make you feel like family the minute you walk in! We live right around the corner and made fast friends with then when they first opened. The food is wonderful and they take time to make things from scratch! When we want to get a great, traditional Mexican meal, we come to Mi Restaurant! :)

I love this place!  Staff is friendly. They have the best authentic Mexican food in the area. I love their steak tacos!  Outdoor seating is quite pleasant and there salsa rocks!!  I am definitely a salsa expert and Mi's is better than most. I go here at least once a week and they are great for a quick lunch break.

A real Mexican gem. We've been there a couple of times and I really love the tacos. The salsa is outstanding and the guacamole was good. The red hot space is very hot but flavorful. The carne asada and fish tacos are outstanding. If you like simple street tacos this is the place, very friendly staff and inexpensive. Try it soon.

Having bypassed this restaurant several times while browsing through Yelp for dinner options over the past several months, I was eager to finally give it a try by placing a pick up order.  My mind was set on the carne en su jugo (a soup), enchiladas for my daughter, and pastor tacos for my husband. Before my husband called to place our order, I was having second thoughts about this place, but quickly brushed off the doubts. I should have followed my intuition, especially after it kept tugging at me while my husband placed the order. Please note, my soup dish comes with avocado automatically, so no need to ask for it. Order placed. Next, enchiladas generously portioned at 4 per entr√©e. We requested half to be topped with red sauce and the other half with green. No can do implied the lady taking the order. Okay, we didn't ask why, nor was a reason provided. No problem, let's cooperate and sure, the green sauce is fine on the side. Next order are the tacos, and we'd like to add avocado. No, can't do that either. Oh by the way, there is no cheese for the enchiladas tonight.  Seriously?  The lady then said that we can put sour cream on top.  I surprised myself for keeping my frustration under control as I listened to this discussion.  Thinking about it... "okay, no problem about the cheese", says my daughter. But wait, no avocado?  We know to expect an extra charge, so my husband probes for an explanation. No avocado tonight. No cheese, no avocado at a Mexican restaurant?  We should have stopped there, but I wanted to know why the lady did not mention that they did not have avocado when it's an automatic part of my dish, which we ordered first.  My husband relays the question to the lady and he was told that I would get the avocado, but he would not. Apparently, they didn't have enough for extra orders, but momentarily after that, the lady told us that someone was coming in (from the store we assume) with cheese and avocado. Lucky for us we thought, so we dismissed the entire incident, and proceeded with the order.  I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately, the food was not good.  The soup was very salty, at least for my taste. My daughter could only finish a couple of her enchiladas, because the ground beef filling was dry and tasteless, and the sauce was too spicy (and we do like heat).  My husband only finished one of the three tacos, because the pork was a little too sweet and it did not taste fresh.  This is the first time that we all stopped eating halfway through our meals.  I wish I could say that it was just an off night for us and we will give it another try.  But, my intuition is telling me otherwise, and this time, I'm going to trust what I'm feeling.
Great little place to get Mexican food in the Northwest burbs.   This place has become our go to spot for a nice take on Friday night.

The best al pastor tacos and delicious sopes. Stay away from the red sauce, since it's on fire! Quick service and it was definitely a great first experience, so I'll be back for more authentic Mexican food.
Very good service!  Small and clean.  Steak torta and tacos were decent.  Meat can use a little more flavor/seasoning.  Would visit again!

Small corner diner. Nice ambiance. Server was pleasant, but tables were slow to be cleaned, and food took forever to arrive. Rice was overcooked, beans were bland. Chile relleno tacos were bland and nothing more than small pepper, rice and cilantro.  Don't think I'll be back, even though it is across street from work.
Great little hidden gem. Always crowded and always tasty. Friendly folks who work very hard in providing quality service and awesome Mexican food!

I know what it feels like to crave real Mexican food and feel disappointed afterwards because it wasn't what you expected. I've ate here a few time with friends and it's one of the best authentic Mexican food you'll have.

I noticed they have carne en su jugo, so I took some home. This is a well-regarded soup/stew type dish that is certainly a rarity in these parts. But I was disappointed. There was lots of chopped up beef and some bacon, and for me it was all too fatty. I ended up taking all the beef and bacon out, The half or third that was left was very nice. Good broth. But not worth 10 bucks for what I ended up with. If you don't care about this issue, then you will probably be very happy with this dish...

Came in for takeout before an evening meeting. The place was empty although it was during rush hour so maybe too early to tell.

I have to say, the food was not great. The al pastor was somehow both greasy AND dry. The beans had very little flavor, I had to salt them to make them palatable. My girls ate the rice though and my older one liked her carne asada well enough. 

If the other reviewers are right, it sounds like there's been a management or ownership change and the food has gone downhill. Maybe it was just the night I went though. For their sake, lets hope so. I'd really like to have a good Mexican place close to home. I'd recommend going to Las Asadas over by the original McDonald's for really great food, even if it's a divey atmosphere.

I've been coming here since it opened never had a problem until today. Seems management has changed or recipes have been downgraded. I always get the carne asada dinner and it's always good. They have since cut down the size of their steak in half, also guacamole no longer is included (even though the menu still lists it as part of the $12 dinner). The server was not busy but still delayed in bringing basic things like a lime for our beers or napkins! Then my friend orders a vegetarian torta and gets a bread with lettuce and two think slices of tomato! My girlfriend walked out and waited in the car when I asked for the check, they took 20 minutes to bring us a check. I'm really disappointed as this was the place my gf an I came to when we wanted decent Mexican food. 
Now I have to find a different spot. ;(

Hidden gem. Best Mexican restaurant in the Northwest suburbs, handsdown in our family's opinion. I'm boring and can't help but order the chicken tacos over and over again.  Just something about the way they cook the chicken in this red sauce that makes it taste oh so good. My husband gets everything from the steak fajitas to this steak soup. We also buy a lot of the mango soda. We take out from Mi Restaurant at least weekly!
Nice little clean spot but the food is great! Tacos are meaty and tasty. They also serve beer so that is great!

Moved to Mount Prospect not too long ago & we love Mexican food!  So looked around & found this place that was close by.  Man are we happy we did because the food there is GOOD!  Tacos, quesadilla, tortas, tostadas, & I mean everything we've tried has been pretty good.  If you like spicy than they have the best red sauce around & its SPICY.  Got 3 stars because sometimes the staff there can be not attentive & have to wait around for things you might want longer than you want?  Also, when you call for carry out for some weird reason if you call after 8 pm & I mean even 5 mins after...they tell you they are closed @ 8 tonight?  But the hours say they close @ 9 pm??? Not sure what's going on there, they might have to update their hours...but even with all that we still go there to enjoy the delicious food!

My husband and I moved to Mt. Prospect in September.  We have been looking for a good Mexican restaurant ever since.  Spotted this place a couple of times and finally decided to try there.  Are we glad we did.  Food is excellent, traditional, authentic Mexican food.  Very clean and friendly staff.  This is definitely our "go to" Mexican restaurant.  They even have an outdoor venue albeit small, but we are looking forward to warmer weather and sitting outside to enjoy their wonderful cuisine.

This quaint, Mexican restaurant serves authentic and quality food. I've been here twice in 1 week because it's that good. They do have awesome specials, but I chose my platters based on the pictures I saw in the menu. Everything looks and sounds so delicious. The first time I came here, I ordered #5. It was the Tampiquena dish, which consisted of: beans, rice, steak, guacamole, enchilada, and homemade corn/flour tortillas garnished with 2 jalape√±os, tomato, lettuce, cucumbers, and orange slices. Two days later, I had the #3 dish which was just as tasty. Came with the same items as above, but no enchilada and the steak was much thinner. They do serve you freshly baked tortilla chips with a spicy, green salsa and 2 condiment containers of hot sauce once you're seated. The guacamole and chips dish was also fantastic. You can definitely tell it was made fresh and the cilantro is a nice touch to the dish. 

The employees are very friendly and accommodating. Once you enter, you can seat yourself and the waitress greets you with menus. Our waitress was able to split our bill 4 ways even though we forgot to tell her we wanted individual checks prior to our meal. 

The space is comfortable and clean. They play Spanish music in the background, which makes the experience great. Bathrooms are clean and well kept. 

Overall, this restaurant is a hidden gem in the northwest suburbs and I'm glad they are close by. I'd definitely frequent this place a couple of times a month or even more! I'd give this place 100 stars if I could.

Decent cheap mexican fare.

Great service!

Nice for lunch.

I've eaten here one and half times. Once the food was good for a Mexican suburb restaurant , so when I was craving Mexican again I decided to go back. Big mistake. I ordered cheese enchiladas, and my husband ordered carne Asada. When I brought the carry out home mine was filled with meat , he had barely any meat and no tortillas. I called to let them know and lady who answered the phone stated bring the entire order back because I accidentally placed someone else's guacamole order in your bag. There was no guacamole in my bag . I brought the bag back . Without the guacamole (I never seen this guacamole) she kept insisting I had the guacamole " I placed it in your bag , my cook saw me" on and on . I was so frustrated I asked for a refund . I DIDNT STEAL GUACAMOLE . Overall the food is decent , small portions, horrible customer service. We went the the Mexican grocery store down the road and had better food, larger portions and way better customer service

I too (like the other reviewer), found this place by accident. But I'm glad I did.

  Clean restaurant. Friendly staff. Good quality. Good taste. Low price's. Quiet atmosphere.

  Need I say more? Probably not. But sO will say: I'll be back :)
Always great food, usually go at least once a week.

I have been going to this place for 10 or more years. It's really the only good taqueria in Mt. Prospect. Is it the best in the area? Maybe not but it is consistantly tasty, friendlier than many and quite clean. A little tacky but the food is why I go. 

I will not order at a taqueria that does not offer lingua, which makes up the worlds best taco (IMHO. This is a sign of authenticity for me. And it can be done badly, but not here. Always delicious, tender and juicy.

My standard order in a taco stand like this is a chorizo burrito w/o rice + extra letttuce and 2 lingua tacos. It is always done just right at this place.

The name has changed from time to time and it was closed for at least six months last year; but has reopened with the same great quality and service.

Best Mexican restaurant in the northwest suburbs, it's a bit small but the food is amazing. I always order the barbacoa taco dinner and it never fails to amaze me. Very authentic mexican food, plus the waitresses there are always fast and friendly.

My parents told me about this place so we decided to try it out. I am soo glad we did! The chips and salsa are pretty good. The salsa was pretty spicy. We ordered 4 steak tacos, steak burrito, and a torta de milanesa.  None of then disappointed!  We will be back again. 
They have $1 tacos on Sunday!
Great tacos, good burritos , would like to see a bigger burrito offered.

I love this place! Is it fancy? No. It's a tiny little place with maybe 8 tables or so. Plastic covered tablecloths over pretty fabric. Very clean. Never sticky. The 2nd time I was here, I was recognized as a regular. To me that means a lot. Ive never had anything here but delicious food at ridiculously low prices. The chicken tacos and burritos are always moist and quite flavorful, but I'm getting ahead of myself here. When you sit down, you get a basket of tortilla chips and 3 kinds of sauces. It's all good. My kids and I can finish off a basket in just a few minutes. My boys love that they can get a Jarritos. They even have it in grapefruit! I've never seen that. The waitress/cashier is friendly, helpful, and sweet. She always refills my water with a smile. I've tried many things here. I have never been disappointed. They deliver top notch food at prices I can afford (less than $20 for me and 2 teen age sons). And they do have tacos for $1 on Sundays. Indeed, there is a special everyday.

I have had a hard time finding GOOD AUTHENTIC Mexican food in the NW burbs.  You can find authentic, but the quality is sub-par.  Just down the street from our house, this new place opened a few days ago.  I'm a big supporter of local business, so I had to check it out.

The restaurant has nice improvements compared to the restaurant that was there before.  Better than the scenery is the food!  QUALITY, AUTHENTIC Mexican food, at last!  We had an asada (steak) burrito and an asada taco dinner.  The steak has a very tasty, well charred taste.  Unlike the other restaurants in the vicinity (El Famous Burrito for one) the asada is not overly fatty, not salty, and not greasy.  I was impressed on the first bite!  The portions are plenty.  The price was surprisingly cheap too!  3 steak taco dinner, rice and beans for $5.99.  Steak burrito with plenty of meat for $5.50!  Size up to that Chipotle!

The staff were polite, young, and energetic.  The menu is also authentic, en espanol!  If you can't read spanish, the staff were ready to explain everything.  

Only negative comment is the menu is a bit small right now, but for a restaurant only open for 5 days, I'd give them a break.

Bottom line -- every bite we took was delicious and we will be going back soon!

The food the very good, all freshly made, not frozen. The stuff peppers (chiles rellenos) are awesome, tastes just like my mom use to make 30 years ago!

Price is very affordable, the staff is very friendly.

The only thing I didn't like is the "TIPS are Welcome" jar by the cash register. If they aren't paying the employees good, then raise the prices and remove the jar. I never seen that in other area restaurants, including the ones in the same strip mall.

We have been looking for a good area Mexican carryout place for a while now, and with MI we have found what we've been looking for.  We have been by this place so many times without walking in -- what a mistake on our part.  

While this place is not much to look at, the food is great.  It easily meets and exceeds the quality of Mexican food in other restaurants where you might pay twice as much.  It is not "fast food" for sure, so if you're looking for a rush in rush out, this is not the place.  But if you're looking for quick, fresh, quality Mexican food at a great price, definitely try this place out!  We will definitely be regulars.

OMG!!!!!!! Kinda found this place by accident, but I am so glad we did! The food here is so authentic and so delicious that its ridiculous. It tastes like you're in mexico, its that good.

we were a party of 4. we had the nacho appetizers. bistec a la tampiquena, lomo quesadillas, and the carne asada. all of the food was full of flavor and as fresh as you could get. the service is also great, very friendly.

i truly recommend this place, you won't be disappointed. it made my day.
Clean, friendly, fresh and dull.  Good hand made tortillas.  Bland beans, rice, chicken milanesa.  Very, very expensive for the portions.

I love Mexican food & this little hole-in-the-wall is well worth the price & time!! Don't be fooled by the sad looking sign....this place is so so awesome...really authentic, the waitstaff are really nice & always help me pick things out for my PICKY eater 6yr old. I've been here for the lunch specials, which I LOVE their burritos, and I've been for dinner...I love their rice, it always is fresh, and I mean, never clumpy, dumpy stuff, it's some good Mexican rice!! The meals, are always a good portion, I never leave hungry & the salsas are a really nice flavor. The meat, is always so tasty, the chicken is shredded to perfection and moist & the beef doesn't have that fatty- taste to it you sometimes get with small places like this. The hand-made tortillas are a nice touch as well, holds up & doesn't break apart when ordering tacos.
hand made tortillas? no one in the area does that. theyre amazing and i highly recommend trying this place. you will not regret it.
Great authentic mexican food!!! Chicken burrito seasoned to perfection!!!

This place is awesome!   I can't even say enough about the food.   I typically order a meal with chicken and I have had both the quesadillas and the enchiladas (green) - both were FANTASTIC.   It is a great little restaurant with very friendly people and the food is delicious!!

My wife and I ordered Mi Ristorante for take out recently.  We just moved to Mount Prospect from Chicago and were in desperate need for Mexican food.  I ordered a chicken burrito and it was delicious.  The chicken tasted fresh and was not "suspect," like the chicken at so many other Mexican eateries.  The guacamole was also delicious, but you had better like cilantro if you order this guacamole.  I think cilantro may have been in greater abundance than avocado on the ingredients list.  

As delicious as my food was, I am only giving Mi Ristorante 4 stars, as I am pretty sure it caused my diarrhea that night.  I will totally still order from Mi Ristorante again because getting Mexican takeout already assumes a decent probability that diarrhea will occur.  It is always a gamble, and the house usually has an edge.

Do NOT eat here! The food was awful! I ordered chicken fajitas and the chicken was dry and cold, in fact all that should have been hot was cold. 
The person I went with ordered the skirt steak and she said it was like chewing leather. This is the worse Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. Not to mention (but I will) where we were sitting (the area is very small and tight) you could see under the "curtain" type drape thing they used instead of a door to separate the kitchen from the dining area. On the floor in the kitchen there were many large plastic cups half filled with liquid ?? pop?? water?? who knows! And the floor was disgusting! 
Unfortunately I waisted my money, time and tummy space on this place. MY BAD for not reading reviews before going here. The only thing that made me come was a coupon I had. Ohh..just another tid bit of info... the gal I was with ended up with diarrhea. Now isn't that crappy! No pun intended.  Ohh...and the homemade guacamole was real bad!  I'm not mexican and I make great guacamole-not rocket science!  They added way too much salt and way too much cilantro.  I just can't say a good word about this place!!

Ordered a steak burrito w/ beans, cheese and sour cream.
Received a steak burrito with cheese.
There was a buzz about this place at work and I was in the mood for a burrito so I decided to try it and it didn't hit the spot.

The steak was juicy but under seasoned and the fact they forgot to put on two toppings  was a bummer.  The red and green sauce were average.

I was quoted 15 minutes for my meal to be ready and it took 25 minutes so I waited for 10 minutes which eats into the half hour lunch I get.  There was only one chef and one waitress/counter person so it was pretty hectic in there.  I'd try Mi Restaurant one more time but overall a forgettable and dissapointing meal.
Frisco grillcheese with milkshake and fries is absolutely best combo ever!! (Other burgers are just ok in my opinion.

I don't really eat at fast food place, but oh well, we were hungry and wanted a quick bite. I stopped by here for lunch, and there weren't a lot in the menu. None of the sandwich/burgers looked interesting to me. Boo. Their fries and shake are always the best part though.

This place is tucked inside a oasis of restaurants, so it's somewhat easy to miss off of Higgins Rd. There's not a lot of these in the area, and I've been to a nearby church for years, and didn't realize there was one so close to take my lil monsters too. So this was a nice pleasant surprise when I found this place. Service was excellent and they got our order quick and accurate. If you've never been to a Steak N Shake before, milk shakes are what makes Steak N Shake shine, IMHO. You can mix and match different shake flavors and top em off with candy such as M&Ms. Overall, a great place to take kids during the weekend because kids eat free with every adult order. Score, for this cheap bastard!

BATHROOM REVIEW: the men's has one urinal and steal. The stall was somewhat rickety, but I guess it gets the job done. A little grimy, but then again, Steak N Shake is a place opened 24/7. Sit or squat? Squat.

Five Stars for being open on Christmas Eve- very few places of any sort were open- but, Steak ' n Shake was, so kudos for that-. 3 Stars for the food and service.

I had an Egg Nog Milk Shake in the spirit of the season- That was excellent- Had a cup of chili ..god awful, seemed like it came right out of a can, just a bowl of muck.  Had a triple with cheese, I didn't want french fries- but our waitress sent them along anyway- I had a few, they were greasy, thin, tasteless and what I expected, and why I didn't order them to begin with- I think I was charged for them, but the whole triple with fries was still less than 5 bucks, so who cares?  

Our waitress was young, and she tried real hard, but I don't think she has a future as a waitress, I asked for the chili, first, before the burger...that was reversed..As it turns out, as mentioned before, the chili was so bad, it didn't matter, only ate half of it.  I also had to ask her a 2nd time after the food arrived, for my milk shake.

The burger was just average at best.  I think for burgers and fries, along the same line- Culver's blows away S n S 

A table across the way, sent their order back.  I don't think I will be rushing back to Steak n Shake for sit down service, they have an excellent drive thru, most locations and the half price milk shake offer 2-5 can't be beat!

Breakfast only review: I love this place for breakfast.  It is my go to when I am in the mood for greasy, bad for me morning food.  And, it's super cheap.  I also like that I can get a sandwich with just egg and cheese and not pay for the meat I'm not getting.  My son and I both eat for under $10 (including tip).  My service has always been really good too!  The reason it is down one star is because their coffee is so bad it's not even drinkable.  
Between you and me, I also frequent their drive through in my pajamas in the mornings.

Although the fries are basic, the chicken fingers are not. You have to try them. I also get the Peanut butter cup or the Oreo's cookies 'n cream specialty milkshake. By the way, this location is open 24/7
We ordered 4 milkshakes and one order of Cajun fries. We got 3 straws 3 freaking straws  we were 4 people we had to share with each other. Like wtf soo pissed

Had a late night craving for a milk shake. Love that these guys are about a block away and open 24 hrs.  Here's a tip though.

If you're working late, don't get a giant milkshake and 5-way Chili at 11pm. Ugh. #myownfault

What's not to love? Prices are great. Hours are awesome. They have the best shake combinations. Service is okay for what you pay. There is always a parking space. Great for a date, Father's Day, Easter. I mean this place is a no brainier and there is always something for all ... Even the picky eater. Please try the Nutella shake.

Not great. ..but passable fare. 
It's what one would expect if they paid 4.99 for a meal.   The burgers are cooked within an inch of their life and the shakes are hit and miss. ..I'd  go for a less frilly one,  like chocolate or vanilla. ..the others that I've tried can frustrate you trying to pull content from your straw due to the lack of mixing and sizable chunks as a result there of. 

The fries are worth mentioning.  Pretty good.  Service inside,  again. ..hit and miss.. 

Better food than McDonald's.

I do like the food however they could do so much better with the bathroom cleanliness it always smells so bad in there whatever they're using to clean it might be a dirty mop but it really reeks they need to work on the cleanliness of the establishment the food is good

You go for the shakes and the cheap (greasy) food. You don't go for the service, ambiance, cleanliness, nor quiet time.  Don't get me wrong, I'm a sucker for a dark chocolate fudge shake, but I don't like sitting on chairs that remind me of airport bathrooms while being served by a bratty 15 year old.

I came here on a Friday evening just to pick up some milkshakes...and apparently it is the to-go place for high school kids...

Drinks/Food:
Strawberry milkshake (~$3-4) - very VERY VERY sweet, kinda like blended ice cream so that you don't need to chew your ice cream.. instead.. you can slurp it.. :)
**it's been awhile since i've eaten here.. the food is just a-ok, but cheap...

Milkshakes in general are all really really sweet.. so don't come here unless you have a sweet tooth! (I think they have discounted milkshake prices starting at 2AM or something...if you would rather be drinking a milkshake then sleeping.. or you can drink your milkshake while you sleep (for those always hungry ppl)

Costs: 
Classic milkshakes are cheaper than the special milkshakes (ex: s'more milkshake or something)..ranges from $4+ for a decent portion..more than enough sugar/calories than you may need in one day...and the food food costs are reasonable...

Atmosphere: you will see HS kids.. and some families...

The best one I have been to by far. We were seated quickly and the food was better than at all the other locations we tried. They even wrapped my burger in lettuce for me. The only downfall was we were never asked or given drink refills til we were ready to check out.

This is a great, family friendly resteraunt! Friendly environment, cheap and good food, and amazingly friendly servers. Ive never had a mis-order and the shakes are spectacular! Overall, a great place to eat dinner.... Definitely worth the time! Oreo Cookies and Cream is my favorite shake, and the chicken tenders are stellar. The burgers have a unique grilling style, making them wonderful and original!

Stop on by!

Friendly service. Opened 24 hours. Love the milkshakes, they have a little more variety than other outlets of franchise I have been. But really cool. If you like spicy stuff then - Spicy Chicken sandwich and Jalapeno Crunch Chicken Sandwich is a must try.

Ate there with my wife leaving St Alexis hospital and experienced the worst hamburger I have ever had in my life!  Left a puke after-taste in my mouth for hours.  Was absolutely horrible.  McDonald's (which I never touch) would be 5 stars in comparison to this cap burger!  Never again!!!

Me and my bf go here quite a bit i always get my favorite frisco melt meal. And he gets something off the 4.99 menu and we always have had great fast service. The people working are always pleasant and very knowledgeable about there food. And the shakes are also very good. So i 100% recommend this place if your looking for a great meal.

Restaurant Review
I can find the shake, but where's the steak! The whole concept of premium steak in my burger was novel back 5 years ago before premium angus burgers started to hit the menu at McD. I use to crave coming to steak and shake to eat there steak burgers and always would leave wondering why my experience is so so. Most likely because the steak burgers themselves are very thin minced up patties of unrecognizable beef with a super lightweight burger bun. The pictures sell you on the most wonderful burger but really the burger itself is worse than McD. I would always get the burger dinner combo which is not on the menu and comes with 2 sides. I ended up getting onion rings which were over fried that the rings themselves look dark brown and shoe string fries that tasted off. Maybe it is something with the oil. Now there is ONE positive and that would be the wonderful milk shakes at steak n shake. I can't say I have ever had a bad milk shake here. The double chocolate fudge was perfect with rich chocolate milk shake and fudge throughout. I should just come here for the milk shakes!

Pro- best milk shakes in the world! friendly service

Con- terrible burgers, sides.....

Hidden deal- Check out your weekly newspaper ads for coupon to save on combo meals and the dinner combo w/ milk shake which is not on the menu. Just order with the server and indicate you have the coupon for that meal
Great service and the food was great as well, got our seat fast and the food came shortly after

Soooo good, even considering the usual stomach issues that typically occur after consuming a meal here.  But Peter B. is right, this Steak n Shake (as most) does seem to attract a really odd collection of patrons.  High school kids, hometown people back for the holidays (AKA me), and random old people that probably go there every day for the early bird.

My absolute favorite is the Frisco Melt.  I can't even begin to really describe it properly - I drool just thinking about it.  Steakburger with "Thousand Island dressing" (it doesn't really taste like Thousand Island - it's BETTER), and a big layer of melted cheese.  It's an orgasm between two slices of bread.  I also like their shoestring fries, and of course, the requisite shake (made with real milk and ice cream).

I've never had a problem with service here.  The servers do look like they're annoyed when there's a particularly large group of people, but I'm sure I would be annoyed too.  After your meal, don't sit around waiting for your server to take your money - you pay for your check up at the counter.  Num num, definitely an old standby when I go back home!
Burgers and shakes have always been good for fast food place, service is quick, good side options except the fries are not very good, -1 star for sucky fries.

I haven't been to Steak 'N Shake in about a year, but I was here recently and had a good experience.  I ordered one of the specialty burgers -- the Guacamole Steak Burger.  I can't say enough about this burger... it was DELICIOUS.  All the included condiments were SPOT ON.  There was a little bit of lingering spiciness in each bite.  Not sure if this was from the pepper jack cheese or the guac (maybe both?), but it was just the right level of spice to push what would probably be a standard burger up a notch.  The red onion was the clincher for me.  I love onions, and had they used white onions instead of red, it would have ruined the burger.

I noticed on the menu that they are also featuring a guacamole hot dog.  I'll have to try this next time.

Without a doubt, I would go back again for another guacamole steak burger.  YUM!

Went here late night in March. March 26th to be exact. The server walked us to a table and tried to seat us at a table that had 3 dirty plates and 3 empty used cups. Obviously the server was not going to sit us there so she sat us at another table. We ordered our drinks and our food at the same time. As time passed, 5 mins or so I finished my drink and waited for another refill. That took about another 10 mins. Steak n Shake had maybe 4 other tables at this time (remember I said I was late, around 2am) and my guest an I noticed there was 11 dirty tables! 11! ELEVEN DIRTY TABLES! I was disgusted and grew super impatient of waiting for our food (about 30-35 mins after our order was took). I walked up to the front desk and asked what is taking sooooo long. A woman who was not doing much work nor working hard threw her hands in the air and shouted "The drive thru, the drive thru!" She was very rude and unprofessional! My guest and I didnt see a line of cars in the drive thru. We seen 2 the whole visit! Before our food came out and to our table wr said we are leaving and we stood up to walk out. We then were yelled at and were told we had to pay for everything we ordered! I got pissed because all we got were 2 drinks and I cup of chilli, never got our main meal! I said we will pay for what we recieved and what we ate. "Nope, you have to pay for everything and we are calling the police, said the rude manager. My guest ended up paying for everything as I waited out side foe the police who were supposedly called to arrive. As I waited I watched as a crew of people, who were not present when we were ready to dine, SCRAMBLE to clean the tables. 
I waited and waited but no police showed up. I will Never, Ever go to this place ever again! The staff was unprofessional and hiding and lazy. One man I seen working, he was on the grill. I praised him as we walked out.
If possible I would have rated this Steak n Shake a -3 stars
Eat here all the time. Some of the best associates I've seen working in fast food.
I loved this place I go there when I have the chance!

Standard chain hamburger place.  This location tends to be very crowded.  Food is decently priced.

EDIT (9/4/2007): I have dropped my rating from 3 stars down to the minimum 1 star.  This is due to a recent bad dining experience on 9/3/2007 which included the following sucky things:

* Served an iced tea with crap floating in it because the ice tea maker wasn't cleaned for over 24 hours.  Although, I suspect my waitress spat in it as well as other food items which were served at my table.
* My party was served cold soup and half of the cups were less than half full.
* Our waitress only stopped at our table 2 times during the meal: to take our order and to deliver our food and check.
* Overcharged for meals, staff had attitude of "So what... Up yours" when asked to make corrections.
* Tables and seating dirty and sticky since staff wasn't properly cleaning up after people left.
* No receipt issued upon payment.

The list above has been reported to SNS corporate offices, and a conversation is pending with the district manager.  I do not plan on returning to this location.

EDIT (10/1/2007):
The district manager has not gotten back to me yet, even though I have given second notice to corporate.

EDIT (12/3/2007):
The district manager finally contacted me during the week of 10/8 and apologized for the incident.  The district manager had the third shift of this location purchase and send me a $25 gift card as well as apologize in writing for the incident.  

Due to honesty as well as the apology of the district manager, I have restored my original 3 star rating.

This is my first review on yelp. This was also my first time at Steak N Shake. Something about the burgers is very Mcdonalds-like, it just melts in your mouth. The burgers look bigger on the menu pictures.

Just picked up two chicken boti kabobs, and 2 tilapia ...

This is my 3td dinner order in a month, while I'm glad I didn't check reviews with my 1st visit, it's disappointing to learn of their bad reviews.  I've had Great experience and amazing customer service.  

I find the owners very helpful, today I tried to order lamb which the owner advised me not to buy unless I'm cook it tonight.  At another occasion owners advised me on amazing fish marinate and shared his quick recipe even though he sells those fish at the shop.

I believe the owners have learned their lesson and drastically improved service.  I highly recommend my halal; go ahead give them another shot!  You'll be surprised....
Great Service!! They have all kinda meat, fish, Snacks & marinated meats too! Very clean and the meat never smells bad after cooking! The owner is a great man, his service is great

Here's what you need to know: the quality of their meat has gone down, there is possible skimming on the weight you pay for, and majority of what you pay for is bones.

It saddens me to write this because I used to love "My Halal Meat" a few years ago, and would even drive out 20 miles each way to patronize this meat shop. However, things have taken a dramatic turn for the worse over the last few years.

First of all, the meat isn't as fresh tasting as it used to be; it could be because the turnaround/sales are not as frequent which leads to vicious circle of having to hold on to meat longer and eventually selling it to the customers days later.

Recently my wife ordered a couple lbs of goat meat, which is pricey at almost $10/lb, but in reality we ended up paying way more. Majority of what she brought home was bones. Yup, I don't mean 20% or 30% of the weight was bones... I mean about 60% of the weight was bones. Moreover, we weighted the packet at home (with the bones) and it was nowhere close to the 2 lbs we paid for (closer to 1.3 lbs). I am convinced this has become the normal dishonest practice at this business based on other reviewers I've recently read on Yelp.

When my wife did call back and challenged the store on the lesser product we received, she was given some nonsense story about "oh well, we trimmed it (even though that was never discussed with us) so the weight went down". The truth is trimming the fat reduces the weight in an already lean cut by less than 10%, not by dramatic amounts as in our case. Resultantly, we ended up paying about $16-$17 for average to below average quality goat meat; That is a travesty.

We will never patronize the business again, which is tragic because we liked the owner, who is charming and engaging. But no value in that if his business is dishonest.

This place is a trash.. The owner tricks arounds and cheats wherever he can and charges u more Bucks!! NOW LETS get to the product... It's overpriced as compared to anyone in the area by $.050 to $1.50 per pounds depending on the kind of meat.Their meat is not good quality it was old and smelly!!! Doesn't taste and smell like halal meat I would never recommend anyone to shop from here! The owner is a cheater!! BEWARE I have never had this awful experience shopping before ever in my life. Spend ur money where u get respect not the  attitude of this Stubborn guy (OWNER)

DON'T GO HERE...!!!

I agree with all of the reviews below.

The owner (ayaz) is a con man. He takes your order very quickly so as to confuse you. Then he quickly cuts and packs the meat and you never get a chance to inspect it.

1) the meat is always under weight (he will say it's 5 ibs but usually shorts you by a ib or so

2) he ALWAYS overcharges per pound. He charges $10-12 / ib for goat. Are you kidding me???? I would rather go to whole
Foods and get fillet for that much.

He is a hypocrite and pretends to be a pious Muslim while he steals from his customers. There are so many other places to shop for good meat in Schaumburg and the surrounding areas.

I would recommend you avoid this place at all costs even if that means you have to drive a few miles more for another spot.

I will never return and will make sure mon of my friends do either.

I just order some meat , a total of 22 dollars.   I gave the lady my American express, she said they would charge an additional $6.  I asked why and she explained it was American Express and the way it was set up.  What a bunch of BS.   I own 3 businesses,  I have never heard of this nonsense.    This place wants rip people off.   And now the product, my friend had a barbecue at his house we had 3 tray of chicken legs,3 trays chicken kabab and 2 tray of steak.  We had the meat sit out all day as it was hot.   We had 2 trays left and this owner bought it back. I wonder what he did with the meat.   All of our friends are very surprised.
bought that spicy chicken which is kept in the display above those marinated chicken. It stinks, had to throw that :(

I stop by this little shop about twice a month on my way home from work. I am greeted with a friendly "hello" by Ayaz every time I come. The selection of what I can eat is limited because I'm a vegetarian, but I absolutely love the veggie samosas and the veggie puffs. One time when they were out, Ayaz offered to take my phone number and called when the fresh batch came in. Just this past week I showed up to get some samosas and they only had a couple left. He ended up giving them to me for free because he was getting a fresh batch later that day. I think he goes above and beyond in terms of customer service!

I got 1 pound goat here yesterday ..full of bones.. I won't  suggest this place..

Don't go here

I placed an order in the last week, and writ down comments "don't cut viscera never" 
they sent me worst baby goat i have seen, the liver & "head" were cut, it was not fresh i return it back 
i ordered other one with no cut it at all & they sent me again another also it was not fresh & they charged me extra 19$ because it had have more 5 lb , thats mean the first one was not complete baby goat, i cooked a part of the goat.
it was very bad it was hard( not smooth) & dark in color after cooking
After that i threw whole goat in the trash.
I will never buy from them again .

Purchased 'Rohu' fish from here .. Unlike other places I have shopped throughout USA you don't get to choose the fish you buy .. You wait and the chopped fish is given to you .. Nevertheless I took a leap of faith and bought it .. The fish turned out to be a very old stock and had a strange unnatural smell to it .. The meat not oily at all and was dry and broke apart while frying .. Had a bad taste in my mouth and smell in my nose while eating .. Did not eat the whole and decided to get rid of the rest we had .. I would definitely not recommend buying fish from here .. Not an honest fish seller for sure .. I am a Bengali and I know fish .. The best fishes I had been from a shop in Bridgeport CT and Sunnyvale CA .. Fellow bengalis would know :-)

I was looking for a place that offered meat/chicken that was cleaned and fat was removed. I went to this place and got 5 lbs. of chicken legs and quarters. When I brought it home I had to still had to spend 20 mins cleaning the chicken but not only that the chicken smelled bad (due to either being not fresh or not Zabiha as they claim). Anyway I pay the same amount of money at Shamiana and their chicken does not smell so I will be going back to them from now on.

On the surface the owner is polite but he will find way to charge extra whenever and wherever he can.  I ordered a whole goat leg made into ground meant along with the bones from the leg.  When I got home, I received little more bones than meat.  Furthermore, the bones were from the spine of the goat, not the leg.
  This is a very dishonest merchant.  I will never go there again!

This meat is good quality, real halal, organic meat. I have cooked various different dishes with it and it has always been fresh and great meat. I think this poor business's rating on Yelp is low because of fake bad reviews that the competitors are leaving. (Proof - check the reviewers' profiles - most of them have left only 1-2 reviews and they have poor English with American names). The meat does NOT smell bad at all!  Anyways, the customer service is great. I sometimes call in to tell them what I want and then pick it up later and they have it ready and packaged for me. They also cut it and package it the way I request. It is on the expensive side but it's the only place I believe is proper halal meat, the organic and ethical way, so I will continue to be going here. I think you can also order online which is great.
The meat smelt fine and it looked good, but it made my dog sick! Bummer.

I love halal chicken in general but could never find a clean halal store in the NJ area. Once we moved to IL, we were pleasantly surprised to find "My Halal Meat". The store looks clean, meat is cheap, owner is professional and they also light incense sticks to rid the store of raw meat smells. All good. However, I really didn't want to but have to give this place one star because I have noticed consistently that 1) the halal chicken does not have the blood properly drained out as it is supposed to be and 2) even if you request for chicken without fat, you have to spend a whole lot of time cleaning it out at home.

Meat quality Sucks. Owner is basically selling meat that has very little flesh and too much bones and uneatable pieces. Not satisfied with his quality and his looks are very convincing. I complained about his meat and owner totally disagree and come up with some stupid logic. For instance if you tell him that crow color is black, and he would strongly disagree. He would say crow color is always white and etc etc.

Employees friendly and helpful.
You look at the menu on the wall and choose what you want.  Grab the bag for that.
The you choose the particulars.  I chose a Caprese sandwich.  Caprese, Basil and tomato.
I added onions and oil and vinegar.  Tasty.

This place was terrible!  Every single table was dirty. They weren't busy, we were the only customers. One of the workers was on the phone and could have used his time better by cleaning the tables. We wonder how clean the food preparation area is. The food was mediocre and over priced. We should have gone to Francos down the street. Don't waste your money!!!

Today was my first which wich experience . I ordered a lettuce wrap with buffalo chicken . It was okay . The ingredients were really fresh , especially the lettuce . If I were to come back , I would probably try a different lettuce wrap like turkey or something . The buffalo chicken lettuce wrap was not extremely satisfying .

This was my first experience with Which Wich and it will most likely be my last. The line was long and slow moving. When I got up to the front I ordered the philly cheese steak which there was an up charge for, so I paid almost $8 for a dry, flavorless 6 inch sub. The sand which I got had little flavor and was just dry. The only flavor came from the banana peppers I had them add. I don't think they even remembered to put the cheese in but I was rushing to get back to work and didn't have time to complain. I will not be returning here. There are much better options in the area.

OK. So I am giving the benefit of the doubt on a few things here. I am giving them 5 stars because I know they just opened up and learning the ropes. Sl

I am here because I absolutely love Italian Subs. I really wanted to test this place out when I saw this place passing it up. 

First - I like how you pick out a bag and check all the things you want on a sandwich. Very clever.

Second - I like how they categorize the menu. So, for example, under  seafood you can get a tuna sandwich, crab salad sandwich, surf and turf sandwich, etc. Clever. Easier to choose your sandwiches.

Third - The Small Grinder is 7 inches. So one  of those is good enough for me. 

Total cost for a small sandwich, chips, and a regular fountain drink was 9.71.

Negatives - Again they just opened so giving them the benefit of the doubt. But they were a bit slow making my sandwich. Maybe it's because they were heating up my sandwich. Service was still awesome. No I am sure there was a reason for it.

Also no combo meals." Deals. Sort of odd of a sandwich shop. Never seen that before and I go to many sub shops.

I will definitely come back again to test out the other Italian Sub options here. 

I took a pic of the menu so I hope this helps.

Only giving 1 start because I had to give something.  Ordered the day before online to pickup the next day.  Paid in advance.  Went to pickup at the time I requested and nobody was there.  1 employee who knew nothing about the order.  Wouldn't refund.  NEVER AGAIN!!!!  Absolutely the worst service I've ever had
Never again!  Super RUDE staff and NOT a good money value.  Got a Philly steak sandwich and it was very small and dry.  Dirty tables as well.  Steer clear!

The place looked nice and clean, i went around 12pm on a wed. Employees were nice, it was my first time there and the cashier came out and explained how their ordering went.

You first look at what type of meat you want then find the bag with the meat that you and then you can read and mark what you want on the bag. When you have marked all that you want on a the bag you can bring it to the cashier and they ring you up and you wait a couple minutes for them to make your sandwich for you.

I got 2 sandwiches
The gyro sandwich with classic onions and tomato, was very good it was comparable meat and sauce to a real classic gyro.

The other sandwich i got was a roast beef with pepperjack cheese, honey mustard,regular mayo, crispy strings (fried onions), lettuce, spinich, tomatoes, pickles, house chip (not sure what they were or if they even were in there), mushrooms, oregano,garlic,salt, and pepper.    This one was bigger than the gyro cuase it had way more stuff in it. It also was a great sandwich  and everything tasted fresh.

Overall i think this is a good place to eat at, comparable to jimmy johns but with more cuatomizable.

I love me a good sammy, so when I heard that Which Wich was opening up 5 minutes from our place, I was super excited.

Came in here during a lunch hour and totally expected to be overwhelmed cause I had looked at the menu online and it seems very extensive.  Now, is it as easy as Subway or JJs?  No, but you have awesome selections and the food is insanely fresh.  You order your type of sandwich by first picking out what kind of meat you want, then you can add toppings, make it skinny, pick out your sammy style (bread, bowl, or lettuce), and then you hand the cashier your marked up bag.  

Each employee was super helpful and friendly.  My chicken pesto was really good -- as I said before, everything is really fresh.  I opted to not have my sammy warmed up, so I enjoyed how each bite had a snap to it.  

I cannot wait to be back to try other options!

This place is good if you want a quick sandwich and you want something slightly better than Jimmy Johns or subway. 

I had the gyro and I can honestly say it wasn't bad at all! I got the 10' with no chips or drink and still paid 9.50 so I wasn't too thrilled about that, especially when I could've gotten a burger and bottomless fries at red robin (next door) for $10.

There is no combo option, the ridiculously high priced chips and drink come at a hefty cost (almost $4 if you want both) and no discount for getting both as opposed to most other Sandwich places. 

The sandwich was good, I ate it all and was full but it didn't knock my socks off or make me want to go back in a hurry for more. I think I honestly would be perfectly fine if I never went back (this was my second time)

The sauce on the gyro was pretty good and comparable to actual gyro sauce (the white colored cucumber sauce i don't know how to spell it) 

Overall if you are into sandwiches this place has a ton of options, is fast and taste pretty good, but for $9 and no chips or drink it seems a bit overpriced.

Great veggie/vegan options and the meat versions of things aren't bad either and my kiddos love the sandwiches. My only issue with every which wich I've ever been in is it takes FOREVER to get your food, even when its dead and everyone there looks like they are in pain as they make your food. Its a fraction of the size of other sandwich chains and yet it takes twice as long to get the food. Like I said, its good food and plenty of options, but if other known chains had the same options I'd go elsewhere

Tons of Sandwich options and great tasting!! Be careful though when you order sauces as I ordered only light mayo and dijon on my sandwich and when I got home and unwrapped my sandwich to eat, it was soggy and oozing with the sauces! I could barely eat it I had to take a napkin and wipe of so much sauce. 

A little on the pricey side. My fiance ordered a large Italian sub and I ordered a medium tuna and the total was around $21.00 not including chips or drinks. 

There was one lady working there and I looked at her name tag her name is Emma. She made being there waiting for our sandwiches super uncomfortable. They close at 9pm and we got there around 8:30pm. When we walked in she was sweeping and seemed like she was extremely unhappy about it and unhappy that we walked in. She was banging the broom around so loudly and shoving the chairs everywhere. As she was sweeping she was talking to another employee about her personal life and everyone in the restaurant could hear it. She would give us a couple glances that did not look friendly. Not very professional. 

I will come back here just next time say extremely light on the sauces.

I almost wanted to go there with a cross section of my 15 dollar sandwich and complain. it was so skimpy i finished it even though I have a light appetite, does that make sense that a light appetite finishes a 14 inch 15 dollar sandwich??? They served me this 1 layer of meat on my "wicked" sandwich so  they can handle my review instead of me ever going in again.  1 slice of turkey 1 of "beef"  a few thin slices of pepperoni, and 2 super thin slices of bacon, for 15 dollars.  There was less than 1/4 lb of meat and cheese, Ill never return.

Tasted ok (although a bit expensive) but both my husband and I got very sick after eating the sandwiches.
Ordering was not easy for first timers and the girl who was there to help, totally ignored us for some reason.
We probably will not be going back...

Yeah I know that all of the toppings are listed on the bags, but wouldn't one assume that an Italian sub would have lettuce and tomato and maybe even some onion?  Nope. I got a meat sandwich with nothing on it.
Normally I like this chain but the past two times I have been here they have messed up my sandwich

A friend from Crystal Lake was telling me all about the Which Wich that opened up out there, so when I saw there was one in Schaumburg, I stopped in there with my boyfriend. I enjoyed the ordering process of writing on the bag and then handing that to the cashier. I will say, that the prices were astronomical. For two 10.5 inch sandwiches and one large drink, it was $20. I could run to the grocery store and buy all the fixings to make sandwiches for a week with twenty bucks. Also, it was not busy at the time, but it seemed like it took them way too long to round up two sandwiches. Putting that aside, I did highly enjoy the food. The quality of the ingredients was good, and the service was friendly. I will probably never return, because of the price, but it was nice to experience.
Prices are way too high. Sandwiches are fine, but I got two 10" subs and it was $20! That was without any chips or drinks. Definitely overpriced for what you get.
Awesome food I don't know anything about the service but he food is awesome and I'm going back 100%...
Excellent Sandwiches..great concept with the bag and markers.  Good choices for every one.

The Ultimate BLT was above average, but $10.65 for a BLT and a medium drink???  The place was filthy at 2:30 on a Friday afternoon.  The stainless steel tables were anything but shiny. They were greasy, sticky, and full of crumbs and other unknown bits  of food. The garbage can next to the pop machine was overflowing. None of this seemed to bother the employees, four of them sat in the dining room eating their sandwiches. I opted to eat in my car. If the front of the house is this dirty, I can only imagine what the food storage area looks like.  It's obvious that the first review (five stars) for this shop was from an employee. I call BS on that review.
Under 2.5 minutes for mine and my husband's sandwhich....which....(get it?)....is unheard of for a which which. The one near Barrington's Arboretum is BRUTALLY slow compared to this one.
This place is really good! Reminds me of Quiznos. 4 stars, could have had a clean table. Would go back!

We used to go there once a week and loved the food, people and the service, to the fact that we recommended this place to all our friends and now they are regulars too. However, last time when we visited they were lagging behind the orders so we expected a delay and sat down patiently. To our surprise people who came and ordered after us got their sandwiches before us and left. We were sitting there with no food for more than 45 minutes. Imagine waiting 45 minutes for a damn sandwich. REALLY! Really pissed with the service and I hope they fix it else they lose very frequent customers.

They have gluten free salad options for my wife (did not see a gluten-free pizza tho).. 
Would try again. Very busy on Fri night, but not more than 5 min wait throughout. 

What can you say - It's pizza and its good.  Wife with celiac liked her gluten-free salad.
Good sized Kids meals $5 with $1 optional desert (large brownie, sundae or fruit plate)

Normally love this place. Love the cosmos and the chicken milenese. Last time we went the cosmo was horrible. I had this young waitress trying to tell me maybe because it has lime in it. I told her i know my cosmos and normally when we come here they are great.  I did rememeber what the bartender looked like, a taller girl. I will only order a drink from this place if she is working.

Not as good as I remember my experience at the Deer Park. ,Ill. Location.   The  salad was ok.  The server was attentive to a point.  In fact asking if we wanted boxes for our left overs. At which point we had not finished eating .we may not be back at this location . Melanie wanted me to add that the server should have been more  observant, that as baby boomers  we are a male and female couple.  Not guys as we were greeted .

I've eaten at CPK since I was a kid, and their menu has dramatically changed over the years. This is a great place to bring kids, even for their birthday. I've always had great service here whether I'm sitting outside on the patio or inside. It's in a good location downtown Arlington Heights, right next to the train tracks, which I personally like watching the trains go by as they are not noisy. 

I recommend ordering their pizza, or if you're in the mood for a lighter dish, a salad. I've found their entrees aren't great. Another thing my family enjoys is the lettuce wraps (we get them with chicken and shrimp). Their pizza crust is delicious, and almost makes you want to get something fancier than a cheese or pepperoni. My favorite is the California, which has avocado on it (delish) and is less of a "traditional" tomato base with cheese pizza than you would think. I highly encourage ordering a cool pizza you couldn't get at a local pizza shop!

I absolutely LOVE this CPK! Coming here with my friends and family is always a great experience because no matter what, I always get friendly and fast service! The restaurant is always clean and the dishes are fantastic. (I highly recommend the garlic cream fettuccini or the jambalaya, it's to die for!) oh and if u have room after that definitely get the key lime pie or red velvet!! You can never go wrong with some red velvet and ice cream.
I like the macaroni cheese, very much. That's all that needs to be said. - A 7 year old

Don't go here thinking traditional Italian pizza. I did and I found out that the pizza here is for people who are not used to good pizza here in Chicago. I gave never heard of pizza like this in my life time. It wasn't bad , but it is just not for me. Bizzarre. Artsy Fartsy Pizza.

CPK is a go-to place if you eat gluten-free. Over the years, they have worked hard to produce a menu of items that are up to their standards and also tasty. It took them several tries with the pizza, but now they've got it. You get three choices (in the GF world, that's a lot!!). They clearly label their menu. This location I have visited many times. They have a typical indoor dining room for the chain, and some outdoor seating right next to the train tracks (can be fun if you have kids). There seems to be a new and very attentive manager working here. Maybe some of the service problems others have noted will get fixed. Although car parking is a short walk away, the bike parking is right out the front door.

I'm giving them a five. Why? Because nothing was done wrong. I started out with the avacadoe egg roles and they were honestly amazing. At first glance I thought they would be gross and thought, "Who  would even eat that?" CPK really showed me not to judge. I had the pizza (the specific kind starts with an S), and that was great as well. Even our server was extremely nice (cheers to you, Ann Marie)! Overall, once again, it was a great first experience.

Perfect place for a kid friendly meal.  The food is good for adults and kids.  We love to sit by the windows so the kids can be entertained by the trains as we eat.  The staff is always attentive and friendly.  Our grandkids love going to CPK and ask for it often!

I'm a regular at CPK and the food is always good, but the service is all over the board. Last night our party of 8 had to wait much too long for everything: the server, the water, the bread, the soup, the entrees, the bill. The place wasn't full, and there were plenty of staff (many of whom weren't doing much) but they just aren't good at handling big parties. We walked in planning on starting with several appetizers for the table, but by the time we finally got some attention, we were basically forced to order our meals. If you are a couple with unlimited time, CPK is a great option. But if you are a big group you can find a better place.

Good service, good food! Depending on what kind of a night or holiday you go on will dictate the time you will have to wait to be seated.

On Valentines day there was a wait, but it was bearable! We waited about 20/25 minutes to be seated. However on a Thursday afternoon around 2o'clock, we were seated immediately! 

Every time I come here the waitress is super nice, as well as the chef. Our waitress would check on us from time to time and the chef came our once as well! Very polite and good service

 The garlic creme fettuccine with shrimp and mushrooms was very good and very filling, even difficult too finish! But again delicious. Portions are generous, especially the salads; you will not have to worry about leaving hungry if you do order one!

From the Lite Menu, the cedar plank salmon is SO good! Perfectly cooked and the corn side salad goes along perfectly. Squeeze a little lemon juice on and it is finger licking good!
Still waiting for my lunch and my family is finished eating. Three tables seated yet this is the slowest service I have had in years.

I absolutely love California Pizza Kitchen. The raspberry is delicious and the bread is simply amazing. Don't even get me started on the pizza. It's absolutely divine! It comes out nice and hot and the ratio of sauce to cheese is perfect. The cheese is warm and gooey. I'd definitely recommend the Barbeque Chicken Pizza. It's probably my favorite thing on the menu. If California Pizza Kitchen keeps making food like this, then I will definitely be back.

My family came here for dinner the day before Thanksgiving to prepare ourselves for eating turkey, stuffing, and mashed potatoes for the next week.  All our food came out correctly and in a relatively-timely manner.  To me, it just didn't taste as good as it normally does.  The crust was off.  Obviously, I still ate half and had the second half for Thanksgiving breakfast.  It was great reheated!

Our waitress was great.  My dad made some awkward comment (not to or about said waitress) and she just went right along with it and kept the conversation flowing while I turned red and buried my face into my hands.

I love CPK, but from my experience the Deer Park location is slightly better.  I also think the Deer Park location is a little cheaper, but don't quote me on it.

Favorite items: sugar free peach lemonade, Mediterranean foccacia, SEDONA TORTILLA SOUP, spinach and artichoke dip, five cheese and tomato pizza, and BBQ chicken pizza.  Get the honey-wheat crust.  Yum!

This place is solid. It's a standard CPK, and you get the added bonus of it being right next to the Metra line in case you want to watch the trains.

The staff is friendly, bring food quickly, and the food is consistently good. I always get the same pizza (boring girl) and it's always good.

Plus, for a carb lover, it's awesome since they give you free bread and butter (though I think you have to ask for it) in addition to the crust you're chowing down on. Yum-o.

You know those guys that you work with that don't technically say anything completely obnoxious, but it is their tone that makes you want to punch yourself (and them) in the face?  Well, CPKs version was our server.  It is unfortunate that such an intense guy works at, what is otherwise, a very nice CPK.  We have had him as our server twice and both times it was the same: loud voice, too many words, highlighting that he wanted a big tip...

Outside of our server, it is very clean, the food comes quickly and is consistently good.  Go, but brace yourself.

California Pizza Kitchen is a good option for casual weeknight dining.  They have a patio area for warmer days and nights.  If you plan on sitting inside, you should bring a sweater because the air is on full blast making it chilly!

*Asparagus + Arugula Salad is one of my go-to small plate starters.  Chopped up asparagus mixed together with arugula, toasted almonds, and sun-dried tomatoes.  The salad is tossed with a lemon vinaigrette and then topped off with shaved Parmesan.  A perfect light start.

*Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza is one of my faves.  It now comes on the thin crust, but I usually ask for it to come on the original honey wheat crust.  Slices of Bosc pears cover the crust with sweet caramelized onions and hazelnuts.  They top the pizza off with field greens that have been tossed in a tasty Gorgonzola ranch dressing.  It's almost like a salad on your pizza.  Give it a try!

When coming to the downtown Arlington Heights location, you have to go in knowing that this place is pretty much run by female servers under the age of 22.  The service is always mediocre.  The food is usually consistent...the service not so much.

They have recently switched up their crusts so pay attention when ordering.  Many pizzas now come on a thin crust and others with a new hand tossed style.  The past 3 times when ordering take out we've specifically asked for and described one crust just to receive another.  Mama Mia!  What's a girl to do?!

Last week, we had a negative experience.  I had ordered a salad for my dinner.  While collecting my roasted vegetables and lettuce onto my fork, I noticed a long strand of BLACK hair intertwined within my fork and veggies.  Our servers hair was a light brown and was pulled back in a braid so I didn't think it was hers by any means, but it definitely belonged to someone else who had their hair dancing over my salad.  I tried looking to the kitchen to see if I noticed anyone with long hair.  The only one I could really see was another server with black hair prancing around the kitchen to help out.   She had her hair half up, with tightly hair-sprayed ringlets hanging on each side of her face.   I brought the hair to my servers attention at the end of our meal (because that's when she checked back with us).  She agreed it was gross and said she would bring it to the managers attention.  Minutes later she returned with to go boxes for us and our check.  No mention of the hair again.  Now, I'm never looking for a hand out, but you'd think the manager would come by to apologize or they would offer to re-make my salad, rather than assuming I want to take it home and munch on some more hair of a stranger.  Well, at least it wasn't something worse like a booger or a finger nail.

The food here is mediocre at best. I've eaten at the one in Oakbrook several times and always had a positive experience. I'm ultimately giving this location 1 star because of the crappy service. It was 4:00 pm on a Saturday when we came in. We were sat without utensils to eat with. Our server didn't bring out my soup before our meal. We had to ask for drink refills and our food took forever. There were 2 other tables in the restaurant. Worst part - we had to eat amongst a sea of dirty dishes. Our table wasn't cleared once throughout our meal. Gross!! And our waitress would just walk by. Every time she came to our table (2xs) she didn't crack a smile and looked totally inconvenienced. Get a new job girl. The service industry is not for you. Needless to say we won't be back. Ever.

The salads, pasta, and delicious thin crust pizza; what's not to like about California Pizza Kitchen? CPK has always been one of my favorite restaurants to eat at. This restaurant deserves full stars however I will be giving it only 3 for the terrible service I've experienced today. 
My waitress (Teresa) only visited my table two times in the entire evening. She served my family stale hard, crusty bread as an appetizer, didn't re-fill our drinks, and never came to our table to check on how we were doing. Instead, I see her chatting with the customers at the bar and neglecting my table. I had to ask another waitress to serve my table and get the check.
I hope in the future they will have better servers.

It is not our first time at CPK or even at this location. We wanted to give it 3.5 stars but since half stars aren't available, we gave it a 4 because of the service. 

We were seated immediately upon arrival. It was around 6:30 on a Friday night with no wait. Our waitress was very nice and kept checking on us throughout our meal. When our order arrived, our server told us he had dropped one of the tortilla spring rolls and that another order had already be placed. One order of spring rolls comes split into 3 pieces. Only one of the pieces had dropped, but we were given a new full 3 piece roll.

We ordered the Baja Chicken and Thai Chicken Tortilla Rolls. Both were good, especially with the side dips: guac and peanut sauce, respectively. I would get the Baja Chicken again (because I liked the guac) and give the Mediterranean Veggie a try the next time we are at CPK. We also had the Shaved Mushroom and Spinach Flatbread (enjoyed/would get again), and the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza (nothing too special about that one though). This was dinner for 2 and we had leftovers enough for a one person lunch.

There is ample free street parking and would like to try the outdoor seating sometime. This location is right next to the Metra tracks. However when a train did pass by during our dinner, we did not really hear it while seated inside the restaurant.

Not a bad place.  Just remember that they don't actually serve pizza, it's more like a bunch of toppings on bread.  But that aside.  

I ordered the Jambalaya which came with noodles instead of rice.  It wasn't all that great if you ask me. A bit spicy but other than that, kinda bland.  

The other people with us seemed to enjoy their food.  They had korean tacos for 6 dollars. Someone ordered it and it literally was 2 tacos... It was ok.

The service was good though, but all in all, probably not worth it.

I've had take out a couple times and I'm not impressed with their GF menu.  I had a cobb salad recently and it had a floral taste to it.  I threw most of it away.  I'll be going to Panera for GF salads from now on.

I've been coming to this restaurant since I was in 8th grade and have never been disappointed. Best pineapple Hawaiian pizza I've had in the area and you can't beat the atmosphere of downtown arlington heights

Options, options, options. 
If you like pizza, they have options.

Is it the best food I've taken down? Nope. No way. 
Is it somewhere a little different that offers really good service at pricing even to the other places nearby? Yes. You betcha!

So often I go with the routine - the buffalo chicken pizza (because it tastes so good). This time around, the wife and I went for something new - lettuce wraps and the cheeseburger pizza.

I was weary of the wraps before they arrived at our table. Once they touched down, my weariness went out the door. They were good. Surprisingly good. We scarfed them with no problem.

Then came our riskier choice, the cheeseburger pizza. The only way to describe its taste is like this -- do you like the whopper with cheese from Burger King? If you said yes than this is the pizza for you. Even down to a "secret sauce" it tasted like Whopper Pizza. That's not bad or good...just what it was. I wish the meat tasted more high quality than Burger King meat but it was as advertised. Flame-broiled pizza.

We avoided dessert (because we pigged out on everything else).
Lastly, I wish I could remember our server's name. She was really attentive, even on a slammed Friday night.

We'll keep going back because we like pizza and good service. Win, win.

One of the best customer service exerpeiences I've had in a long time.

We got seated fairly immediately. Right after getting seated, I went to the bathroom, and my friend went to the bathroom. In that time, no server had visited our table to greet us. When a server finally did arrive, she seemed a little frantic, it seemed that a miscommunication had occurred about who would be taking care of us. Not a huge deal to us. 

However, that apparently was so much of a blunder that the manager visted our table and comped our whole meal. He even requested that we have dessert as their treat. The server that took care of us was wonderful: we're fans of the recently-retired BLT Pizza and she requested the kitchen make it even though it was off the menu. She also recommended an excellent salad for me. 

Food was great! Everything tasted wonderful. 

Not many restaurants I've visted would take the fault for such a minute error, let alone comp a whole meal to gain a customer's satisfaction. I was very impressed and appreciative of the manager and server. Outside of a tip, the least I can do is write a favorable review and revisit to bring them more business. Bravo, AHCPK!

We sat outside on a gorgeous night.  It's not bad for pizza, but not the best.

The best part is the variety they offer.  Basically any type of pizza you could possibly want, they have.  However, they won't be the best you've had.

I had a Hawaiian pizza, which was good.  The pineapple was fresh and the cheese ample.  But it was missing that good ham that makes a Hawaiian pizza.

They did offer delicious raspberry-lemonade and strawberry-lemonade, which I would get again.

That is, if I go.  The price was a little to step to not try and find a better pizza in the area with a bit more character and a little less dough, no pun intended.  (These pizzas barely have any.)
Always love going to California Pizza Kitchen in Arlington heights downtown. Nice friendly service and the good value that CPK offers.

This CPK location consistently offers some of the best service I've experienced in the entire CPK chain. I usually dine here in the early evening when I work in the suburbs, permitting the traffic to die down before my drive back to the Loop. They're extremely "single-diner-friendly" at this location, and service quality doesn't diminish if you're alone. In addition, it's located in a cool area near the train station, with abundant nearby parking. On my last visit, I had a server, Adam, who really went out of his way to ensure that I had a pleasant dining experience. For all of these reasons, I offer CPK Arlington Heights my highest rating.

I love the management here. There has recently been some turn around and you can tell it's for the best. I come here with my husband and kids and the managers always great about our allergies and sits down at our table to catch up and chitty chat everytime. This is the only California pizza kitchen we will go to because of how well they treats us.

I am a fan of CPK because I am a fan of thin crust pizza over deep dish. Weird, since I am a Chicagoan! This restaurant has quite an interesting variety of pizzas. One of my favorites is the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza. Yum. I have tried a few others and they were pretty good too. I like the atmosphere of the restaurant. The staff is always friendly & attentive. This one is one of my favorite locations along with the Schaumburg location.

They make a mean margarita at CPK...or two, which is my usual intake, and have a nice selection of food to offset my boozing. (smile) There are plenty of options for vegetarians, although some items are pre-mixed and the meat can not be removed.

I live in the city and work in Des Plaines so the Arlington Heights CPK is a convenient spot for me to meet up with my NW suburban friends after work.

The staff is exceptionally friendly and I am impressed with how frequently the managers and hostesses make the rounds along with the servers. You tend to have at least two staffers checking in on you, and yet not to excess.

Parking in the area is easy. The bathroom is always clean.

As usual, the food is good! I always get the chicken tequila fettuccine. My boy-friend ordered just a pepperoni pizza with whole grain crust. The waiter forgot to put in the whole grain part so the waiter apologized and put in the correct order. The manager came over and apologized as well and brought us this mushroom and spinach flatbread, which was on the house. They honestly didn't have to but I will say, it was good! The manager checked on us again and asked if we wanted to take the pizza they made earlier, so instead of them wasting it, we took it home. I thought their service was great! And the food is always delish!

California Pizza Kitchen in Arlington Heights has become our home away from home.
My daughter Erika and I had never tried CPK but our friends had recommended it highly.,This is largely because of the always delicious food!   Erika and I
enjoy the barbecue pizza and the avocado rolls...  and one really special waiter.

 Fernando makes dining a pleasure from beginning to end. He is friendly,respectful, personable, efficient and always makes great suggestions. Last night he called our attention to a placard suggesting a red wine where some proceeds go to a heart association. Wow he had us!
