Let me start with the beautiful ambiance as u walk in the door... after sayin hi to the polite bouncers' you step into a parallel dimension with the unique bar feel you were expecting. You want to play pool? ONLY PLACE IN PALATINE TO DO THAT.. 

not a beer snob' this is ur place. If not u should get to steppin.. 

Come in with no worries leave with the same.
 
Kristen the bartender is a very nice and loving individual. I feel apreciated every time i walk in the door.

If u like small businesses and beleive in the american dream i dare u to come here..
You know who's the best? COLLEEN. SERIOUSLY. She is my favorite of allllll time. Food=good. Drinks=hell yes. BLT pizza=heroinesque. For those of you who love blow jobs, bring your own whipped cream.

Love this place! Best pizza around. Love coming here for a night out with friends to grab dinner and drinks or come for a game. Great atmosphere friendly servers. Can't say enough about the great pizza! You cannot find better!!!

Horrible food and service. Owner is rude ad hell and has no customer service skills. Tasteless and bland food. Stay away from this place, lots of other options in Palatine. Will not give it a second chance.

Had the pizza!! Omg it is the best.. Super thin, excellent sauce and more than enough cheese!!! Pizza here rocks!! Also had the Chicken Pesto sandwich... It was awesome! The server, who was also very attentive, recommended. Very good pesto and the chicken was cooked perfectly!! Wish this place was closer to my house!!!!
Amazing food and bomb service. Enjoy every dish I've ever eaten here from the wraps and sandwiches to the pizza and wings.

After this location having such a bad reputation for years, my husband and I and  friends have given it a second chance, came I a few times to watch football season with palatine friends. Not bad , not great but local, walkable  neighborhood "SPORTS BAR " 
Somethings never change tho. Terrible service ? What are these girls thinking ?? They seem more interested in conversations of their own rather than waiting tables? ?? Drink Specials so watered down, crazy. 
I asked , is there any alcohol in this coke ? My husband 
Tasted too, feeling mutual.  " don't get another one he says...me the optimist says , it can't be twice? ? I ask waitress,  she LECTURES US ....I'M JUST THE WAITRESS! !   Bottom line.....Horrible Service, Watered  down drinks, and food...............##  stick with pizza. 
Too bad for palatine,  it would of been nice to have a real functional SPORTS BAR in Town.
Go Hawks !

I will say the owner contacted me quickly and stressed how he is working on the issues at hand, this i appreciated very much.  Also, stopped in on a different day with some friends (who were going here anyway) and they ordered a pizza and I have to say honestly, It was MUCH better this time.  Seems that the problem here is inconsistency,  Please keep improving, I would love for JL's to be successful here.

Pretty cool sports bar. Good food. I would definitely recommend the Buffalo Chicken Wrap. Thin tortilla filled with amazing and spicy buffalo chicken with lettuce and ranch dressing.. it was a bit messy, dipping with delicious ranch, but totally worth it. Served with a yummy side order of french fries, with ketchup. As an appetizer we ordered the Skinny, hummus with pita bread and veggies.. very good but definitely only enough for one to two people! I would absolutely go back, especially if there's a game on. I would really want this wrap again, but would have to try something new the second time around!

I started to come to JLs when they got a new owner.  The owner came from Pop's in Schaumburg and that place got bad after he left.  The space is nice with huge ceilings.  They have also done a ton to fix up the place and now has 4 projection tvs and a ton more tvs.  I came for a Cubs/Hawks game on a Saturday night and was able to watch both at the same time on two big screens next onto each other.  I LOVE the food here!  I always get the steak tacos and my family always gets the pizza.  This time my wife got the ribs and they were literally fall off the bone.  Trina was our waitress and she busted here butt on a packed night!  They also offered $10 Coors Light buckets (5 total) and I think $13 buckets for others...which is a great deal if you have a large group of people or really thirsty.  This is now my favorite bar to go to and definitely my favorite Official Blackhawks bar!

UPDATE: I just went here again for a Cubs game...atmosphere was crazy!  New owner has changed up the menu a bit and really remodeled the bar very nicely...totally new place with a ton of brand new TVs and big screens!  I happened to have Trina again as a waitress and again she was awesome (so nice to see a consistent wait staff).  If you haven't been here in a while I recommend you try it out.

Walked in with my mom, sister, and sister's gf half an hour ago. Told the bartender my nephew's football team was on their way for pizza. She didn't seem too happy--odd since the place was mostly empty and you'd think she'd welcome the business. 

A few minutes later when we still hadn't gotten menus, I walked to the bar and asked for a club soda. Again the bartender appeared unhappy with my order being so small. It was $2 which was ridiculous.  As she handed it to me she said irritably, "I don't have a waitress today so you're going to have to be patient with me."  I walked away.  

When the team started coming in I told my sister we weren't welcome and that we should go, but someone else had planned the party so we didn't want to cause a lot of trouble. Then my sister went to the bar to ask for pitchers of water for the thirsty team. The bartender said "sorry, our water machine is broken."

WTF?

At that point we were all eager to leave so called another local pizza place and they were happy to accommodate us.  Before we left I walked up to the bartender and took her picture. Once I did this she gave me the only smile I'd seen from her all day. "How can I help you, sweetie?" was suddenly her attitude. I told her we were leaving and why. She feigned great confusion. We are presently having great fun at another local pizza joint that was happy to welcome these thirty kids and parents. We intend to tip well.

****Update:  The owner sent me a kind and apologetic message, and the coach of my nephew's team said that they usually have a great time at JL's.  I guess my experience was not typical - still a terrible first experience but I think it was just that one bartender.  I'm upgrading my review from one star to three.  Thank you, Dave. 

P.S.  I do think it's going to become a family joke: "Want to go out to eat?"  "Yeah, but let's go somewhere where they have WATER."

I was surprised how good the pizza was here! I was kind of scared because I read some Yelp reviews and it was a mix reaction on the pizza, which I thought was great!! The nachos were awesome too, would totally order again!! The only complaint I have is that I ordered a vodka and tonic and after the first sip I knew it was vodka and water. Instead of making a fuss I asked the waitress for a half a cup of tonic water to mix in my drink. (All I wanted was a splash). She ended up charging us $3.00 for that little "splash". I would come back, but stick with water in the future.

Pretty nice TV setup. Food is solid bar food. Menu is too large so it's mostly frozen I would guess. Kitchen would be swamped trying to make all the options available. It gets very very packed during Blackhawks games.

First time ordering from here. Very quick delivery and the hot food was still hot! My wife, who is 100% Italian, had the Calamari Pasta dinner and sadly was not impressed with it. She said the breaded calamari was mushy and thought it odd that it was served on top of the pasta and marinara sauce. I however, enjoyed my order, although it was only an Italian Sub. But it was loaded with meats, cheese and other toppings and was delicious. Fresh cut fries complimented the sub well. Will try other entree's with the hope of giving JL's more stars!
Of all the pizza places in the area, this place has the best, the buffalo chicken pizza is UNREAL. Highly recommend, Owner Dave is awesome!

This place has terrible projection TV's from the 1980's. The service
Was poor and the food was not very good. I will say the pizza was ok-I would have it delivered but I would never go back to the facility.  There 
are too many better places in downtown Palatine to go to

Strange place.  Sports bar but main TV and sound is playing the TV show Jeopardy.  That's weird. One person working the front. Nice enough but not very talkative. 

Looks like a sports bar but acts like the local tavern. At this point I don't feel trying the food would be a good choice so no comment on food

I will try again later in the day to see if it has a better ambiance.

I stopped by to watch the game. I love this place. Not only was the pizza delicious but the server was friendly. I ordered a thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage. The pizza had a nice flakey crust and I  really enjoyed the robust flavor of the sauce. Our pizza had just the right amount of melted cheese.  

Its good place to hang out with friends, eat some great pizza, drink a beer and watch the game.

This place is absolutely horrible. The waitress was completely unpleasant and took over twenty minutes to come to our table to get our order. Then they got my food order wrong. But the worst part is that I saw the bartender make my drink with the wrong liquor, and when I told her she about the mistake, she lied and insisted that she used the right liquor.

Tried their pizza last night. We ordered a medium-half cheese, half pepperoni. It was pretty good. I left wanting more but full. I went with my husband and our 2 little kids. It's a bar but saw a few other families. We went around 6:30/7:00. Lots of TVs.
JL'S is just what Palatine needed... it's a great place to watch any sporting event. The food is delicious and the service is always friendly. I am so exited to have a place like this in town!!

Stopped by after a conference in the city and visiting family nearby, they had excellent pizza and a great atmosphere as I had gone during the Blackhawks Stanley Cup Run. Their food was excellent, service was friendly and we had a great time. Would definitely go back during a Blackhawks Playoff Game.

Was really hoping for a fresh start for this location with the recent ownership and name change but my first experience was poor.  The only change to the inside is a red wall with a Blackhawks logo.  Bathrooms still a complete disaster and nothing has really been cleaned up or changed other than the menu.  The items looked fairly good and the promoted they were made fresh but our food experience was poor.
They heavily promote pizza and even have it in their name.  This place was DEAD SLOW and it still took us nearly 35 minutes to get our pizza.  When it came it was under cooked in my opinion and had far too much cheese, which seemed to be a lower quality mozzerella that was not melted completely.
Both me and my friend had stomach problems for hours and hours after eating it.  
May give them one more chance in a few weeks to see if the new ownership makes any improvement but highly skeptical right now.
I think the chili must have had beer in it. Wonderful if you're a beer fan...I'm not. Cheese curds were good. I'd go back if I'm in the area again.

My last visit was more 3 1/2 stars than 4 stars.  I usually love  their burgers even after the new ownership.  I usually can't go wrong with the burger on the pretzel bun, but tonight it was just meh.  My Mom and son said their burger and cheeseburger were great as always; the cole slaw was good too.  That gave me a bit of hope for a next time.  This is a nice neighborhood joint and and I would like to continue coming here with the family; I just hope it was just an off night for them.

Stumbled onto this place last minute.  Had a burger build your own. Pretzel bread egg bacon.  Huge delicious with side of steak fries and Cole slaw. Amy was our waitress and she was great, helpful and friendly. My friend had fried chicken sandwich that he said was one of his best. 
I'd go back!

$35.00 after tip for two bland cheeseburgers, fries, one diet coke and a tablespoonful of canned baked beans and terrible coleslaw. The arrogant son of the owner..ugh...Catch the Metra to Cary and get a burger at The Tracks. This place lost its mojo 15 years ago.....

Best burgers in this area. Even the cole slaw is amazing. I won't go back on a Saturday because they do not have the square footage to operate properly. I get the charm of the place, but it's incredibly cramped and you're practically eating in the laps of the strangers next to you. Not comfortable at all, but the food is stellar. I'll be back, on a weekday.

Great burgers and tasty cheese curds!!!
The service was great!!!! This building has some history going way back to Prohibition!!

Besides the praise from my first review, Brandt's has shown me exactly how important their customers are to them. The OWNER of Brandt's personally came to my house to inform me that I had been given the wrong bill the night before and that I had overpaid. He wanted to make sure I was aware of it and corrected the mistake beyond my expectations! They have my business for life! Thank you Walt.

Brought the family here hoping it was " family friendly". Walked in around 4:00 on a Saturday afternoon to an empty restaurant and a few people sitting at the bar. Was greeted by a man, presumably the owner, told us to sit anywhere. Thought we had made a mistake picking this place to eat. After ordering our food customers began filling in. AWESOME food had by all. Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had, my son thought the same thing. Place was packed by the time we left. Waitstaff was great also. I am definitely making this restaurant our "go to" place. Great job Brandt's.

Most inconsistent take out. Owner is drinking at the bar. Staff can't find the order in the computer. I'm confused. Your place is empty which is really sad. This place was my go to 5 years ago. Wtf happened? Yeah you guys need a hip check. Seriously wake up!

How depressing .......
Grew up at this place with its burgers and the world best fries...now under new owners I wanted to relive my childhood and enjoy one of the best burgers ever!!
Very depressing soggy burger .. No real flavor all the love seems to be gone.
Fries were one of the worst displays of food... 3 day old McDonald fries would taste better..I was told nothing has changed since the new owners have taken over but that's hard to believe ....
Pass on this place please ....burger king is right down the street and it's cheaper ..
At least you can drink here ... You'll need to in order to enjoy the food
A mighty tasty burger, served on rye with great fries. I wish I could have had a beer with it! But it was lunch time and I had to work. A great American Roadhouse!
The burger was very good. The home made chips from earlier in the day should have been warmer

An excellent joint. Packed with friendly locals. The food was excellent.

Started the night off with some cheese curds, the cheese tasty, the dough light and airy, with honey mustard to dip it in. Recommended.

The burgers.. Where do I begin? You HAVE to order a burger. It's necessary. I had a burger with Munster, bacon, mushrooms, and all of the toppings.. The burger was cooked to perfection, just the right amount of fat in the meat. Don't forget the Mac and cheese, heavenly. Worth it, has a lot of cheesy punch. The coleslaw slightly peppery. And the house made chips, excellent.

The boy had buttered burger with american and the toppings it comes with. The steak fries were tasty.

Only downfall, our server was delightful, but it took a bit of time to get the check and to also have it picked up to run the card. Also, during hawks games, the area we sat in, down the stairs, the volume needed to be up a bit more so we can hear the TVs! But we're definitely coming back in the future, many many times. This place is heaven
Still the best!  Cheeseburgers on a pretzel bun, slaw and real pub feel! Still packs them in, yet still has the feel of a genuine charm of an old English pub!  Keep it up Jim and Walt!

First time there,  went because of all the good reviews.  Food took forever,  horrible greasy burger,  cheese curds were not good my chicken quesadilla was just OK. And weird tasting sweet potato fries.  Over all I feel sick after from all the grease and definitely not returning ! No idea why they have good reviews.

Happen to be in the area and was invited to have lunch there with a friend who lives in Palatine and knows the area well. This spot has a great burger!! Nothing fancy or anything but the burger tastes really good and is very fresh. Service was good and I overall the place was crowded for a Friday. 

Given that this place looks like a house, the interior also feels cozy and you feel like you are in someones house having dinner/lunch! If I am ever back in that area I would definitely go back to this place for another burger!

This is a nice local neighborhood joint, and I've eaten here a few times.  Everytime its the same problem.  
Their burgers are bland.
Almost positive they put zero seasoning on their patties before they hit the flattop, further evidenced by their appearance on Chicago's Best.  There is also no sear, which is how you get great flavor.

The service is always fine, and the people are nice, but you can tell the owners' experience isn't in restaurants.  As someone who's worked in restaurants for over a decade, you know to season your proteins.

So as a suggestion, put some salt (kosher/sea) and pepper on your patties right before you cook 'em!  Also, cook em on a higher heat for a better sear.  Basic restaurant fundamentals.  These things seriously lack flavor.

On a positive note, the burgers are moist, and could be pretty decent.  And I hope these guys do well keeping a Palatine staple alive, but SEASONING!

Forty-five dollars for three orders of burgers. Good but overrated for me. Fries were greasy. Burgers were big but nothing extra special. Sorta miffed when I got six Ketchup packets for three orders of fries.

A crowed place, yes, but not really a big place either.

When your goal is a great burger and something cold, this is your destination.  Yes, it's crowded.  And loud.  But the servers move quickly and efficiently, which is all you're really after for a burger fix.  NOT a first date place.  NOT a last date place.  Just good food and fun.

I love the fact that they have pretzel buns and sweet potato fries options for no additional cost.  There are also a lot of other options. It is a very good burger which comes with a side and coleslaw. It is small and can get busy, but it is a really charming place.

This is the epitome of a dive bar.  The food is excellent and the service is friendly.  I had the ribs and really enjoyed them. Right up there with some of the best.  The burgers were cooked perfectly and juicy.  The homemade chips are way better than the fries.  I can't wait to go back.

Although this appears to be my first review of Brandt's, we've dined here many times over the years and I am certain I've review it before. However, with the change in ownership last year, Yelp must have created a new profile.

We ate at Brandt's last over a month ago and the experience was great. I posted an updated review complimenting the staff about how much better the place was under new management. But, I hope our experience this night was just a bad night.

We were seated right away. Brandt's is small, and we were put at a table that was crowded in by other tables leaving little room for movement. The waitress was energetic, but was not attentive. We placed our order shortly after sitting down. It took her about ten minutes to deliver my drink, a coke. We were all talking and didn't realize it until we checked, but 1/2 hour passed before they finally delivered our food. 

Two items (three people in our party) had to send food back. My hamburger was supposed to be cook medium - their burgers are at least 1/2 pound and usually great. But one side of mine was charred and the other side was raw. Well, I guess if you take the average of them it was medium? I didn't mention that the fries were under-cooked.

They were apologetic and said they would replace the burger, which they did. The second burger was fine, and the fries were still under-cooked but better than before.

One hot button of mine is the server's attentiveness to drink refills. I drank my coke while waiting for the meal to be served. When they dropped off my second burger, they ran off quickly and did not notice all three of us had empty glasses. I was finally able to flag her down and ask for refills, but they really should watch for that.

I'm disappointed about this visit. While I don't consider myself a regular, we've been there over a dozen times over the years, and three times since they changed owners last year. So, again, I'm hopeful this was just a bad day for them. But, it was memorable for us in an unsatisfying way. I really hope they get their act back together or they will lose some of their hard earned customers.

My wife and I try to visit different places each weekend and last week we tried Brandts. We had heard about the legendary burgers and were not disappointed. Our party of four each tried a different burger and even the sides were very good. Our martinis at the bar were served promptly and the staff were extremely friendly. Good choice of draft beers, including IPA, complimented the food perfectly. Only disappointment was extreme noise from close proximity of tables but otherwise it was a fantastic evening.

The food was alright - given the prices and wait however, I expected to get better food. The food for me in general lacked a good texture and could've had more refined flavor combinations. Most notably, the burger really lacked flavor in the meat (could've used some more seasoning or wood/charcoal grilling) and could've used a well toasted bun. The steak fries and sweet potato fries were simply soggy with no crispyness at all. The homemade chips and baked beans tried to do too much in terms of flavor and as a result, didn't really present a clear theme. The BBQ ribs were too dry and lacked flavor.

Given the other good reviews, maybe I came when they were too busy and would get a better experience if I came at a slower time.

Brandt's has been at this same location making great burgers since I was a little kid. I had the chicken quesadillas last night, and they were also quite good. If you're looking for good, solid bar food Brandt's is a great choice.

We were in on a Friday night around 6 o'clock. 

Our only seating choice was in "the basement" to the right of the entrance.

It's a small space with the fine stench of mold. That coupled with country music that was too loud and three flat-screen TV's was almost too much to take.

It took awhile to get a waitress and when she came, she wasn't the most pleasant woman.

Uncharacteristic of Brandt's (though we'd only been there two or three times previously), it took the better part of an hour to get our food (there were three of us).

The burgers tasted better on previous visits and the fries were cold.

I'll chalk it up to an "off" night for them, but they could do better.

Brandt's is ok - they didn't blow me away, but I don't hate it.

When I came in, I immediately noticed how there wasn't very much room at all. The tables are squished together (we ended up sitting at one right by the bathroom), you have to squeeze through people at the bar to get to your table or the bathroom, and the tables themselves are pretty small. Cozy would be putting it nice. I like to have a little more room to move.

The menu is pretty limited - one burger that you can customize with your choice of potato, some other sandwiches, soups, and salad. I got the burger, which was very tasty and juicy. I really don't have any complaints about the food or the prices. It's good for what you pay. They also have a decent selection of beers on draft and bottled.

The service was meh. When I first walked in I wasn't greeted. I had to ask if you seat yourself or if someone is supposed to seat you. When I was seated, I had a choice between 2 tables, neither of which had much room. Our waitress was a little snippy at first, but got better later on. 

I would come back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I definitely wouldn't come here with a big group of people.
New owners are still making one of the best bugers I've ever eaten I mean everything is really really good here
Place is small but packs a flavor punch. The burgers are huge and juicy. Recommend on a pretzel bun. The southwest chicken wrap has wonderful flavor. The sweet potato fries were crisp and plentiful.
Small place, so getting in some nights is hit or miss. The food is really good, and the divey bar ambiance is great. Prices are pretty reasonable.

Great food marred by horrible customer service... Don't let them seat you in the basement if they ask, unless you want to be ignored for the night. Had to ask another waitress to get our waitress two separate times. Then after getting our food, we didn't see her until we got check - otherwise I would have told her that my medium burger was still bright red inside. 

Food was great, but I sure didn't feel taken care of.
Brandt's do Palatine is one of my all time favorites! I've frequented this establishment numerous times and continue to reccomend this restaurant to everyone I know who enjoys awesome food!

We went to this place couple weeks ago, because we wanted to try the burgers everybody is talking about in their reviews. And we weren't disappointed! The burgers were amazing!! Great buns, great meat. Everything seemed fresh and was just very delicious! I'm taking a star off for the environment though. The bar area is ok, but the dining area is just ugly. Not cozy and not beautiful. We didn't check out the basement, so no comment on that ;)
Best burgers around! I love this place

Fresh half pound ground burger, fresh, fresh.....cooked anyway you like with trimmings of great pickles, sweet onions,  lettuce,  tomato. Several bun options. Fresh chips, good slaw. Perfect lunch spot. Dinner, get in line and put your name in.....always busy. Great neighborhood place, always freindly staff.

Back at Brandts, after 15 years.  My friend said it has not changed except it's been remodeled. Walking in the door nothing has changed. A remodel that looks 15 years in the past!!!! It does not matter. This burger is still one of the best in the Chicagoland area. Yum. Yes it has a small menu.  It is famous for burgers...not enchiladas, not ribs, not pasta,#SoGetABurger!!! Even the coleslaw is Yum!

Brandts has been remodeled and looks great!!!Amy was our server and she was great!!!When we came in there was a wait upstairs but found the basement to be open seating . So we chose to sit down there  which was nice and cool on a humid day. We started with cheese curds they are a must they are battered like fish and chips and come with 3 sauces. The homemade garlic ranch was the best!! We also ordered the  sunrise burger which  wasn't listed on the menu but has a fried egg  bacon cheddar cheese and your choice of bun we choose the butter bun for around $11 came with your choice of fries homemade chips and came with with coleslaw. We ordrred a full slab of ribs and meat fell off the bone it was so tender. Our friend ordered the corned beef sandwich on rye . The meat so tender and chopped with sauerkraut.  The beer selection was great too some nice ipa s... dogfish head, founders and anti hero. They also had Guinness, Stella ,miller, etc. If in the Palatine area stop in for a great burger cheese curds

Nice little beer and shot bar atmosphere but for a bar burger place...very poor value. Way too costly for below average food and service. Not really a destination location and the chances of me going back are very slim.

Worst service I have ever had. My daughter and I went for a dinner. We ordered an appetizer after which our waitress promptly disappeared.. 25 minutes later I had to look for someone to help. When the waitress finally came back, our appetizer order hadn't been entered. So another 20 or so minutes go by and we finally get our appetizer and order dinner. A half an hour after that the waitress comes back and tells us the cook left and we won't be getting anything. We arrived at Brandts about 6:15. We left after 8pm only having an appetizer. They comp'd the dinner but I will never go back. I get being busy. I get mishaps. But there was no communication or honesty about what was going on. That is ridiculous.
Very nice place, and super super super good burger...make sure to add bacon ($1.75)....again, it's vereeeerry good burger :)
Don't expect high end dining here. this is a great local beer/burger joint that does it right. can it be overcrowded? Yes, but its a BAR. the burgers are among the best in Chicago land area.
Amazing! Delicious. So good. Haven't had a burger this great in a long time. The pretzel roll melts in your mouth!
It would be nice if they posted closed on Sunday. Jus pulled up and they are closed on Sunday. Most businesses have it on the Website or Yelp alerts you they are closed.

Excellent food and their staff is incredibly friendly. Their burgers are amazing! Only thing to be aware of is that it's super small inside. If you go with more than 4 people, the wait is really long because there just isn't room.

Great little local place for a tasty burger, fresh cut fries and some darn good cheese curds.  The batter is light and delicious.  People are friendly, food is good, albeit a bit greasy (but what does one expect from a burger joint?). Worth checking out if you're in the area.

I discovered Brandt's about 2 years ago through a friend's recommendation.  The Brandt's Burger is seriously one of the greatest things that has ever happened to me.  I take my kids here with me whenever I go, and I'm the guy that always puts Creedence on the jukebox.  Love this place!!

I've seen Brandt's driving by and had always wanted to go.  From the outside it looks like an antique looking house, turned restaurant/bar so it caught my eye.  Last night my friend recommended we go so there was my chance.  As we walked in, we didn't get greeted right away so I was a little confused, but sure enough our waitress seated us and was very nice.  The place is smaller than what I expected but cozy.  The menu is very small.  Just some appetizers, a simple burger that you can customize, and a few higher end items.  Everyone raves about their burgers and sure enough they were right!  One of the best burgers in Palatine!

The Brandt's burger is fire!  Best burgers in the area. Order it with a pretzel bun, it's delicious. The place gets busy very quickly during lunch, which is the only time I've ever been here.  The place is on the small side so get there early.   Friendly and prompt service, and the burgers were cooked perfectly. If you're craving a burger, this is a must try spot.

You'd never really guess that Brandt's is a restaurant when you drive by, it has a slightly 'haunted house' vibe to it from the outside. Once inside that vibe turns into an over crowded but friendly neighborhood bar feel. 

We were a party of six and were seated at a table in the corner and were so wedged in that it was impossible for most of us to get up if we had to without the rest of the table also getting up. It really is a tiny restaurant with a few too many tables. 

I've been to Brandt's several times and I usually stick with their specialty, the Brandt burger, and this time was no exception.  I like my burgers pink and juicy, and this one was cooked pretty close to well done even though I had ordered it medium. No worries though, it was good. The burgers are pretty giant and I happily took half home for lunch the next day. 

The bar area is small and only has two small TVs, so if you're looking for a place to watch a game this may not be the best bet. 

Overall - good food, really good service but a little bit small and crowded.

Cozy neighborhood favorite. My burger was excellent, perfectly cooked with a side of homemade fries. The seating a little uncomfortable but it's a small price to pay IMO you can't get quality non chain restaurants just anywhere and I'm happy to support this favorite.

Brandt's is undoubtedly the best burger joint in Palatine. Not just because of the awesome burgers and "you got your money's worth" drinks, but they treat every customer there like they are family. Every time I go in there before I even sit down the bartender says "the usual?" And Even though they ask me how I'd like my burger cooked each time I order it, I'm sure they already know. When ordering, they are so particular about how you'd like your burger even going as far as asking if you would or would not like lettuce, tomato, grilled or raw onion. They'd rather take the time to ask customers instead of you waste your time picking off what you don't want. All of this has been the Brandt's tradition since it has been there. Anyway I give 5 stars to a place that no doubt deserves it!
Cool joint to just hang out at. Food and beers are decent. But watch out for that burger, it can be a slippery mess to eat.

Go for the 5 pack of sliders. Better than the regular burger. Ask for your fries to be crispy or they can be mushy. The ribs are really good and paired with some deep fried shrimp; really really good!

The food is good, known for their burgers! Although the Tee shirt sales seemed to stress our waitress out a bit. It was before they started getting busy.  Too bad they don't have a small display case there you can see what they had.

Best burgers in Palatine or the vicinity. Period. Since the reopen, the quality of the service went WAY up, too. The new butter bun is incredible, and they're always cooked to perfection. 

Other things we've ordered have been just fair...like the boneless wings, mac & cheese or the pretzel appetizer.  But the burgers bring tears to my eyes they're so good...every time.
Awesome food with great service. Had their Buffalo chicken wrap and loved it. I will be back.

Simply updated decor and remodeled 'wine room' makes Brandt's of Palatine a 'new' old favorite! 
The sliders on the appetizer menu are a nice touch for people looking to get that classic Brant's flavor in a smaller portion.  Sweet Potatoe fries are a nice addition to the newly updated menu. 
The bar scene is still the same, Tommy and all... and that's a good thing! 
Service is excellent! 
Can't wait for them to *hopefully* expand!
One of the best burgers I've had! Small place so get there early. Worth the wait tho.

Brandt's is an OLD family favorite....The burgers were outstanding...good old fashioned juicy burgers.  Wine and beer selection was good...the Wine I had was very nice just a little high priced for a location like this. The only reason we didn't put a 5 start...was the service.  Waitress was nice, but felt she was rushing us at one point and forgot us at another.  Not a reason to never go back though....look forward to the next time!

I can honestly say brants has the best burger in the Chicagoland area and yes I've had kumas. It's small and a bit cramped inside but the service is good and the staff are friendly. Get a pretzel bun and I like the sweet potato fries. A bit pricey but worth it.

By far the best burgers in the suburbs. They are cooked to order so it takes some time for them to come out, no problem, this is not a fast food restaurant. The atmosphere is cozy but crowded, you have to keep in mind that this is a historic building. But the food is delicious, I tried the fries and other appetizers and wasn't disappointed a bit. The drinks are generous in size and not overpriced. Service is good but not the best, they seem to be able to get the food out in the right time but don't seem to always be able to keep the beverages replaced. This issue would never keep me from going back, definitely a must try.

I went get a burger, but i am not eating wheat or dairy.I ordered the burger with grilled onions lettuce and tomato. The waitress was super generous with the lettuce leaves and the tomato. I made lettuce wraps with the burgers. The burger was perfectly cooked. Thank you to my waitress who made my bun less burger experience worth a return trip soon

Went to Brandt's in Palatine last night. Arrived at 7:15 got a table at 7:50. No problem there, there is usually a bit of a wait. Ordered right away. 8:45 and no food in sight. I did however notice that carry-out orders were "flying" out of the kitchen in record speed. At this point 6 tables were occupied but none had received their meal. When I noticed a party of 7 seated across from us, 45 minutes earlier, still had not received their food I knew something was amiss. One member in our party ordered pretzels which took 30 minutes to arrive. At 8:50 we asked for our check as we had no desire to wait any longer for our food. Just as we were about to leave our waitress told us our food would arrive at any minute. Too late. We told Jodie- the manager on duty of our dissatisfaction and she was very apologetic and professional but had no explanation for the delay. We have been patrons of Brandt's for 35 years and have never experienced this. My question is who's decision was it to fill all the carry -out orders before the people actually sitting in the restaurant?

I finally visited Brandt's after they reopened with a slightly different name (Brandt's of Palatine instead of Brandt's Little Cafe).  Upon entering, I noticed that there was very little change from the last time I was here, which is good because I loved the character of the little cafe.  The downstairs area looks like it was the most renovated, now there's a TV & a few high top tables with stools compared to what appeared to be maybe a total of 2 tables before.  

They used to have a small illuminated board with a few menu items, now they have a regular menu which has a lot more choices than before which was a much needed change.  Their burgers haven't changed which is phenomenal, but now they give you some choices to go along with your burger.  Each one comes with 2 sides, you can choose from fries, chips, sweet potato fries, cole slaw. mac & cheese, veggies & maybe 1 or 2 other things.  You can also pick which kind of bun you want, I opted for the pretzel but found that it was tougher to bite through than your typical buttered bun.  The fact that they added a whole appetizer section to their menu makes me want to stop in, have a few drinks at the bar/downstairs & order some appetizers instead of a full blown meal like I've been accustomed to.  Make sure to check out the historical significance of the building when you're reading the menu, it's a trip to picture this place back in the prohibition days!

Classic palatine staple.  Like being in a north woods tavern.  New owners have put lots of $ into upgrades, but old charm still there . Great burgers, solid food, excellent bar, great prices and happy helpful service .  Can't wait to see if they add outdoor seating.  Must stop by

I come here just for the burgers. The restaurant is very small and the noise from the bar carries over. Despite this, the Brandt's burger is just too good to pass up. It comes with a myriad of bun and cheese selections, and the fries it comes with are delicious. Very reasonably priced for the large portion. I'd recommend the Brandt's  burger on a pretzel bun with American cheese, and the homemade fries.

Got Brandt's to-go tonight.  It was delicious!  Even after the drive home the fries were still crispy!  That's an accomplishment for take out. The only reason I'm giving only 4 stars is because I would like to see a little more diverse menu.  What we had was delicious, but we had to compromise on our food choices.

I've been going to Brandts Little Cafe for years and was heartbroken when they closed their doors...

But now that they have reopened, my heart has been mended.  The food is excellent with great new additions to the menu.  My personal weakness are the sweet potato fries.  They are KILLER.... and addicting!

The new owners did the place justice!!! It's hard to change a regular's place and make them like the place more.  My entire family are regulars now... three generations brought up on Brandt's.  Have to love a place that can make the whole family happy!

You have to check them out for classic pub food with some surprising twists.

I used to go to Brandt's at least once a week for lunch, but although the quality of the food is the same, since they re-opened I'm always afraid to.  It seems that the kitchen now is always really slow.  I only have 1 hour for lunch so I give them a try about once a month to see if they have fixed the problem and today was the day.  I just ordered the hamburger which is what they are famous for and it took 40 minutes to get the food.  It's a burger not a 7 course meal.  That means I had to eat it too fast so that I could get back to work.  Val kept my glass of tea full, and kept telling me it would be soon, but waiting 40 minutes for a burger means it is going to be awhile before I go back again.

Nice to have a great burger place close by.  The new owners have fixed up the place but kept the old charm,  At our table we tried burgers, chili and ribs - all were excellent.  Must order the home made chips on the side.

Had lunch at Brandt's yesterday.  Food was excellent and the place looks pretty much as it did before the new owners took over.  Was with a friend and we both had the Brandt burger..just as good as before.  Also had the fresh chips with ranch dressing...prefect with my burger.  The new owner, Walt came over to see if everything was OK which was cool.  Price was right and there is something good about supporting a local business.

Seriously the best pierogi in Chicago. The cheddar and cheese ones make me salivate just thinking about them. Good kielbasa too. I eat here at least once a week for lunch and I don't see that changing anytime soon. Keep up the good work ladies!

The food was fantastic! 

I ordered the pierogi plate. My aunt had the keilbasa plate. 

The only thing I did NOT like about this place was it was completely empty and the owner (at least I think she was the owner) rushed me with my pierogi options and stuck multiples of ones I had only ordered one of. I was like B!$@h relax. You don't have anything to do relax and pick my damn pierogi!!!!!

The pierogi are all steamed which is fine, but I prefer them to have a lil crisp burnt edge. That's how I make them at home with saut√©ed onions and it's so good!!! These were good tho and already made which is a plus. I haven't been back to this place tho and to be honest idk if I will for the simple fact of I don't like being rushed.

If you're in the mood for Polish food definitely stop in here. The food is authentic and good.

I really dislike European food, and barely like Italian. So when my friend suggested we check this place out I wasnt really thrilled. I tried polish food here for the first time and loved the pierogis. 

I ordered cheese, mushroom, potato and cheese, spinach and cheese and had it topped with the butter and onion sauce and really liked it. 

I even tried a fruit pierogi and thought it was just ok. I also ordered a soup it had dumplings in it too and found the serving size to be pretty generous.

Ive returned and watched my coworkers order sausage and cabbage, and like it but im not that adventurous and probably wouldnt like it. 

Overall this little spot is great and made me love pierogis. The ladies working here are pretty friendly too and help you order if you dont know what you are doing like me.
My Mother and I walked into this little pierogi restaurant not knowing what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised at the tasty food! I will definitely be coming back here
Fresh, cooked to perfection, fast and cheap. Authentic Polish food, prepared homemade in a fast food atmosphere. Stop at this indiscriminate place and enjoy.

My wife discovered this Polish Bistro. Small and quiet. 10 varieties of pierogi's in quantities of 7, 9 or 12 plus they have blintz's! Polish noodle dish with cabbage and a polish sausage dinner with mashed potatoes and cold sauerkraut is what my wife and I enjoyed. The quality and authenticity of the food took me back 30+ years to my grandmothers dining room. Very moderately priced. I will definitely be back.

I'll keep this review short. The food is great and I honestly mean that. Homemade taste and properly prepared. As a Polish American who eats Polish food regularly I know what I am talking about :) Not your typical lunch place. This place actually offers great food for a great price. We're coming back soon!

It's a shame they are located away where they are, otherwise the place would enjoy more business (I feel). But who cares and that's just my opinion anyway!

This place is amazing.

Two words: meat pierogis.

Seriously.

My mouth is watering.

Great food, friendly service and good prices.

This is by far, the best Polish food I have ever eaten. I should know something, being from Eastern Europe originally and having had plenty a bad Polish meal before. 

This place is truly different. What a gem!! The Pierogi are divine, plump, delicious, true authentic food for those who want to experience amazing Polish food made from scratch by a lovely lady who is also the hostess and the server. Too bad I live on the other side of the country, otherwise I would eat here every day!!! If you are coming through Shaumburg and have only one free night, like me, dont miss the opportunity. There will always be another steakhouse on your business trip, but only one EJ Pierogi deliciousness.

If you like Polish food then you will love this place. My husband grew up eating Polish food and when we saw this place we had to give it a try. He loved it! We had the potatoes and cheese pierogis as well as the special (sausage, potatoes and cabbage). The soup looked really good. You can buy Frozen pierogis as well. Very authentic!
Best home made polish food around. Highly recommend . Awesome food people and service.

The pierogis are large and pretty good. This place is not very crowded which is nice because I able to enjoy my lunch rather than rush. I tried the spinach, meat and potato and cheese and they were all delicious.

Wow! I always wanted to stop here and I am glad I did!! I grew up with polish food and you cannot beat the pierogies! I have been to several Polish restaurants in the Chicagoland area and this is my favorite. This is sort of a fast food kind of joint. Located in the light industrial neighborhood of Elk Grove, Illinois....they probably make most of their revenue during lunch with many blue collared workers coming in. Most are Polish immigrants with a mix of others. The restaurant is super clean and very nice despite the location. Both of my parents are from Poland and the food is simply amazing and tastes like my moms cooking!

Price wise was just right. U can come in and ask which pierogies u want. U will have a selection of meat, cheese, potatoes, etc. it would cost 7.99 for 9 from what I remember. They have other Polish foods available such as Borsch, kielbasa (sausage), and blintzes. 

They do speak Polish so they is a plus for newly arrived immigrants. Sorry...no alcohol here and I can see why. This is a lunchtime place that I noticed. Hard working blue collared people frequent this place for lunch. I don't think they open during Sundays.

I'm very sorry but when You called your place "...pierogi" it's supposed to mean that they are really special, homemade (at least ) instead of that they are from polish distributor "aleksandra" - average , nothing special , far away to delicious .  However your zapiekanka is pretty good

I had passed by this place a few times and finally decided to go there. I fell in love with the pierogi. I tried the meat, potato and cheddar and they were amazing. I also tried an open faced type sandwich called zapniaka (I probably misspelled it) and it was great too. Everything tastes homemade. The restaurant was very clean. The only thing that threw me off was that the person working at the time was not friendly at all. Did not even get a smile. I would definitely go back just for the food. They need to work on making customers feel welcome.

There is nothing else like this place around the area. Amazingly hot and fresh Polish food! There is a chance you may be waiting but the food is always worth the wait. Don't skimp on the onions and bacon on your food either. 

I only wish cabbage rolls were served everyday. Side note - call ahead to ask.

Had the cheese blintzes and red borscht with dumplings and they were all excellent. When we first tried the soup, my polish boyfriend said, "thats real polish borscht right there". We also had the goulash with potatoes and beets and was very satisfied with that as well. The meat in the goulash was very tender. 
Service was also great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Unlike some places, they bothered to speak English to me and explain the dishes. Its a good place to go if you're curious about polish food. They also sell pierogies frozen which you can take to cook at a later time. Will definitely come back to try their other dishes. 
Gave this place 5 stars for great price, service and taste. I encourage others to come check this place out too.
Really authentic assorted stuffed pierogis. I really good value. Great for carry out. First time I'll return for sure.
As described by others. Make sure you check their hours before going.   Worth a drive.   Highly recommended, lot of options. The dessert pierogis were awesome too!
AMAZING!  I love all their pierogies but my favorites are the spinach and the mushroom/kraut.  Made fresh daily and the prices are very good.

Love this place!!! They're fast, great prices and amazing food! Perfect location for anyone that works in the industrial area. Decent selection of different foods as well. Wish I could go on a weekly basis

Delicious pierogis! Homemade, served by the owner. I'm not too familiar with polish food but my goodness may I please have some more? 

My favorite was the potato and cheese pierogis (go with the onion and bacon topping- you won't regret it) followed by strawberry and blueberry (dessert pierogis are good, a little doughy but still yummy)!

Polish sausage and cabbage are great. 

Perfect for take out or a quick bite for lunch. A small place with a huge killing on the menu! A must visit

WOW! As you can tell from my previous posts I LOVE pierogi. I found EJ Pierogi when I was in the mood for a good Pierogi and I didn't want to go downtown to get my fix. I bought two dozen, a dozen of mixed fruit with Blueberry, Strawberry and Plum; all of them where YUMMY but the strawberry was my favorite. I also bought a dozen of savory to sample, Kraut and Mushrooms, Potato and cheese and spinach; again all of them where delicious but my favorite was the kraut and mushroom! I will definitely be back to try more things on the menu. 
I asked the very friendly lady behind the counter if everything was homemade and she said yes, which makes everything even better!

The food was alright but the customer service was not good. The lady working there was not friendly at all. When I ordered pierogis, she rudely asked how many like I was wasting her time not telling her right away. Also my wife ordered the 3 cheese blintzes and only got 2. We decided not to say anything to the lady since she already been so rude and we didn't want to deal with her again.
Pierogi's are good.   Pass on the rest.

I found this place about 4 years ago and try to visit it at least once a year when I am in the area. I have taken several other people and they now also try and make it there when in the area. Love that it's a basic place, not a lot of extras. Simple menu made by people who are very nice. Prices are very reasonable and I love the Polish Borscht.

This place is awful! All the food we ordered (3 people) came with the same sauce, The soup was thin and tasteless, and everything is served on paper plates with plastic utensils!!!! Go to Ugazdy on Irving Park Rd. for good Polish food,

First time eating there a few weeks ago.  I am in the hospitality business, specifically food and beverage.  The place is clean staff is friendly and the food????  Well I recommend you eat up and decide if you like it as much as I did. Prices are reasonable. See you all soon.
Good pierogi - but I am not an expert

Stopped there at lunch picked up a dozen potato (cheaper by the dozen).  Excellent!! Will be going back after work to pickup 2 dozen more of different flavored to share tonight!! Very friendly and helpful staff.
Wife brought home Mushroom/Kraut, Spinach/Cheese and Potato/Cheese pierogis, Sausage, Cabbage, and Cheese blintzes.  Yum!!!!

When was the last time I said "let's go out for Polish food?" 

Answer: never. 

It was a Friday afternoon. We're out of turkey for sandwiches and the hubby says we'll just go out for lunch today since we're out of turkey. Ok, no problem. 

Friday morning at the office, I decide to ask my 'work mom' if she would like to be my lunch date today and she accepts.

I'm pretty much over all the same average food in the Elk Grove area and being restricted to a half hour lunch, you can't travel too far to dine out so I jumped on Yelp to see if there are any new places in the area and up pops EJ Pierogi! 

After reading a few reviews, we decided to make this our lunchtime destination. Our coworker (who is Polish, btw) kinda invites himself to join us for lunch after my work mom offered to bring him back something and let me tell you, I'm so glad he did. He totally turned out to be our Polish ambassador! I found myself asking him what was what and would I like this or that?

At first, I wasn't sure if the lady behind the counter didn't like me but it turned out she was very kind and informative. By the end of our visit, she was growing on me and seemed very appreciative of me taking photos to post online to advertise their adorable establishment. 

Now this place is not located in the nicest building, but they really transformed what used to be a subway into a cute neighborhood place. They are located in the same building as the quick oil change place and next to a rundown hotel, but when you're inside this restaurant, you kinda feel like you're at someone's home (someone with a hot bar, that is).  The d√©cor is minimal but the place is clean and tidy. The dining area is open and if they were packed full of people, it would not feel too crowded by any means.

They have all kinds of pierogis. Fruit, meat, potato and cheddar, cheese, mushroom, you name it! 

Did you know how filling pierogis can be? Neither did I! 

The two and a half of the NINE pierogis I ordered were fabulous. For pierogis, that is. I don't know much about them but they were tast-teeeeeee!!!

I did make time to ask "what is the meat in the 'meat' pierogis?" and she informed me that it's a mixture of pork and beef. Thank goodness. I was a little scared there for a minute.

We were there a while waiting for them to fix up some blintz and soup, so we did figure out that if we ever want to dine here again, we would have to call in our order ahead of time. While we waited, we ask a lot of questions about different items on the menu and while I was walking around snapping pictures like a tourist in Italy (or Poland. maybe), I saw they make goulash!!! Now, I'll tell you a little something about me. As picky as I am about my food, and as much of a scaredy cat I can be when it comes to trying new things, I grew up with a European step-father. He used to make goulash and cabbage rolls and all sorts of things you wouldn't imagine I would ever try, but I did try these things growing up and really found I like a lot of these different foods. Keep the cabbage away, but I'll eat the stuffing inside in a cabbage roll or give me goulash any day of the week! I'll eat that stuff up! So I decided the next time we go, I will order the goulash if they have it available. 

We saw a sign for "finger dumplings" and asked what they are...we were informed they are little potatoes...but they take 7 minutes to make so we'll have to get those next time. 

Both of my coworkers ordered the Borscht soup. He liked it a bit more than she did. It didn't look too appetizing to me. They did have a chicken and dumpling soup on the menu that I debated ordering but glad I didn't because that would have just been too much food! He had the Kielbasa sausage and cabbage with potatoes and inhaled it! Both my work mom and I stuck with the pierogis and blintz as our main dish. I like the pierogis. It's not something I would eat regularly, but I did enjoy my lunch. I was a little surprised at how filing the pierogis can be!! I think it's the dough. It's pretty heavy. Like I said, I ate 2-1/2 of my pierogis and sent the rest home with my coworker because I wasn't going home after work nor did I think they would keep for another day or two. 

EJ Pierogi has a coupon deal on www.restaurant.com available for $2.00 with a $5 value with a minimum purchase of $7.50 so you can save a few dollars here. 

I'll definitely be back. Next time, I'm sharing an order of pierogis with someone else or trying the goulash and definitely getting an order of those finger dumplings!!! I'm so happy that I tried something new. I was not disappointed!

*This business has two different listings so this is a duplicate of my review*

We took advantage of the 50% off coupon and went to town on that menu!

We ordered:
- Red Borscht - classic and tasty with those mini dumplings
- Kraut & mushroom pierogies - new flavor to me and fantastic
- Potato & cheddar - my new favorite. Serious comfort food in a dumpling!
- Meat - meh, the meat was on the dry side and didn't really pack an flavor making for a sandy texture.
- Spinach & cheese - excellent savory choice with plenty of spinach.
- Pyzy Meat - pretty much the star of the show. It's like a round, meat stuffed dough ball of fluffy, chewy deliciousness. Little pockets of heavenly comfort food is what they were. These must be eaten fresh because they get hard after a night in the fridge and don't soften up with heat.

Prices are decent even without the coupon but the coupon makes it easy to try a little bit of everything to quickly become familiar with their menu. Good home cooking for a decent price means I'll be back again and again!

Went there tonight for the first time and loved it real homemade Polish food was so good very good quality food big portions and tasty well seasoned clean place good service family owned nice big menu 3 soups to choose from 9 pierogi choices owners so nice very reasonable priced they have my business for sure will be back so if you want some good homemade food give them a try you will be back thank you Ej Pierogi for a delicious dinner tonight
My husband and I experienced the fabulous pierogi today.  OMGOSH!  We will be going there very very often.  Terrible location, but the food is absolutely delicious!
Pierogi's good.   The rest of the food, not so much.   Stuffed cabbage was horrible, but sauce was good.   Sorry, but not a repeat customer.

Awesome pierogi, always stop by here on way home when i know the fridge is empty. LOL.

Food is great, blintzes with farmers cheese are the bomb. They are like a desert.

The lady behind the counter is always nice and smiling, did i say that her pierogi are awesome.

If you go here make sure to smother your pierogi with bacon bits. [Insert picture of homer simpson drool]
Love the polish food. It's my first time to dine here and didn't regret it. Good dinner for us. Highly recommending this for everyone to try

Amazing food!!!!! The Cabbage roll is just like mom makes! Pierogis we cooked to perfection!!! Good prices and the owner is super nice and thankful for our business. I can't wait to go back and try more food!

The best damn pierogi in town! ;-) 
Very friendly helpful staff and nice quiet place. The food is delicious and professionally prepared. There are many options and possibilities to order meals. In the menu there is also some "very interesting" soups  ;-)
I personally highly recommend this place for a really good meal. 
Dumplings stuffed with spinach or potato with cheddar cheese filling... #1!! 
And ZAPIEKANKA :-))

I Recommend the mushroom & kraut and cheese pierogis, The polish sausages and the cheese blintzes.  The blintzes are magical. Their entire menu is delish! 

Yum yum. My favorite lunch spot.

I live near the place and recently had some left over Pierogis from a ceremony at my daughter's school so I thought I'd check it out.

The place is immaculate. Clean and a modern interior. I'd have no problem staying here to eat. Nevertheless, I was getting a big order for the family and had to get home.

We ordered:
12 Potato Pierogis
3 Spinach Pierogis
3 Meat Pierogis
3 Kraut & Mushroom Pierogis
3 Cheese and Potato Pierogis
2 Polish "Hamburger" Patties
Dumplings
Polish Sausage
3 Cheese Blintzes

The Pierogis are great. A good size but not too doughy. I particularly liked the Spinach Pierogis.

The Polish "Hamburger" patties were good. My wife did not like hers as much as I liked mine. The ones we normally get at another place are saltier, which apparently my wife prefers. I actually liked EJ Pierogis patty more because it was not as salty.

My wife and kids loved the dumplings. They were all gone without minutes. I'm not a big fan of dumplings so I have to take their word. The dumplings were larger than your typical Silesian dumplings.

The polish sausage was huge. Flavorful and well cooked. They even added cooked onions. The sausage by itself, on a roll or bread, could have easily been somebody's lunch.

Finally...the blintzes. OUTSTANDING. Sweet cheese on the inside and a soft dough on the outside. They sprinkle butter and sugar on them too. Blintzes are a tricky thing---sometimes there's too much dough and too little filling and vice versa. This place has it down to a science. I have to say they were the best cheese blintzes I've ever had.

For all this food we paid $39. We had a $5 restaurant.com gift certificate so it was $34. Really not that bad of a price considering all the food. It fed a family of four and we had leftovers. 

I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant. They even serve goulash, soup, and some kind of mushroom and melted mozzarella sandwich that looked amazing. The server behind the counter was very nice and very helpful when explaining the menu to you. It's now my must-stop for Polish fast-food in the Elk Grove Village area.

This little place is great!!!  Great pierogi!!!  My faves are the spinach and cheese, and potato and cheese.  

The red borsch soup with choice of mushroom or meat dumpling is great.  Just like my mom makes :-)

If you are looking for something lighter, try the fruit filled pierogi.

Smacznego!
Here's a place with hot and fresh cooked polish food. A diamond in the rough. 1st time here and definitely not the last.

For this price- one can't go wrong. 
The choice is pretty basic polish traditional food. 
The quality of food is ok. The quantity is great for the price.
Good parking, I think they might have the outside sitting, not available on my visit.
Good parking. The pictures i saw in some other reviews, don't do this place justice: there is room for improvement, but it is def not as ghetto as it looks from the outside.
And yes, zapiekanka (Polish pizza bread). At quarter of the price that any other place has it for! And still very good!
In desperate need of a website, my work is not far from there, but it's hard to order for few people, when we don't know the items.

Without Phil's glowing review of this place I would have NEVER found or tried EJ Pierogi's so just trust us and try it. EJ Pierogi is attached to the side of a gas station, probably in what was a Subway, and easy to miss.

I found Phil's 50% coupon off a second pierogi plate on MoneyMailer HERE and good until 11/30 but prices are very reasonable anyway.
http://www.moneymailer.com/coupons/online/60007/dining/690763

I liked the meat, potato & cheese, kraut & shroom, and sweet cheese piergos the best but they were ALL good. You can have grilled onions or bacon added on top, I went with the bacon and it worked. Not fancy but very clean and nicely decorated. We just scratched the surface here starting with the perogi special, lots more pictures here. Yumbola.
https://www.facebook.com/E.J.Pierogi 

We liked the Pierogis so much we bought another dozen to split for our parents, perfect parent comfort food...maybe they'll forgive you.
And we really liked Ewa the owner. Tell her Yelp sent you. Smacznego!

Best recycled Quiznos ever.

The pierogi were great and as others have said, the pyzy are great too. Something else not to miss -- the soup with dumplings -- simple but so tasty.  On top of it, the staff are really nice.

I hate to say it because the owner seems to be a very nice young lady I tried her pierogies they just didn't measure up my ex wife is made pierogies for years and years and years and this girl's pierogies are just not as not good I can't say how disappointed I was especially because when I met her she spoke with a very strong polish accent I went in there may be expecting too much it's just really disappointed me I'm sure there are some polish stores around although I haven't found one that make better pierogies I will eventually find one

Stopped in on a whim for some homemade frozen pierogis to go. Took home sauerkraut & mushroom, potato & cheese, and spinach & cheese. Boiled them and then fried them in a little butter to brown. Enjoyed them with a dollop of sour cream. All were delicious, but the spinach were my favorite. Don't have many reasons to be in Elk Grove, but I'll be sure to stop in next time I'm in the area.

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!! Went in here for a quick lunch one day to check it out and got some pierogi's and some blintz. Everything was soggy and doughy, it was all in the garbage. Had a foul odor to the pierogi's too, so I just got turned off automatically. I love pierogi's but these are just under cooked and doughy and wet. Would never come back here again.

Wow!  We stopped by as we were passing through the area and now have found a new favorite place for lunch.  The pierogi were outstanding!  We especially like the kraut & mushroom, potato and cheese, strawberry and sweet cheese.  We took several dozen frozen ones to enjoy at home since we live out of the area.  The service from Ewa was friendly and warm.  She was extremely helpful to us as well.  The restaurant is very clean as well as the restrooms.  We will definitely be back again and again!  They had quite a selection of food.
Really good pierogi - especially the sweet cheese!

So the paper plates & paper bowl for soup was a little strange but the flavors made up for it definitely.  Delicious potato & cheddar pierogis drenched in onion & bacon, sausage was perfectly garlicky, but the mushroom zapiekanka was probably my favorite.  Staff are friendly, prices fair, it's not the best location but worth it.

I came across this restaurant by accident while buying from wholesale tile and stone counter top suppliers in the neighborhood. Just by looking at it's clean cheerful facade I could tell that it was going to be genuine cheap eats.  I especially like the spinach and cabbage with mushroom pierogi.  The blintzes are well made from scratch but of the sweeter persuasion.  The soups and lunch plates are all best of kind...tasting just like Mama made them.  Great peasant food.  Worth the drive if you like a genuine ethnic experience.

These are the best Pierogi I ever had!     The service is fast, the place is spotless, and the prices are decent.     Well worth the every penny!     love the Sauerkraut and mushroom pierogi's!!!!    YUM.

Excellent Polish fare, best Pierogi I have ever had this side of Gdansk. The restaurant is tucked away next to an auto repair joint and you can easily miss it. Exceptionally clean restaurant and washroom in a proud and meticulous family-owned eatery. Superb pyzy, borscht and blintzes. Great service from the ladies behind the counter adds the final touch. Highly recommended
Definitely the place to go for pierogi. Coming from a polish family, these are definitely on point. They have a great variety of not your typical ones too.
Great lunch spot. Very friendly service. She recommended the Pierogis, I ordered a variety and they were the best I have ever had.

Delish! Their pierogi are amazing. I've tried them with kraut/mushrooms and potato/cheddar. Both were great! The dough is just the right consistency, not too thick. Nine pieces will fill you up just right! 

I'm definitely coming back to try some more dishes. The place is very clean and welcoming.

good to see a Polish corner fast food instead of another Spanish. This Polish Bistro has many choices and everything looked very good. The Polish sausage and pierogi's with meat were excellent and the place has a variety of eastern European soups to choose from. they also serve breakfast and I imagine it is as good as their lunches.
Really good!  Authentic and delicious.  I like the potato and cheese though the cheddar and cheese is good as well.   I will try others and will be returning.
Delisious Pierogi's!

For what it is, a simple, homespun Polish food joint, it's perfect! I have only tried the savory pierogi, but all of them were quite tasty--I would love to try the sweet ones next. The service was pleasant, the restaurant was borderline-rustic but very clean, and the price was on point (plenty of pierogi to eat for under $8). A great lunch option to add to your mix!

The most tender delicate pierogi I've ever had. My favorite was the kraut and mushroom. They were very flavorful and juicy.
The polish sausage had a crisp tight casing and the meat was well seasoned.The sausage was accompanied by a creamy cooked cabbage and mashed potatoes. They we're velvety and smooth. 
I had started with a delicious Borscht soup with mushroom pierogi gently submerged in fragrant, rich tangy broth. It was one of the most sensuous meals I've ever had! 
Our hostess was attentive and available, seeking our opinion with every presentation. 
The atmosphere was as casual as it was affordable! It's a MUST GO, if you're at all interested in a passionate, yet unpretentious presentation of Polish cuisine!
Alas, they were closed today. Tomorrow I return to try the "zapiekanka" a beautifully offered baguette blanketed in cheese and mushrooms and deliciousness. I'm saving myself for it like a virgin on her wedding night!

The hotel offered us White Castle and Subway. 
YELP saved the day!

We headed into wilds of Elk Grove Village for this gem!  Loved the plump and delicious pierogis! !! We Had the meat, kraut, and strawberry as well as borscht.  Great value,  great taste,  not fancy but very satisfying!  We will be back

I stopped here after seeing a Yelp review!  I'm glad I did!  Great food and reasonable prices.  The lady was very nice and helpful.  I will definitely recommend this to others. Great cabbage and polish

Don't let the exterior turn you away.  I went here for lunch with mom on a saturday. There were only 2 tables full when we got there about 12:30 but it quickly filled up. We shared a plate of pierogi (spinach, meat and cheddar/potato), I got the polish sausage special and mom got a stuffed cabbage. The prices are very reasonable. The service is pretty quick and friendly and it is clean and neat inside. The food is ok, I don't understand the 4 & 5 stars, but perhaps for this area, this is the best polish food available. The polish sausage was mild and it said it came with cabbage which turned out to be coleslaw. I was expecting boiled or fried cabbage, but I like coleslaw. Mom said the stuffed cabbage was ok.  My mom liked the spinach pierogi and I prefered the potato/cheddar. I live near the Brickyard which is home to a lot of polish restaurants, so compared to some of those places, EJ is not quite as good, but you can't beat their prices.

Yum yum yum! Tried this place for dinner a few nights ago and absolutely lived it! I had the spinach and sauerkraut/mushroom pierogis and my boyfriend had the meat and cheese/potato. All four were delicious. We will definitely be going back. Can't wait to try the cheese blintzes next!
Meat Pierogis were outstanding!! I will definitely be coming here often. I was very impressed and the prices are very reasonable.

Keep in mind, I'm Mexican reviewing Polish food BUT living in Mount Prospect,  we have our share of Polish people with many Polish markets around so I've had pierogi and other great Polish food.  This is the best I've had!  No questions asked... just come here and eat!

No frills, but very clean. Delicious food served cafeteria-style. Prices are great! One can mix and match pierogies. The flavor so took me right back to my childhood in Siberia. Thumbs up!! ... Oh, bring cash!

I found this place to be a very tasty, quick, reasonably priced, lunch option. Their menu is focused on pierogi but there are a few other options.  I'm going to have to try the Pork Goulash eventually, if I can resist ordering pierogi. Of the few times I've been here (of the many more to come I hope), I've tried the meat, potato and cheddar, and kraut and mushroom.   I've always had mine with the optional bacon and optional onions which top those pierogi off nicely.

As others have said, it is next to a car repair shop off a busy intersection and you might miss it otherwise. Do your taste buds a favor and try this place.

Have had pierogi, kopytka, and the red borscht soup from here. All very good. It's very clean and wall color/decor was soothing to my eyes.. Really easy to eat there often as it is a quick service restaurant and food that you actually want to eat again and again.
Great Pierogi's, Go there any chance I get when in the Elk Grove area...just catered from them  for a party i'm having. A+++
FANTASTIC!!!!!  The Cheddar and Potato Pierogies are to die for.  Worth looking for this whole in the wall.  A wonderful experience.  Dump the fast food hamburger joints and get the good stuff.

This is a nice place with very good pierogi and pyzy I rate them higher than Helens in Wood Dale. The dumplings were just right, nice bite to them not mushy and overcooked. The fillings ( I tried all of them except meat and the desert ones) were quite tasty. My husband loved the Borscht with meat dumplings. This place is perfect for when you get a craving for dumplings, like I do once in a while. Prices are very reasonable $4.99 for 7 pieces. The ladies behind the counter were VERY nice and friendly. I will definatly be back soon. Hope they last, being stuck in the obscure corner they are in may not be to their benefit. and I would have never known they existed if I hadn't happened to be stuck at light and noticed the sign on the corner. no advertising that I have seen.

La Tasca made a great first impression as my first tapas restaurant.

Atmosphere: separated dining areas that give you a cozy feel in a large restaurant. There was soft music playing in the background and a muted baseball game at the bar.

Service: The staff was very knowledgeable regarding their menu. Our server was also very accommodating and professional. 

Food: pincho de solomillo, pollo de castilla, empanada de carne, los tres mosqueteros, Spanish rice, caramel flan, and mango sangria. The pincho de solomillo was delicious. The tender meat, soft dough, and crunchy fries combined perfectly in my mouth. The pollo de castilla was a bit too dry for me. However the los tres mosqueteros was perfect with the Spanish rice. The meats were juicy and the rice was soft. Yet their shining achievement was the empanada de carne. It was more of a meat pastry than the homemade empanadas my Hispanic friends' mothers would make. The dough was flaky, sweet, and soft. The meat was tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned. I never wanted it to end. As a bonus, the caramel flan was also a creamy heaven. The sangria was like any other. 

Overall: I will come again just for the empanada. I would even be here everyday if it wasn't on the expensive side!

I have to be honest with you - I do not love tapas restaurants. I've been to a lot of "tapas" restaurants that are hipster divebars that serve tiny plates of unexceptional American-fusion food, all at a jacked up price.

So, take this 5-star review with the opposite of a grain of salt. This restaurant is stunningly good. As I dug into my macchiato (which the bar man nailed), I looked over a menu where I just couldn't order everything I wanted to order. I got 2 deserts, the nut cake and flan. Both were superb.

A note on authenticity. I've never been to Europe, but I bet this place would fit right in as a Spain-Spanish restaurant. Espresso drinks on point, daring fish dishes on the menu. The beer list is practically all Spanish imports. This is the opposite of the lousy hipster tapas places I've been to in the past, and I really appreciate that. 

For the record, I did not leave hungry.

Having first gotten the tapa experience at one of THE tapas restaurants in the city (Caf√© Ba-Ba-Reeba) I wasn't entirely sure that La Tasca could live up to the pre-set standards in my mind.  I tried so very hard to be open-minded about this restaurant, but I kept getting this nagging feeling in the pit of my stomach.  Meh, I said as I tried to ignore this feeling and give a fair chance to La Tasca Restaurant.  To be totally honest, I probably would not have come here anyway were it not for a Groupon offer that my fianc√© and I had been looped into getting.  I soon thereafter realized why I was never inclined to dine at this restaurant other than out of pure convenience...the quality of the food was not even close to comparable.

Of course, I didn't know this walking into the restaurant but that sixth sense told me I wasn't going to be having some phenomenal experience.  One of the very first indicators that La Tasca was going to fall in comparison was the taste (and perhaps size of the pitcher) of sangria.  Having had a long day at work, my fianc√© and I were in desperate need of some sangria only this came out tasting like pure red wine with some ice cubes and cut-up apples tossed in there for shits and giggles.  With that being said, the sangria was not sweet, and in fact it was somewhat tart.  Secondly, the pitcher of sangria was tiny in comparison to the one at Caf√© Ba-Ba-Reeba; at both places we paid about $27 for a pitcher, but unlike Caf√© Ba-Ba-Reeba where we each got about 3-4 full glasses, this pitcher only served about 2 glasses per person.  It's kind of a rip-off when you think about it this way.

I hate to continuously make comparisons, but I feel it is the only way to judge this place.  The variety of offerings here was alright, but not phenomenal; with that being said we ordered four different tapas plates: the trio sausage plate, the meatballs, the beef and cheese empanada, and the octopus de galena.  The sausage plate was good, but some of the meats seemed a little rubbery.
