The empanada was good, but could have been better had there been a greater amount of fillings in it; I'd say that about half the empanada was nothing but the casing...albeit good because of its croissant-like texture.  The meatballs were delicious and I would have gladly had more!  But the best deal was definitely the octopus...this plate was only about $10 (similar to the others) and it was filled with octopus.  The octopus was cooked perfectly, and oh was it yummy!  I love me some tentacles.

Though we were already feeling the hurt after eating all these tapas, we had the paella Valencia...now, mind you - we had this same paella at Caf√© Ba-Ba-Reeba and it was 100x better there.  Granted, the serving is enormous here, but the taste of the saffron was deficient.  Also, I hated how the chicken was left on it's bone when served in the dish - I don't want to have to take a break from shoveling the food in my mouth to peel the chicken off the bone.  I didn't even particularly enjoy the other meat in the paella; in fact, after eating it I began feeling pretty nauseous...and I felt this way again after warming up the leftovers later that night (which really stunk, by the way).  Not good.  Not good at all.  Thankfully, we ended on a good note with the rice pudding which was served with raspberry syrup atop it.  This rice pudding really was great - and perhaps the best part of the meal.  

I have to say that the service here was average, but nothing to blink an eye at.  There were points throughout the meal that our waiter was absent and other times when he was not.  Either way, our plates got taken out of our way in a timely manner.  That's really all I cared about as I didn't want to be overcrowded by dirty dishes.  Our server was also accommodating in that he didn't raise a stink when we handed him the Groupon ticket, cash and two credit cards.  

Basically, La Tasca isn't terrible, but it is not great.  I would reserve a trip to the city for a good tapas experience as this place leaves a lot to be desired.

From the dishes we ordered, I would recommend their herbed goat cheese with the tomato basil sauce. So delicious and flavorful. Wish more baguettes were served with it, it was that good. Also, the chocolate custard which was so rich and a perfect end to the meal. Their red sangria was good as well. Pretty strong and not expensive at all.  
Our server was really nice. However, getting seated was slightly annoying. The hostess had originally told us it would be 15 min even with reservations which I was ok with. That 15 min wait turned into a 40 min wait. I would have just appreciated it if they were honest from the get go so we knew what to expect.

If I could give this restaurant -1 star I would do it. Got seriously food poisoned after eating there. Left a message- someone calls back and explains to me it must have been the breakfast I had in the morning - Like Seriously? Service was Pathetic as well- my companion who is a food/restaurant blogger said she would never ever visit this place again. The guy had the ordasity to argue with me and tell me that I was food poisoned someone else. Strongly advise against this horrible establishment with no ethics and no taste. Utterly disappointing and Horrible customer service.

I had an outstanding experience here.  I am honestly shocked at the lower reviews.

They have a huge menu with lots of gluten free options AND willing to adjust items for me.  1 star just for that.
White sangria that reminded me of Spain.  1 more star.
Very hot food served fresh. 1 more star
Excellent service. 4th star
Amazing desserts.  5th star

A must try in my book.  I live near by and will be here regularly.

If had been a while since I had eatin at la tasca and had always had good experience and about a 4 star experiences. My most recent experience makes me think they have slide down a notch to 3 stars. I love me sum tapas but they have been around a while and think they have gotten comfortable. Just make it or premake it in many cases...churn it out...done attitude. Nothing really struck me as interesting any longer. The food was just Mehhh...oook...nothing stood out of the 6 tapas we tried. With all the restaurant competition they face they need to pick it back up. The fact we walked in on a Saturday nite @ 7:30 and it was 1/2 full makes me think others have realized this too. No longer the it place to be they need to introduce some new flavors and get creative to get back on track. 

Quick note: aside from my sliding opinion, they do offer a large tapas menu, numerous wines by the glass, and fairly good/well staffed service.

Just all around no good!!   We must have had 5 dishes including the paella - nothing tasted good.  Greasy, off tasting and utterly disappointing.  Not to mention I was sitting on a floor that had to be at lease tipped at a 15% angle.   Money is to hard to come by these days.  DON'T waste yours here!!   Damn!  Even the sangria was bland. Muy Mal!

I'm usually not a big fan of tappas to begin with but this place knocked it out of the park.  I absolutely loved it.

Great service, excellent food and wonderful atmosphere.

Found a new favorite.

Went out for dinner.  Power went out 5 times during diner on a Friday night.  This is not the first time this has happened either.  Get an election for god sake and put a full load on the system when testing it.  

Food was average, service was bad but I chalk that up to the staff trying to run around working around the power issues.

No plans on coming back.

First of all, I should say that this place used to be my favorite tapas restaurant.  I've been going there since 1998 and it was always a great experience.

But the service I received the last time I was there WAS SO RUDE I'LL NEVER GO BACK!!!!  It all started when my date and I were told we'd have to wait 5 mins. Or so for a table - that's OK - I get it.

We then sat down at the bar and the bartender asked us what we wanted to drink.  We said we were just waiting for a table.  The bartender then rudely snapped "well you can't sit here if you're not going to order a drink".

I'll never go back.  They've lost my business forever.

Best tapas place in the north suburbs. They have a large selection of vegetarian tapas, clearly marked, and at least 20 wines by the glass. The service was friendly and attentive, and the food was amazing - even the complimentary bread and olives they put out as soon as we sat down were stand out - fresh french bread, and a large bowl of olives. They even had a cup of olive forks at the table already (nice touch).
We ordered queso de habro al horno (baked goat cheese in tomato sauce), championes barcelona (mushrooms stuffed with spinach, pine nuts, and cheese), empanada de queso y espinica (spinach and cheese empanada) and the patatas aioli (potato salad). All were large portions, and they were served in ways slightly different than other restaurants, so even though most of these were standard tapas fare, La Tasca was distinctive. The mushrooms were in a saffron sauce, the goat cheese was served with tomato bread, the empanada was served on a bed of field greens salad. We finished by splitting the Creme Catalana de Chocolate, which we could have easily shared with a third person. Looking forward to going back!

Service definitely needs improvement. Waiters repeatedly reached over me/my food rudely to refill my water without saying a word..at least ask you if I would like a refill so I can move out of your way! One waiter spilled water clumsily on the floor which splashed all over my leg and didn't even acknowledge it. Waiter who took our order commented about how much food we ordered...rude...and when we were first seated, he made us feel rushed to order. He kept coming back after a minute or two asking if we were ready...we had never been there before (and he knew that bc he asked us) and the menu is big, so some leisurely time to explore the menu would have been nice. Plus, we were out for our wedding anniversary and with 3 small children, we don't get time out alone often...we didn't want to be rushed. 

Dining room was crowded (tables too close together/too many tables in that room), loud. It was so loud that my husband and I couldn't really have a conversation bc we couldn't hear each other. Also, we were seated RIGHT next to the kitchen...like, next to one of the counters where they were literally preparing food. I could have reached my arm out and touched the counter. Weird. 

Ordered wine, which was served to me in a small water glass (!?)...um, what ever happened to a wine glass?? The food came VERY fast, TOO fast. The tables are very small, certainly not big enough for multiple tapas at once. We felt like we had to eat very quickly to keep up with how fast everything was being brought to us, and to make room on the table.

The baked goat cheese with bread=delicious.
Some kind of scallops = flavorful sauce, scallops were a hair overdone (on the border of being chewy).
Some kind of shrimp= sauce also very good, but a bit heavy on the acidity (lemon).
Grilled calamari= TERRIBLE. Way overcooked, it was like chewing a rubberband. Sent it back.
Bacon wrapped dates= not enough savory (bacon) to balance the sweetness of the date and the red pepper sauce. 
Ordered a couple other things but don't know what they were called (some sausage trio that was disappointingly bland, and a chicken skewer thing over bland rice).

I definitely wouldn't recommend this for a leisurely time out/date since it's so loud and the rapid delivery of food makes you feel rushed. Not sure if I will return.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while, especially after falling in love with tapas in Barcelona. I was not disappointed at all!! Same authenticity and taste as the original country's cuisine, and the decor was on point! Lovely atmosphere and great views of downtown Arlington heights if you are sitting by a window. 

Sangria: the red one was absolutely refreshing and delicious. A pitcher size comes in a beautifully painted Spanish one as well. Perfect for 3 people to each have 2 glasses. There are also deals for $5 glasses on Tuesday I believe.

Patatas bravas: mmmm the sauce is what differentiates this Spanish dish from normal fried potatoes. Each restaurant in Barcelona had this staple, with slight differences in the taste, and La Tasca was very similar in its recipe. A must try for those new to tapasl- and a very safe dish that you really can't go wrong with.

Ensalada de la casa: a good starter house salad. Obviously very small though like the rest of the tapas dishes.

Gambas al ajillo: this shrimp dish was excellently marinated in a delicious garlic herb sauce. Another safe dish if you are iffy about seafood.

Pincho de pollo y chorizo: oh my goodness I usually don't like chicken but this was perfectly cooked and tender. Soft and juicy chicken with some yummy chorizo over flavorful yellow rice. Delicious.

With the complementary bread and olive dip, authentic atmosphere, and great tasting dishes- you can't go wrong here for a quick trip to barca without flying. The only thing is tapas are much more pricey in the U.S!

First time in Chicago and we were craving some tapas before our flight back. 

We ordered the patatas bravas (so great), the empanada de carne (soft and savory), the queso de cabra al horno (came with pan con tomate which was astounding), but the star was the pulpitos a la gallega. I personally love seafood, but often many restaurants tend to overcook the octopus to the point it is super tough. Well, not these guys. The spices were just right, the char was on point, and the texture was so so so great. 

Service was also outstanding, our server had to leave as soon as he seated us and we did not even notice as there was no interruption in the service; both the owner and another server stepped in right away.

Also, thanks to the owner who gifted us flan! It was delicious.
Excellent food, excellent service, my favorite pace to come anytime I'm in Palatine or Schaumburg!

We celebrated a family birthday with a party of 25. Danny helped with all the planning of food for the event and was extremely accommodating over the phone. Michelle helped us throughout the party. She was extremely patient with everyone, including our rowdy children. Extremely happy with the experience. Food is excellent- always.

3 stars for friendly service, location, and selection of food.  No, the taste does not get any stars, sorry.  It is just ok, not enough to make me go back...  Plus the tapas items cost an average of about $9, totally overpriced I think.

This is located in 'downtown' Arlington Hts around other restaurants, across from the Metra station, among other restaurants and local stores.  The restaurant is big and I guess Spanish-y decorated (???), ahhh who cares???

I came because I love Spanish paella, more like obsessed... for a great paella.  I ordered the seafood paella and to my disappointment, every seafood (clam, shrimp, mussels, scallops) were all overcooked and tasteless.  The whole dish was very salty and had a very fishy smell.  I wish they used better quality seafood.  Oh well.

My favorite plate was the potato... fried potato with some spicy sauce drizzle.  Everything else was just ok.

I also tried the peach sangria... ix nahh on this one too.  

Sorry, I will not return!

Vegeterians beware! Not the most vegetarian friendly tapas place I have been to.  Food is average.  Also one thing that really offended my was the called the vegetarian paella vegetarian but cooking it with chicken broth.  Sorry sir that is not vegetarian!  Also do not tell me that other vegetarians are okay with it assuming that it makes it better for me.  No it does not.  I still do not understand why you call something Vegetarian and than add a disclaimer that its made with chicken broth - still comes from chicken FYI.  

If you are a meat eater - tons and tons of options!

date night with hubby is a success here. we ordered 5 plates, and they were distributed evenly so no plate got cold. by the time we finished the stuffed mushrooms (which were stuffed like a boss!) we got the plate of chicken croquettes. one hot plate at a time, just the way tapas should be served. unfortunately, one less star because of a very sad and tasteless caramel flan. not a great ending, but still an overall great experience

Food- great.

Waiter Sam- sucks. -1 star

Manager- amazing.

I'll still come back because it's my favorite restaurant but only because the amazing manager saved my birthday dinner from being completely ruined after the waiter disgustingly served my friends and I. But the food is amazing, as well as the atmosphere created by decorations and music. So if you're wondering whether you should come here or not, I'm declaring that you definitely should.

I'd say about 3.5 stars here.  They have a friendly, vibrant and upbeat dining atmosphere in this prime downtown Arlington Heights location, and that boosts the overall rating.  The tapas and dessert were in the ok range.   We tried 4 tapas dishes:

Calamari
Stuffed mushrooms
Beef tenderloin
Bacon wrapped dates

Calamari and stuffed mushrooms were nice, though a little salty on the calamari.  The beef tenderloin was lukewarm and the bed of potato strings it sat on were cold and hard.  The bacon wrapped dates also were oil soaked and also a bit salty.   These are tweeks on the tapas where they could have been better, but the overall meal was OK as mentioned.  The cheesecake was also OK but again somewhat over the top on sweetness of toppings.  Our young server lady was delightful and cheerful.  I'd say this would be a nice date night sort of place to consider.

I found La Tasca after purchasing a Groupon deal. The entire menu is overpriced and service was on the slower side. The calamares a la romana were decent while the The empanada de carne and pincho de pollo y chorizo were nothing special. Although the Groupon enticed us to come, we probably spent more money at this restaurant than we would have at other places.

Went here for with a friend. At first look on the outside it does not look like much or even a restaurant that I personally would have chosen but we gave it a shot. This place is very classy and shows some high end appeal. Once you first walk in through the double doors you see this nice wooden bar and or you could have the waitress seat you at a table. We decided to sit at a table. We ordered two different Tapas. One was a Perch and Butter Tapas that was delicious and the other was calamari as an appetizer. We also ordered scotch and cava (Spanish Wine). This place is a nice hidden gem that if you have a special someone take them here and try something new. This place features a lot of finger like food to share so you could mix and choose different kinds to share with your significant other.

Ok, I wanted to give this place a chance despite the mixed reviews . Let me preface this by saying I am of latin decent .  I have been to cafe iberico and absolutely love tapas . This in my opinion was Americanized version of tapas . All seemed to be soaked in a tomato cheese base . 

I ordered the goat cheese which was amazing . Followed by the chicken croquettes , patatas Bravas,  empanadas, and a filet that the server recommended . As I mentioned all was soaked in the tomato cheese base and the beef tasted very bland .  When we asked for wine  suggestions   the waiter kept missing the mark . I sampled the red sangria and it was watered down . I give it 50 percent for effort but no authentic tapas by any means

I'm giving this place 3 stars but that's only because of the ambiance. 
I came here for dinner with a group of friends, we had reservations and once we arrived we were told that out table was not ready. We waited by the bar, no problem. We were there on this particular night because there was a live band playing. One of the band members is a friend of my friend. 
We requested to be seated in an area by where the band was playing. 
The restaurant is nice, lots of seating. 
Once seated we waited a while for our server. That was pretty much the theme of the night.... Waiting. We waited forever to place our order. Our server was taking care of a large group of about 20 people. I think he was concerned about them and not our party of six. 
Besides the long waiting periods I was not happy with my food. We went with tapas and everything I ordered was just meh. I've had better tapas elsewhere. Sangria wasn't great either. The only thing that I was happy about was the band. Our dinner date turned into a night of dancing. 
I don't think that I would return there unless it is to watch the band. The food and drinks are nothing to rave about and the service was lacking.
Our food was great and the service was phenomenal. Our waiter was to die for. His name is sam. Ask for him.

3d time here. Really good food and very prompt and nice service.
Had the 2 empanadas (spinach and the cheese w leeks).  Both good, I prefer the spinach one.  I think the other one would be better served with the cherry raisins sauce on he side.
The Belgian endive with salmon were v good again.
Chicken brochettes was good , guess too much rice...
The banana w ice cream just ok imho.
We'll return.

Overpriced and horrendous. I've been to a lot of tapas restaurants, and this is by far the worst i've been to. For the price, I even asked my friends if these were entr√©e portions, they weren't. We ordered the mushrooms, which arrived in about 3 minutes, they had to be microwaved, they were soggy and I still have a bad taste in my mouth. Yes I am a foodie, and tapas are my favorite food group, but this was mediocre. I ordered the patatas bravas, a staple at tapas restaurants, and    they might as well have microwaved some potatoes from Costco and put a Kraft cayenne mayonnaise on them. I typically don't write reviews for restaurants for here, but when I am this repulsed, I feel obligated to prevent people from spending money on food that they can make better (and fresher) at home. Sangria was fine, but didn't really make up for the bland menu, with poor quality food

Made  reservations for Saturday night at 7:30 was told there was a 30 minute wait and that there's five tables before you. They didn't have a reservation. What is the use for a reservation.  Bad attitude at the front of the place.  Don't go there. 

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
One of my favorites!  Food is always great. Never had anything I didn't love!  Great spot for any occasion!  Love it!

This was our 1st time here as we went with friends who are vegetarian and if you are there are plenty of good choices to select from. Its a tapas place or small plate Spanish restaurant. The service was pretty good though the waiter needed a few reminders for things like more coffee and bread but it was NY eve and packed so that is understandable. He was very friendly. 

The food was very good and the selections were ample. The patatas braves were very good actually and the portions were adequate to large depending on what you ordered.  They had a grilled egg plant with a crispy, sweet glaze which was fantastic. Do try it and the grilled vegetable plate. 

The only down side was that it was very loud, partially because it was NY eve I suppose and the music was cranked way up. However you had to really raise your voice to speak across the table which becoming tiring after a while. I would go back to see if its different say during the week and to try other dishes.
Meh meh meh.  We gave this a try as we are fans of tapa style dining, however the food here was blah!  We typically eat pretty healthy and felt disgusting after eating here, we won't be back.

Way too overpriced.  Tortilla espaniola, the Spanish tapas staple, was gross.  Clearly cooked before and rewarmed.  The rest of the dishes were meh. Octopus was the best but not great. Bread was crappy. Croquettes tastes like doo doo.    Really way too expensive for what we were served.  Additionally, while the service was good, I got the distinct feeling our sever did not want to be there.  Not one smile. Not worth it.
We are always looking for new  places to eat and we found this nice place in yelp !! AMAZING food and the waiter was supper nice...

We went in because of the paella but unfortunately its a lot of rice, we added a few tapas to the mix queso empanadas, filet madrid, and stuffed pepper. The waiter knows nothing about the menu at all nor does he help assure. I'm disappointed that anything that has bacon or pork can't be made without it...does that mean they don't cook anything fresh? 

Paella was decent, its mostly rice cooked in broth the mussels and clams smelled to fishy salty.

Boo!!! ROBB C. You are not very friendly or try to sell this place, then again no one here is friendly at all! Bus boy keeps walking around looking at you like they are just waiting for you to leave. No one allowed to smile must be there motto here. Ever heard of garlic...use it! Way too much hype for this place. Don't waste your time or money but cheap for a place that's suppose to be so good. Second chance won't be getting another from us.

Have lived a block away for 14 years and went there today because my mother insisted. BAD food the table next to us left their sea food payeya (spell) and advised us not to order it. I live in AH and don't understand why people from all over come to eat here, yet to find a good resturant here.  

Maybe it was a bad day for the Chef, but a day at a resturant does mean we can pay them with bad money.

I don't usually write reviews but I couldn't help myself with this restaurant. The food tasted like it was days old. My husband and I ordered the stuff mushrooms, black bean soup, garlic shrimp and brochette chicken none of which was good. Even the bread on the table tasted old and stale. We came here years ago and and i thought it would be better but was definitely mistaken. We didn't even have napkin and utensils at our table. Our waitress was very nice though.

This was my first time trying and I am writing my review to tell everyone about my experience I had with the waiter. Before we ordered and throughout our meal our waiter was average, came off nice and I didn't mind him. It wasn't until we got our bill that we had a problem. The waiter hand wrote in a suggested gratuity of 30% and then hand wrote the new total at the bottom of the bill. We didn't think he was that great/attentive of a waiter so we tipped 25% instead. The waiter had the nerve to come back to the table to tell us that he was $6 short of his suggested tip. 

If this was based only on the food, I would have given it one more star. We had about 8 different dishes and they were just average. Not the exact names but we had bacon wrapped dates (YUM, let's be honest though and say that anything wrapped in bacon is amazing!), one that was a goat cheese dip, beef tenderloin, spicy potatoes, a Spanish frittata one, a veggie dish, octopus w/paprika & seafood paellas. My favorite dish was the chocolate flan for dessert, AMAZING melt in your mouth with a crunch from topping, so good!
Wonderful mix of food.  Came with whole family.  Children experimented with wonderful new flavors.  You don't notice how quickly you fill up.  Fantastic meal!

Highly recommend going with a group.  Our favorites are canalon de atun, gambas, patatas bravas, pincho de solomillo and the calamari. 
Bread is plentiful and good for dunking.
Order a pitcher or two or three of sangria and finish with platanos caramelo.  
Delicious!

I think over the past few years the food quality has went down hill. The tapas is just ok at this point. I think that unless things take a change for the better I'll just suck it up and drive downtown instead of coming here. The portions are smaller and the prices are still on par with a downtown restaurant.

I was not going to write about La Tasca because I feel like I've written too many negative reviews.  However, it popped up in some search results earlier today and the wave of unhappiness I felt compelled me to write something.

The best part of the dinner I had at La Tasca was sitting outside.  It was a beautiful night, and there are not enough opportunities in the Chicago area to eat outside.  That said, the noise of the Metra train and the heavy foot traffic of the commuters walking by after getting off the train hurt whatever ambiance there was.

Everything we ordered was either average or downright bad.  The sangria was flavorless.  The calamari steak had a little bit of a fishy odor, but it was nothing compared to the octopus.  I cannot remember the last time I returned a dish to the kitchen, but the octopus smelled bad and did not taste right.  We had to send it back.

The spinach and pine nut stuffed mushrooms were okay, but bland.  The only other item I had was the beef tenderloin special.  As with the mushrooms - relatively flavorless.

Our server disappeared at the end of the meal.  The other server whom we asked to find our waiter was exceptionally more attentive for the two minutes he was engaged with us.

Last week I had dinner at El Tapeo in Oak Brook - incidentally on the same night that Yelp was having some sort of event there.  El Tapeo beat the hell out of La Tasca, and this contributed to my wanting to write something.  I am surprised by some of the positive reviews here.  Maybe La Tasca had an off night.  I doubt I'll ever know - I don't plan on returning.

I had a spread of cold and hot tapas. All were very delicious. The white wine sangria had a great flavor to it. But then...they had this coconut flan that was OUT OF THIS WORLD. I can't believe how tasty every single bite was. I will call ahead of time from now on just to see if they have it in!

I made a reservation for party of 4 at 7pm on Saturday.  The place was packed and we waited for more than 40 min.  We ordered tapas and paella.  The tapas are as good as usual.  Everyone in the party was a bit disappointed of the paella.  It didn't have much flavor.

The restaurant was charming, waitress was fantastic, but they were swamped on a Saturday night (good for them) and it was LOUD, including screaming kids.  Wines that are under $10 at Binny's were over $30, but that's expected and the waitress' selection was wonderful.  The kitchen was slammed, so the food came out in shifts, which we were thankful for as it allowed time for conversation.  The scallop dish was marvelous, fantastic, the best thing on the menu.  The olives & olive juice were quite tasty too, but the other dishes, beef tenderloin, pork medallions & tuna were all over-cooked to the point of being tough.  The cheesy potatoes were very nice as was the flat bread too.  The dessert was so-so as the cake was hard.  Yes, I'd give it another go, but remind them that my previous encounter had over-cooked meat to see if they'd improve.

Great find in Randhurst.  Amongst a sea of chains, this location stood out as a killer spot. The food was great, wine was good...not amazing but acceptable, and the staff was nice. My only suggestion would be to wear bugs slray, or have the place get tiki torc he's with fuel to ward off those obnoxious mesquite on the patio.

Place is a but pricey....so better for date or fun night out with girlfriends versus a Std going for a Bute to eat night.

The best tapas I've ever had
Including going to Cafe Baba you know where
Their banquet facilities are also wonderful 
An ideal place for bridal shower or family party!

We came back and talked with management after we were done eating dinner elsewhere and they were very apologetic and as disappointed as we were about the reservation mishap. In the end they made it right and changed our minds about giving them another chance. No one or business is perfect and sometimes people (hostess) have bad days so we feel our review needed an update to give them credit for what they did do right... but we also feel the original review should stay so they can work harder to avoid this again.

Original

Don't bother with a reservation since they don't know how to save tables. We got there a little early for our 7pm reservation and they told us they were backed up and our table would not be ready for 30 mins. 10 mins  is one thing but 30...come on...don't seat all the walk ins. It really isn't that difficult. We convinced them to call us when the table was ready and went to a bar for drinks across the street. They called at 7:43pm to tell us our table was almost ready and that the table was eating dessert.. We insisted they call back when they paid because dessert can take 20mins....the hostess finally agreed after saying that they don't typically do the calling thing. We were right across the street so come on. We waited and waited and never got another call....so we just ate somewhere else. The hostest was terrible. Never empathized with us, never offered anything to make it right... Just did not care...a very bad hire by management. Though I hear the food is good...sadly,  we did not get to experience any of it.

Very poorly managed restaurant. I made a reservation for four people for 7pm last Saturday. I was told that a private party rented out a room which meant I would have to wait 15-20 minutes for my table. It ended up being over a hour and the table STILL wasn't ready. We gave up and ended up eating at Armand's across the street.

Best to go on a slower week night. They run late on reservations, on the weekend. About 30-45 minutes. They schedule the reservations too close together, and actually over book. Be prepare to get a high bill for what you get.   All the tapas are around $9+. Paella is loaded with lot's of rice as a filler. Decent but not great. I have had paella in Spain, and it lacks the spices and flavor, that good paella should have.

The food was good, the sangria was just ok and the ambiance was nice.  I've definitely had better tapas and the parking situation is obnoxious (doesn't really exist except for the parking garage and few blocks away) but it's definitely worth a try.

The one thing I adore about Downtown Arlington Heights is that its adorable.  I love how it feels like a tiny city and there is plenty to do.  It is especially cute during the Winter.

Easy to find location, its right on the corner, but parking can be a pain.  I do believe they offer valet though.  It isn't a huge establishment, but they made the most of their space and it is very cozy and romantic. This would be a cute place for a first date.

Ordered a ton of food with some girlfriends.  At first, I was really impressed, everything was super tasty, however I just started to notice that most of the things we ordered had the same sauce and there would only be 3 or 4 of the pastry (and for $8?!?).  Food was never cold and always did come out pretty quickly, I just got super full off the same sauce.  But then there would  be different meals like the Beef Tenderloin that was greatly priced and very good.

I want to come back, but definitely order different items.
Lovely place to hang out after work - Try their house labeled Red wine...you won't regret it.

I have been here several time since it has opened  which is years ago  , and Im surprised that I never gave it a review , Well here it is : 
Reservations were at 7:00  we were seated at 7:20 ish  but had a great time at the bar and had a couple Sangrias  with the party of 7 that we were.
We sat down  and our waiter was excellent ,   The Bus staff was on top of the cleaning up the empty plates,water etc...   The food was  excellent  everything we had from  salads to the grilled calamari, to the beef tenderloins,  actually we probably had a couple  of everything  bacon wrapped figs, Quaso dip,  I can't say the food just came  coming until someone said that they couldn't eat anything else , So we all had  the Plantain/ ice cream  dish  which I have to say it was a Banana  and not a real Plantain But I don't care they taste similar anyway  and the chocolate custard  desert with the carmelized sugar topping which was great, il go back here more often as  this time was probably the best its been, and the place was packed  on a Saturday during a snow storm  on 1/9/16 
Oh one more thing,  the Beef tenderloin over the Shoestring potatoes  was freakin  awesome

Kudos to Danny, Peter and the rest of the staff for their wonderful service and wonderful food at a memorial luncheon for my mother held at La Tasca today. They were all incredible helpful and flexible as we planned the menu and then later as we had over 50% more people join us than originally planned. Our guests loved the room, the atmosphere and the food. Thank you again.

We went for dinner with another couple a few weeks ago.  We all went home very disappointed. The food was mediocre at best and the service was worse!
When there are so many other great choices nearby, I'm not sure how this place stays in business.

The tapas were a little pricey for what you got based on similar restaurants. Staff was friendly.  Food was good, but not outstanding.  I had the paella and it had way too much lemon that it drowned the rest of the meal.  The best tapa we had was the steak.

Went here with the family for my birthday.  I like tapas as a concept because I enjoy variety, but the dishes are priced highly enough that you don't end up ordering many different things.  It was my birthday though, and therefore the best opportunity for a splurge at La Tasca.  The ambiance was lovely to look at, but a bit loud.  Our server, Mike, was excellent.  Our tapas selections were: 

PLATO DE JAM√ìN Y QUESO MANCHEGO (Plate of Serrano ham and Manchego cheese) - Comparable to a plate of prosciutto and thinly sliced Parmesan cheese.  Overpriced for what it was.  Skip it!

QUESO DE CABRA AL HORNO (Herbed goat cheese baked in a tomato basil sauce, served with tomato baguettes) - This was well-loved by our table, especially since you could dip the bread from the never-ending bread bowl in it once the tomato baguettes were gone.

ENSALADA DE PULPO (Cold Octopus Salad) - Very good.  If you've ever had this dish at a Greek restaurant, it is essentially the same thing.

EMPANADA DE QUESO Y ESPINACA (Spinach, goat cheese, and golden raisins baked in a light pastry puff) - This was one of our table's favorite dishes.  The sweet raisins especially added a nice punch.  Kind of like a tiropita with spinach and raisins.

The big problem with this tapas arrangement is that we tried to split everything between 6 people so we could all savor the novelty, but that required everyone to be very frugal with their portion sizes.  With each dish at around $10 a piece, just ordering two of everything would have added up quickly, so mostly we were all able to just get a "taste" without being able to feel fulfilled.

Luckily we also ordered the seafood paella (as others have mentioned, all the paellas take 40 minutes to cook, so order this immediately if you plan to have it).  The paella is $15 "per person" with a two person minimum to order the dish.  However, according to our waiter, each per person serving actually serves two people.  So for our table of six we ordered a three person serving of paella which more than fed all of us, and we even took some to go.  If not for the tasty paella we probably would have left hungry, so this was the perfect finale for our dinner.  Just a word of caution, though: for some reason I expected this dish to be spicy.  I think because last time I had paella it was some cajun-style version.  This dish was not spicy in any way, so that is good news for spice-wimps and bad news if spicy was what you were craving.

Because it was my birthday they brought out a caramel flan with a candle at the end.  Very thoughtful and we all agreed that was some of the best flan we'd ever had!

I am not sure if I'll ever have the sort of disposable income that would make me want to come here regularly, but I know they do have Groupons and in any case it was worth doing at least once.

Only really decent and average. Can honestly say nothing made me say, wow I need to order that again. For the price you would kinda expect that when you leave you think to yourself, I can't wait to go back there again, unfortunately that didn't happen. Been here, tried it, kinda over it

Yum. I've been going here for years and I moved out of state 5 years ago. I have my list of "must eat" while I am in town, and La Tasca is on it. I love that you can go with friends and try all sorts of different things. It's a fun experience as well as a great meal. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the extensive and unique menu. The bar area is great for hanging with friends and the restaurant area is great for a quiet dinner date. The owner always recognizes me as a regular and makes a stop at my table to chat, even though my visits are over a year apart these days.  

I think I've tried about every tapas on the menu and don't think I could pick a favorite. For my most recent visit we did the 5 for $40 deal, which is 5 tapas for $40. It's a great way to try something you might be unsure about without the risk of ending up with a meal that you don't like (although I've never had anything I didn't like). If I had to recommend any specific dish, try the bacon wrapped dates or the scallops. Ask for extra bread with the scallops because you will want to soak up every drop of the delicious sauce :)

Thanks for a great meal, and I'll see ya the next time I'm in town!

Place has a pretty big menu and pretty big portions for tapas, not a complaint at all. The food I had was excellent. The baked goat cheese and the dates wrapped in bacon were by far the stars of the show, although we got a couple of meat dishes that I remember enjoying as well. Service was good. No one was overly friendly but they were on top of giving us bread refills and letting us keep the menu and order more when we finished our first round of tapas (my boyfriend and I are big eaters) and we never had to flag down anyone, but I didn't feel like they were hovering. I honestly really like that, I don't want a forced conversation with my waiter when I'm on a date. 4 stars only because I personally really didn't care for the decor and ambiance, and we didn't get seated at a booth even though the place was basically empty. We were even kind of dressed up. Either way, I'll be back again for those dates.

Horrible, food is super expensive and its not worth it, wont get you full at all, u have to spend 300 $ to be satisfied and full, the sangria is not that good at all, and they are stingy with the bread, jesus i will never come back :( I WAS DISAPPOINTED
We wanted to dine here tonight but after cruising the streets of Arlington Heights for 30 minutes plus waiting in front for the valet for another 5 minutes we gave up.

I was just logging on to write a review on a different place and saw the bad review for La Tasca. 
I was there this summer on a date (as well using a Groupon), and it was during a busy Taste of Arlington Heights (I had just moved here - so I don't know if I got the food festival name right).   
Anyway, we had quite a few dishes, can't quite remember, but they were all REALLY good. I do remember we had DELICIAS ANDALUZAS - and I loved it. It was a combination I had never had before, and I loved it.   I do want to go back again!

A wonderful tapas restaurant with my favorite seafood tapas and favorite classics with a twist. 

Excellent adult beverage selections as well as desserts. 

We had the patatas bravas, pulpo catalana, ensalada de pulpo, berenjena con ensalada de mariscos (nicely curried), and a flan del dia (coconut).

Everything was delicious,  and we'll be back again soon.
My go to bar in the burbs--great Sangria and the olives with bread served at the bar always make it hard for me to leave. Great selection of Tapas in a friendly comfortable atmosphere.

Went here with a large group for a party. 

Slowwww, another chewing on the tablecloths place. 

Service is pretty chaotic. 

Spent quite a bit too, unimpressed with the food and flavors.

I enjoy doing tapas and sangria, especially for a girls night, but La Tasca has yet to wow me.  I've had dishes that were delicious, dishes that we're good, and dishes that I felt were indelible (don't get the eggplant with seafood medley).  Once I was lucky enough to receive a rubber band in my glass of water!  I have yet to receive exceptional service, which you would expect from a restaurant similar to La Tasca.

Some of the choices can be a real miss, so just take my word on what to get.

*Queso de Cabra al Horno - herbed goat cheese that has been baked with a flavorful tomato sauce, and served with baguette slices.

*Empanadas de Carne - lamb, pork, and beef within a light puff pastry, and served atop a tomato basil sauce.  This happens to be the last item on the hot appetizers so don't miss it.

*Mejillones a la Mallorquina - juicy mussels in a spicy tomato vegetable broth, filled with peppers.

*Vieiras Gratinadas - saut√©ed sea scallops in a vegetable bechemel and topped off with manchego cheese and bread crumbs. Warning, these are good, but probably a result of all the butter used.

*Platanos al Caramelo - a perfectly saut√©ed  banana and ice cream, topped off with a caramel drizzle and pistachios.  

*Caramel Flan (or any flavor of the day flan) - a cool, smooth, creamy, and delectable treat!

Always check their specials for some good tapas that you may not be able to get otherwise.

My husband and I came here on a Saturday night without a reservation and only had to wait about 10 minutes to get a table, which was great. The atmosphere is very welcoming and comfortable and everyone is very nice. We love tapas and were not disappointed!  We tried a little bit of everything - 

- Embutidos y quesos variados (meat and cheese plate) - this was my favorite; it sounds so simple, but the marinated peppers, meats, olives, and cheeses were so yummy together! They give you a full basket of bread to go along with all the tapas and it was perfect with the meat and cheese plate!
 
- Calamres a la romana (lightly breaded calamari) - these were very good as well

- Gambas al ajillo (Shrimp saut√©ed with garlic, red pepper, white wine and olive oil)- this was really good and had a good kick to it! The bread is tasty dipped in the leftover sauce.

- Pincho de pollo y chorizo (chicken tenderloin and Chorizo served over Spanish rice)- really yummy and flavorful! 

- Croquetas de pollo (Chicken and ham croquettes)- these were not very good. I wonder if we just got some not so tasty ones, because they are in other peoples' positive reviews, but we weren't very impressed. They were very bland and had an off texture. 

Overall, a great experience with very good food. We will be back! 

Tip- They have Groupon deals from time to time. You can find their current offer here: https://www.groupon.com/deals/la-tasca-restaurant-tapas

We have not been for 3 years and after last night we were wondering why!  Victor our waiter was delightful!  He picked out great wine for us and suggested three amazing dishes for us.  We told him we were relaxing and we were going to take our time and his timing was perfect!  Amazing experience!  Thank you Victor!

What a disappointment! Great location, friendly staff, really good service and vibrant atmosphere.  If only they had good food!

I love tapas and this place tries to educate the consumer on the tapas style of eating.  But the food is uninspired and bland. Multiple dishes covered in the same sauce and none of it tasting authentic.  The crowd seems to like it here, but if you're looking for tapas like you've had in Spain, pick the other tapas restaurant around the corner... Much better food.

I do love my tapas -- small plates so that you can try a variety of dishes. I'm always looking for variety and trying a little bit of everything, so it's perfect.

The food and service was great. Not sure why there are so many bad reviews?

We actually came here thinking our Groupon was for this tapas restaurant, but it was actually for the tapas place right around the corner. I guess we'll be having tapas again soon LOL.

They start you off with some bread and olives. Already points for free anything! haha. 

Ordered everything from the Tapas Calientes Menu, because we be muy caliente!!!~ We on fiyaaaaa. In order of my favorites to my least favorites, altho all were good:

Mejillones a la mallorquina: A lot of mussels in a delicious sauce that I could seriously drink. Table favorite!!!

Croquetas de pollo: these chicken and ham croquettes were one of our favorites. Crispy on the outside, hot and steamy on the inside. Great tomato basil sauce on top.

Delicias andaluzas: bacon-wrapped dates. Love the combination of the sweetness of the dates and the saltiness of the bacon.

Pincho de solomillo con champinones y cebollitas: Beef tenderloin with sour cream sauce -- the meat was juicy and tender. Just the way I like it!

Empanada de carne: beef, lamb and pork ground meat empanada. Again that tomato basil sauce was delicious and went well with this empanada. The only reason why I made this last place is that it's hard for me to enjoy lamb or any of the more "gamey" meats.

This is a great place in downtown Arlington Heights to get your tapas fix.  Lots of delicious tapas that includes some of the typical ones (patatas bravas & bacon wrapped dates) but also some that you don't normally find at other restaurants (the seafood ones).

I'm usually pretty wary about ordering seafood in salad form but the "Berenjena Rellena con Salpicon de Mariscos", a seafood medley over grilled eggplant, was actually pretty fresh and tasty.  You can never go wrong with the bacon wrapped dates that come with a red pepper sauce.  Can you really ever go wrong with anything that's wrapped in bacon?  Is it even possible?  Bacon aside, every dish I've had here I've enjoyed.

Decor/Ambiance-wise it has a very classy look.  They tend to dim the lights at night so it tends to be a little dark (I guess you can call it "romantic").  It can also get busy around dinner-time so you can expect a wait.  With the seeming mass of people there at times seating can be a little cramped, and it can get a little loud inside.

Overall awesome tapas that's conveniently located!

This is a wonderful restaurant to go to if you are looking for small plates. We had never had tapas before and our waiter Sam was great, he walked us thru everything, and gave great recommendations. We will absolutely be returning. I highly recommend the lamb chops!!

This place is just okay... We had a whole bunch of different plates and most of them were just okay.. Nothing really was amazing! The sangria was not very good.. Service was very good though! I do like that! Still not dying to go back..

Absolutely beautiful restaurant with a breath taking d√©cor. I visited it with my 5 y old daughter and we truly had a great time.  Since my daughter will not eat anything spicy we followed waiter's recommendation. All three tapas were a great choice! Sharing them made it even more fun. Great place to bring people together over multiple plates of unique food.

It was fairly late on a Friday night and my friend and I were super hungry and looking for a sit down place to eat.  We were excited to see that La Tasca was open until midnight, so we started heading towards downtown Arlington Heights.  When we arrived, there was only one other table occupied.  The service was very friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere was inviting and cozy.

We asked for suggestions on which dishes to order.  I was in love with the fact that they had different flavors of sangria!  I ordered Pineapple sangria (pineapple is always my favorite flavor when it comes to alcoholic beverages).  The boyfriend ordered the Pomegranate so we could try a red and white sangria.  Both were very good.  The extra flavoring was sweet, but not overwhelming.

All of the dishes we ordered were really good, the only one I was not that impressed with was the goat cheese.  That is only because you can get that almost anywhere.

We just moved to Arlington Heights with true excitement about experiencing all that our new home town has to offer.  We went into this dinner with a positive, but not over-excited perspective.

La Tasca was... fine.

It seemed that for every good thing that happened in the restaurant an equal and opposite (read: bad) thing happened.  Let me be specific: The white sangria was good (and I usually don't like it).  However, the waiter (on a weekday night without that many tables) was rude... to us.  He was perfectly agreeable to everyone else.  Each time he came by (which was not often), I smiled and used more words than I needed to highlighting the things that they did right (some of the dishes were very good, but they did not get cleaned out of the way quickly).  By the end, I felt like I was doing all of the work.  

If there was a better service experience, another trip could help isolate which dishes are really amazing, which could help the disconnected wait staff.

My wife and I honeymooned in Spain, and Tapas is one of our favorite cuisines. I often cook it when entertaining. So when we had theater tickets in Arlington Heights I was pleased to find La Tasca just a block from the theater.

We ordered a few of our favorites - Patatas Bravas, Chaminones Barcelona. We tried a special: goat cheese rolled in eggplant with tomato sauce; a spinach and raisin empanada, steak with shoe string potatoes. Every dish was served hot and with with nice timing. They arrived every few minutes and as we ordered more we had a changing buffet on our table. The stuffed mushrooms were good but a bit plain, but everything else was outstanding.

For dessert I had sauteed banana with ice cream which was very, very good. The caramel sauce is killer. My wife had a honey-nut tart which surprised us. Expecting a warm tart with chocolate sauce, instead e got what looked like a slice of nut cake with fudge frosting. In fact, it was an upside down tart with a fudgy-chocolate layer over the crust. Absolutely delicious. However, it comes with whipped cream when what it really needs is ice cream. It is very rich. But I'd definitely order it again!
Love the food. I have been twice and definitely prefer to sit outside. The dining room is cramped and uncomfortable but outside is really nice and relaxing in the summer.

We had 7pm reservations for my sister's birthday dinner. Upon arrival we were told they were backed up and it would be another 30 minutes. When we asked why this was the case, (the RBF and incredibly unfriendly hostess) told us we were "lucky" as those without reservations were looking at at least an hour and a half wait. Well, don't we feel lucky then. No apology though. So, we get it...shit happens.... but NO apology and nothing but attitude despite our being understanding of the wait. We then asked if they could call us when they were ready for us so that we could go just half a block away for some drinks. We received a call at 7:43pm (again, we had 7pm reservations). The hostess mentioned that the table they were waiting on for us was on dessert and that we should head over. When I asked her to call when the table was ready (again, within a block from there), she said "we don't do that. We don't actually usually call at all". I then asked if they could call when the table had at least paid their check. Having previously worked in the industry,  I know that dessert can easily mean another 20-40+ minutes. She hesitated, said fine,  then hung up. Now 2 hours 24 minutes later (with a reservation) we have yet to receive a call. Very disappointing and can't believe how rude the hostess was. Non-empathetic, rude, and now....just forgetful. We are literally half a block away and just eating here. I wish I had her name. After the number of years I've had in the industry, this is the last type of person they should have on staff. But happy bday to my sister who was a trooper and accepted just having dinner elsewhere. *update: 10:22pm.... still no call*

Restaurants that do not use bread from a legit bakery tick me off. I mean, c'mon.  How hard is it to buy bread from a bakery?  There have got to be some in the area.

My boyfriend and I spotted an employee walking back to the restaurant carrying several loaves of bread from Jewel, which is located right across from the restaurant.  I was really hoping that he wasn't going into La Tasca, but he was.  And, I hate to say it, but that awful bread definitely bumped my star rating down a notch.  I'm really hoping that they simply ran out of bread that night and had to resort to Jewel bread.

First, their menu definitely seems a lot more limited than other tapas restaurants.  I had no qualms with the decor and liked the bold, bright paintings that hung from the walls.  The background music confused me at times because they'd play more contemporary and techno music as opposed to the traditional Spanish music that I think should be playing at a tapas restaurant.

For our tapas, we ordered:

- Queso de Cabra Al Horno: goat cheese baked in tomato basil sauce served with tomato baguettes.  This is my favorite dish ever at tapas places.  Theirs was good, but not great.  The bread really did this dish in.  I wish that the bread been toasted a bit with some oil.  It had some of the sauce on it, but it seemed like it was put on as an after thought and not baked into the bread.

- Pincho de Solomillo Con Champinones Y Cebollitas: beef tenderloin, mushrooms, pearl onions topped with Spanish sour cream cause and served over shoestring potatoes.  I really enjoyed this dish and thought everything worked well together.  The pork was cooked perfectly and I loved the crunch of the shoestring potatoes.

- Champinones Rellenos: stuffed mushrooms with ground pork tenderloin and pine nuts and marinated in a Spanish brandy.  I'm a big fan of mushrooms and pine nuts so I enjoyed this dish a lot.  The ground pork had a little crisp on the outside, which I enjoyed.

- Gambas Al Ajillo: shrimp sauteed with garlic, red pepper, white wine and olive oil.  Overall, just OK - a little too heavy on all the sauces though.

For dessert, I had the Platanos Al Caramelo, which is a sauteed banana and homemade ice cream topped with caramel and pistachios.  The banana was gross and did not taste fresh.  I really did not like how it was sauteed nor how it was presented.  The whole banana was on the plate.  I thought it would have been nicer it it was sliced.  Everything else was good, but I seriously struggled to finish it.

Service was just OK - our server checked up on us and was nice, but didn't go out of her way to be too friendly.

I had a $15 Groupon so the cost was cut down by a little bit.  After the discount and tip, we spent a little over $30.  That's not a bad price, but the food and the whole experience was just so-so.  I might give them another shot if I was in the area and craving tapas, but I definitely think there are far better tapas places out there.

I went here over 5 years and remembered it being really good. My memory must be failing me....

We got a coupon in the mail and decided to go. 

We ordered about 7 dishes and ALL were bland. Plus there was a lingering (bad) smell of cleaning solution at 5 p.m. I regret spending my time and money there.

Terrible! 

Below local grocery store deli quality. 

Very loud.

Extremely over priced.

Extremely under flavored.

All three people with me if different ages and ethnicities let me know it was pure garbage.

Average tapas restaurant. It wasn't the best tapas, but decent food and reasonable price. We sat at a bar and ate there. Everything came timely and a bartender was friendly. My favorite was bacon wrapped dates!

Very convenient location with many street parking around.

I was really not impressed with this place. I understand they are small plates but they are REALLY small yet the same price as an entree somewhere else. Luckily we had a Groupon so we were able to get a little more bang for our buck. We ordered 4 tapas and 1 bowl of soup and were already over the amount we had to spend. The food was alright, no trip to Hollywood, but not bad. However, there was no substance or protein to fill you up. The service was bad. Our server looked down on us like we were less of a customer because we were young and had a Groupon. We did not appreciate his cold shoulder attitude. Overall,  we won't be going back.

Everything here is delicious! The service was fantastic. We received our food very quickly with the expert recommendation of our great  server. We will definitely be back here again. What we ate (non official names): the spicy potatoes, beef tenderloin, baked goat cheese, baked wrapped dates, Serrano ham and manchengo cheese. Muy bueno!

I tried La Tasca because they were having a Groupon deal.  We made the drive over to downtown Arlington Heights and were seated in a small table with a rushed, slightly curt waiter.  The Queso de Cabra al horno is a must! I loved the seasoned, toasted bread & the gooey tomato & goat cheese sauce.  I've tried this dish at other tapas restaurants, but the bread at La Tasca soaked up the sauce nicely.  The empanadas de carne were average.  The calamari was quite good (the sauce made it all the better).  The mussels were alright (the broth was good, but the mussels themselves were puny).  The pitcher of red sangria was alright, but a bit too watered down for almost $30.

I bought a Groupon for this restaurant just to try out this style of dining. I was not impressed and left hungry after racking up an $80.00 bill. Some of the food was delicious, but the portions were not enough to share with another person.

Their steak was cooked perfectly, melted in my mouth.

However, I wouldn't go back.
We had a bridal shower here for my sister and the service and food exceeded our expectations. It was a wonderful space and everyone had a great time. We will definitely be back!

Was very disappointed sangria was watered down and very over priced. The bar service was rude and the food was not hot. Never asked if we wanted to order anything else just gave us our bill. Won't be going back.

The absolute worst paella i have ever had. I was shocked considering the server recommended it and that the restaurant itself got decent reviews. I am not picky and could not eat it. Servet did not bother to ask if everything was ok when we asked for a box minutes after getting it and barely took a few bites. For me that would have been a question mark and would have asked if everything was ok. If the situation would have been handled differently i would consider returning but this was a waste of money for something we did not eat.

I live in downtown Arlington Heights and have been frequenting La Tasca for many years.  It is by far, my favorite restaurant in the area, if not in general.  I never get sick of this place and have eaten there as many times as 3 times a week!  Last  month alone I went 4 times.  Danny the owner is the nicest guy, and really appreciates his customers and regulars. The bartendar (can't remember his name) is very friendly and attentive, and fun to talk to.  The atmosphere is welcoming and I always feel comfortable here.  My gf's and I have gone straight from the gym, and I have also gone dressed up for date night.  I wouldn't go in gym clothes on the weekend, but during the week it was fine. The wine is superb.  The food is DELICIOUS!!!  I have tried many different small plates (that's my favorite), but here are my top reccomendations. 

Patatas bravas - perfectly crispy potatoes with a cayenne sauce.  These are a must have!!  We sometimes get two orders, for two of us!

Queso de cabra - herbed goat cheese dip.  AMAZING!!!  Don't miss this one.

Calamares a la Romana - My favorite calamari ever!  The dipping sauce is heavenly

Trio of Sausages - DELICOUS!!

BACON WRAPPED DATES!!!  - I CAN'T SAY ENOUGH ABOUT THESE.  Get these as your final round and it tastes like dessert....  but speaking of dessert, don't skip that!!  The banana dessert is wonderful! 

They have many other dishes, but those are my favorites.  My mouth is watering as I type this!!  

Don't miss out on La Tasca's food, atmosphere, and drinks!!  It's a must go to for date night, or with a group.

We went there on a Saturday night for dinner. Reservations were at 7 but unfortunately we didn't get seated for another 30 min. The bartender did ask us a few times if we wanted drinks as we waited which I appreciated. 
We started off with the guacamole which was made quickly and with perfect consistency. I had the poblano burrito which I couldn't even make a dent on because of their chips, salsa, and guacamole we ordered. Made for great leftovers though
Their desserts were great too! We all shared the tres leche and the chocolate cake. Both were on point and something I'll think about for awhile. 
Service was great. Our server gave us the right amount of attention. We will definitely go back soon.

The time has come to write a review, and this is one of the only 5 stars I will issue. My wife and I live behind Salsa and have been coming for over a year on an almost weekly basis. The food here is excellent and the portions are huge (our normal order is a split or chicken fajitas, plenty). The service is top notch and they always take the time to greet you warmly and walk guests through the menu. If in the dining room make sure you get sat with Marcela, Ana, Gloria! If in the bar, make sure Max makes your drink! He knows what is is talking about when it comes to tequila and is an all around great bartender. 

The owner is always around and she makes sure to visit with guests. Carlos the daily manager is great and makes sure any issue is perfectly tended to!

Short version, this place is great...you'll love it!

It's a 3-star restaurant. The service was okay, the food was okay, the atmosphere was okay, the prices was okay.

We had the queso fundido for an appetizer and it was just a hunk of melted cheese (which was okay).

I had the steak tacos, and i've had much better steak tacos at other places. My wife had the enchiladas and they were good. Not great. Good. 

Solid 3-stars. I was expecting more and i was a little disappointed. I think maybe all the 5-star reviews threw me. Or, after trying Bien Trucha no other Mexican restaurant will compare.

Very nice place! Great drinks and food! We are big fans of the margaritas there. they did a great job with the ally on the side of the building,gives the place a very nice style.
We will be back soon

If you're looking for a great Margarita and fun ambiance, check out Salsa 17!
My best friend and I stopped in on a Friday evening for some drinks and food. 
I had been dying to check out Salsa 17, since moving to Arlington Heights in June. 

We grabbed a high-top in the bar area and were ready for an ice-cold margarita!
The place was PACKED, but not uncomfortably so. 
We both ordered a "Mexican Bulldog" margarita. 
For those who are wondering, it's a signature margarita with a corona tipped upside down. Essentially, infusing your margarita with Corona! Truly great! 
We could have essentially shared one between us, however we were thirsty! ;) 

We chatted it up while sipping our margarita and enjoying the chips and salsa. 
The salsa was more authentic than the competition next door. (ahem..Mago) 
We loved it so much we asked for a refill on the salsa! 

Next, we started getting really hungry and knew it was time to try some bomb tacos! We ordered the taco platter. It was excellent and plenty of food for two. 

I would definitely come back for the excellent margaritas. If you're looking for great margaritas and tasty tacos in Arlington Heights, be sure to check out Salsa 17!
Easily the best guacamole and house-made salsa in the area. Super cool and fun atmosphere.

Great food, ambience and service!! My husband is big on Mexican food and we are regulars here. We come here, tired from work or feeling too lazy to cook and we leave here with a full and satisfied tummy. We order tableside guac, salmon/chicken with pistachio mole sauce. Both are always good, salmon & chicken cooked to the point. The mexican rice that comes with the entree is delicious too.

They have a very good margarita selection, try to get one when you can. 

Good place, good service, good food!! Definitely will go back!!

My brother and his wife love this place. Personally, I'm not big on Mexican food. But we were nearby at my brother and sister-in-law's house, and my partner loves Mexican food. So I agreed to go and I have zero regrets.

We came on a Friday night. My brother called to try and make a reservation, but they were no longer taking any. We decided to risk a long wait and came here. We parked only 3 or 4 blocks away. There was an outdoor festival going on, so we maybe had to park farther only because of the event.

We arrived at the perfect time. They were able to seat us almost instantly and then proceeded to have a line of people out the door. The menu has a great variety, and one of the best things is that vegetarian and vegan options are abundant for my brother.

We all ordered something different. I went with enchiladas which were great. I forget what everyone else got. I sometimes don't like the complimentary salsa and end up eating chips. But the salsa was amazing, so we probably split like four orders worth.

I don't eat guacamole. You'll probably stop reading at this point, but I know that everyone else raved about how good it was. They also make it fresh at your table which it quite cool and hip these days.

My favorite thing about this dinner is that they had fruit smoothies on the menu. I used to gulp down margaritas like there was no tomorrow. But I got to be too good of a drinker and had to retire my title. So now I prefer the non-alcoholic drinks which a lot of places don't have on the menu. I was able to get a yummy mango strawberry smoothie with dinner.

The food here is top notch. It's a little more pricey than I normally look for in a dinner place, but it was definitely worth every cent.

I would just recommend making a reservation and plan to have some great food, good atmosphere, and killer salsa (and probably also the guacamole).

Well holy crap, I can't believe I haven't reviewed Salsa 17 - I've eaten here a dozen times, and left stoked every time!

OK, so time for the pro tips. #1, this place gets crowded and loud at night. I'm not a crowds guy. If you're like me, eat early and have a reservation.

Far more importantly... You're probably eating the fajitas. I don't blame you, they're delicious. But you'll be stuffed by the time the waitress asks about dessert because the portions are huge, so you'll say something like "gracias pero no." But you are making a TERRIBLE MISTAKE since the chocolate lava cake here is literally the BEST ANYWHERE, EVER.

I've had serious discussions with my fiance about just ordering the chocolate cake slice for delivery. Oh yeah, they do delivery! But seriously though, the pastel will change your life for the better. Or maybe the worse if you're on a diet. 

Think melty, pure chocolate cut into a wedge that resembles black cheesecake. I'm not describing it right. Think pure, elemental chocolate, hot enough to be slightly melted, but not hot enough to melt the whip cream. I could right poetry about Salsa 17's chocolate cake, and I just might. You should definitely try it!

This is a great choice for Mexican food in Arlington Heights. Love the guac! The tacos, burritos and chile rellenos are great options. My only complaint is their drinks aren't that great - I much prefer Mago if you care about having some good drinks with your meal.

Pretty good spot. Came here for lunch today with some of my coworkers, got a corn tortilla steak dish with cactus lettuce on top. I don't recall what it's called but that the description of it.

Service wasn't bad. Waiters and the manager that came out were both friendly. The waiter frequently came around to refill water. Overall pleased with service.

On to my favorite part, the food! The dish I got was quite pleasant. The shredded steak was well seasoned, not dry, the cactus salad had a nice kick to it that complemented the steak well, the tortilla it was on was nice and puffy all topped by some good green sauce.

Overall, this place is worth a visit & definitely a return. I left 4 stars to allow for room for improvement. When I return, they may be worthy of earning 5 stars.

A long story, short: we had an old Groupon for the restaurant which caused us to go.  The restaurant had changed management and had no way to confirm that we weren't cheating with our printout.  So the $20 face value was negotiated to $10.  So I guess the message is we think our customers are cheaters.

Now for the review: the Azul Margarita was very enjoyable.  The at-table guacamole was outstanding.  The salsa and chips were upscale.  The chile relleno with lamb was creative with a properly prepared pepper.  My partner's pork taco delighted.  The coconut flan so good.

And then there was the matter of our Groupon.

Four stars.

Come back?  No.  I don't think so.  Hospitality does not seem to be the restaurant's hallmark.

Amazing food! I thought this place was going to be decent, but it was beyond my expectation. I had the carne asada, perfectly cooked amd seasoned, medium rare. But it was a bit too greasy. But this is one of the best carne asada I've ever had. Their chips & guacs are made fresh, and the horchata was yummy! They also have vegetarian options. Downside is that it was really busy in there, and we had to wait awhile for the food.

Salsa 17 has the perfect name...assuming it means this place gets a score of 17 out of 17 on salsa quality and tastiness.  The chips and salsa were fantastic and the main event also didn't disappoint.  My husband had sizzling fajitas and I had a burrito filled with steak.  Only complaint was that the neighboring table got an order of fajitas as we were in the middle of eating our meal and the smoke drifted directly at our table...it would have been alright but it seemed that it was a bit overcooked, so we were inundated with a burning smell as we tried to enjoy our meal.  I do bet this was just some bad luck and wouldn't hesitate to go back and give it another try.

If you know me, I plan my meals around dessert and in this case I planned to have Capannari's Ice Cream for dessert that day so I was looking for a dinner spot somewhere nearby.  My dining companion, K, and I yelped restaurants in the Arlington Heights area and found Salsa 17.  I later realized that I had walked past it many times when dining in downtown AH and just never stopped in.  We were seated immediately upon arrival but waited a good 5-10 minutes before our waiter arrived but besides that service was very good.  K and I started off with some drinks; he had a Modelo and I opted for red sangria.  His Modelo was a bit watered down but I enjoyed my sangria.  It could have had a little more fruit in it but had a nice balance between sweetness and dryness.  

As for entrees, I ordered the tamales verdes (I think that was the name??) which was filled with pulled pork and came with sides of black beans and Mexican rice.  The portions were generous and much bigger than I expected!  I only was able to finish one tamale and took the other 2 home. The tamales were flavorful with tender pork and the Mexican rice colorful with diced veggies.  I would definitely order the tamales again whether it be the same ones or a different filling.   K cleaned off his plate of chicken enchiladas so it's safe to assume that he thoroughly enjoyed it.  

Service was quick and efficient and I had no complaints.  The manager (I assume) stopped by our table later in the evening to check on us and ask how our food was.  I always appreciate when management makes an appearance because it shows they care.  She was very sweet and thought I didn't like my food since I only ate one tamale.  Little did she know I was saving room for the most important part of the day...DESSERT! 

I recommend stopping by Salsa 17 for a GNO, date night, or basically any sort of occasion.  It's a fun, laid back atmosphere in a great location and I don't think you could go wrong with anything you order.

Great Drinks and Great food! We went on Sunday night so it wasn't busy but you do need to get your order in before kitchen closes at 8:30.  You get unlimited chips and salsa. Also had table side guacamole (it's okay IMO).  We all had fajitas and everyone enjoyed them. 
Our waiter was very patient and gave us great service.

Food was absolutely amazing!  Best tacos pastor I've ever had.  My dad had a tilapia sandwich that was great.  Fish was perfect.  Table side guacamole is outstanding.  Salsa is fresh and homemade.  Staff was really friendly and service was very good.  Definitely the best Mexican food I've had in the suburbs and maybe all of Chicago.  I can't wait to go back again soon!

This place is great! The real deal! I moved from the city about a year ago and couldn't find a great Mexican restaurant like one of my favorites in the city. The food is great! The fried cheese is so good, the steak tacos and enchiladas are great. The chips and salsa they serve is great too. The service was outstanding.  Antonio was our server. I'm so glad I found this place.  We will be back!

If you want a taco that are drier than Sahara desert on a hot August night, this is the perfect place for you! In fact they are so dry, I had to specifically as for hot salsa to douse my tacos to somewhat enjoy them. However, the free chips and salsa are on fire and ya better not burn yourself.

Every time I come here I really do enjoy my food.

The salsa they they bring out is different I think they char grill their tomatoes, I love it! The  table side guacamole is great, they make it just the way you want it.

I always get tacos, they are a good serving size and are always juicy. I can never finish my meal and end up taking them home

I always order a different drink when I go here i think Ive tried most of the margaritas and sangria. 

This and A toda Madre in Glen Ellyn are my all time favorite Mexican spots

I frequent Carlos and Carlos next door. Well we drove there one night only to find out they were Closed for the evening - so we came here since it's RIGHT next door. 

The ambiance is fun! Love the decorating and lighting. It's great! Unfortunately i can't say the same for the actual food. I was not a fan. Our waiter was nice - a little hard to understand, but he was nice. 

I don't think i'll be back. The do have an ADORABLE little outdoor seating area, though! I kinda wish we'd come during summer. 

Maybe you'll like it more than i do. and if not, try Carlos and Carlos next door cuz it's amazing.

My friend and I dined at Salsa 17 in Arlington Heights on April 16th for a late lunch. Let me start out by saying our waiter, Miguel, was attentive, personable, professional and is a great asset to your restaurant, which was very much appreciated in the events to follow. 

My friend and I both ordered the tilapia fish tacos. Halfway into eating the first taco, I noticed some green spots on the second taco and showed my friend. We actually spent a good 5 minutes contemplating... perhaps it was the purple color of the cabbage or was it a fleck from something else that was on the taco? We didn't want to cause any issues but after examining it further, the coloring of the cabbage isn't green nor does it have a fuzzy look to it. My friend then began to examine her tortillas and found green on the edges of hers as well. I asked to see our waiter to which he was quick to respond to this concern. He apologized and said he would have them remade on flour tortillas. 

A few minutes later, Jessica (the manager) approached our table with our plates of moldy tacos in her hands and Miguel trailing behind her. She placed the plates in front of us and said that she "PROMISES" it isn't mold, and that it's the purple dye from the cabbage. We responded and said we understood that the cabbage can bleed onto the tortilla (and saw purple on the tortilla where the cabbage was) but that cabbage is purple and the spots in question were green, fuzzy and on the edges of the tortilla, which were not touching the food on the tortilla. She just stood at our table insisting it wasn't mold and it was clear then that nothing would be done. 

When we brought this issue to our waiter's attention, I was pleased with the way he handled it. But once the manager became involved, it went down a steep hill. Honestly, had they just remade the tacos with the flour tortillas, I wouldn't have even written this and would have just chalked it up to "stuff happens".  I also have a problem with the fact that our plates were taken from our table, out of our sight, then brought back for us to eat. We don't know where they were, who touched them etc so not only were we expected to eat the moldy tortillas but who knows what else? 

This situation was handled very poorly by a member of your management team; someone who should be an example for everyone else. Jessica was the complete opposite of Miguel; displayed attitude, was extremely unprofessional in that no matter what we said to her, she kept "promising" it wasn't mold and dismissed our concerns. I really do not feel we were asking for much in this situation... simply for the meal to be remade without moldy tortillas. It sounds like such a simple solution and yet it was apparently impossible.
