I had not been to Salsa 17 in quite awhile but I can tell you that I will not be back. Not just because of the moldy tortilla but rather because of how this situation was handled by Jessica. This is completely unacceptable.

Really like this restaurant for the table side gauc, atmosphere and their tacos. I give it only 4 stars because we had a problem with the margaritas. They were way too sweet and didn't taste fresh. It was unfortunate because when I want Mexican food, it needs to be paired with a bomb margarita. Unfortunately Salsa 17 fell short there but we got the combo platter of tacos and they were all fantastic. I'll definitely be back, and will probably try the margaritas again. Maybe they were having a bad day. We also got and order of the table side guacamole. It was so good! There's something about getting fresh gauc made right in front of you. I honestly was watching them very intently to see if I could make it at home. I tried to replicate but mine fell short. I guess I'll have to come back to get my fix.

My boyfriend & I went there for the first time last night!  It was a beautiful summer night and we were able to dine outside. It was romantic and the tables are nicely spaced out. They serve chips and salsa when you arrive. The salsa had a very unique but delicious taste. Our server was attentive. The food was hot & delicious!  We will definitely go back!! We are happy we found another great restaurant in downtown Arlington Heights.
My husband and I have been here several times and I absolutely love the food it's very good delicious authentic Mexican food

The table-side guacamole is definitely worth getting. They make the tortilla chips and the salsa there in the store. You can tell. The salsa has a deeply roasted taste. It is exceptional. I had tacos which were very great quality.

I have been thinking about this review for a few days.  I decided that the only way to appropriately rate this place is based on the quality of the food.  We ordered a main speciality, the seasoned salmon, as well as a more moderately priced item, an Al pastor burrito.  The waiter that served us was amazing, making a 2 star review difficult, but I want them to know that their wait staff is very good all the same.  

The salmon was poorly seasoned (dry rub of black pepper, paprika, and Cayenne pepper, really not fitting the fish) on a plate full of mashed potatoes and corn niblets.  The plate was almost two feet long, and only 6inches wide.  Making us both laugh, as we tried to angle the ridiculous thing on the table.  The potatoes were the only edible food on the plate.  The salmon was dry, overcooked, and flavorless.  Half of the plate is occupied by oily deep fried spinach, which was very crunchy, but also flavorless and literally dripping with fryer oil.

This together would have made this restaurant a 3 star affair, as the atmosphere and staff were so good (as well as the margaritas), however the burrito was the worst I have ever had.  It tasted like moldy cheese and mothballs.  I love burritos.  I'll eat them from nice places, fast food joints, wherever.  This was a burrito in shape only.  It tasted more like wet cardboard with bland salsa and chunks of tire for meat.  The rice on the plate was exactly like you'd get from a Goya box, and the refried beans were no better (actually, that's not fair to Goya, as their food prepared correctly tastes pretty good, this was more like reheated leftovers that were left to sit out under a heat lamp for an hour).  The guacamole was also flavorless, like a green mayo, with a few half inch chunks of avocado.

All together I just couldn't believe how bad this food was, especially for the price.  With two drinks and two  meals, the whole thing came to nearly 80 dollars, not including tip.  I don't plan to come back.

TL;DR: bad food, high prices, you'd be happier with Taco Bell.

Ok, the house salsa is amazing. 

Smoky black beans and roasted tomatillos...it was possibly the best salsa I have ever had. 
I ordered a couple appetizers. Calamari was fresh and delicious! Ceviche was also amazing!

I cant wait to come back and experience more of their menu!

I have always been a fan of this place even when it was under different management years ago. I think the dishes are consistently good (sometimes, a little too salty), the chips & salsa are awesome, and the tableside guac is some of the best I've had. Some of my favorite dishes include the tamales and enchiladas of all varieties. I do have to say the chile relleno can use some improvement (especially when you compare it to Mago's down the street).

The only complaints I have are 1) the drinks are not cheap (avg $10) and I've never seen specials on them. Be prepared to spend some coin if you're planning on drinking. 2) When the restaurant is not busy, the service is painstakingly slow. We were there on a Sunday for an early dinner and there was one waitress serving 8 tables. We should have known something was up when the people next were fuming when they left and the waitress kept apologizing. I like to take my time with my meal but not for 2 hours when I have a child with me.

Otherwise, they atmosphere is great with some festive decor, waitstaff is super friendly and food is above average.

Worst combo (veggie & shrimp) fajitas I've ever had!  Only 4 small shrimp, the veggies were predominantly green bell peppers, not a single red pepper, the spices used were disgusting and it was so greasy. Needless to say, I ate the shrimp and the overly greasy onions & zucchini and left the rest. The salsa was very good but the corn chips had a shortening undertone that I couldn't get past. Once they fixed my friend's enchiladas (ordered chicken, got vegetarian), it seemed the others in our group enjoyed their carne asada and cheese enchilada mole (lots of cinnamon in the mole!), personally I won't go back.

Salsa and chips amazing and fresh! Enchiladas verde or carne Asada plates are a must! Friendly staff. The dessert tray, fried ice cream-flan-brownies is so good! Definitely would recommend it, beautiful downtown Arlington heights area. Clean and beautiful decor

We have dined here several times.  They have a great location in downtown Arlington Heights, within an easy walk of several parking garages and the train.  There are also street spots to park in right out front, if you get lucky.  There is outdoor seating down the alley, which is surprisingly charming, with plants and lights.  However, the tables are pretty tiny.  It can be a chore to get all the food and drinks to fit.  They don't supply a gluten-free menu, but the servers are very knowledgable, and are always willing to run back to the kitchen and ask about a specific dish.  (For example, I believe most of the moles and the chips are off-limits, but many other sauces are ok.)  They have luscious made-at-the-table guacamole.  This gives you a chance to get it customized.  No cilantro-no problem.  Double the jalape√±os-right on!  The service has been fine when we have been.  It's not always that speedy, but just take another sip of your cerveza and enjoy the ambiance.  The walls have been painted with a unique combination of men and women from Mexico's past.  Caballeros, banditos, dancers, actresses, and more all leap larger than life size from the warm orange-toned background.  They've also covered the trim with a super-saturated teal that I would love to use in my home.  (C'mon honey, please???)  This place can get very busy on weekends, and whenever downtown is doing something.

Great place to enjoy Sangria and freshly prepared guacamole.  A really nice addition to dining in the Arlington Heights area.  

The queso blanco as an appetizer was great.  Only wish would be that their mole was a bit spicier and in a few more selections

Had a bit of a wait but the wait proved to be worth it.  Service was great and the decor warm and inviting.
Great food and ambience! The only reason this place is not 5 stars is due to slow service.
I'm not sure how I feel about the hostesses, they can use a little brushing up on their customer service but the servers are all great. As for the food, really not great.

Visited here on a Wednesday evening. We ordered the tableside guacamole, chicken quessadillas, and chicken flautas. The tableside guacamole was delicious, one of the best we have ever had.  The only strange thing was that the woman making it only gave us 1 1/2 avocados in it, even though the other half was sitting right there by the bowl. The quessadillas were also very good, but the flautas were not very good. Service was average.
Boyfriend and I love Salsa 17 well we always get their taco platter and split them.. I love their veggie tacos and boyfriend loves their fish ones! Yummy

We went on a Friday night with a group of 7 - had reservations and went early so seated right away. The guacamole was one of the best I've ever had (and I eat it a lot!). All of the servings were large and I can only speak for what I ordered - fajita burrito w/grilled chicken - amazing! And I'll be eating it for several more days - it was huge! The servers were very nice, warm, friendly - even participating in some of our pranks (it was work people I had in my party). Even at the end when we were finishing up our drinks standing at the bar the bartender was so friendly. For me the only downside as a patron is there were a lot of little kids there on a Friday night so I guess it's good for families. I don't live near here but I would definitely go back when in the area.

Great food and great atmosphere. Nice outdoor seating outside right in heart of downtown Arlington heights.  The guacamole cart was the highlight for us and a must try. We also had the fish tacos and the pork tamales which were also really good.

The food was great, the service was very poor. We ordered the cheese dip with our drinks and we got our drinks,food,finished our food then we got the cheese dip. The server refused to take it off the bill because we still got the cheese dip. Don't recommend going here if you enjoy good service.

Came here with my boyfriend for date night and Marcella, our amazing waitress, helped us pick the really cool and delicious sizzling fajitas that we were able to split half pollo and half bistec which were both delicious. I would have posted a pic but we devoured it before I could! Also the table side guac is a must try!

Good food and fair prices. I enjoyed this place quite a bit. HOWEVER, I question their sanitation. When you come here, you will notice their guacamole cart (used for making table-side guac, a MUST) is left out, with NOTHING covering any of the ingredients. Any dust, bugs, people, hands, coughs, sneezes will be landing right in the food...and they store it right by the door, where everybody enters. This makes me question how they do things in the back of the house. This being said, the food was great, and so was the service.
Yummy guacamole! Wait staff could have been more attentive but food made up for their bad service. You will leave very full and with leftovers!

Amazing Mexican food! The chips and salsa were great and our arrachera and carne asada were delicious! I tried both the red and white sangria and they tasted amazing and definitely came with a big punch! I would recommend coming here if you're looking for some great Mexican food in downtown Arlington heights.
Great atmosphere and amazing food!! I recommend going for dinner and eating outside.  I have been there several times and have never been disappointed yet.

Me encanta este lugar! (I love this place!)

Went for dinner on a Wednesday night around 7pm and I'd say at least half the tables were occupied, so pretty good sign considering it's the middle of the week. 

The decor is adorable and really a sight! Huge sombrero & tequila bottle on the walls, awesome paintings/graphics, very clean space, and great food & drinks! 

While walking to our table, another had a cart beside it filled with ingredients: fresh table-side guacamole! We ordered it and it was really good, chunky guac. You can customize to put how ever much or little you want of each ingredient.

We ordered a margarita with ginger and, I believe, peach. I could smell the ginger; very gingery & refreshing. Also got the sangria roja (red sangria), also really good. Also tried the classic margarita with salt rim; yummm. 

Our server brought out tortilla chips with a dark purpleish/black salsa and it was amazing! I loved it. A bit spicy, but not too much. I have no idea why it was the color it was, but so good, I meant to ask if I could buy a jar of it! We had to have seconds. 

I asked our server which Mole sauce she liked best or which one was most popular and she brought out four of them for us to try. OMG. I love them all. They are so interesting in flavor, especially that chocolate, nutty one, the Poblano. The story behind it is interesting, too. Legend says that a nun had to prepare a meal for an archbishop. She emptied her cupboards and mixed a bunch of ingredients to obtain unique flavors. I ended up ordering the Mole Poblano (chocolate one) with Arrachera (skirt steak.) The meat was cooked to my liking & good quality. I still had the sample Mole sauces and used them all with the steak, along with some of the guacamole. Also got to try the Arrachera Chihuahua with mushrooms, peppers & melted cheese. All so good! Black beans came in a cute edible tortilla dish. 

I was too stuffed for dessert, but want to go back & try the apple empanada, a special (especially since the last one I had was from Taco Bell & literally had no apples in it and was probably 95% hollow) and the Pastel de Chocolate Abuelita (flourless chocolate cake) and the Crepas con Cajeta (crepes with plantains) and the Capirotada (bread pudding,) basically everything.

We definitely want to return, especially since my beau loves margaritas and drinks them weekly. Our server was great and we had a very pleasant experience. =)
Visiting from California and we're just looking for a good Mexican food place and this did the job. Good was fairly priced and came out quick and tasted very good. Highly recommended! Get margaritas

Came for lunch with 2 friends on a weekday and ordered a couple of pitchers of Sangaria...never dawned on us that those pitchers would cost $76.00! I lived in NYC for 9 yrs and never paid that much for Sangaria! The waiter brought a female manager over who was less then polite and basically told us they use 17 different high end alcohols and fresh fruit...and that there was nothing she could do bc it clearly states in the menu how much it is. If the food was fabulous it might have made the situation a little less aggravating, but even that was mediocre at best! 

I have an extensive network of friends and everyone I know will be warned to stay away! 

On a positive note our waiter was great!
The fresh guamole was amazing. .the food was fresh..and great tasting. .and I love love the Marigettas here
Great night out with my family. Arlington Heights is a great little town and this is a hip and tasty spot to grab a bite. Try the queso with chorizo.
Excellent authentic Mexican food and a great atmosphere!

I was surprised at how nice Salsa 17 was! It is definitely classy for a Mexican restaurant - this is not your usual hole in the wall. The decor is very modern, and overall just has a very nice feel to it.

You never know what to expect in this area as far as wait times go, but luckily when I went here on a Tuesday night, there was no wait at all! I was seated right away and was given water and chips/salsa. Their salsa is very good - roasted peppers and tomatoes. Yum!

I was disappointed with how pricey their drinks were. The margarita was great, but tiny for $11! Most of the drinks are $9-$11. I thought that was too much for what you get. When I get a margarita, I like them big.

The food was very good. The portions are big, so I felt like it was worth the money. I got the fajitas, and that was probably enough for 2 people. They have a nice selection (pretty much your typical Mexican fare).

The service was very good - our waitress always had our drinks filled, asked if everything was going ok, food came out in a timely fashion, and she boxed up my food for me. No complaints there!

Honestly if their drinks weren't so pricey (of if you got more for your money), this would be a 5 star place for me.

The food is good but the service is TERRIBLE.  I have never been mistreated by a food service employee.  The blonde older hostess is terribly RUDE.  I am convinced she is racist.  She had the audacity to yell at us when we were upset that a 20 minute wait turned into a 45 minute wait.  SHE SHOULD GET FIRED IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!!! VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!!!

I suggest going to Mago or Javiers.  The food is great, the drinks are amazing & the prices are cheaper.  The service is 10x better at those restaurants.

My friends and family will no longer be going to Salsa 17 due to our terrible experience which is very unfortunate because my family would go there at least once a month.

Food is good. I mostly come here for fried ice cream. They don't always have it or its not consistent. So i feel obnoxious for having to call to ask what kind of ice cream they're using that day or of they have it. That pretty much makes or breaks if i will eat there or not. Staff is very nice. Just wish it was a bit more consistent.

This place was fantastic! The salsa,  guacamole, and margarita were my favorite parts of the meal. Do not go though if you are in a hurry. The service was slow, and looking at some of the other reviews this seemed to be a common experience. It was a great place to go out and enjoy the night with friends.

Gotta say, the decor is awesome, definitely loved the style. The table side guacamole was THE BEST, no really it was THE BEST. The black beans that come with the meal are damn tasty. Will have to try it again because the tamale dinner I had was ok, had way better tamales bought on the corner from the old ladies in the city. The person I was with their chicken dinner was also ok. Will definitely go back and try it again though

We came in on a Monday night with flurries. It was very slow with only 3 other tables filled: a couple, a family and business colleagues. The waitress was polite. The chips & salsa and the veg. enchiladas were alright. The black bean and butternut squash tamales did not meet expectation. The atmosphere is run of the mill. The menu is pricey. The location is perfect and they served great corn in the summer festival!

Third time here for lunch and never disappoints. This place is has authentic Mexican food! We started with the table side guacamole and it was delicious. The steak tacos with rice and beans were incredible. Atmosphere was great and I would definitely come back on a weekend night for food and drinks.
Top of the line, Mexican cuisine. Amazing drinks, & the dinners are delicious!  Be prepared to pay for what you get. On some nights it can get very crowded and loud.

I have loved Salsa 17 way back since it was called Fuego when it first opened. I go a few times a year since I moved further north and don't  live close enough to go as often as I used to. I always get the same thing and it is soooooo delicious. The table side guacamole and the queso fundido with poblano peppers are both amazing. In the past, I could tell they were trying to change the queso fundido recipe and it was making me nervous. Today when a friend and I went for dinner  it was back to being as good as it used to be. Phew! Don't mess with perfection! The chips n salsa are always so friggin good as well. If you are in downtown Arlington heights you have to try this place!! The drinks are really tasty, too!!
The food was good and so was the service. We went last night with a group of eight and the wait was 45 minutes to an hour which was fine.

hubby's fajitas were so-so, but my tamales were sooo good! we also shared a Paloma because it was a late lunch, and it was still way too early for me to drink. it's a place where you have to scream just to hear what the person you're talking to is saying, so it was loud with that screechy bachata music. they pack as many tables as they can, so the back of my chair is right up against the chair of the person in the table beside us. sorry stranger! anyways, get the tamales with a Paloma! it will make up for all the other negatives.

So we wanted to try something new and saw that this place had great reviews. We called ahead and made reservations because of the tips on yelp, only to find that we we're the only people there! They make fresh guac and pico and serve with great tortilla chips! The atmosphere is calming and makes you feel like you are somewhere south of the border. Service was great they adapt to your preferences.

What an amazing venue to celebrate Father's Day!  In the heart of scenic downtown Arlington Heights, which is home to several amazing restaurants, if you're in the mood for Mexican, look nowhere else.  I first came here with three of my friends after we had visited Arlington Park Race Course a few years ago.  I live in the city so it's difficult for me to get out to the suburbs, but since my parents live in Buffalo Grove nearby, it was convenient for us this past Sunday.  From my first visit, I remembered the ambiance, the food, and the drinks, and it just left a positive memory in my head.

So, I took my parents there this time.  And let me tell you, it lived up to ALL the memories and expectations I had.  The convenient parking, the beautiful fountain outside, and the awesome summer day made entering this place even more alluring.  A very friendly host greeted us and seated us right away, as we walked into a restaurant that was elegantly and artistically designed to resemble the spirit of Mexico.  From the color scheme to the sombreros to the approachable waiters with the cool "Arriba..." shirts, it felt like I never need to go to Mexico again because I can just go to Salsa 17.  They had nice music playing as well, that wasn't too overpowering.  I definitely heard a Romeo Santos jam. :)

Finally, the food.  Amazingness!  It doesn't matter if your'e vegetarian or not, a drinker or not, because they have EVERYTHING.  We ordered the tableside guacamole, extra spicy, the spinach quesadillas, which were the best quesadillas I have ever eaten in my life, and the vegetarian tostadas, also delicious.  The limonadas were tasty too, and our waitress Marsella was super cool.  The bill was also very reasonable.  I didn't want to leave that place.  I will definitely go back.

This is the best Mexican restaurant in the Northwest Chicagoland area.  No joke.

Quality of the food and drinks here are top notch! Margaritas were very well made with fresh mix and Patron Citronage....add Fortaleza tequila to that and you quite possibly have one of the best ever! Also....whatever they use to marinate their arrachera make some of the best fajitas around. The reduction of one star was for the long wait with having reservations. Great waitress! We'll be back!

This place just didn't do it for me. It's a popular place but I don't get it! The salsa was super salty and the drinks were watered down. We got the enchiladas and they tasted bland and like a bunch of salt was piled on. The rice and beans were tasteless too. If I'm going to spend a decent amount at a restaurant it better be worth my money but this just wasn't. The waiter was also rushing us which never makes you feel good. Thanks but no thanks Salsa17.

I know that tonight was a busy night but an accurate estimate of wait times would be nice.  I have no problem waiting an hour when I am told it will be an hour.  But at an hour and half and two hours I start to get cranky.
Plus I know people were getting in ahead of my family.  I guess that was my fault; I was being polite (despite having a crying child) and others were being rude and more demanding.  
I will certainly think twice before I consider coming back.  
I was able to get my son Taco Bell.  Yeah there is a quality difference but they were able to get me what I asked for when I asked for it.

Yelp codes their star system like this - 2 stars means "Meh, I've had better" and 3 stars means "A-Ok".  I had to give Salsa 17 2 stars because honestly, I *have* had better and it really wasn't A-Ok. It was just 'ok'. We liked the decor (yes, a little busy) and our hostess that seated us and waitperson that waited on us was really nice. The food was the same food you can get an ANY Mexican restaurant. There was nothing bad about this place - there was just nothing outstanding about it either. I will say that we ordered a meal and we are real gringos so we don't like really spicy food. Trust me, I know - I get it, I'm going to a Mexican restaurant and there is going to be a lot of that type of food BUT we have been to plenty of Mexican restaurants and had great non-spicy meals. With that being said, we asked if a dish was hot and we were told it was not. It was. Really hot. I couldn't finish it. 

The guacamole - outstanding! Seriously some of the best we've had. Chips, super salty. Meh.

Best Mexican food around.

Perfect Wednesday night out. 6:00 and about half filled so no waiting around. Place was packed by about 6:30. 

Fresh guacamole was nice. I ordered the skirt steak with a chicken enchilada with mole poblano. They use great ingredients and it shows as the flavors are popping. 

Id recommend this place to everyone.

Went here after my daughters high school graduation. Food and drinks were good. Service was very slow and the restaurant was not even half way full. Overall, I am disappointed with the $7.95 "birthday special." I asked our waitress if she could do anything special to celebrate the graduation. She said they can bring her a small dish of ice cream and sing (similar to the happy birthday song. Just replaced word birthday with, graduation.) It was very nice and my daughter loved it. But to my surprise they charged almost 8 bucks for a scoop of vanilla ice cream!!! Aka "birthday surprise." Needless to
Say our total bill was over 250.00 just taken back at what could have been a great complimentary gesture... Be aware for the "birthday surprises."

1st time at this restaurant great foods nice atmosphere the salsa and chips to die for I had chicken fajita my friends have chicken burritos the both were delicious unbelievable I give this restaurant.4 stars
Good food!!! Liked that they used fresh spinach in there enchiladas and quesadillas. They have spicy & non-spicy salsa. This place definitely beats Mago's food.

Service was great.  Circus and atmosphere  were great.  The  food  was made
As if in Mexico    The desert was 
Real good

We had an enjoyable late lunch. The margaritas are very good and definitely on the "citrusy" side.  I especially enjoy their version of salsa - it looks like it is prepared with a mole' base.
I had the fish enchiladas which are prepared with scallops and shrimp and a red sauce and cheese are drizzled over them.  It was very good.  My dining partner had the spinach and cheese quesadillas.  She let me try one and I thought it was OK but didn't have much spice.
All in all this was a decent lunch.

This place has really gone downhill since it was Fuego. Not real busy anymore which should have been a sign. We'd been here once since the change and it was ok, but not great. So we thought we'd give it another shot.
We waited for over half hour for our entree, the "surf and turf" special which was suggested as an upgrade to the regular mixed fajitas. The steak was well done instead of requested medium rare and quite dry. The beans and rice were just so-so and barely warm. They cooked us another steak, but we had to wait another 20 minutes and while cooked to the right temp it was tough and not a great cut of beef. Should have insisted on the regular fajitas. 
The wait staff was pleasant and apologetic, but there are better choices out there. Don't think I'll be back.

Although we had a reservation and arrived 15 minutes early we were not seated until 30 minutes after our assigned reservation. They seated parties without reservations in front of us which I was confused as to why they bother taking reservations. Anyway they do have a nice bar and bellied on up for some TASTEE top shelf margaritas. Defiantly checkum out. The setting is fun and well decorated. I do have to say the music was crazy loud and not very authentic to what I would imagine. During dining hours might want to rethink the club vibe and volume of the music. Now to the food. Guacamole made at the table was tastee, although I specifically asked for it to be spicy unfortunately it was not... but still worthy of devouring. The salads are BIG And glad we split it. The entrees are also GIANORMOUS but I have to say again were very bland. The service was adequate with a few flaws both nothing horrible. Overall a good spot but could use some fine tuning.

Downtown AH.  Tuscan and TTowa are fantastic.  Otherwise, meh.  Lots of atmosphere and quite a scene, but what about the food?  

This place has good salsas, as per the name, great beverages and wonderful moles, but the entrees are just okay.  Pretty good shrimp.  Bland chicken tamale, but nothing really wrong with it.  

When we want mexican food, we go to Wheeling...or any El Famous.  And we use paper napkins, plastic forks and save a bundle.  Better food, less atmosphere.  Great trade off.

Salsa 17 has a wonderful atmosphere.  In the summer you can sit outside and take in downtown Arlington Heights and hear the music from the park.  Make sure to get the guacamole that is made table side. You are sure to enjoy it!

Came here for the first time excited to finally try the restaurant as I'm a local. However what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my boyfriend turned into the dinner from hell. The table next to us was seated after us yet was leaving by the time we FINALLY got our food. 


Two tables down a couple that sat down significantly after us also left by the time we finished our dinner and were waiting  some more to ask for the check. At least when we finally got the check I asked the manager for the discount and she took an app and drink off the bill. 


Needless to say I will DEFINITELY never come back and suggest you don't either (but if you do definitely try to avoid Miguel, the server). My suggestion is Mago's or Javier's instead!!!
Pork Tenderloin with Chorizo Cream Sauce was excellent. Would like more Guacamole at my table side. Overall one of best meals in past year.

Growing up on the Mexican border and traveling through Mexico through my life I can tell you this place is the real deal!Even in Texas it's hard to get Mexican food this good.

Tastiest and most authentic Moles. Wonderful selection of wines (try Navarro Malbec red wine with any beef dish). Generous size portions and many options which are naturally gluten free.

If you are gluten free, their secret to tasty fajitas is a splash of soy sauce. I know it sounds unconventional but it's undetectable that is what's in there but can hurt a celiac.

I've had great experience with food here 9/10 times and the one time it wasn't great it was still good.

The staff are sweet, warm and helpful and really represent the best of the culture of Mexico.

I am Mexican and everybody always ask me about a good Mexican place, well this is the place to go. Mole is really hard to make  and.they have 4 different kinds here. Good fresh guacamole. Great margaritas and drinks. In general all the dishes have great hi quality. If you are a little more adventurous try the Huitlacoche chicken... So good!

Let me say the pros and the cons 

     First the pros.  The food was amazing, the portions were huge, and the staff was very friendly.


The cons.  They got my order mixed up.  They didn't tell us that the fried ice cream portions were so huge, otherwise we would've shared.

I gotta admit, being such a Mexian makes me feel a little guilty for loving this place so much. Although it certainly is an authentically Mexican restaurant, for the most part, there are tiny little details in their menu that make it very obvious most of their customers aren't Mexicans. 

Nonetheless, this place was nothing short of amazing!

We decided to have my Daddy's birthday dinner here since he's your typical Mexican; he refuses to eat anything other than Mexican food. We arrived on a Saturday at around 6 PM. And although finding parking was a bit of a hassle, we got lucky and found a good spot. 
When we walked in, the hostess told us it would be about a 25-30 minute wait. It was nice out so we decided to wait outside since she asked for our number and said she would just call when our table was ready. I assume they do this since they really have no space for people to wait inside the restaurant. And since it's located in the heart of the town, there are lots of shops within walking distance. 

To my surprise, they had a copy of their menu on the wall just outside the door. I loved this because it makes the ordering process so much faster! We only ended up waiting about 10-15 minutes. Our server was a fellow Mexican, and was very nice and helpful. Our drinks, although were a little on the "too sweet" side, were delicious. We decided we must try their famous table-side guac. However, by the time the lady was able to get through the crowds and packed tables, make our guac, and serve it, our food was already being served as well.

I definitely can't complain, the food came out super fast! I certainly wasn't expecting that since they were so busy. We for sure thought there was no way any of us would finish our entrees since we devoured the chips with the guac and both of the delicious salsa's the serve beforehand. But everything was so delicious. For once, there were NO leftovers.

Once the food arrived, I loved that it was literally still sizzling from the stove! Since it was just my family, I got a chance to try a piece of all of our plates. Seriously, OMG. These guys don't joke around. 

I ordered the chicken stuffed with cheese and peppers. They pour some type of mushroom sauce over it, and serve it with their famous chipotle mashed potatoes. I think my favorite part of all was the mushroom sauce. I can't even try to describe it. It was so perfect! Another thing that wowed me was the quality of the chicken. It wasn't too dry, and cooked to perfection! I'm a cheese lover, so having it stuffed with loads of cheese was perfect. Oh and we can't forget those amazing mashed potatoes! The perfect amount of spicy-ness!

I also had a chance to try their Carne Asada, and I can't deny I was so impressed! The quality of their meat is insane! And it was literally cooked to perfection! My brother and sister both got different kinds of shrimp entrees. One was some type of garlic saute, and the other was with chipotle sauce. They both came with the chipotle mashed potatoes. I can't say that I prefer one over the other, they were both delicious, and I loved that their shrimp were so big. 

The fajitas was probably the only entree that didn't have that "wow" factor. But of course, the quality was still consistent with everything else. 

As far as price, for a Mexican restaurant, it is certainly a little on the high end. Although, considering it's location, it's probably spot on. However, I've been to many overpriced Mexican restaurants, and this, by far, is worth every penny!

Hence my super long review.

By far, the best place, Mexican or not, to eat in Arlington Heights. It's always great. Never fails. Great owner (Hi Amy!) Great staff. Great location. Great ambiance. Great vibes. We just love it, and I thank them for having a nice vegetarian section of their menu, which can also easily be veganized.

Our meal was average. The shredded chicken was a nice change from the usual grilled chunks of chicken breast. However, it was all pretty bland and underwhelming. My tamale was alright. My tostada was soggy. And my taco was so subpar I couldn't finish it. It's not a terrible place to eat. Clean. Fast service. Better than you're average run of the mill Mexican joint. But not worth the prices they're charging.

Great people great family owned and operated
The minute we walked in max was welcoming on xmas eve night
Me and my girl will definitely go back there for a killer margaritas
Highly recommended and deserve 5 stars*****

This place is the best Mexican restaurant in the NW burbs in my opinion, as long as you aren't concerned about the price

We are vegetarians and their options are spectacular.  The Chile Rellenos ... they make my head spin they're so good.  The black bean tamales with goat cheese are spectacular as well.  This is a next-level Mexican food location - not your typical Mexican-American food.  Think Fontera Grill downtown.  The table guacamole service and salsas are a step above almost every other Mexican restaurant I've visited too.  My only criticism would be that the food is on the salty-side, but that's an unfortunately pervasive state of things at upscale restaurants these days (thanks Gordon Ramsay)

The drinks, though expensive, and staff are top notch.  They have homemade sangria onsite but I'm a sucker for the margaritas.  The mezcal based one is my favorite.  This is one of our hands-down favorite restaurants and where I bring my lady on many of our most special evenings.

Usually can't get out of here for under $100, but we do leave feeling warm, very well fed, appreciated and with lots of leftovers

This place is legit!! Drinks are insane. The mister and his friends swore by the drinks until he got me to go. 

Was not a big fan of the ceviche, not bad but not my favorite. 

Will definitely be going back! Only wish I remembered the name of the drink he raves about. Even the Mai Tais are great ;)

I just had the Ensalada Margarita with grilled shrimp and it was probably the best salad I've had in years.  Wonderful combination of greens with shrimp, tomatoes, sliced avocado, orange slices, a Mexican cheese which was very firm and an orange based vinegarette.  I would HIGHLY recommend it.  Their salsa doesn't suck either.

Pretty good, authentic Mexican restaurant. The chips were warm and the salsa smoky and had a good amount of heat, which I liked. I got the shrimp tostadas - too spicy and too many onions for me. My wife got the enchiladas with salsa verde. The chicken in the enchiladas was super moist and tender. Rice and beans were fairly standard. Got the apple crepes for dessert. Really good dessert - I'm not big on sweets but I enjoyed it.
Service was great overall. Fast, prompt and polite. I would return. Many menu items I still want to try.

I am enraged that my original review which I posted one day ago has been deleted from the public eye. Please note, yelp reviewers and Yelp's employees, that I will continue to post this review until it is no longer being deleted. I have every right to account for my experience.

Below is my original review:

We had an amazing experience dining here. Our serve Antonio was not only well veresed on every dish on the menu, but was courteous and articulate throughout the evening. We ordered two dishes and the chicken we tried was mouthwatering and so savoury. I couldn't get enough of the many flavors in the dish, I wish I remembered the name of it. The place is beautiful and the atmosphere at night is lively and youthful. We were going to pass on dessert, but Antonio was so descriptive in explaining the ingredients in the fried ice cream that we had to give it a try. Wow. Incredible! We are going to come here again and again, and definitely will request the fine dining experience we received with Antonio. If you haven't been here, I would recommend trying their homemade guacamole, made fresh to order with chopped garlic. A+

When I was served my first mojito on a Friday night --the place completely packed by a crowd of people in all of their suburbanite glory--I noticed two things: the blended mint leaves --a big no no-- and the almost nauseating excess of sugar.  Mojitos are supposed to be a refreshing drink, but after finishing mine at Salsa 17, I felt as thirsty as a sponge in the middle of the Death Valley desert. I asked the bartender if they could please take it easy on the sugar --as in using half of what they had used, at the most-- and she proceeded to tell me the mojitos came from a pre-made mix. I could not believe my ears. Specially having to fork 10 a piece for each drink. I can only imagine all of their drinks are just some Walmart bought mix with some added ice. After seeing some of their dishes come out of the kitchen, I realized that the whole place is a lot of style with little substance. In the end, we decided to just get some tacos at an unassuming taco joint, even if that meant not rubbing elbows with the polo shirt and khaki shorts crowd.

One of the best meals I've had in the last few years (and I live in Manhattan and spend half my paycheck dining out).

Salsa, calamari, and moles were highlights.

Loved this restaurant! Went for dinner on a Monday. We had the friendliest server (Ulises) who was fast and attentive. Food is amazing. You must get the table-side guac. Delicious, and it's fun to watch them make it in front of you. I had the chicken fajitas which came with beans, rice, guac, sour cream, cheese, pico de gallo, and of course the grilled veggies. Some of the best fajitas I've ever had. My boyfriend had the enchiladas verdes and loved them. The ambiance is great and we loved sitting outside in the decorated alley- they did a great job converting that into an eating area. I had sangria blanco which was also delicious and came with fresh fruit (unlike some places that use canned, or just plain old nasty fruit). Highly recommend, great for a date night. Reasonable prices as well.

The manager (I'm assuming she was the manager) came around to our table and made sure everything was okay during our meal. She was very much a people person and had a very professional demeanor, so brownie points for that (she was the manager with the owl tattoo).

Great to see that this Gem of an Italian restaurant is still here years later!!

So we were out celebrating Friday evening before going to the movie theater across the street and we had a good hour and a half before the movie started , and I suggested we try De Marcos.

I used to go there at least 20 years ago and I have to say that this place has not changed one bit. back then there was no " yelping" but here we are in 2016 and I have to say..... This place is really good. 

Yes its hidden on the very corner in the small little strip of businesses, yes parking can be a challenge, and yes with a blink of an eye you'd pass it up if you don't know its there or if you're going for the 1st time and get turned around trying to navigate the area.but its right on the corner of 53 and Lake street/

So everything in the area was packed, considering it was Friday evening , the week before Thanksgiving and it seemed like everyone was out, But we parked, walked in, and were seated instantly.

Our Waitress, Mary, was at our table within one minute and took our drink order - 1 French Martini and 1 glass of Pinot Noir- made very good and wine tasted fabulous!!

Bread basket with small pizza tomato bread cut into squares- The tomato sauce is a hit!! was placed on the table and we enjoyed that before putting in our order and that alone would've been enough with drinks.

 So we ordered The Portabello mushroom appetizer which was prepared with some garlic and balsamic served warm and that was like wow---- as they say in Campbell soup labels-- mmmmm good!! a must rry.

On to dinner: we ordered the Lasagna and chicken breasts in a wine sauce served with potatoes and Italian sausages and I have to say that  I was very pleased at how moist and flavorful the chicken was . ordered a side of angel hair pasta which tasted like it was home made and served with the "red sauce" again -- mmmmm gooood!! that sauce alone is really good! The lasagna was as good as any, not to over powering with any ingredient but just right..

De Marcos was good back then and its definitely just as good today !! I would highly recommend it when ever you're out  and would like to do dinner before a movie or want to have dinner with  you spouse/ or gf /bf or have a family gathering. It's as authentic as good 'ol Nanas"  home cooking. 

The dining area is very comfy, the bar is a good size to have a few or while you wait when its busy and is not cheap on the liquor, you want a drink? well you'll get your moneys worth thats for sure, and the staff is very attentive  fast, no waiting here!.

cant talk about it any more to give you an idea of what its like , so you should check it out, you wont be disappointed !!

I've driven past this restaurant seven zillion times and never even noticed it was there. The outside is completely unassuming - dare I say, boring - and there are plenty of Italian restaurants in our rotation, so I wouldn't have even bothered to venture to a new one if our friends hadn't asked us to dine with them there a few weeks ago.

And we would have been forever missing out.

This is one of those weird reviews where the decor, the ambiance, the price, none of that really mattered. Because the food. Is so. Good. So good.

The interior is fine. The lack of a wait on a Friday at 7 was phenomenal. Our server was perfectly charming (and described every menu item in such rich detail that I wanted it all!). We began with an appetizer special - fresh buffalo mozzarella with thick, fresh tomato slices, shredded basil, kalamata olives, and good olive oil. It was the perfect caprese salad, I could have eaten six more portions of that incredible mozz. For the main, I went with the gnocchi pasta, with sage and butter sauce, and sausage. It sounds so simple, but sometimes simple is easiest to screw up. This was incredible. The gnocchi was fresh, the portion was ample, and the texture was al dente, almost chewy, perfection.  The sage was fresh and flavorful, the rich butter sauce was decadent, and the sausage was savory and plentiful. It was so easy but so sophisticated. Comforting but elegant. It's tough to describe how well curated this plate of pasta was, but it was delicious.

If you're looking for authentic, rich, comforting, fantastic food in a quiet and simple atmosphere, take a chance on those anonymous looking, easy to pass up little corner restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

RDM's is located in a small strip mall off of Lake. If you weren't looking for it you may miss it. You can't enter off of Lake. You have to enter on Rohlwing.

This is a white table cloth place, but it does not come off as too fancy. We came for a casual lunch and didn't feel too out of place. 

This is a traditional Italian restaurant.

I had the ravioli, which was a mistake simply based on portion size for myself, it was good. Bread, with oil and parmesean are provided. Some meals come with a  salad or soup.

I had never been here before. A friend suggested it as she always wanted to try it. We were there on a Thursday (10/27) afternoon around 1 pm. We were quickly seated and they brought out the menus. They had a variety of daily specials. We had a chicken in a Brandy sauce. It was very very good. It came with a side of pasta with red sauce it was good. Table bread was a nice treat. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. 

While we were there there was a small party in the backroom and a few tables of other folks. It wasn't packed around 1 PM which was nice we had a chance to sit and talk and didn't feel rushed. 

Some misc things. The parking is a bit of a pain but workable. It appear the crew is allowed to eat together after the lunch crowd which was very nice to see. They kept one server at the door to watch for new guests (very nice that they do that -congrats to the owners). They did serve Diet Coke in bottles vs. fountain. 

I would go back in a heart beat...Go and enjoy....

A solid white-tablecloth Italian restaurant with good service.

The menu is not particularly lengthy but there were 6 specials the night we dined.  We both ordered pasta dishes off the regular menu and they were fine.  We started with  a half dozen baked clams that were the typical quarter to half dollar sized clams that restaurants typically serve these days.  Yes, they were good but very small.  At close to $9, skip them they are not worth the price.  (If you want really good, plentiful baked clams, check out my other reviews.)

I had my usual Bolognese pasta that  I always order when dining at a new Italian restaurant.  Yes, it was very good.  (If I hadn't been spoiled by an incredible Bolognese I had in Door Cty, the one at De Marco's would have rated excellent.)  My wife had a shrimp, scallops and vegetables with garlic & oil.  She really enjoyed it.

We started with the excellent cream of mushroom soup.  This was definitely the highlight of the meal.

Drinks are fairly priced.  You'll find wines by the glass for $7.  My vodka on the rocks was $8.  My wife said the Cosmopolitan was excellent.  Our server, Drew, was friendly while being efficient.

A 3-star review should not be construed as "average".  It was "A-OK".  Drinks and service were excellent and the food was good.  Prices for pasta dishes are a little high.  This impacts my price/value ratio and why I rate them 3-stars.  There is a LOT of competition for Italian retaurants.  De Marco's offers a good solid meal but so do many others.
Great Italian food we ordered for take out once.  We got mussels in marinara sauce, grilled calamari, linguine with seafood & chicken dish.

This used to be THE place.  I've been going here forever...at least 15 years.  My favorite thing about dining here was the energy.  It was always packed.  Sometimes there would be parties...famous people...proposals...you never knew!  The service was amazing and if you were a regular, and I was, so very fun and personal.  The food was always exceptional.  Favorites:  Chicken marsala, seared tuna, their tiramisu is the BEST and their white chocolate cheesecake...omg!   BUT...

When the economy turned Jerry (the owner) and some of the staff were oblivious.  The prices, which were already up there, continued to climb even as the restaurant emptied.  Some of the staff started playing games with the bills to see how much they could inflate a check.  Asked for the house wine?  Surprise!  I gave you the premium.  Asked for a simple mix of pasta, spinach and ricotta? Surprise!  I'm going to see if you'll pay $27 for it.  Suddenly MY restaurant couldn't be trusted  and I started noticing more and more how empty it was...  How tired everyone seemed...  How Jerry or his wife would sit at a table like it was their living room rather than a public dining room.  That's not fun.  That's not energetic.

We started going less and less and after one too many bill "mistakes" my husband instituted a boycott.  I continued to occasionally go on the sly.  But you know how it is once you've been a regular...  If it becomes obvious you've found somewhere else to go there is resentment when you return.  I'd start being offered bad tables in an empty dining room.  Service would be slow, again, in an empty dining room.  The last time I went...and it WAS my last time ever...I received full-on hostile service.  It was shocking.  

I have no doubt the food is still quite good but every time I drive by, even during prime dining hours on a Friday or Saturday night, the place looks nearly empty.  I saw another reviewer mention getting in on a weekend and picking her own table without a reservation as if this was a good thing!  It's not.  It shows a formerly great restaurant in a death spiral.

A better choice would be Za Za's just down the road.
Incredible food. Great family-like atmosphere. This is some high quality Italian food! As you can tell, I really enjoyed my meal. Grab a espresso to finish off your meal! Ben fatto!
Never had a bad meal here! The grilled octopus and baked clams are my favorite, I'll go to order a bunch of appetizers and get full off that. The zuppa di pesce is amazing! Great authentic food!

Could easily be a five star restaurant.   It was just missing a bit of "we are happy you are here."    It almost seemed like the lady of the house was on vacation.   Food is the real deal.  Service excellent.

Really great Italian food in an unassuming place that's not too dance and not too much of a dump either.

Always get one of the specials.  They typically have more than five every night.  Great authentic food, good wine and a friendly attentive staff.  

Additionally this place is good for business dinners.  Definitely recommend it!

THEIR RAVIOLIS ARE AMAZING!!! Every time I go back to Addison, I look forward to visit the restaurant! May not be the most fancy place or something but they definitely make their food with love and man, as an Italian you can actually taste it!

Omar works the bar at the front door, and his recommendations are impeccable.  It wasn't busy this Friday I went for an early dinner, and his recommendations for not only specials, but menu items is spot on.  I had something from the menu (I just don't remember the name of it), but it was exquisite!!!  highly, HIGHLY recommended for a nice dinner.. 

This could be quite the romantic spot for a couple, absolutely.

The ONLY downfall if it is that, is location. It is located at a super busy intersection, on a corner of a strip mall, so you'll miss it if you blink or have the green light.
Great pasta and seafoods.  Great value and good service. Very authentic Italian cuisine. No regrets going here.
My sister and I absolutely loved it here. I loved the Tiramisu the most, thank you for a wonderful dinner.

Ate here at lunch today, and they had plenty of specials.  The tri-colored lobster ravioli with shrimp in a light cream sauce was the boss!  Every bite both caused my taste buds to rejoice yet made me a little sadder because it meant that the end of the meal was closer. (ok - my mouth is watering again just thinking about it.)

The house salad was nothing special, but no complaints about it...the job of a salad is to prep you for the main course, unless you actually are in Italy, but that's another issue.  Fresh pepper made optional by the server is always a nice touch.

Very nice waitstaff, and the insides of the place was fine.  The strip mall that the place is in is disappointing, so don't shy away because of that.

I would have given 5 stars, but $2.75 for a 7.5 oz bottle of coke?   Seriously???

First impression. Lots of suits. Literally a room full of men. Oh-and it smelled like cigars.Once seated were were so close to the men next to us that we might as well been sitting with them. We heard ever single word of their conversation.When it came time to order, I was disappointed the waitress told me that they were OUT of mussels to complete my seafood diavolo. Okay, is it so impossible to go to the store and buy more? Ergo, I asked to substitute  for more calamari instead. My fiance ordered GRILLED calamari as an appetizer and that is EXACTLY what it tasted like. The grill dominated the flavor. It might as well been thrown straight onto the coals. I suppose they have yet to master how to cook calamari this way. If this is what it IS suppose to taste like then....yuck!

Anyhow, when my entree arrived I was excited until I realized it was the 80% pasta 20% SEAFOOD rip of meal.I also requested it be spicy and ended up dousing it in Tabasco sauce, Needless to say, The linguine went home and my fiance ate it for lunch the next day. 

Cons

-Shaker Parmesan cheese? Really?

-Tables to close

-smelled like cigars at entrance

-overpriced pasta I could make at home. 

-out of food required for meal 

Pros

They had actual Tabasco sauce. 

-the waitress was nice.

-The  complimentary fruit dish at at the end was fresh. But why did the two guys 
next to us get waaay more watermelon then we did? /:I

Sorry DeMarcos. I will not be coming back.

Had a wonderful dinner last night with fellow employees! I had the Grouper special and it was delicious. The owner greeted and seated us as well as checking in during dinner. Mario our server recommended the grilled calamari-amazing! I will never it fried again! Other dinners included the spinach ravioli, lemon chicken and veal. Everything was delicious, service was impeccable. We are already booking a party for March!
Rotolo was delicious! Baked clams fantastic!  Focaccia bread was good too. Everything washed down with some tasty wine of your choice. I'll be back for that rotolo asap!

Well, I figured it was about time that I wrote a review on this place since I have been going there for years and years.

This place is located in a small strip mall on Lake and Rohlwing. 

I have to say that each and every time here, I have never had a meal that was below excellent. The food here is just delicious. I most always get pasta but I have had their specials too. Every time delicious. 
The bread with their house garlic butter would alone satisfy me but I know that there are lots and lots of good things to eat. The Linguine Del Gulfo (I think I spelled it right) is pretty incredible. All sorts of seafood on a perfect pasta and sauce. White clam linguine is some of the best you will have.
This last visit, my wife had the spinach ravioli special which was just something else. The spinach was the pasta with a fluffy cheese stuffing in a delicious sauce that had some sage in it .I like going with her because she always lets me  try her food. ;)
I also like that they provide some complimentary fruit at the end of dinner.

So maybe you ask why am I only giving four stars instead of five? The prices. They are up there. They are dollars more than I believe they should be but I still go there anyway because it is so good. Their pour on the wine could be larger too, but so what? I get two glasses.

I am glad I live fairly close by.

Hands down, this is the best place for Italian food in the western suburbs. Really.

Cheers to All

My wife and I have been go here for over 20 years and have never been disappointed.  Their wait staff is always knowledgeable of the menu and their great specials along with attentive service.  When the owner is there he always greets us and remembers us with a welcoming handshake.  Great place for Italian cuisine and the family.  Very accommodating for a large group also.
Had dinner there tonight. Food, staff, and atmosphere is perfect. I have not been there in at least 10 years. I love the way the place lays out. The bar is awesome. Great job.

The bar area looks nice, small, but still ok for groups.

The restaurant part is nothing to write home about, the music is played from overhead speakers, some of them directly over tables. Instead of non-descript music, the local radio is played, including the annoying ads in between.

It seemed to be all a bit rushed - the waiting staff, how your food was served, etc.

We had the grilled tuna, cheese ravioli and grilled calamari. No risotto on the menu, unfortunately.

Calamari was grilled ok, nothing special, the tuna seemed overpriced for the quality / thickness, the cheese ravioli is, well, cheese ravioli.

All in all, a dinner with taxes for about $57 - overpriced.

Not what I expected
I have always wanted to try this restaurant when I was passing by Lake/53. However every time I was on my way to somewhere else and not able to make a stop for a meal.  Well 2 weeks ago we tried. Pasta - italian sausage - meat balls - they taste like fast food. Well if they sat in a food court in shopping mall, it makes more sense.... Disappointed!
Big fan! Authentic Italian cuisine. The place is a gem!!!

Demarco's,

This is going to be your best review yet!  I remember my first time coming here was in HS. I had some delicious pasta and fresh bread.  Don't be deceived by a restaurant in a plaza.  This one would easily top most restaurants in Little Italy.

I know somebody who was in the hospital, and the first meal they wanted was Demarcos.  

The grilled seafood with angel hair pasta is delicious.  Comes with butterflied shrimp, fish, and octopus.  I had the salmon.  Let me say the only other salmon I enjoyed at a restaurant in Chicago was at Blackbird. It was so juicy and flavorful.  The greens on the side with garlic was a nice compliment.

I would like to say that the server Debbie is wonderful!  

Great place, go check it out.

My first time here.  I pass it almost everyday going to working for the years but never stopped to give it a try.  I had the clam linguine in the white sauce.  It was excellent. There was just a touch of too much garlic in it but I love garlic so I was not too upset about it at all.  It was a decent sized seating area and they seated us and every party eating there away enough from each other that we could not hear our conversations.  The staff was very friendly and I was impressed by the number of specials they were running at the time.  Our waitress was awesome and made sure we were happy with everything.  Good food, great staff! I will be back!
I get the same dish every time I go and always good.  Wish they had fresh parm cheese.

small place with a bar in the front, cozy atmosphere, friendly staff.
luckily we called ahead and got a table within 30 minutes, we got fried calamari and baked clams for appetizers 
calamari was okay, not the best ive had, didnt try the clams but the others said it was tasty.
I had the chicken marsala, entree comes with soup or salad. soup really filled me up, i barely ate my marsala, which was tasty also. My boyfriend went for the chicken parmesan, yummmyyy, it was really good, and it was a large portion 
for dessert we got tiramisu, not the best i've had, but it was still good.
nice place to go to, but since its out of our way, we probably won't make a special trip out here.

My friend S and I came here because we wanted to get some seafood in the Addison area.  We came here at dinnertime and were seated very promptly.  The restaurant itself is relatively small but they had outdoor seating as well.  Some older gentlemen were having drinks and smoking cigars outside.   Once we sat down, we were served the standard bread, olive oil, and vinegar expected at an Italian restaurant.  They also had a pizza bread that was pretty good too.  There was an extensive wine menu, but we did not order anything to drink.  

The daily specials seemed to be the way to go here and were highlighted by the waitress.  They had 7-8 specials for the day in review.  I ordered a tilapia and S ordered the Calamari Risotto Diablo.  When the tilapia came out, I couldn't believe the size of it and it came with a side of pasta!  The tilapia was done right: flaky and light, pan fried to perfection.  It was smothered in a tomato based sauce and olives and tomatoes sprinkled over it.  I didn't think I would eat the whole thing but I managed to make it through (thank god for my appetite).  I didn't have the room to finish the al dente pasta that came with the meal.  My friend S's dish was good too.  The risotto was wonderfully creamy and they weren't kidding about the diablo; the dish was spicy as well!  He couldn't finish the dish either, so we both ended up packing up lunch for the following day.  

The service was wonderful here.  As quickly we were seated was as quick as everything else.  My glass of water was never less than three-fourths full and I never had to look around to find the waitress.  They gave us fruit for dessert which was perfect after a large meal, even though we said we did not want dessert.  I would recommend this place as a wonderful date spot and also for larger eaters.  I am definitely coming back here.
Had a great dinner.

Wow expensive! Upon the reviews we found on yelp and other guides, we ordered right off of the specials menu. $18 for a grilled octopus appetizer that was charred nicely, but not blanched in cold water afterwards; thus incredibly rubbery and chewy. My wife ordered the lobster linguine - $28 and me the tilapia special with spinach for $25. My tilapia was delicious, although the portion was tiny given only 1 side. My wife's meal was average at best, although the portion was much better. After a glass of wine for the wife (water for me), and a piece of tiramisu we had a $115 bill after 17% tip (mind you the bus staff does ALL the work and the wait staff took it easy). $115 is a mag mile price for dinner - not a strip mall location in a western Chicago suburb. Food was good, not necessarily great; all in all we won't be back given the outrageous prices.

First, this restaurant is in a strip mall next to a nightclub and piercing studio. Once you get past that, the restaurant is nice, service was impeccable, good veal parmigiana and delicious tiramisu. I think this is the best place in Itasca, so go. Just remember, the location brings it down a star.

great italian joint in a random strip mall, filled w/ real character, real characters & real, authentic food. their veal saltimbocca is so good it might be what veal dreams of becoming when it grows up (could make a vegan change teams) & the chicken diablo will blow your face off. true story.

I went to DeMarco's last year for Valentine's Day and only waited for 15 minutes!!! They have a bar located  in the front waiting area so we grabbed a cocktail until our table was ready.  If people are looking to arrive at a restaurant on a Fri/Sat night without waiting for at least 20-30 minutes you are apparently new to earth. The food at DeMarcos is amazing and it will hands down beat any Italian restaurant (chain) that you will go to. It is pricey but if you are looking for authentic Italian food in a  warm and romantic place I def suggest DeMarcos. The dining area is smaller but I didn't have an issue with noise or anything. It just feels very authentic and that is what everyone should be looking for when dining.
Great food, family owned and operated. Ask about the daily specials.

Food was good, service was good, WE'LL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN! Our lunch bill was presented as $40.51 - the change we got from $50 cash was $9.00. When questioning the explaination was: "we round up from 50 cents. HUH? IS THIS EVEN LEGAL?

For the life of me I can't understand why some people recommend this restaurant . Three times I have been there and you couldn't get me to go back there even at "gun point". And speaking of gun point the patronage is like 'tryouts for the wannabe badfellows." How trite! Food was disappointing all three times. I know this isn't baseball but three strikes and you are OFF my list. It is also very tightly seated. I can't tell you how many times my elbo was hit by some one's hip as they walked by. Wait staff was the best and only good thing about this place.

Expect a long wait without reservations! The Dining Room is small and they cramp in as many tables as they can. Parking is limited on the weekend, and is located on a busy intersection with no alternative parking nearby. Those are my first main thoughts about this place. They do have some great authentic pasta dishes, but the meat dishes are nothing spectacular. Good wine list, but pricey. The service is excellent and the servers do know their menu well and may suggest wines for the entree you have selected. However, for how expensive this place is and with no real ambience to speak of, this place is just so-so for me.

This is my go to place for Burritos! Hands down. To be clear this place is a dive. But the staff are pleasant, and the food is top notch. 

Prices are very reasonable.

I usually walk in, order, and have a real sugar Coke while I wait. Food comes out quick and is consistent from visit to visit. 

Perfect place to get burritos to go and bring back to the family.  I stick to the red sauce. The green gets a little spicy. 

High recommend.

A small and personal place where you can dine in or carry out. This is your basic taco place, but you know it is good, because all of the locals go here to eat. 

I had the three taco special, which was three tacos with rice and beans. For the meat I chose Al Pastor (pork), and it was topped with onions and cilantro, which is the authentic way. The meat was marinated nicely, and piled on street style corn tortillas. The beans were basic refried beans that were topped with cheese. The rice was the only thing that seemed to lack flavor. It was good, but I've had better. 

My boyfriend had the burrito pequino with rice and beans. He chose chicken for his meat, and he said it was good. Overall, service was quick, and the food was good. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants some authentic Mexican food. Also, the price is reasonable. Oh! And they are open late!

I've gone here a few times after a night out with friends and fell in love with their chicarones tacos. However, this is based off my recent trip, yesterday. As its been months since I have been here, but I was disappointed to where I won't be returning again.

I had the 3 taco dinner (steak, tripas, and chicarrones) the sides of bean & rice lacked flavor and was super bland, where it tasted like it was from a can or a box. 

The steak taco was dry, the tripas were decent, and the chicarones were not how I remembered them to be.

To be honest, we did eat a majority of it because we have been drinking, but usually I'm not picky and just realized knowing if I was pretty sober eating that, I would've most likely left everything on the plate. 

My friend had some spicy shrimp dish, which also lacked flavor and her husband got the shrimp cocktail, which only came with maybe 5 pieces of shrimp in there as it was all mainly the tomato juice. 

Too bad, this was our go to spot whenever in the area. We will now be looking elsewhere for tacos.

Love their food. Nice people and great food!
Love their 3 taco dinner, strip steak dinner and burito's. 
Garlic Shrimp fajitas are good too. 
They make fresh pico degio and its very good!

This place is as good as it gets! Food taste very home made, fresh and everything I had here so far is excellent, place is clean, very small but welcoming, staff is friendly and they try to accommodate you. I I will return.
The tacos, Arroz and frijoles hit the spot and burrito was huge. A little too much cheese in the quesadillas, but my daughter loved it. And very affordable.

The nachos are a joke. I almost never came back because of that. They threw some chips with some nacho cheese and VERY greasy ground beef together and it reminded me of shitty cafeteria food, on a bad day.

The tortas are decent but the meat had too much chewy pieces and fat. tacos are decent. Wet burrito is pretty good.

I'd give them a try if you are in the area, just don't get the nachos

Such an amazing place, felt like I was at home. Such amazing food. Service was amazing! Food here had the spot for good mexican food. I was definitely in a food coma after I left there. 

Please try this place out!

Original Tacos was an average taco joint to me.  The tacos were slightly above average, NO free chips and salsa :( , decent prices, and the sauces (green/red) they brought to the table were REALLY watery, which was frustrating as the liquid would run down my hand and wrist when trying to eat the taco.  I would come back as I am having problems finding a good taco place for lunches in the area, and this one is currently near the top of the list.

This place made me so sick. Their tacos are the smallest tacos I've ever seen with little tiny pieces of what was not meat, but pieces of fat. I ordered their Jamaica water and it was sugared red water, gross! $5 for chips and salsa is RIDICULOUS!  My toe still hurts from jamming it on their stupid tables,  which the waitress showed no empathy.

My father-in-law used to say if you want to find the best food in a neighborhood, find out where the locals eat.  Well when it comes to Mexican food, I'm guessing the locals eat at Original Tacos.  The prices are reasonable, the food is tasty and English is NOT the primary language spoken by the wait staff. :-)  I had heard about this place from a friend of mine when we were telling them about Taco el Norte and raving about how authentic is was.  My friend mentioned that this place was good and I figured I'd give it a try.  The guacamole was good, the salsa was spicy (but not too much) and my ground beef macho burrito was more than I could finish. (Maybe because i also got a side of rice and beans.)  The co-worker I came with also got the macho burrito, but his had shredded beef and he said he'd make a point to go out of his way to eat at this place again.  So if you haven't been here and you like tasty Mexican food, it's worth the effort to stop in for lunch or dinner.

Local place with ok food.  We ordered steak tacos for the family and at first bite they were really good, but as we ate on they were not that great, just average.  I wish the steak had better flavor to it.  The lady server was very nice, but once she had 3 tables she was overwhelmed.  Just and OK place, but we would stop again if hungry and its easy.

This place is tiny, dinky, and you could miss it very easily, but you would be missing some of the best Menudo in town. 

The broth is not as dark red as I usually like it, but the flavor is HUGE. For only 5.75, you could have the deliciously meaty bowl of tripe goodness just like Grandma used to make if she were a living on a farm in San Jacinto, MX and just butchered the family cow. 

Fresh, tasty, simple. I will be back.

Ordered food from here for the first time tonight after reading so many good reviews here on Yelp. Man, people weren't kidding when they said this was a small hole in the wall" place. Actually drove past it and had to make a u turn to get there. Place probably seats 12 people at the most. HOWEVER... their food is delicious! I had the Mucho Burrito with Carne Asada and it was the best burrito I ever had! The thing was HUGE! My wife had the fish taco dinner and my daughter had the chicken taco dinner. While my daughter absolutely loved hers, my wife thought the fish was a bit overcooked, but she is excited to try something different. We usually order out mexican food once a week and will be doing so from Original Tacos every week from now on!  Oh, one more thing, they are VERY affordably priced!
I was originally hesitant to try this place at first but it is a hidden gem!! I get the Tacos Original religiously, the chicken is so moist and flavorful. So glad that I gave it a shot.

Tried them for lunch yesterday. I really wanted tacos but I ended up with the enchiladas. I got the dinner plate which is 3 enchiladas, rice and beans. I liked that you can see what is being cooked, and all of the aromas coming from behind the counter smelled amazing! The restaurant itself is tiny, I think I counted 8 tables, and it was very clean. They have a decent size menu, a lot to choose from and they sell beer! 
My order was done and ready to go in about 6 minutes. I was very impressed with the size of my meal but the food didnt wow me. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed and liked my meal but I wish I would have ordered the tacos. I got a cheese, a steak and a chicken enchilada. The meat tasted delicious, full of flavor and just right but I wasn't impressed with the sauce. There was nothing special about it. The rice was ok but I didn't like the beans at all. Im a beans girl and these beans were not good, very bland. So I give this place 4 stars because I loved the flavor of the steak and chicken and I know the tacos would be delish and their horchata was great. I will for sure go back for the tacos!

BEST BURRITOS IN PALATINE , try out the wet ones and u might get moist yourself...

They said this review is too short, but I ain't no food critic so fts. U can sit down there and they give u chips, service is good cuz it doesnt matter if your black or white .. can't go wrong... geez

Nice cozy place tucked away in a little strip mall.  I had the steak tostadas and was a happy camper.  The steak had a good flavor and wasn't fatty like you get at some Mexican restaurants.  The staff was friendly and made me feel at home.  I had a very pleasant experience and will definitely be back to this nice little neighborhood spot.

Tip: you go past the GFS market place and Chen's (all within small plaza) then you will see a small sign that says Original Tacos.

It was my first time trying out the tacos here. And it wasn't all that great.

I ordered 3 chicken tacos and 3 fish tacos for pick up. They gave me about 5-10 minutes so it was pretty quick in terms of cooking. 

Each taco comes with lettuce, onion, cilantro upon your request. It's about the size of your hand as for the portion. 

Chicken taco was quite disappointing to say the least. Chicken was very dry and overcooked as it became harder to eat without pouring a load of salsa that came with the order. 

Fish taco was better however. It was a fried cod filet that also appeared to be overcooked. It had a dark brown coating which showed sign of being left in the fryer for too long. 

I paid about 13 dollars for 6 tacos, but I felt like I didn't get what I paid for in terms of quality. Good thing I was at least hungry.

This review is solely on the tacos so I can't say much about other things on the menu. 

If you're looking for good quality tacos, I'd suggest you find somewhere else.
Amazing staff with great quality authentic food. Will recommend to anyone. I love this place !

What a treasurer. A true treasurer. My carne asade macho burrito arrived quickly, the burrito is full of flavor. The meat is seasoned well, and it's filled to the brim with meat. The salsas delicious. Here's a picture to oggle at, admire, and give you a comparison shot of what you'll be eating. Plate ratio/knife ratio/fullness of burrito is on point and exceptional.

The worst Mexican food I have ever had in my natural born God given African Indian American life.. I ordered there once and that was enough to completely and utterly turn me off from this place forever. I ordered steak nachos and steak tacos, a standard order for me when trying out a new Mexican joint. I was so disappointed when I opened the container filled with oddly chopped tomatoes and onions and a sprinkle of meat. I gagged at first bite and nearly choked to death because the meat was so damn dry. I immediately regretted the decision to skip the horchata. I wish I could describe how bland the meat tasted but I can't describe a flavor that wasn't there... THERE WAS NO FLAVOR, which frightened me...
The tacos had all the fixings that should have made them bomb and a hit right off the bat, but of course life couldn't be so rewarding, I nearly choked again. Trying my hardest I swallowed and tried to find the flavor...again it was missing...
I hate the waste of time and money and I wouldn't wish this devastatingly disappointing restaurant on my worst enemy...not even a LAPD cop...

You'd be better off going to taco bell around the corner... You're welcome for the advice.

Decent customer service though...

above average Mexican place ... 
great fish tacos...
decent enchiladas...
descent quesadilla....
great horchata ....
open late so an added benefit ....

Overall a nice local Mexican business for quick grabs

I've been ordering the Macho Burrito from these guys since an old buddy of mine turned me on to the joint about 19 years ago. Tacos are excellent too, still one of my favorite places for comida Mexicana after all these years. Open til 3am on Friday and Saturday nights as well. Perfect for night owls and partiers.
