Hands down my favorite hole in the wall Mexican joint! Huge burritos meaty tacos. The pastor and chorizo are better than la rosita and Los arcos 2 other palatine spots

Original tacos is a solid, no frills Mexican restaurant. They make a great steak burrito and the enchiladas are also very tasty.  Drink selections include pineapple water (my favorite), horchata and a standard array of jaritos (sorry no aqua de Jamaica).  They serve a number of Mexican beers too.  Great Mexican food for the burbs! I'll be back real soon...

Very good tacos but the steak torta with avocado is my favorite!  The meat is always cooked perfectly and everything is proportioned nicely. Great Aguas frescas too the jamaica is the best!! The service is great as well the waitress is always happy and smiling and the foods ready pretty fast.
Easy to miss (small sign) but solid food at a solid price. I am a snob with my Mexican food (grew up in Pilsen), and these are the best tacos in the nw suburbs. Great prices too!
Awesome place and very reasonable ! staff is very friendly :)

Awesome food, nice friendly owners and great take out for a family on vacation.  Small eat in area but good food, authentic Mexican taste made to order.  My kids are picky and they accommodated!!! Give this small place a chance to dazzle you, they will!

This place is the definition of: "Hole in the wall".
A place you can pass by a million times and never suspect what you are missing.

I got the macho steak burrito. It was huge, greasy, but PERFECT. It was the kind of meal I think about days after eating it.

They keep it simple here, it's cheap, and they do it right.
We just moved to Palatine and our neighbor suggested this place. I'm so glad they did! We love it! I'm a big fan of the tacos.

First time Visit, a pickup to bring back for lunch.  

I didn't call ahead, but they did cook thing promptly.  

Very small dining room, not lots of staff on to handle a lunch rush, so if your time sensitive, please call ahead.  Otherwise beware cranky Clock Watching HR/Boss types.  

I had something interesting...  A Hawaiian Burrito.  BBQ Sauce, Steak (or Chicken), pineapple, refried beans, rice, lettuce, and perhaps a few other odds and ends.   It was nice sized, and certainly a unique taste.   Encouraging enough to try them again, but likely not for another Hawaiian burrito.  It's ok, and worth trying once, but just didn't grab my attention for a long term favorite food relationship.


***Leftover Edit****

Eating the Hawaiian Burrito Cold, as leftovers..  Pretty damn tasty!

Delicious, affordable, friendly hole-in-the-wall with a sign outside of it that says all you need to know, "tacos."

3 meals cost me a hair over $20. 6 hours later and I'm still so very full. 

In my quest for the tastiest Mexican food in the NW burbs, I've been tricked many a time with a beautifully presented dish that lacked flavor. Not here. Authentic, a hint of kick and everything was well cooked. 

The biggest highlight was the quick and friendly service. 
It's unfortunate this place doesn't have more reviews. It needs and deserves it. 
Stop by, pay less than the McDonalds-owned burrito chain and treat yourself to something bigger in size and better in taste!
Their huevos rancheros are fantastic!!

Came here for fish tacos and was super disappointed. The fish was deep fried and overcooked with 2-3 tomatoes and a little lettuce. Also got the beans and rice which was just as bland as the tacos. You have to pay for chips and salsa and the guacamole was just ok. Should have taken the extra 5 min to go to Mexico Uno.

Very suprised by the lower reviews.  Make no mistake, this place has wonderful food.  It has been very hard for me to find authentic Mexican food in the burbs.  This place could use a little sprucing up but the food needs no intervention.  Ordered almost evetything on menu; tacos, beans and rice, guac, burrito, gorditas, seafood.  Love it!
Best Mexican food around! Eaten here many times & will definitely be back.
Very good steak tacos, quality steak. Salsa is flavorful but not overly hot.  Chips and salsa not complimentary, but available.  Definitely recommend!

Ate her a few months back. Wanted to try a more authentic burrito than if I were to just go to Chipotle. I got a steak burrito with everything, and I thought it was average. I was expecting a lot more after reading the reviews here, but it wasn't good enough for me to consider coming back.

Granted this small gem is only minutes from my place, I have been coming here for roughly six years now.  Good size portions and good quality foods.  I've custom made a dish there with is pretty much steak nacho fries, just like fully loaded mexican nachos but replacing the chips for fries instead. Drooooool!  Think it's about $12 or so but definitely worth a try! Thank me later!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!  Really good food. Really good price. They need a bigger dining room. Be prepared to take it to go

This place is fantastic! My husband used to go here when he was growing up in the area and he took me to it one time a couple of months ago. Ever since then, we go here to get Mexican food. It is a small place but you can eat-in. My husband loves the Hispanic shows they have on their t.v. First of all, you can't beat the price and the food tastes great! We love all the workers there. They treat us like family and take really good care of us. Our usual meals are the chicken taco specials. They seem small when you see them wrapped but when you unwrap it, they are decent sized. The meat tastes great and the vegetables are fresh. Their tortillas are just the right temperature and have great flavor. We also recently tried their huevos rancheros and are hooked on that too. It comes with rice, beans, and tortillas and is just a nice, hearty meal that really fills you up. Their horchata is delicious. We usually get a large one to share. My husband especially loves their beans and I really love their rice and green hot sauce. I have also had their fish tacos which are quite good. We are looking forward to trying more items on their menu in the near future (maybe tonight! lol). We definitely recommend this little gem!

The burritos here are pretty good.  It's a hole in the wall type place, and it can get loud if the jukebox is playing.  The food is tasty, and not too bad on price.  I generally order pickup to avoid dining in.  Get a steak burrito, and you will be very full and happy.

this place is a dump and had a 70% on their sanitary chart.. their other ratings were in the 90's except for the most recent one.. so knowing me, my boyfriend and i tried it anyway.. not a good experience. the guy at the counter (seemed like he was the owner or manager) and the guy in the kitchen with him microwaved my plate of food.. i ordered an enchilada and burrito that came with rice and beans. when it came out, my beans and rice were CRUSTED to my plate.. the burrito and enchilada was not bad. my boyfriend ordered steak and chicken tacos, and the steak tasted exactly like fish.. (no one wants steak that tastes like fish.) totally gross. the chicken was alright. good thing i was feeling nice that day because i was very close to asking for a full refund on our food that tasted like microwave and fish!
Absolutely awesome steak tacos and the macho burrito doesn't lie, it's the size of a football.

Found this place while looking for any open taco eatery after a late night concert. EXCELLENT food!! This is the only place I ever came by that served tacos with pork skin. My hubs said the pastor was the best he ever had. Very sad to move out of state soon and only discovered this place now. Having it again today for lunch!!

Hands down one of the best Mexican places in the Northwest Suburbs.  Way better then Tacos El Norte which is right down the street.  The place is a little bit of a dive but they use fresh ingredients and the food is excellent.  You can't go wrong with the burrito or the tortas.  Check it out!
This place is a little hole in the wall but they have some great food! Carne Asada, steak tacos and guacamole are especially good.

This place is located in a little strip mall center.   We happened upon it on Christmas Day when looking for something to eat.  It took a little bit for the food to come out, but I guess that could be because of it being a holiday.  It was well worth the wait though.  I had steak tacos.  The meat was well seasoned with a delicious char from the grill.  The beans were delicious as were the chips and salsa.   The prices are very reasonable too.

Juan (the owner) and his staff have some fantastic eats here.  Super authentic and affordable.  I have been coming here for sopes and posole for what seems like forever now and have never been dissapointed! My parents come for the burritos and although I have never tried one (not a huge fan of burritos in general) the rave about them... and they are HUGE!!!! It's not a question of IF I will be back... it's a matter of WHEN!! :)
love love lovee! this place, best mexican food around

I tried their torta last week and it was very good. Size was bigger than I'm use to closer to my home. I went during lunch time and the place was not too packed. I ordered to go and service was okay. The cook was a bit too serious and looked annoyed. But I would definitely go back some other time.

Service: The service was extremely pleasant: smiles and an upbeat atmosphere. 

Food: I ordered the regular cheeseburger with a small fry and drink. The prices were kind of iffy, but worth it in the end. The cheeseburger has two meat patties on it and tastes absolutely delicious. The cheese is also melted wonderfully on the top of the patties. The French fries, unlike what everyone seems to be saying, are not greasy at all. 

In conclusion, I had a wonderful time at the establishment and will be going back soon :D

I love the juicy burgers here and the homecut fries. Be aware the large french fry order feeds about 4 people and are pretty greasy, they soak through the bag. I appreciate the peanuts you can munch on while waiting for your food and the digital pop machine with a lot of soft drinks to choose from. Servers here are always pretty fast and friendly too. Their milkshakes are good too and you can add things like fresh banana.

Everyone always says (at least years ago when Five Guys first came out) how great this place is.  I have tried this location a couple times, and a few other locations.  I never really enjoyed my meals from here.  It's sad that I can make better burgers at home than basically any restaurant has served me.  If you want super greasy fries and a big but low quality burger, then sure, give them a try.  Not for me.  Only places that I have found I enjoy burgers at are expensive sit down restaurants (and I'm not talking about like TGI Fridays; I mean like expensive steakhouses likes Wildfire or Chicago Q - and you should probably get ribs or a steak from these places), or small town bars where they make their burgers by hand in house.  The rest is just corporate sourced crap to me.
Great burgers and TONS of fries.  Free peanuts while you wait -;a good representative of the chain

Though the burgers are good, they are incredibly petty there. I asked the cashier if I could get s regular sized cup for my water, and not the Dixie cup they offered me. She said you'll need to pay for the cup, so I ask how much, expecting .25 cents which would still be 20 X more than they paid for it. But she tells me $2.79. I had to have her repeat it it was so outrageous, to which she said the same. She then stated that that's five guys policy that she has no control over it. I declined the cup and took 
the Dixie cup and had to make several trips to the water during dinner.

Five guys burgers, this is a total disappointment and scam. There's tons of burger joints out there who would really rather please the customer.

Overpriced and crap burgers. Hit up a Smashburger if you want good burgers at a higher price.

Seriously, I hated walking into this place seeing all kinds of signs telling me how great it was, to pay an arm and a leg, to bite into something Wendy's has apparently mastered better.

This is the second time I've been to a Five Guys. I don't recall where the other was but the experiences were similar. Five Guys is not anything glamorous. This makes it quaint. The seats are not too comfortable, but they seem to be clean.

They serve burgers, hot dogs and fries. They also have a couple of sandwiches. They give you a number of options on the burgers - notably missing is fried egg, which seems to be very big at other burger joints lately. But, I had a burger with everything. The meat was very fresh, and I was surprised by the amount of meat. There were two good sized patties - I would get somewhere between 1/3 and 1/2 pound of meat. The veggies were okay - the tomatoes were kind of tasteless, but the jalapenos were crisp and spicy.

Everyone raves about the fries and I'm not sure why. I get the fact that they buy from specific farmers - they make that very clear. When we went there was a sign that shows what town in Idaho they were grown in, and the name of the farmer. And, while the potato taste was good, the fries were kind of soggy. I really like mine crisp but that may be a personal preference.

They have one of those coca-cola drink machines where you can mix your own and have multiple choices. I have been trying to stay away from sodas of any kind (mostly successfully) so I had an Iced tea. They had another machine where you can choose your iced tea - iced black tea, iced green tea, iced sweet tea, and there was one other choice I don't recall. The black tea I chose was not very good. It tasted like it was powdered, but in fairness I don't think it was. I just expected something that tasted fresh. Oh, and they do have freshly sliced lemon, but the ones they had appeared to have been sitting out for a while and were browning.

I would say that it is certainly worth going back for a burger, but I would skip the fries and the iced tea.
I prefer an In-N-Out Burger any day over this but when you're in the Midwest and this is all you have it will work in a pinch.

I recently started a hunt for the best of the best burgers out there. So many people have told me that 5 Guys is the best fast food chain out there so I knew I had to finally try it. 

Burgerwise - Five Guys is pretty dang good. I went for the bunless option (any burger can be made into a salad or wrapped in lettuce) but I also took a bite of my husband's burger that had a bun. I like that you can pick whatever toppings you want, so you can go as traditional or wild as you want. Both ways that I tried it, I would say the burger was a 4.5 star. The meat was extremely flavorful, juicy and fresh. It was the only fast food burger that I've loved as much as In-n-Out. The fries were hand cut and just as good as the burger. This place isn't cheap though. For two burgers and a fry to split, it cost $20. 

The reason for not giving higher stars overall is because I thought the staff was less than accommodating here. I tried to ask a few questions since I was a newbie and I was met with a bit of an attitude and 0 helpfulness.
We had great service, the store manger stopped by our table to make sure all was well and best of all they had Malt Vinegar for our fries. We will be back!
My son's favorite place to eat, great burgers and always serve more than enough fries!

This is like my favorite location.  For some reason it's never too crowded which is nice.  Staff is always efficient and quick (they do work on tips as well so tip well if good service)

From all the gourmet burger places I place it above meatheads but not quite better than smashburger but not by much.  Where Smashburger is more airy as far as burgers go, this place is more meat and thick.  Their menu should give it away, their standard burgers are double burgers so if you want a single go for the single.  You build your own burger here so make it to your tasting.  They make everything to order and their portion in fries are HUGE!  A large fry is usually good for two.

They have an outside area for when the weather is actually nice in Chicago!  And I can't go without saying they have one of those lovely Coke machines!  Love it!

What's not to love about Five Guys?

The burgers are hand-formed and never frozen; there is not a single freezer in the store. Not counting cheese they can come with your choice of over a dozen toppings with either one or two 3.2 ounce patties. Due to popular request there are also 3 sizes of fry servings and even the smallest size can feed two people. Most 5G stores such as this one also offer a Coke Freestyle machine that allows you to mix popular Coca Cola products with flavor add-ons for over 100 drink combinations. You cannot go wrong here... 

unless you have a peanut allergy, since they use peanut oil and have free peanuts for consumption while you wait for your food.

The prices could be more reasonable, as well.

Five Guys is such a simple place with a simple menu. It is definitely not my favorite burger place- but this location was nice. The only bummer or complaint that people had for the particular time we were there was that the restaurant was out of pickles (strange for a burger joint). The employees were nice, our burgers were good, and the cajun fries are still the best thing about Five Guys Burgers and Fries. This particular location seemed very clean and the bathrooms were clean as well. 

Of course- as a big heads up- if you are allergic to peanuts you should never set foot in a Five Guys Burgers and Fries!

It is like any other 5 guys, but if you go in the early afternoon it is absolutely dead. So you get really fast service.

you gotta love the drink machine with a 100 different flavor combos

parking is easy as per Schaumburg usual

Burger's are good, service was fine, clean place, but a little more overpriced than other's around. Fries extra, drink puts the meal over ten dollars, close to eleven for a lunch, less at surrounding fast food restaurants.

DISGUSTING (please view all photos!)
February 25, 2015 I placed an order to pick up.

HAMBURGER
1. Someone made the burger, wrapped it up and it appears once it was wrapped up they squished it into a ball.  When I took my hamburger out, it was round and I thought, hmmm - that's rather odd, but maybe it's that way because I ordered a lettuce as a bun.
2. I began to examine what I thought was a hamburger it appeared vomitous! Lettuce was severely saturated, soggy, extremely wilted, with a couple brown spots as a finishing touch. As I began to pull the lettuce off my round baseball looking item, the hamburger was all mashed up in little pieces, brown ground meat looking as if it was ready to put into a old fashioned Mock Cooter Soup! (RECIPE: From White Trash Cooking.  Author: Ernest Matthew Mickler). The tomato looked if someone took one slice of a tomato dropped it on their greasy floor and stomped on as if they were Barefoot Grape Stomping Champions. After digging into this hot mess (Actually it was cold... but you get the terminology I'm trying to convey) with about ONE HALF cup of mayo. At that point, I wrapped it back up into the ball and tossed it in my garbage can and when it went in, I said, TWO POINTS for me.  You know, when you don't miss the garbage can?!

GRILLED CHEESE 
1. Very dense bread as if the bread was still in a dough texture. A TON of cheese, and I mean a TON.  I've never seen so much cheese in a sandwich before.  If I scrapped the cheese out, I could make Con Queso Dip that would easily feed three to four grown adults. Lastly, I ordered the grilled cheese with tomato and sadly it was not in there and yes, I used my fork & spoon to dig through the goop to see if it was smothered.  

FRENCH FRIES
1. The worst fries I have ever sank my teeth in my entire life.  SICK! Saturated with oil as if they were sitting for quite some time. When you grabbed a fry it immediately slouched over and the SMELL was just DIRTY.  That was some OLD reused oil that hasn't been changed in a long, long time. I would rather eat a dirty sock, the entire sock!  These fries could definitely be used on Fear Factor as a repulsive food challenge 

CALLED SCHAUMBURG / MEACHUM STORE
It was 5:55pm and a manager said, can you make this quick I leave at 6 (plus it was snowing like mad) although it irritated me, I spoke really fast - he said, come back into the store and I will have another manager give you a coupon (Mind you, It's snowing like Mad!) I said, no thank-you then hung up.  I called back at 6:10 to let to explain about my grilled cheese.  When I was done speaking, he was silent as if quietly hung up on me... He was there, then I said your food is absolutely disgusting and I'll never come back again.  He said, OK.  Then I said, I'm going to post my review to Yelp and post my pictures, he said do what you want.  Then I hung up and now you are reading my horrible experience and at the same time, you get to view my photos!  Please take a look and enjoy the slide show.

NEVER - EVER would I recommend this establishment to anyone EVER nor will I ever eat or step foot inside a 5 Guy's restaurant.  No coupon can rectify my experience.

Simple, clean, fast, great tasting, and at a decent cost.  I have been here a couple of times, and each time I state, "I can't wait for another cheat day so I can visit Five Guys".  

I learned after my first visit, always go for the little burgers.  The standard is a double, and it was something I was not prepared for the first time around.  My poochie agrees Five Guys rocks, but he's angry that I don't come home with an extra patty for him.  

I can't pick my favorite fry though.  The cajun ones are addictive, but the five guys ones are wonderful as well.  Try them both, and share with the family to see which ones they like the most,  

Employees seem attentive, and seem to actually care about providing genuine customer service.  Something that I have seen lacking at other similar establishments.

I'm surprised to see their overall rating is only a 3. They have one of the best cheeseburger's I have ever had. I like the fact that they cook your burger to your wellness. The fresh cut french fries are nice and crispy, not soggy and greasy. I can never leave there finishing my whole meal it is so filling. It beats all the fast food places for me!

I love this place. The food is always made in front of you so you know how its being prepared and they also give you a bunch of extra fries. Plus, there is a never ending supply of free peanuts as well.

Sometimes the burgers have a wet bun, but this isn't always the case and certainly doesn't prevent it from being absolutely delicious. I have been coming here for a while and have yet to be disappointed.

It is the best burger in the area I believe.
Burger was good and all ingredients fresh just 2 much money for me. Got a burger and frys and spent $14

I've had Five Guys previously, but never ventured beyond my usual cheeseburger and fries.  I recently grew a sensitivity to Gluten and thought my burger days were over!  However, I went to Five Guys and tried their "Burger in a bowl", if you will.  This was AMAZING.  I got a single burger with sauteed mushrooms and onions - there were tons of veggies in there and totally made up for the lack of bun.  My boyfriend got the cajun fries - which I tried one - they were incredible!

It's just not for me. Burger was ok, but not worth a repeat the visit. Fries are a greasy mess. It is a unique coke/pop machine which dispenses about 100 different flavors and I just felt I could taste the previously dispensed beverage.

I came here expecting a good place to eat and hang out. I heard about this place and I wanted to check it out. I like the options available for the burgers and those new pop machines where u pick your options digitally. A little expensive though, I did spend 20 dollars and I was expecting 10 to 15 dollars for 1 cup of overflowing fries, two burgers, and two drinks. Burgers were above average.

Decent burgers and fries but I think Five Guys is overrated.  Their burgers are pretty good for fast food but they're not amazing.  The little burger (or whatever it's called lol) is plenty of food for me especially since their burgers are pretty greasy.  The only difference between the little and regular burger is that the little has 1 patty versus the regular which has 2.  I do like their fries since they're fresh and nicely crisp but tender on the inside.  I know they have a secret menu like many other places but I have yet to try anything from it!

I come here once maybe every 6 weeks with my lunch crew. The staff is always fantastic and we never have a problem finding seating. We enjoy the complimentary peanuts. :)

Prices are high, way high, but the burgers are good, way good. On my last trip I got a burger (which is 2 patties) with cheese, mushrooms and mayo. A winning combo for me. Soggy and greasy, it's so tasty but I can feel everything clogging up from the grease inside of me. Yum and Eek! 

I've had the hot dog which was just okay. The fries, also, are just okay but they give you so many! It fills up about half of a brown paper bags for the smaller size. I never dare have gotten the bigger size.

All in all, I like Five Guys. Meatheads is better then Five Guys in my opinion though. But I will definitely continue my bimonthly visits.

Their little burgers are great because their normal burgers are too big for me to finish. And they give you a ton of fries, a small order is enough. Plus they have the really cool coca cola machine with a variety of drink options. Love 5 guys burgers!

Dear Five Guys Burgers, 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Finally there is a Schaumburg location for one of my favorite burger chains. For those in the area that have never been to Five Guys, the menu is pretty simple. They have "burgers" which are actually double patty, and they have "little burgers" which have the single patty.  They come plain, and you tell them what toppings you want from 16 items, like mayo, lettuce, grilled onions, A-1 sauce...etc.  

They also serve Hot Dogs, which I must say are absolutely delicious.  They split the dog in the middle and toss that sucker on the grill...mmm, mmmmmm, mighty tasty.  They have two types of fries, five guys style(regular) which I've never had, and Cajun style (seasoned) which I recommend. 
The regular portion of fries is definitely enough for two people to share, but If your really love spuds then order the large.

I ordered my usual which is a bacon cheeseburger, with lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and BBQ sauce.  Good for you, absolutely not! Does it taste good? Absolutely, positively YES!!!  They don't carry milkshakes, or salad, or onion rings...they got burgers, dogs, and fries. They stick to what they do best, and they are really good at it.  I have a feeling I will be here more often than my doctor would like me to be, but I'm not complaining.  Welcome to Schaumburger!!!

I am only rating this 1 star because of the price. The burgers and fries are good but the prices are astronomically high. I have eaten here many times but I don't remember a burger, fries and drink costing almost $16.00. I had a bacon cheeseburger ($7.79) regular cajun fries ($3.79) and a large drink ($2.59). This is insane. With tax (which in Schaumburg is 11% on food), my total was $15.74. They used to give you a ton of fries, not anymore. I like the food here but this is the last time I will go here. 

Looks like I will be going to Smash Burger from now on. The same items there are $11.17. Still not cheap but man, $16.00? Forget it. I could go to a nice sit down restaurant and get a good burger for less than that.

They do have really good burgers, but as others have said it is quite pricey.  My husband and I got two burgers, a drink, and one regular Cajun fry (trust me, the portion was HUGE) and our bill was around $20.  The family is front of us had a bill at $60!! They could have went somewhere else for that price..

Anywho... the food is great, especially the Cajun fries and I really enjoyed snacking on  peanuts before my meal came.  My burger was perfect and had a lot of flavor.  But I am basically giving this place 3 stars cause of the price--I know I can get a good burger at other places for a cheaper price.  

Just come here to treat yourself once in a while...

there was tons of hype about five guys awhile ago,so of course i have to try it and see what its all about for myself. Ive been here a few times already because sometimes i would attend to car meets that takes place in their parking lot (big parking lot). they are made fresh to order, so that's a plus! 

the burger was pretty greasy and lack in flavor, i was expecting more out of it from all the hype and the price I'm paying.. the burger is a little above average i would say... as big of a fan i am of french fries, their fries is just OK. even tho they give you a big portion of fries, it just doesn't make it up for the taste. i do enjoy their pop machine haha.. so much flavor to choose from!

i would not go out of my way to five guys.. but if i attend to another car meet here then its only fair to eat here since i am in their parking lot..
Always the best place for a consistently good burger, and a TON of fries.

Looove love 5 guys burgers & fries.

I completely stopped going to fast food places for burgers once I discovered this place.

The burger meat is never frozen, always fresh and hand formed. The fries are peeled and cut in the store. Get the little cheeseburger with everything on it and your mouth will thank you for hours. Everything just blends together so well..I'm starting to salivate a little just thinking about it.

Prices are kind of high, but I think it's worth it for this kind of burger quality. My only complaints include the bun getting soggy super fast (leading to a burger that's falling apart) and the bun sometimes cooling down by the time you eat it. No one likes cold buns.

Oh! They also have boxes and boxes of peanuts for you to scoop and eat while you wait. You probably want to avoid this place if you have a peanut allergy :p

Staff has always been super friendly and the bathroom and dining area are tidy and constantly being swept.

An "ok" burger spot in my work hood. One big turnoff is the fact that they don't have any meal deals. So my burger, fries, and drink came to $11!! They were also blasting rock music through the speakers so it was difficult to carry on a convo with my lunch date.
Very nice and clean five guys as usual! Fast on ordering, fast on cooking and the stuff was friendly too!
It was so greasy, that I felt like I could've drank the burger through a straw. Big difference between juicy, and just pure grease. I'd rather go to Smash Burger, or even McDonald's.

Upon entering, I immediately felt like I was at an In and Out burger.  It has a similar interior.  Fresh cut "homemade" style fries.  

The menu is simple.  Burger, Bacon Burger, Fries, Hot Dog.  That's fine by me.  I come to this place for one thing really.  The burger.  I like the idea of being able to choose or customize your burger.  I had mine "All the way" meaning it included all the conventional toppings: lettuce, tomato, pickles, mayo, etc.  I did like that grilled onions and mushrooms were also an option.

Overall, a pretty good burger.  Like someone said, I can't picture myself coming here often.  Probably less than a month.  It's seriously unhealthy stuff and can put you into both a food coma and into a heart attack.  

It was on the pricey side which took a star from me.  I think I ended up paying around 25 bucks for 2 bacon burgers and a hot dog.  Really?  2 burgers and a hot dog with a side of fries for almost 30 bucks?  I'm not even at a Bulls or Cubs game!  LOL.

Hands down the best burger and fry joint period. Cooked fresh and made to order and the fries are really good. Don't need to order the large fry because they give you plenty. A little on the pricey side but worth it!

It's not necessarily the cheapest burger but it's worth the price. 2 patties that are perfect & topped with whatever you want (from a list). You get a bag full of fries (get seasoned!) and this schaumburg location has the Coke Freestyle machine (google it, it's awesome). And unlimited peanuts. Outside seating during nice weather.

Simple menus can mean a place doesn't care or it means a place doesn't care to mess up what made them good.  I'm glad this place sticks to what they know best, burgers (and dogs but thats another story).

The burgers are single or double burgers that are made fresh to order .  The topping list is pretty extensive and they don't overcharge for grilled shrooms, onions or peppers.

The fries are huge in portion, we split an order of small fries between four co-workers and it was more than plenty.  I'm  alittle bummed we didn't realize there are cajun fries, but whatever.

Thanks for opening up so close to work and letting me try one of your fabled burgers before I move to the land down under.

Oh and free peanuts in the shell is pretty good and enjoyable while you wait for a burger.

This place has fresh off the grill burgers that are juicy! LOVE IT. If it's too pricey for every one that has complained about it go to mcdonalds. This place is really good. You have the option to put anything you want on your burger. Also, the fries are made fresh for your order. NOTHING to complain about.

Five Guys is a good option if you're looking for your classic greasy burger in a short amount of time and you want a step up from the normal fast food burgers.  Personally, every time I go there I find the meat to be a little too greasy for me, but the fries are absolutely amazing. Dip the fries in ketchup, and get a cherry coke from their drink area, and you've got yourself a pretty good meal. You can add grilled onions to the burgers for no extra charge, but honestly, they aren't that great-- the whole no charge for toppings thing is cool though. I go here when i'm craving the fries, and it's probably one of the best places in the area for a decent burger.

Went in with my dear husband and had the little cheeseburger with mushrooms and grilled onions.  It was fine, the burgers are ok, the fries are ok, it doesn't blow my mind.  The peanuts are a nice touch.  The cashier was pleasant enough and are food came out in a timely manner.

It seems like a lot of people have a problem with the price.  I think the price is fine, but to be honest I don't like to pay too low of a price when it involves meat.  I'd rather pay a little more and have a decent quality of beef used.

The only reason I'm even giving this place 2 stars is because the burgers are decent.  We've gotten food from this place twice (thanks to Schmoyo and Daym, the dudes responsible for the Oh My Dayum video).  The first time wasn't bad, the burgers were ok and the fries left something to be desired.  So we figured we would try it again and maybe we had gotten a bad batch of fries the time before.  As everyone says it's a little pricey but I don't care since it's an occasional artery clogging treat.

So we went again last night and the fries were absolutely disgusting.  I'm not being dramatic at all, they were easily the worst I've ever had in my life. They were so bad that we threw them out without eating any and didn't even give some to the dogs.  I almost took a picture of them flopped over the cup, it was so gross.  Completely soggy and they were mushier than I cook pasta, ick.

Am I missing something?  Aren't they known for having stellar fries??  So disappointing...
Love the burgers! Kinda pricey in my opinion but it is what it is. Better than McDonalds that's for sure. The fries were okay; Cajun ones were a little too heavy on the seasoning.

I've been to a Five Guys in Chicago and it was pretty good, just read my review for the one on Sheridan. All of the Five Guys are probably pretty similar. 

However, I was not a fan of Five guys in Schaumburg for only one reason. Half their soda machine was out of order. I understand that shit happens and stuff breaks, but before people order drinks, you should let them know that selection of drinks is limited. I'm very particular about the kind of soda i drink (regular sprite/sierramist/7up) and this was on the side that was broken. So I basically shelled out money for a large drink that I didn't even drink and the place wouldn't give me a refund. 

Oh and they claim their ingredients are fresh, but I asked for mushrooms on my burger and they tasted like they came out of a can. And my boyfriend said that the jalepenos were not that good.

Upon request from my son back from college, we went there. 

Burgers were marginal at best (no taste, just regular beef patty). 
Cajun fries were good, but not exceptionally good. I've had better. 
Worse yet, staff there were cold and arrogant. 

My son, who had been sick and tired of dormitory food even admitted that he was not impressed. 

Hype and high prices. Very little value. Not worth it. I will not go back there.

You can't decide on what to get for lunch? Go to Five Guys - they simplify for you! They will serve a great burger and fries for you really quick and easy. Is it a little higher priced for a burger - yes but is it a no frills burger that will hit the spot - definitely! Also nothing says greasy fries then a cup full of them!

The place is good and makes your options slim so you can get in and get out with your hunger satisfied. You just have to live with yourself for the guilt of enjoying a sinfully greasy burger.

When we were in Chicago, this was the first time I ever tried Five Guys. My sister is a huge fan of Jaws Burgers near our house, and I've heard that the two are pretty equal in taste. Honestly, I like Jaws a bit better. Five Guys has a good burger, but there's not a ton of flavor. And when I ate their fries, I could feel my arteries closing. Not that I didn't like them, but I didn't love them. And the fact that they're fried in peanut oil makes them the restaurant fries with the most calories. Yes, I looked...
I guess I prefer burgers with a bit more flavor and fries that are worth the calories I'm consuming. Not that I'll never eat here again, but I guess I don't see what the big fuss over Five Guys is.

Ok, it was pretty tasty, but I don't really get what the big deal is. For $9.78 for a Little Cheeseburger, fries, and a regular drink, I think I'd prefer to go down the street to Culver's.

The burger was definitely tasty, and I really liked the sesame bun. In fact, I Think that was the best part about it. The pickles have a bit of tang to them, and the beef was moderately seasoned, but fine. Everything seemed very fresh, and top notch for a fast food restaurant.

I expected more out of the fries, given how much effort they go to in order to let you know what others think about them (all over the walls, windows, drink). You can tell the potatoes were high quality, but they needed a bit more seasoning (Five Guys Style), and were perhaps just a touch undercooked. 

So solid food, but nothing I will crave, and about 20% too expensive IMO. I'll give it another shot after my arteries recover.

When this place opened we thought we would give it a try. Honestly I have no idea why anyone would come here. The food was literally worse than the gristle burger they were serving down the street at Ted's Montana Grill (So shocking that Ted's closed this month). 

My boyfriends burger was really greasy. I ordered the veggie sandwich thinking it would be a nice healthy alternative. NOPE!!! It was a mess of greasy onions and I think green peppers fried until any nutritional value they might have had was gone. I could have eaten that & caulked it up to experience (note to self - place is only for those on the fast track to a double bypass). They just had to drown that poor little sandwich in cheese, dripping, everywhere cheese. I like cheese, just not so much that It's a never ending mess that after 6 napkins of trying to wipe some of it off I give up & toss the sandwich.

If you want a good burger in Schaumburg, don't mess around - go to Weber Grill - $9.95

YUMMY

not as good as In & Out but close enough since there aren't anywhere here, especially since this place was on the new in Cali before I moved and I've been waiting to try it out since...

simple, fattening, tasty...

plus everyone there is nice!

I've heard tons of great things about 5 Guys...and I must say that I was told a whole bunch of lies!!!  

The burger was okay...but not original or great!!!  The beef patty only covered  1/2 of the bun while the salad of ingredients I chose filled the rest.  The fries were overly greasy.  The price was also highly inflated versus the quality & quantity of the meal.  

Peanuts were available for patrons.  I don't really understand how a peanut goes with a greasy burger and fries...but they were available.  

The thing that this place does well is hiring a friendly & attentive crew.  They also score points for cleanliness.  

It's nice to try...but I would not make this a regular spot.

With the amount of hype this place gets I expected so SO much more. What I got was a tasteless, greasy overpriced burger dripping with sauce. I guess you need that much ketchup and mayo/mustard to give it any flavor. I will definitely not be back and I would not recommend this. If you want a decent burger with more variety, try Smashburger instead.

I remember when Five guys opened in Schaumburg and the hype that followed it. 

I wouldn't say it was a bad burger but it was outrageously priced for what it was. I think I spent close to $10 for a burger that was about the diameter of a Big Mac patty. It was dry and as flavorless as a patty of meat could ever be. The fries were OK but I'm not a huge fry person to begin with. The soda was the best part of my meal unfortunately. 

Some people dig it, and more power to them if thats what they like.

Mehh...this place is alright. I heard good things and a lot of hype from this place like "OMG THEIR FOOD IS AMAZINGGG!!!". I went in there half drunk from the morning before, I ordered a small burger, some fries and a drink...it came out to $9.02, okay...a little expensive but whatever I'm about to be hung over and I am hungry damnit. The burger was okay...the fries...were not cooked all the way thru..and the drink was a drink..lol I probably won't be going back here unless someone else really really really wants to go. I just dont see what the fuss is about.

I think I heard too much hype before I tried Five Guys. I've heard so many great things about their burgers and while I think it was a good burger it didn't deserve the top notch talk.
I like the fact that you can get a regular fries and feed 2-3 people. And even though I didn't have any peanuts I like that idea of something while you wait for them to finish up cooking your burger.  The double cheeseburger was a good size but the flavor was not their for me.  I don't like a lot of toppings on my burgers but I like when they are seasoned with goodies like Woreschester. The Five Guys burgers tasted like a slightly larger, flatter patty than your regular fast food burger. I'm not sure where it ranks in my top ten of burgers but it might be on the outside looking in.
Good burgers, great fries and a huge portion. Peanuts are a nice touch. They do need to turn the music down and there a little pricy.

Man o Man.... These burgers are crazy good!
The cost for the burger, fries, and drink is pretty expensive, but it's well worth it..

Went here for Lunch FINALLY!!! I thought the food was very good, but WAY over priced. I got the little burger which was almost 4 bucks, an order of cajan fries that were 3 bucks, and a drink tht was 2 bucks.....that makes for an expensive lunch, with my boyfriends added to mine it was over 25 bucks for lunch....a little pricey. Now with the price rant out of the way lets talk about the food....I wish it wasnt so good so I could tell myself that I will not be going back there, but I know I cant do that!!
The cajan fries were amazing, the fries still had the skin on them(my favorite) and they were super crispy. The little burger was a good size patty that was made fresh on the grill when you ordered, always nice to get fresh food. The best part of the while experience is the soda machine.....OMG you can make 100+ different flavors of sodas....it was so hard to chose so I had to make 2 different ones to try. First I made the coke zero with cherry syrup....VERY Good!! Then I made Mello Yello with grape syrup.....I would have never thought to try this on my own but it was really good. 

So yes I will be going back to five guys to try the different soda cominations and even pay for thier high priced food in the process....what can I say it was good!!!
Nothing special about this place. I could make the same burger at home. 18.00 for 2 burgers, 1 fry, 1 drink. Way to expensive for the lack of taste.

Definitely a good, fast burger.   I have never had Five Guys and was curious to check it out.   I went with a single patty with everything, should've just went with a double though as the single disappeared pretty quickly.   I didn't really love the fries, but loved that they had malt vinegar available for them.   The service was very fast, friendly and helpful to newbies.

It was kinda hard for me to find and I travel this area a lot. I didn't even know that little strip mall existed.  It is North of Remington on the West side of Meacham.  

Fast, friendly and convenient...I will be back with coworkers soon!
If you want a good cheeseburger fast with grilled onions or any number of ingredients, this is the place. The price is higher then most other fast food places but they do not compare.

I liked the burger I should of got the regular one not the little one with only 1 patty.  Meat was cooked fresh and burger was really tasty.  I especially likes the Cajun fries they were excellent!  When compared to in and out I think the fries were better here but the burger was definitely better at in and out!!!!

Loved this place!  I've noticed them slowly popping up all over Chicagoland and had to look them up to see what they were even selling.  Really good burger, especially for the price.  The fries are ginormous, you can get by with just hte regular if you like.  
And the place is just fun.  Old-timey burger joint feel with fun people having fun.  They all cheered when I ordered, which only made me want to order more.  If you're looking for a good place with just burger and fries that doesn't taste like fast food, but reasonably priced, this is it.

I thought it was pretty good. My burger was made fresh to order. I didn't think it was greasy at all and was very well made. The fries I could live without, nothing special there. The soda fountain was awesome. You can select any flavor and add in any other flavor syrup you want. I could get vanilla Coke Zero for example. Yes it is more expensive than a McD's or BK but the burgers are way better. I love burgers and these guys do a good job. I'm not going to write home and tell mom about it, but it was pretty good overall.

So it was a chilly evening but 3 of us wanted to try it out based on what discussion I had about In/Out burger in California. Let me say In/Out for us was IN and this place 5 guys was OUT.

I went up to counter and no one was behind me. Started ordering and had a question about the toppings - the guy gave me this "ok let me start this over again" bussiness which was not very customer friendly. After I ordered 3 cheseburgers and 1 large fries - with cups for water, get the sticker shock of $24.xx dollars (the price was up there but just my mental calc when price comes - little voice went off). 

The ambience - the music was a little over the top. The place felt like sitting outside chilly, with the burger smell all over - expected, but over the top again. But I saw all the rave postings on the walls all across the joint, so was patient. 

The burger was greasy but bland even with the jalapeno - which was just a sliced green pieces. The veg was nothing to note. And to top it off the lady took the picture of the fries - old oil and talked to the cook - they agreed oil needed to change and laughed it off with the other helps which my daughter took note of. I was last to finish it trying to find something worthy to the posters I saw - even in the bathroom.  I'm found myself metally driving back to other burger places. The brand name sounded good but not this one.

Meh.  Honestly expected more of this place after hearing the hype for about a year now. Maybe other locations are better? The burger did taste good, the fries were so-so. The free peanuts lacked enough salt for my taste.  Service was s-l-o-w and it was not at all busy. We went an hour before they closed, so maybe they were just looking to get out of there.

Delicious delicious burgers that need to be all the way. And some of the only fries I'll actively eat because they're tasty - I'm usually the type who picks at a few fries and once they've chilled I'm done - only hot fries are the best, yup. But I've finished theirs between my boyfriend and I so that says a lot for me! Honestly they're a bit on the greasy side but sometimes I like having artery clogging goodness. A smidge on the high side of prices, but I eat here infrequently so I don't mind. Too low and I may eat here too often and have too MUCH artery clogging goodness, oops!

Five guys your burgers are decent but I still love portillos soo much better! As for you fries, those are pretty tasty! Kinda pricey... I get way more food at portillos for less then what I got here. And the girl behind the counter that day was way rude and didn't look happy to be there.

I've given this place a few chances, but I don't really get the appeal.
-the patties themselves are somewhat overcooked for my taste and kind-of bland.
-the toppings selection is basically everything you'd find at mcdonalds plus mushrooms, jalapenos and green peppers, I don't see why it is so prominent in their image
-the fries is the only redeeming point of this place. Be warned an order of small fries can feed 3 reg. people.

Also on a side note, I find it somewhat ironic that they put the origin of their potatoes prominently on the large sacks that double as a partition.  I would much rather know where the beef came from rather than the potatoes.

I love any and all bacon cheeseburgers! This one disappointed me - I got everything on it - couldn't taste the bacon, but then tried a piece of bacon all alone and it had no flavor. Their fries taste like potato skins, so you better like potato skins if you order them. Next time I'll try the cajun and a plain bacon cheeseburger (sounds sad). Their beef patty was tasteless - prefer Buona or Assembly even Burger King's flamed broiled taste. Got my order to go - the grease came through the bag, right away should have double bagged it. Got no peanuts while I waited... Enjoyed finding (not really on Remington at all) and trying a new place.

This review is for the location in Schaumburg, but represents my review of any Five Guys locations that I have visited. Having cooked burgers for a fair amount of my life, I have my own opinion of what makes a burger good. One would think that Five Guys has what it takes, with the handmade burgers topped with fresh ingredients. But their burgers just do not live up to the hype that surrounds the name. Neither the single or double burgers seem to have any taste whatsoever other than the toppings. Not even the bun contributes anything to the burger. All of this results in an overpriced slab of blah. The peanuts are nice but merely a gimmick. Honorable mention goes to the fresh cut french fries which may be the best in the business. Too bad, though since I have little other reason to visit.

I don't know what they do to their burgers, but they are SO GOOD.  The cheese just melts perfectly into the bun and the pickles are delish.  Their fries are also amazing, and I love to put malt vinegar on them.  Sure it's a little expensive for a burger and fries but I prefer theirs to many other fast food places.

Pricy and very caloric.  I always get my burger all the way with Jalepenos and a1 sauce.  It is a messy burger but the fries are great.  Gotta love the cajun fries.  One fry and your entire mouth (for days) will taste like it.  No amount of brushing your teeth or mouthwash will ever get that taste out of your mouth....it is there for days. :)

I don't know what all the fuss about this place is about!  I heard all the glowing reviews about Five Guys so I went there during lunch to see for myself.  The burger was ok, but nothing special.  I wasn't impressed with the fries either.  It was jammed packed with nowhere to sit.  The location is not great either. I definitely like Portillos better!

You have to go for the burgers and fries. However, make a trip and get one of their hot dogs. Really good especially with cheese, onions,mustard, pickles, relish. Oh and of course, a side of fries to make it a balanced meal!

for some reason, someone told me that they close at 11.. so i ended up going around 9 50 only to find out that they were just cleaning up and no one was there.. but since they still had 10 minutes til close, they let us order with no pressure.  I felt really bad because i was with 3 other people and we ended up staying almost a half an hour after it was closed but they were really nice about it.

as for the food, their Cajun fries are sooo delicious.. i could tell that the potatoes were FRESH.. they just melted in my mouth.. my friends were having an orgasm in their mouth with their burgers.. i thought they were pretty good too but i honestly think the fries are better than the burgers.  

the menu is really simple and to the point.  the prices is pretty good for the portion. i got the "little hamburger"  but it filled me up..

The parking lot is horrible.  They need more parking since they share it with the Einstein Bagel people as well.  Food was too greasy and I had to ask them to double bag my food since it seemed like the grease seeped through my bag and I didn't want to dirty my car seats.  But fries were ok but they did give me a lot of it.  I had the burger and it was not bad.

The battle of the overpriced basic burger places rages on!  I just reviewed Meatheads last week so for the sake of the war, I need to review Five Guys.  After visiting this location a couple times, the burger patties were a little inconsistent.  I had a regular cheeseburger which is usually a double patty but there was only half a patty on top, so considering the price I paid, I felt jipped!  Luckily the cajun fries were awesome so that partially made up for the lack of burger.  I've learned to save some cash by splitting a small fries & ordering water to drink, but I'm still spending just under $10, which is out of control!  The service is what was really lacking this time around.  The past couple times I've been here, it was busy & the cooks were in the zone so the food was getting dished out at a fast pace.  But this visit was different, it was like the B shift was working.  Every part of the service was slow, from the cashier to the guy calling out the numbers.  The place wasn't busy so maybe everyone was just hungover since it was New Years Day, but the service is usually way better.
Largely flavorless meat.  Too high in calories.  Fries were good.  Don't see what the big deal about this place is, honestly.
The burgers all Come with two patties and your choice of toppings with lots to choose from.  You get free peanuts while you wait or after you eat for a snack and the fried are the best I've ever had.
$12 for a burger, fries and a soda.  Burgers are not much above average.   Fries are average to below.  Soda is soda.  Easily the most over rated place I have ever been to.  Won't go back.

Five Guys was a total disappointment.  Not much choice, you must have double pattie burgers and the only cheese is american.  The fries I ordered were undercooked, and my simple order of bbq sauce, lettuce and tomato was wrong since they forgot the bbq sauce.  Very expensive for something that wasn't good.  Ordered 2 burgers and a fry and it was $19!!  Don't think they will be in this area long because they don't even begin to compete with Portillo's!

I will drive unholy distances for good soup, and Maxfield's is one of those places I will trek out to when I have a craving for a fantastic chicken noodle or cream of chicken rice soup.

This is my go-to pre-shopping at Woodfield destination.  Located in a strip mall, it is your typically decorated family restaurant, with a nifty old-fashioned soda fountain and always pleasant service.

The menu is extensive; filled with plenty of breakfast and lunch options, but my order never changes.  A bowl of soup and a side salad loaded with creamy garlic dressing.  They always serve it with a basket of assorted rolls and crackers (including packaged crunchy bread sticks, which you just don't see too often anymore!).

Used to come here all the time on late start days in high school just around the corner. Came again years after college and food was mediocre. 

At the end I told them I didn't need the receipt and got charged $10 more than I should have. A lot of my friends say the same thing. 

Watch out
Very old fashion family  restaurant. Good service with decent food ,nothing stands out too much ,but not bad ,mom had the Supreme grilled chese sandwich  that was horrible .besides that all is good

Love Maxfields! Me and my 2 year old have lunch here about once a week just to get out of the house. Servers are always super friendly, food comes out super fast and hot. We love their grilled cheese and soup :)

This place is incredible!! We came at a very busy time but were greeted and seated immediately. My husband and I opted for the specials #1 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage and fresh orange juice, and special number 3 was just French toast instead of pancakes. Our server was attentive and quick with the juice and food came out right after. The juice was delicious!! The food was exceptional. I'm not sure how they cook their eggs bust they were the fluffiest scrambled eggs I have ever had. The French toast was made to perfection. Two thumbs up to this very well managed restaurant. Very very good.
Maxfield's is a wonderful breakfast place.  They have just about everything you could crave on the menu.  Check it out, if in the area.

Was there yesterday with my daughter for lunch. Very good. Burgers are the best!! 
And our favorite place for breakfast..generous portions!!

Maxfields is a cute family restaurant that made me feel like I'd gone back in time 20 years. The decor is very homey. The menu contains all the basic items that you'd expect from a traditional American restaurant/diner. I joked that they were trying to fatten you up because the sandwiches are served with soup, fries and coleslaw. Yes, that's an AND not an OR. I ended up ordering the mushroom and asparagus breakfast skillet which came with hash browns, two eggs and toast. There was something a little off about the taste of the asparagus. I couldn't quite place it. Everything else was fine and about what you'd expect. Nothing fancy, just filling. This wouldn't be my first choice of a restaurant, but I'd be okay with tagging along if that's where everyone else wants to go.

Even on the most crowded Saturdays, we still get seated in a reasonable amount of time (15 minutes or less). The staff is always very friendly and polite and we are never disappointed with our food. Our favorites for breakfast are the pancakes, corned beef hash skillet or a cheese omelet with a side of "ham off the bone." One thing I also appreciate is our coffee is never cold because the servers constantly check on you. Also, those clearing tables are fast and courteous too. This is a great place for breakfast, family meals or a business meeting. There always seems to be specials and a wide variety on the menu too. Hardest part about coming here is deciding what to order. Thanks Maxfields, for being a gem in our community!

We had Susanne and she was a delight! Sunday morning and there was no wait we ordered within 3 minutes and had food within 10 mins it felt like! She was super polite, friendly, attentive and sweet to our baby too! Food was great as always!

Found this gem on Yelp when I got to town this morning.  Coffee, 2 eggs, sausage, hash browns, and toast.  $9.30... This really hit the spot after a very early flight and arrival.  Great little breakfast spot!

Good typical diner.

Lots of food options.

Super freaky fast food delivery.

Old decor that needs some TLC.

Really cheap prices.

Coffee is good - including the decaf :)
By far the best breakfast place in Schaumburg. The owner is extremely personable and presents a great family atmosphere.
This is my first time coming to Maxwell's and I was very pleased. Would definitely come here again. Our waitress was Dianna and she was very kind and professional.

Chicken rice soup should be renamed to flour rice soup. It was so thick with flour that the spoon stood straight up in the bowl.  Was looking forward to trying the Mediterranean style wrap with chicken, cucumber, black olives, etc. The chicken breast turned out to be small cubed pieces and it was an overkill of black olives. French fries came cold. 

No thanks!

How have i not reviewed this place yet?! I've been here dozens of times, we usually go two or three weekends a month for breakfast and have never had a bad experience. There's usually a short wait, but i've tried pretty much all of the breakfast foods and think they have all been excellent.

Also it's a great deal! you get a lot of food for the price. And the staff is just awesome! Love this place!

I love breakfast food so I was more than happy to check Maxfield's out when my friend suggested it for dinner.  The food was decent but service was definitely lacking.  I wasn't expecting 5 star service since it is a diner but what we received was pretty terrible.

My friend and I came around 8pm on a Friday and it was pretty dead except for a couple tables.  I had the Fritta skillet with a side of potato pancakes and my friend had the sausage and cheese omelette with a side of bacon pancakes.  Both the omelettes and skillets come with a side of buttermilk pancakes, toast, or potato pancakes.  Here are some of the pros and cons from dinner.

CONS: 
1) I ordered the potato pancakes with my skillet..the waiter came out with buttermilk pancakes
2) The waiter asked us if we wanted more water rather than just refilling our glasses
3) We had to wait a long time before our waiter came to check on us and get us our checks because he was busy cleaning the counters
4) When we asked for separate checks, he looked confused and said "oh..separate checks" and acted like most people don't ask for it

PROS:
1) Food came out fast
2) Food was pretty good and portion sizes were fairly large for the price

I wouldn't say this was a bad experience per se but it definitely didn't wow me.  If I'm in the area I might try it again but otherwise it probably would be a pass for me.
We go for breakfast.  Nice size portions and good food. We order carryout often and everything is hot and made correctly!

They were busy but seated us in 5 minutes.  Coffee served as we were sitting down.  The Denver omelette I ordered was enough for 2 people.  And, with hash browns and 2 pancakes.  The meal was delicious.  I will be back.  

My wife had a BLT with fries and coleslaw.  Bacon could have been cooked better, less fatty.

Environment is pretty good. Service is pretty good, but waitresses are not the nicest and in the best mood. They also are not the most cleaned up people in the world. Wish they were a bit better waitresses. But pretty good service. The best part---GREAT food!  Love the food. Go a couple times a month to get Sunday breakfast. Will continue to go.

This is the first time I've gone to this place.  It's not a place I would typically consider because it's near my school, not where I live.  I thought the atmosphere was mildly dated, but I thought the food was pretty good for diner food, and the staff was very friendly.  My friends that I went with say the fries are to die for!

I AM a fan of Maxfield's. I can only comment on breakfast, but it's definitely worth a visit. My family and I have been here multiple times for hearty breakfasts. I love their breakfast quesadillas and my kids adore the pancakes. Another draw is the friendly service. The host always greets my husband with a handshake and we've found the waitresses and bussers to all be friendly. The service is a little slow, but as long as you go in knowing you will have to wait a bit, it's manageable. Maxfield's gives that small town, family-owned, multi-generational dining experience that the chain restaurants lack. Check it out!

Service is amazing, both the waitresses and bus staff are extremely attentive.  Refilling coffee and water cups efficiently. The food is amazing, we moved to the area about 1.5yrs ago and recently discovered this gem and have been here almost every weekend since. Must check it out.

Went there tonight for dinner started off very nice soup was good.  Then entrees come out Greek style chicken breast oven brown potatoes.  Food was cold potatoes were white sent it back didn't have much time asked just to nuke it came back the exact same way.  Asked for the manager 15 minutes later she came over.  Tried to explain she says her name was Liliana as I'm explaining she tells me to calm down.  I was done at that point she didn't care that she lost a customer. She wanted to sit back down with her man friend.
Good food at good prices.  Friendly staff.  plenty of parking.  Nothing really great but nothing to complain about either.

Let's face it, breakfast food is the only food that matters. Any place that can get me my pancake fix is a winner to me. Maxfield's gives absurdly large portions and their pancakes are delicious. The service can be a little slow, but I attribute that to the large crowds (usually of old people) that we always seem to encounter. The bread basket they bring out in the beginning is full of stale and tasteless rolls, so don't bother with that. In addition to pancakes, their scrambled eggs and omelettes are also very good.

Was expecting a little more, but was quite disappointed. But first the good. I loved the interior. Many who are my age and younger might say that it is dated, but it reminds me of the kind of restaurants my parents took me to as a kid back in the 1970s. It had that Chicago nostalgia feeling to it, so I was alright with it. Still, the booths were a little small. The service was nice and friendly as well. Those were the good point.

However, looks and service can take you so far. The food didn't live up to the hype. I ordered the traditional Eggs Benedict and the eggs were not prepared correctly. One had only a slightly runny yoke while the other was basically cooked solid. My mother went there a few weeks earlier and had the same experience. As far as the taste, it was great. However, with Eggs Benedict, those eggs have to be spot on, but they were terribly off. If they were spot on, I could give this place a 5-star review.

I came here with my family on Mother's Day around 10AM and the wait was about 35-45minutes. Not bad considering that Wildberry's was 1.5hrs. The host did a great job of handling the breakfast crowd and we were able to get a table in a timely fashion. But that's where our experience took an unfortunate turn for the worse.

We were seated in a section with a rude, old waitress who definitely shouldn't be working in the hospitality industry. Her attitude and demeanor would have been more fitting of a truck stop diner than a family restaurant. I've probably never had such a bad waitress in my life.

I ordered the Special Club #3 which comes with chilled juice. Now, I've been to many breakfast places and I always order orange juice. It's a staple part of my breakfast. But I've never seen such a small serving. It might as well have been poured into a shot glass. But considering it's part of a combo I'll play along. The food although was satisfying but nothing to brag about. It's hard to mess up breakfast staples. The place was fairly clean but not well lit.

I don't see a reason to come back here.

Great price for the amount of food you get. Very nice staff that works there.  The apple pancake is awesome and so are their burgers. Cole slaw is good too. Kids love the mickey and chocolate chip pancakes. Would definitely go again!

I absolutely love this restaurant. I come here often and I'm never disappointed. The food is good and so is the coffee and people are always around to refill your coffee cup. I often come here for breakfast. Tried lunch once and even their burgers are yummy. Needless to say I don't mind coming for lunch now. I also tried their chicken noodle soup and it was delicious. It's homemade and taste like it was made when I was a kid.

Outsanding food , burgers and fries are very delicious, when ever they have creamy chicken soup with rice that stuff is to die for . The only reason why I'm giving Maxfields 4 stars is becuase there service I've noticed recently has been very poor . Which includes waiting a long time for refills and just taking a customers order . So besides the service Maxfields is a place to go while your in the schaumburg area.

Maxfield's wasn't exactly our first choice for Sunday breakfast with the girls (and babes), but when Wildberry's had an hour long wait, we sought other options.  

Maxfields seems like a standard family owned pancake house.  Nothing really stands out about it.  The decor is unassuming, a nice selection of booths and tables to accommodate a variety of parties.  Our wait was about 15 mins, which was much appreciated, especially given our pint-sized diners.

Our waitress was friendly enough and made sure that we were offered drinks right away.  She wasn't super pushy when it came to us lolly gagging about what we wanted to order.  Our food came quickly, despite the restaurant being packed at the time, which was pretty impressive.

From a quick glance, the menu is pretty extensive, although I had a mad hankering for crepes, so I didn't take much notice of anything else on the menu.  My dining companions got crepes and pancakes.  The food was alright, fairly standard breakfast fare.  The portions were pretty generous, and I felt like I got a lot for my money, which is always nice.

I will have to say that the servers weren't turned off by our kids, which is worth noting and much appreciated, despite the fact that the toddler of the group proceeded to sticker the table (don't worry, we cleaned it up before we left).  

I don't think that Maxfield's would be our first choice of breakfast places for out next get together, but if our go-to place is beyond packed (again), it's nice to know that Maxfield's will be our solid plan B.

One of our favorite places until today
Usually awesome service until today
We never found HAIR in the soup until today 
When we brought the HAIR to our servers attention she denied it was a HAIR oh well

We're from out of town and stopped in based on Yelp ratings. We were NOT DISAPPOINTED!

Even though the place was packed on a Sunday morning after church we were seated immediately. 

The menu was very extensive with plenty of choice. A bonus was they offered potato pancakes as well as regular. 

I had 2 eggs with bacon, hashbrowns and potato pancakes. Yea I love potatoes! LOL 

My wife had an omelet pancakes hashbrowns.

The serving portions are Large! 5 pieces of bacon a huge pile of hashbrowns and 2 potato pancakes! Like wise my wife had more then she could eat.

Everything was delicious hot and came quickly. The server was very nice but joy overly sweet or hovering. 

$20 covered our meals and we were plenty full with a box to take home for the dog!!

GREAT FOOD!!! Love the service I get their. My wife and I love coming here even though it's a bit of a drive for us for breakfast. It is totally worth it. We love their biscuits and gravy!! Must try in my opinion.

Had a great breakfast here last Saturday. Split an omelet (huge, includes potatoes and pancakes)! And it was served on 2 separate plates--nice! Mentioned to server it was our first time and asked about their soups for lunches, and she was kind enough to bring us small samples of their soup of the day, which was quite good. Prices reasonable, food good, clean and nice atmosphere-- what's not to like??

Love the mom-pop feel of this place. The service is awesome. The menu is vast. The corned beef hash was delish and naturally the bacon, crisp like I like it but the pancakes were just okay. I think my expectations were high for the pancake, so my bar was too high for them to reach. Overall nice place.

First time trying this restaurant and I'm so glad I did. 

Nice atmosphere. Very friendly staff. Good selection on the menu. 

Had the BLT club. Came with soup, fries, and coleslaw. So much food. Couldn't finish it. Here's the best part of this BLT: it was made with regular sized bacon. None of that thick cut or honey maple bacon business.

Mom had the turkey club which came with same things mentioned above but included turkey. She said it was pretty darn good too. 

Would totally come back. 
Only reason I didn't give it five stars was because it was so hot in there. I understand e rest of the customers there were of the older population but man...it was HOT in there.

We debated after breakfast 3 or 4 stars but since I had the super crunchy bacon and IM writing the review I'm going with 3! Fiance√® had the bacon onion skillet which was very good. I of course had French toast which doesn't surprise anyone, it was pretty good but my side of bacon was way over cooked which I wasn't crazy about so I offered everyone a piece, which I normally don't :)! Ole omelette was ordered and some pancakes too by others which everyone enjoyed. Service started out very slow but once our server arrived she was great, very personable and helpful! Super busy place but we were sat quickly! We would try it again when in neighborhood!
Great find! Please see my check in tip. Wasn't thinking when I typed it out that I was in the check in window and not in the review window. Lol!

I went here this week for lunch with my work lunch crew. One member of the crew has been craving diner food and this was our closest option to work.

There was no wait which was nice and service was typical diner style...Whadya want? Short and to the point direct which can be easily mistaken as rude. Know what you're getting into at a diner.

The food was nothing to write home about. I had a ham and cheese sandwich which came with some fries and it was good, but not amazing. The bread was a bit burned. It was a good deal for $8 though. My friend had a beastly meal that came out on three separate plates and couldn't finish it all for $10. Good prices, decent food.

All in all an alright experience, I wouldn't mind coming back here to give it another go.

I liked this place. I came here for brunch with my dad a little before noon, and it looked pretty busy, but we were seated right away. 

My dad ordered one of the specials and got an entree along with bread, soup, and dessert - a great value. I wasn't wowed by the bread; it comes in a basket of assorted breads/croissants/muffins which are served cold, but I think that's how most Greek restaurants serve their bread, at least from my experience. 

For my meal, I got an omelette which came with pancakes and hash browns. I added fresh strawberries for a dollar. Nothing spectacular but I was happy with my meal. 

Our server wasn't super friendly or enthusiastic, but she did a fine job checking up on our table, so I didn't have any complaints about the service.

Our brunch turned out to be less than $30 and the portions were huge (we ate leftovers for days after), so overall I was pretty satisfied. I wasn't amazed by the experience but have no complaints so I wouldn't mind coming here again if the opportunity arose.

I've gone back a couple more times and I guess I have to give it 4 stars now to average the reviews to 4.5 stars since there are some minor issues that prevent me from giving it the full five.

After a couple more visits, the service is still excellent, the food is still prepared a bit lighter in sugar/salt than other restaurants, the prices are still good, and the portion sizes are still large. Here's some things that stood out:

The soups here great. After visiting many other family restaurants in the area, I find that this is probably my favorite place to go for soups, especially when they have creamy soups.

The beer battered scrod and shrimp creole here are delicious as well and provide a great reason to come here on Fridays. However, I did not like the texture or flavor of the macaroni and cheese at all.

Regarding texture again, the broiled perch, meatloaf, roast sirloin of beef, and pot roast could've all used better texture although the flavors were pretty good. Maybe the meat is simply too lean to get an excellent texture without being higher in fat.

The restaurant is great in potatoes, whether it's potato pancakes, fried, or mashed they're all good.

The ice cream is good here too and for some people, if you add whipped cream on top you will be very pleased. The rice pudding is still in my opinion the best in the area. Extra cinnamon and cream make this a real delight.

Still not a big fan of the cakes/pies but the cheesecake is quite nice.

In summary, I still think it's a great restaurant with nice interior and great prices but texture on some of the dinner dishes could be improved a bit.

So glad we found this place for breakfast. It was close (1 mi) to the Hilton Garden Inn, and though we paid the same as for breakfast there, we prefer to try local places instead. 

Regulars abound, which is a good sign. 

All of us were happy with our food and left stuffed by the large portions. 

The choices were almost overwhelming...tons of options.

Got together with family here and was disappointed by food and service. My mom ordered an entree that came with soup beforehand. Of course, she ate the soup. When the entree came, it was a disappointment. Her chop steak tasted not-so-fresh. The waitress offered to bring her something else. Someone else had ordered a Denver omelette and said it was good, so she ordered that. 

By the time she got it, the rest of us were almost done eating. Then, when we got the bill, we saw that they tried to charge her for the original entree as well. When she brought that to the attention of the manager, she took off the entree but still charged for the soup. She said that because my mom ate the soup, she had to be charged. So I guess if you eat here, wait to see if your entree is decent BEFORE you eat the included soup or salad that comes out first... even if that means your soup gets cold.  LAME. Overall, the food was just okay, and because of their questionable customer service, we won't be going back; first- and last-time customer all in one day.

If we are out & about in the Schaumburg area & want breakfast, this is where we go.  They have a nice variety of omelettes, skillets, pancakes and the like.  Their lunch menu looks big as well, but we've never been here at lunch time.  Our food always comes out fast and has always been delish!
